Who We Are:
Cardinal Financial is a nationwide direct mortgage lender whose mission is to prove that homeownership is possible for everyone. By bringing an open-minded approach to an often closed-minded industry, we're able to embrace every unique financial situation differently in order to craft the best possible loans for our borrowers. We pride ourselves on providing excellent service backed by our groundbreaking technology, and these two components of our process come together to complete a simple, personalized mortgage experience. But it all starts with our people.

We believe that no matter where you fit in our organization—Sales, Human Resources, Information Technology, or even re-stocking the break rooms with endless coffee supplies—everyone can influence the experience that we provide to our customers and our partners. We tell our customers and our partners that anything can be reimagined. So why not your career? Looking to join a company that values its people, innovates and expands on its proprietary technology, and is growing at a ridiculous rate?! Apply below!

What You Will Do
Clean data in preparation for reporting and analysis
Assist with the collection and analysis of data in support of Business Intelligence requests
Research and analyze key business drivers, competitive environment, opportunities, trends and operating metrics
Interact with team members across all departments
Assist in developing and maintaining various models
Provide support for ad-hoc data analysis
Cross-train with team members to increase individual and team knowledge
What You Need
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business, Information Systems, or equivalent experience.
0-2 years data analysis, systems analysis or BI work experience, preferably for a financial services company
Intermediate Excel knowledge required; Advanced knowledge highly preferred
BI tools experience preferred; SSRS/SSIS/SSAS or Tableau preferred.
Experience with database querying; MySQL or SQL Server syntax experience highly preferred.
Experience with VBA (visual basic) preferred.
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance.
Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner.
Positive attitude with lots of energy.
Ability to work well within a team environment and take constructive criticism, coaching and feedback on a consistent basis.
Highly detail oriented and organized with the ability to multi-task and work in a very fast-paced environment.
Ability to prioritize and manage a large volume of tasks.
Ability to exercise discretion on sensitive or confidential matters.
Basic knowledge of consumer lending processes, products and operations preferred
What We Offer
Strength, Stability, and Vision.
An empowered culture where your ideas are important and your voice matters.
Opportunity for career growth.
Competitive compensation package.
Benefits that become effective the first day of the month following your start date including - Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and much more.
401K w/ 50% match up to a maximum employee contribution of 5%- Effective the 1st of the month following 30-days of employment.
Back Apply Now

Can you analyze customer needs and address those needs by developing a clear plan of action? This full-time opening is for a Business Analyst in the Morrisville, North Carolina area.

Past experience with usability and application performance considerations
SQL experience
Solid grasp of developing requirements and product specifications for new or existing applications
Prior experience integrating with API backends

Overview
Description:
The Business Analyst is a key member of the Global ERP Program, and will help ensure that the SME’s configure and implement the Global single ERP solution (‘Nexus’) across the Waterlogic group and, in parallel, will lead the documentation of all configuration & set-up and document all necessary Business process flows.
The role will also support the Global Nexus Team in the testing and implementation of the overall global solution, this will involve document and achieving Business sign-off of all functional / operational business processes, support the creating of the Test Scripts / Test Cases, along with acceptance criteria to support UAT execution and sign-off.
Additionally, the Business Analyst will support the Functional / Operational SME’s in co-creating or updating the Global training material / collateral and supporting End User Training, as well as assisting the Functional SME’s during UAT, Go-Live and Post Go-live support.
This role will involve ownership, establishing rigor and governance on all templates, To-Be’ business processes and training materials, while supporting the global roll out of Nexus (within your agreed workstream(s) and responsibilities. Firstly, with the US & UK implementation expected to complete in 2019, following which the implementation will continue across other territories, with an emphasis on implementing Nexus into their larger markets (Australia & Germany) first, followed by other countries across the globe. National and Global travel will be required. (up to 50%)
Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Create & manage all US Process (Visio Flows) and To-Be’ Business / Functional Processes.Document the US system configuration and Set-upInstall a Global ERP solution and a single standard way of workingEffective RAID Management (Risk & Issue tracking process - identification and resolution)Effective Management of Business / Functional SME’s assigned to your workstream(s)Manage all System Administration documentation and templates
Qualifications
Experience:
5+ years of successful business analyst experienceERP Implementation and/or Service industry experience preferred

Overview
The primary responsibility of this position is to represent the business users and thoroughly test new system enhancements, document issues, and validate issue resolution. This position reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. The position will also provide input into new business requirements for new improvements.
Responsibilities
Testing of new features and fixes related to systems supporting authorization processing and utilization management.Thinks through test scenarios, develops appropriate use cases/test plans, and helps prepare test data.Represents the user community, contributes ideas for system improvements and assists with requirements.Coordinates closely with the Quality Assurance team.Supports management in the resolution of production issues.Identifies and manages issues that may impact project quality and timeliness.Provides support to end users as needed.This position requires the ability to create test plans and analyze test scenarios.Requires the ability to make or recommend business decisions based on data analysis.Must be able to interact with all levels and facilitate group discussions to promote consensus.Must perform other duties as required or assigned.

Business Analyst

Summary – Responsibilities include assisting the Project Manager with implementing a new or upgrading an existing client on proprietary software applications. This would include assisting in defining requirements, creating and implementing test plans, working with vendors and training end users on software usage.

Essential Duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Document procedures. Build a rapport with internal and external customers to elicit their business concern and collaborate in a workable solution.

Provides analysis, definition, and direction to computer applications related development and maintenance activities.

Ensures correct business functionality, requirements, and industry standards are addressed within the computer application.

Develops detailed business user requirements, system documentation, workflow procedures and data test plans.

This position will perform the following:

Review Technical Documents
Collect, develop, analyze, and edit Business Process Diagrams.
Interview Business Users & Subject Matter Experts.
Capture Functional Requirements and develop Use Cases.
Data analysis, mapping, verification and testing.
Report comparison and compilation.
Quality Assurance

Education and Experience The ideal candidate profile would include 1-2 years of general information technology experience and a desire to learn. Strong client interaction skills are a must. In addition to competitive compensation and benefits this firm offers a challenging and rewarding work environment with realistic opportunities for career growth.

Description:

* MUST BE Bilingual fluency in English and Spanish *

Functional Description:
Positions in this function provide sales support and administrative services to non-employee sales producers such as broker agents, field marketing organizations, and independent contract agents. Ensures proper completion of contracts, marketing agreements, and documentation of sales targets. May administer programs and monitoring to ensure compliance with external agent credentialing and training requirements. Acts as internal liaison and customer service resource for external producers relative to enrollment and policy questions, systems issues, and coordination of materials fulfillment. As one aspect of broader support role, may manage administrative aspects of commission payments such as routine tracking, reporting, and troubleshooting issues relative to missing or disputed payments.

General Profile:
Works independently.May act as a resource for others.May coordinate others' activities.

Job Scope and Leveling Guidelines:
Applies knowledge/skills to a range of moderately complex activities.Demonstrates great depth of knowledge/skills in own function.Sometimes acts as a technical resource to others in own function.Proactively identifies solutions to non-standard requests.Solves moderately complex problems on own.Works with team to solve complex problems.Plans, prioritizes, organizes and completes work to meet established objectives.May coordinate work of other team members.

Shift Start/End Time: Variable 7:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m. CST

Dress Code: Business Casual

Deloitte Services LP includes internal support areas such as Marketing and Communications, Human Resources/Talent, Information Technology, Facilities Management, and Financial Support Services.

Business Solution Analyst - WPS
Location: Hermitage/Nashville, TN
Are you passionate about technology and interested in joining a community of collaborative colleagues who respectfully and courageously seek to challenge the status quo? If so, read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity with Deloitte’s Information Technology Services (ITS). We are insatiably curious and life-long learners focused on technology and innovation.

Work you’ll do
Maintains a solid knowledge base of the functional capabilities of and is a Subject Matter Expert in Market Development and the various areas and products within it.
Assists the Engagement Manager in leading, directing, and reviewing all activities associated with support of existing products and delivering new technology products. Responsible for product quality, project timeliness, and customer satisfaction.
Interfaces with clients to define and document requirements for a named set of custom developed or vendor software products. Creates documentation including requirements, user stories, acceptance criteria, feature description PowerPoint decks, user guides, process flows, wireframes, and newsletters.
Manages the product backlog for product, working with the Engagement Manager to prioritize requirements, define and manage scope and sprints for a project.
Possesses overall understanding of appropriate business processes and workflows.
Engages business owners and other ITS resources to respond to requests for new applications and/or enhancements. Collaborates with the Engagement Manager in creating and presenting the appropriate project on-boarding processes and materials (Charter).
Responsible for conducting Design Thinking sessions to gain insights into end user and customer needs.
Leads and is responsible all Testing and QA activities within the project lifecycle. Works with and manages USI QA resources to develop and execute Test Plans, Test Scripts and all other deliverables and activities related to Quality Assurance of the Products.
Provides feedback to USI QA resources
Works with the Engagement Manager and clients to plan and execute User Acceptance Testing.
Provides operational support to practitioners and firm clients. Engages with various ITS organizations to resolve problems as they arise.
Participates in reviews of plans associated with project execution.
Responds proactively to both business and project issues and escalates appropriately.
Assists Engagement Manager with status reporting as required by the Market Development Channel and Deloitte Applications Studio leadership.
The team
Information Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte’s success. ITS is the engine that drives Deloitte, which serves many of the world’s largest, most respected organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.

The ~2,200 professionals in ITS deliver services including:
Security, risk & compliance
Technology support
Infrastructure
Applications
Relationship management
Strategy
Deployment
PMO
Financials
Communications
Deloitte Application Studios (DAS)
Deloitte Application Studios (DAS) is the internal software and applications development team responsible for delivering leading-edge technologies to Deloitte professionals. Their broad portfolio includes web and mobile productivity tools which empower our people to log expenses, enter timesheets, book travel and more, anywhere, anytime. DAS enables our client service professionals through a comprehensive suite of applications across the business lines. In addition to application delivery, DAS offers full-scale design services, a robust mobile portfolio, cutting-edge analytics, and innovative custom development.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:
5+ years of experience working in supporting multiple software projects in various IT roles.
3+ years of Business Analyst or System Analysis experience.
2+ years of Quality Assurance experience.
A solid knowledge and understanding of functionality within Deloitte applications preferred.
Must have in-depth knowledge of software development lifecycles including Agile development and testing.
Experience with test plan creation, automated test scripting, and load/stress testing.
Familiarity with SharePoint, TFS/Team Foundational Server, Test Director, MS Project, HP Quality Center, Automated QA tools is a plus
Prior experience that demonstrates good business understanding is needed (experience in a professional services organization is a plus
Demonstrated ability in applying repeatable quality assurance processes and methods to enterprise wide technology projects or initiatives.
Excellent written and verbal communications, organization, analytical, planning and leadership skills.
Strong management, communication, technical and remote collaboration skill are a must.
Experience in dealing with multiple projects and cross-functional teams, and ability to coordinate across teams in a large matrix organization environment.
Ability to effectively conduct technical discussions directly with Project/Product management, and clients.
Excellent team collaboration skills.
Strong relationship building and maintaining skills. Fosters a climate conducive to establishing positive working relationships with clients (internal and external).
Preferred Qualifications:
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA) is a plus.
Familiarity with SharePoint, MS Project, HP Quality Center, TFS/Urban Turtle, Automated QA and wire-framing or visualization tools is a plus.
Experience working with Agile development processes.
Experience in packaged software development
Experience in programming is a plus.
Experience with implementation of Mobile Web Content vs. Native Development.
Ability to distill complexity to what users need in a mobile experience and 3rd Party vendor products
Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or equivalent educational or professional experience and/or qualifications.
Travel Requirements:
Limited travel might be required.

How you’ll grow
At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.

Deloitte’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.

Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.

NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Business Analyst to join our team in Groton, Connecticut (US-CT), United States (US).

NTT DATA is seeking an experienced and passionate Senior Business Analyst to help grow our Business Analysis Practice in North America. In this role, the Senior Business Analyst is responsible for working with stakeholders and subject matter experts to elicit, analyze, document, communicate, and manage requirements and business analysis artifacts throughout the solution development lifecycle.

The preferred candidate will have a solid work history of delivering superior business analysis and consulting services in life science and/or other industries. The candidate should be capable of seeing ideas from concept through to implementation and applying a formal business analysis methodology based on industry best practices to accomplish the task. The position requires an individual with exceptional communications skills (verbal and written), superior facilitation and presentation skills, and strong analytical capabilities. An understanding of the IIBA’s Guide to the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge and CCBA or CBAP certification is preferred.

In this role the Senior Business Analyst will be required to:

Uncover the goals, needs, and opportunities for improvement
Discover, document and analyze business processes at varying levels of detail
Elicit requirements from a diverse set of business and technical stakeholders
Analyze and document requirements using graphic and text based techniques (activity diagrams, use cases, user stories, etc…) to create requirements deliverables
Manage, communicate, and represent requirements throughout the life of a project
Evaluate a solutions ability to meet the needs of the business and deliver value.
Analyze the impact of technical and non-technical changes across an enterprise
Collaborate with a business analysts working across various projects to ensure requirements quality and avoid missed requirements
Mentor and manage junior business analysts

This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. About this role:
The Clinical Operations Business Analyst is responsible for analysis and reporting of productivity and quality metrics to allow for high-quality, data-driven decision making in support of the clinical operations process. The analyst will not only aggregate and analyze data but also translate results into meaningful business activities. S/he must have extensive experience in business process analytics. This position will serve as a liaison between the clinical operations and finance team. We are looking for an analytical, detail oriented individual with the ability to work in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment.

Responsibilities include:

Analyze data from multiple sources and provide management reporting on results.
Identify performance metrics by individual and teams and identify trends.
Work with coaches and managers to identify corrective actions needed
Proactively monitor performance trends
Enhance existing processes, reporting, and systems that define, measure, and analyze productivity and quality measures of the Zio report creation process
Develop and report out on key performance indicator dashboards

As a Business Analyst, your primary function is to analyze and manage our organization's projects, procedures and design solutions to help the organization operate more efficiently and effectively. You will identify new opportunities and processes to meet Credit Union growth and strategic goals.


Responsibilities
Work directly with business lines throughout the organization to assist in determining business requirements, make recommendations for appropriate solutions and develop new process to achieve improved efficiency. System configuration and maintenance activities of multiple systems.
Coordinate and collaborate with Credit Union team members and 3rd party vendors to implement solutions to satisfy business needs while maintaining a vision (road map) for future needs.
Prepare business case proposals and develop thorough project plans including project scope, schedule, resources, budget and risks.

Mapping and documenting interfaces between systems.
Manage multiple projects concurrently in a fast paced environment.
Ensuring that budgets are adhered to and deadlines are met.
Lead implementation of a new systems including data migration.
Planning and working flexibly to meet deadlines.
Vendor Management
Write technical policies, procedures and documentation for systems/applications/Products implemented including user guides, troubleshooting guides, etc.
Keeping up to date with technical and industry developments.
Other duties and projects as assigned.

Bachelor’s degree, (Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Business-preferred) and 2-5 years’ experience in Information Technology, Project Management or Financial Industry related fields, required. Strong analytical, organizational, oral and written communication skills. Willingness to work outside of normal business hours. Ability to prioritize, meets deadlines, and manages changing priorities with limited direction. Ability to maintain the confidentiality of the Credit Union and member records at all times.

High level of professionalism. Make recommendations to meet the goals and objectives of the Credit Union functions, procedures, and policies. Must have strong analytical, problem solving, and root cause analysis skills. Logical, process-oriented thinker with a natural sense of urgency. Good interpersonal and client-handling skills with the ability to manage expectations and explain technical details. Lift 20-40 pounds of office supplies (copy paper, computer paper, mail, etc). Repetitive motion using wrists, hands, and fingers. Reach keyboards. (Keywords: IT, IS, Information Technology, data, program, computers)

For 70 years, Charles River employees have worked together to assist in the discovery, development and safe manufacture of new drug therapies. When you join our family, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether your background is in life sciences, finance, IT, sales or another area, your skills will play an important role in the work we perform. In return, we’ll help you build a career that you can feel passionate about.

Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced IT Business Analyst for our Information Technology group located in Horsham, PA.
Ascertains and documents business requirements and processes that fit with the company's system architecture standards, utilizing deep understanding of business processes for area of focus. Recommends process improvements, working closely with users and management. Involved in planning of system and development deployment as well as responsible for meeting software compliance standards. Establishes and documents system parameters and formats and coordinates and/or modifies system parameters in terms of existing and projected computer capacity and capabilities. May create (or oversee) test scripts to ensure functionality meets requirements documented. May design and develop training material and may deliver training. May act as a liaison with other business functions.
This position will directly support the Safety Assessment Toxicology and Pathology business units. Must demonstrate proficiency with GxP, computer systems validation processes, understand basic project management skills and processes and be a very effective communicator. This position should have a background/subject matter expertise in the one or more of the following fields: Toxicology, Saftey Pharmacology, DART, Veterinary Medicine, Pathology, Clinical Pathology and have leadership skills.
The following are minimum requirements related to the IT Business Analyst position.
Education: Bachelor’s degree (B.A. /B.S.) or equivalent in Computer Science or related discipline.
Experience: Minimum 5 years applicable business analysis experience.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be accepted as a satisfactory substitute for the specific education and experience listed above.
Certification/Licensure: CCBA or CBAP is a plus.
Other: In-depth knowledge of current IT technologies and state-of-the-art practices including an understanding in areas of application programming, database and systems design. Must understand internet, intranet, extranet and customer/server architectures and how legacy and web-based systems interface with each other. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills including the ability to deliver informative, well-organized presentations. Ability to work well in a team environment.


About Safety Assessment
Charles River is committed to helping our partners expedite their preclinical drug development with exceptional safety assessment services, state-of-the-art facilities and expert regulatory guidance. From individual specialty toxicology and IND enabling studies to tailored packages and total laboratory support, our deeply experienced team can design and execute programs that anticipate challenges and avoid roadblocks for a smooth, efficient journey to market. Each year approximately 120 investigational new drug (IND) programs are conducted in our Safety Assessment facilities.

Job Title: Business Analyst

Join us as we build a next-generation analytics platform to serve our world-class agents. As a Business Analyst, you’ll help build a platform of robust analytics features that lay the foundation for optimizing agent and broker productivity that bring Realogy’s renowned real estate brands into the next era of data-driven excellence.

What we’re looking for:
We are seeking a highly motivated Agile Business Analyst to join our Data team. This individual will possess a strong understanding of business analysis and analytics technology, and have a proven track record of defining and driving technology-based solutions to implement strategic solutions that bridge the divide between business and technical knowledge.

What you’ll do:
As a Business Analyst, you’ll elicit and evaluate business requirements for delivering new or enhanced software systems, appropriately document system requirements, and measure the success of the resultant initiatives.

You will:
Grow into a trusted partner of our Strategy organization and Business Units, coming prepared to the conversation by knowing your partners’ pain better that they do
Partner with cross-functional teams to analyze, decompose and map current state processes and pain points, then determine improvement opportunities including creation of target operating models. You are a listener but not a note taker.
Drive ideation and new solution thinking to delivers significant net new business value to partners
Strive for industry disruption and moonshot initiatives that differentiate Realogy offerings from currently existing ones
Take ownership to lead solutions from concept to implementation by partnering with technology and business organizations to ensure requirements are satisfied and delivered on time
Build and develop business relationships vital to project success
Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders
Work with business product owners to facilitate creation and maintenance of Product Roadmaps and Backlogs

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Joining the Stanley Black & Decker (SBD) team means joining one of the world’s largest, fastest-growing, and most dynamic companies. Stanley Black & Decker is unique in that we’ve got a rich and storied history dating back to 1843, but that hasn’t stopped us from evolving into a vibrant, diverse, global growth company poised and ready for the future.

Being a part of our team means living our core values of integrity, accountability, respect, speed, stretch, vision, and boundaryless. It means thriving in an environment of constant innovation and positive change. It means delivering tools, services, and solutions that the world counts on when it really matters. It means maintaining the highest standards in everything you do, every day.

It also means joining a team that has been globally recognized as one of the most innovative, sustainable and rewarding companies in the world. With over 50,000 employees world-wide the Company has World Head-Quarters in the US and a Global Emerging Market (GEM) Head-Quarters in Miramar, Florida.

JOB SUMMARY


Stanley Black & Decker is looking for an inspired, proactive, and experienced Senior Business Analyst to manage digital technology projects from ideation to deployment. The ideal candidate lives and breathes digital, has a passion for new technologies and strong experience launching projects in partnership with multi-disciplinary teams and multiple stakeholders.
The Business Analyst is responsible for identifying business needs and determining solutions maintaining a focus on customer satisfaction, innovation, relationship building, change management and driving positive results.
This individual will collaborate with Business Teams, Project Managers, Shared Services Teams and vendors to lead and manage all aspects of GEM Digital projects from strategy briefings and project discovery through launch.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


Leads a partnership with internal and external technical and non-technical teams
Defines the strategic direction of the cross-functional team by identifying clear and measurable business requirements and execution standards
Facilitates requirement sessions with stakeholders and creates comprehensive requirement documents by decomposing high-level information into general understanding terms and details
Utilizes modeling approach to represent requirements information in graphical forms that augment textual representation
Monitors day-to-day activities of digital builds, such as mobile applications, web experiences and digital products
Ensure that projects and prototypes are completed as planned and with the highest standards
Engages closely and collaboratively with designers, engineers and UX to shape product roadmaps and execution schedules
Understands how policies, systems and processes impacts requests, projects, cross-functional operations
Shares business knowledge and understanding among team members and stakeholders
Brokers consensus among stakeholders with conflicting needs

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES


Proven track record of managing cross platform digital projects (desktop, tablet, mobile) with large groups of distributed stakeholders and project team members
Strong knowledge of all phases of digital development from concept to information architecture to design, development, and QA
Experience with SharePoint, Salesforce, eCommerce, DAM, PIM and CMS platforms, metadata modeling and workflow automation
Working understanding of business process and system process within one or more knowledge areas
Knowledge of system development methodology, project management, system architecture and analytical/problem solving skills
Experience working on digital innovation, UX and mobile first responsive design
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment a must
Excellent presentation, communications skills, solid organizational skills, strong leadership capability, visual skills, ability to prioritize
Minimum of 5 years of systems analysis experience with understanding strategic business information systems

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS


Over 7 years of experience of digital leadership experience in a multinational global company
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Management, Computer Sciences or related fields
Certificate in Business Analysis (preferably in a quantitative discipline) or equivalent work experience
IIBA and/or PMI-PBA certification is a plus

The job description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment. Stanley Black and Decker reserves the right to revise or change job duties and responsibilities as the need arises. Requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills, and experience required.

Public Consulting Group, Inc. (PCG) provides management consulting and technology services to help public sector education, health, human services, and other government clients achieve their performance goals and better serve populations in need. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, PCG has more than 2,200 professionals in 55 offices around the U.S. and in Montreal, UK and Poland. The firm draws on more than three decades of consulting to public sector clients to deliver best-practice solutions and measurable results to state and local public agencies, state-operated facilities, and private providers that do business with government agencies. PCG is committed to a diverse workforce which is a reflection of our clients and the people they serve. Our organizational culture attracts and rewards people who are results-oriented and interested in making an immediate impact on their community as well as their own career.

Business Analysts are the entry-level position in PCG’s consulting career ladder. They are expected to play a staff role in a wide range of work assignments that may include the following:
Supporting project managers across multiple projects and clients and working with various project teams.

Preparing and presenting written status reports. Supporting the team completing assessment documentation and recommendation reports for clients.
Conducting policy and other research to support the project team and assist in preparing information briefs for both internal and client-facing use.
Defining, documenting, and improving business processes.
Gathering and analyzing a variety of data, including both financial and written policy/procedure information.
Learning and performing tasks related to sales and marketing.
Travel (25% - 50%) and work over 40 hours per week is required. This is a salaried position. This position will be located in our office in Boston, MA.

Business and System Knowledge: Understand the portfolio trading product with regards to its business processes as well as regulatory requirements (FIX order management, allocation, booking, regulatory requirements, etc). FedEx Supply Chain, a subsidiary of FedEx Corp. (NYSE: FDX), is a leader in the third-party logistics industry offering a diverse service portfolio that enables commerce for businesses. Overview
The Business Analyst specializes in understanding the needs of the business owners and translating them into technical specifications. This position will act as an interface to the business owners and technology departments, as well as implementing and supporting the Customer and Marketing Applications Portfolio, including: Consumer Websites, Loyalty Programs, Marketing Offers and Promotions, Customer Relationship Management, etc.
The position involves analysis and presentation of information to business owners, including Marketing, Player Development, and Casino and Hospitality Operations. It requires proficiency with developing requirements documents, knowledge of the business and strong communication skills. The position will also be responsible for the QA of any new or changes to the applications before they are released and deployed into the Production environment.
These initiatives will be done in accordance with department policies, procedures, and standards to support information systems development and maintenance.
Responsibilities
Main Duties and Responsibilities:
Gather requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task, and workflow analysis.
Translate requirements into technical specifications to support development in both traditional (Waterfall) and Agile development methodologies.
Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, decompose high-level information into details, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with technical team and business owners to analyze information needs and functional requirements to deliver an effective solution.
Participate in the QA and release management of changes to or new applications through thorough testing, debugging and user acceptance before planning and executing deployment into Production.
Develop user documentation and conduct training as required.
Participate in small or complex applications rollout to single or multi-properties.
Provide post implementation support and troubleshooting.
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Analyze problems and escalate issues in a timely manner for quick resolution. Responds to and assists with other problem tickets as required.
Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.
Maintain and enhance technical skills through formal and on-the-job training.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Must adhere to the Seminole Tribe's Policies and Procedures.

Skills Requirements:
Solid proficiency in full Business Analysis skills (Analysis, Design, Testing, Process, and Documentation). Ability to translate business requirements to technical requirements to enable IT Technical teams.
Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into operational requirements.
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group in a dynamic work environment.
Collaboration and facilitation skills within IT and across business area users and management.
Highly personable and able to build strong relationship across business groups and with IT personnel.
Stakeholder management, including department leaders, vendors and consultants.
Autonomous: ability to work with little or no supervision
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required. Hospitality, Information Management, or Computer Science preferred.
Hotel/casino gaming experience preferred.
Project Management/Coordination practices and techniques preferred.
5+ years’ experience as a business analyst or similar position. Business Analysts Certification preferred (either PMI-PBA or IIBA-CBAP).
3+ years’ experience with Customer/Marketing Applications; including Websites, Loyalty Systems, Customer Relationship Management, and/or Campaign Management.
Agile experience preferred.
Working knowledge of JIRA, Selenium, ServiceNow preferred.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Visio, Excel, Outlook).

Position Summary
The Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for developing a robust supply chain for new projects. Individual works closely with the Logistics and Purchasing Team. The position will be responsible for defining & delivering integrated Global Supply Chain business solutions using Oracle Advance Supply Chain Planning (ASCP) and Demantra Demand Management (DM) modules of Oracle E-business Suite applications.

Organizational Relationship
This position reports directly to the Manager – Business Transformation

Accountabilities
As part of the role, the person is expected to interact with supply chain operations, identify gaps and improvement opportunities in the Supply Chain Planning process, and design solutions using Oracle ASCP, Demantra, extensions, and other related home grown systems.
Performs analysis and evaluation of options, alternatives, and system capabilities.
Utilizing production planning and MRP information from Oracle to develop off-line spreadsheet/database models that will be used to determine capital expenditure [machine, fixture] and headcount decision making, sourcing decisions, and schedule feasibility/optimization
Recommends system functional improvement to meet user requirements.
Ensures system and process user requirements are properly defined and met and tasks are accomplished within defined timeframes at the highest quality with attention given to detail and scalability
Ensures the solution delivered actually adds value to the business and will help prepare all satisfaction, utilization, and ROI calculations of the solution
Manage Supply Chain team members' adherence of standard processes, maintenance of quality and performance to service levels and schedule.
Identify system issues and other unique issues, escalate and resolve as appropriate - be responsible for systems problem management activities for the supply chain team.
Establish positive working relationships with other team members so that the team receives comprehensive information to build according to the requirement
Should have in-depth functional understanding of ASCP and Demantra modules with basic technical knowledge about applications and database related to these applications. Skilled in Demand Planning, good understanding of Supply Chain Planning, and fair understanding of Oracle Value Chain Planning process flows and best practices is essential.
Responsible for BR100 and MD50 documentation and collaboration with onsite and offshore development team along with testing of developed component for an application.
Working knowledge of Oracle Web ADI is a plus to maintain master data related to planning and forecasting.
Consistently demonstrates the 6 For Success: Be trustworthy, Commit to your team, Listen to understand, Serve your customer, Prepare and plan, and Deliver the result.
Perform other duties as may be assigned at management’s discretion.

Characteristics & Attributes
Experience maintaining supply chain systems, preferably in an implementation capacity (Full project lifecycle preferred).
Ability to anticipate potential problems, determine and implement solutions
Outstanding critical thinking skills. Ability to analyze business needs and translate into system requirements
Must be extremely organized and capable of tracking, managing, and resolving many issues simultaneously.
Excellent interpersonal skills, customer service, communication, analysis and problem solving skills required.
Expertise required in functional areas of Oracle R12 – ASCP, Demantra, Purchasing, Inventory, Bills of Material, Order Management modules.
Experience integrating with external order entry, order capture, Point of Sales, and 3PL systems desired
Proven ability to work with all members of a project team, including business, technical, and management.
Education & Experience
Degree in the field of business administration, business management, computer science, accounting, MIS, Supply Chain or Manufacturing.
Candidate must have 4 years of experience working in an ERP environment, preferable in Oracle ERP.
Strong business process understanding of Demand/Supply Planning and Sales & Operational Planning processes.
To be successful the new hire requires keen analytical skills, integrated thinking, and a drive for results.
Strong communication skills are essential as role will require heavy collaboration with business teams to problem-solve and solution-shape.

Chenega Professional & Technical Services (CPTS) is seeking a Business Process Analyst III to support the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), Center for Drug Evaluation and Research (CDER), Office of Surveillance and Epidemiology (OSE).

Essential Duties and Responsibilities: (Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position)
Serve as the primary author and editor to capture business requirements for developing written documents pertaining to the support of multiple OSE work streams and efforts for improved informatics as assigned by OSE Regulatory Science staff.
Perform quality reviews to ensure business requirements specification document is accurate, consistent with FDA laws, regulations and policies, includes all important concepts, meets the writing style requirements of the agency, follows the appropriate template and are written at an appropriate comprehension level for the intended audience.
Produce working and final drafts of written business requirements specification document for review by SMEs and senior leaders within OSE’s specified timeframes.
Review existing use cases inventory and prepare for meeting with business staff to complete the documentations.
Facilitate and gather requirements, use case development, perform business and gap analysis.
Map respective business processes (As Is - To Be) and identify instances where existing processes may be streamlined or improved prior to and/or in alignment with a technology solution.
Manage system lifecycles by using the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology including scope, gathering of business requirements, user requirements, functional specifications.
Work as a cross-functional team member, critically evaluate and manage user requests to ensure accurate prioritization and optimal resolutions.
Conduct ongoing assessments to confirm that implemented solutions meet business requirements, compliance and regulations.
Manage communication with all stakeholders (business partners, IT team, service providers) in the project to ensure they kept aware of the status of all work.
Partner with key staff in the functional areas (e.g. Pharmacovigilance, Risk Management, Premarket Safety Reports, Signal Enhancements, Data Mining, Data Analytics, Data Visualization and internal process improvements) when appropriate to ensure requirements conform to applicable regulations.
Manage project tasks to ensure user requirements and artifacts are documented and delivered per plan.
Lead communication with internal staff and technology service providers to bridge the requirement gaps.

Other duties as assigned.

Supervisory Responsibilities:
None.

Experience in Microsoft suite of tools including Visio and SharePoint.
Experience with business process improvement methodologies.
Strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to maintain collaborative working relationships with internal business partners, IT team and technology service providers.
Knowledge of Project Management and the role of Project Managers.

Overview


At Perficient you’ll deliver mission-critical technology and business solutions to Fortune 500 companies and some of the most recognized brands on the planet. And you’ll do it with cutting-edge technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the world’s biggest vendors. Our network of offices across North America, as well as locations in India and China, will give you the opportunity to spread your wings, too.

We’re proud to be publicly recognized as a “Top Workplace” year after year. This is due, in no small part, to our entrepreneurial attitude and collaborative spirit that sets us apart and keeps our colleagues impassioned, driven, and fulfilled.

Perficient currently has a career opportunity for a Business Analyst in our Columbus office.

Job Overview:
The role of the Business Analyst is for individuals passionate about identifying and delivering the right Business solution for each client. Our Business Analysts have a keen Business orientation with an understanding of how technology can be effectively applied to meet a variety of Business needs.

Our Business Analysts fill a number of different roles on our project teams working with a variety of technologies for a wide range of clients. The specific responsibilities vary for each client and each project. Key to the success of our Business Consultants is the willingness and desire to quickly learn the client’s industry and the unique requirements of each engagement and to fill whatever role may be required to best support our client’s needs.

A Business Analyst thrives in challenging environments and accomplishes difficult assignments without significant supervision and instruction. Our Consultants can handle the stress of being accountable for delivery and: complete goals on time, practice strong attention to detail, persevere through tough obstacles, and do not get easily discouraged.

The Business Analyst may be involved in the strategic planning of an engagement or helping the client make decisions about their future IT direction. Once a project has begun, the Business Analyst may assist in facilitating key requirements with stakeholders and customers using standard and User Experience techniques. The Business Consultant may be responsible for functional designs, detailed designs and system mapping, wireframes, requirement specifications, and prototypes.

The Business Analyst works with the Lead Business Analyst and Senior Project Managers to assist with daily operations exercising time management, communication and collaboration in a fast-paced environment to ensure the successful delivery of projects. The Business Analyst will interface with Perficient technical and business delivery personnel, as well as vendors and customers on a regular basis.



Responsibilities
Build trusted client relationships through proactive account management and effective project delivery
Establishes knowledge of client business challenges and priorities to translate into opportunities
Maintains regular client communication and satisfaction, ensuring opportunities and challenges are addressed in a timely manner.
Helps deliver presentations to clients and management teams
Contributes to project discoveries, kickoff, prepare proposals and statements of work following company standards.
Translate client’s business needs into detailed business requirements documents, use cases and systems interaction diagrams.
Works with customers and internal Creative teams to establish approved wireframes and mock-ups for solutions
Assists project team to establish high, mid, and micro level plans for project team.
Helps to establish critical path, milestones, delivery dates, and review client deliverables to ensure they meet client acceptance criteria.
Provides leadership throughout the lifecycles of a project, guiding the understanding the project team has through design and development to ensure project requirements are met
Helps establish project test strategy, methodologies, test plans as well as assist with test execution.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree
1-3 years of professional business analysis experience, with strong relationship management, account management, and support experience.
Experience working with external clients
Knowledge of Agile and iterative development methodologies
Understanding of current technologies and Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Ability to obtain, understand and respond strategically to client needs.
Highly detail oriented, well organized, and able to coordinate multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong analytical, problem solving and conflict resolution skills.
Energetic, motivated, service-oriented, and be able to multi task.
Excellent listening, oral, and written communication skills.
Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills.
Flexible to new situations and challenges.
Flexibility to travel up to 50 percent.
Preferred skills and education:
Degree in Computer Science or Engineering
Experience working in the consulting industry
Experience working in financial industry a plus
Understanding of complex Internet based enterprise level applications
Understanding or background in testing a plus
Experience working in an Agile environment
Track record of delivering on time, on budget, and meeting client commitments
Perficient full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs including billable bonus opportunities. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work.

More About Perficient

Perficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global 2000 and enterprise customers throughout North America. With unparalleled information technology, management consulting and creative capabilities, Perficient and its Perficient Digital agency deliver vision, execution and value with outstanding digital experience, business optimization and industry solutions.

Our work enables clients to improve productivity and competitiveness; grow and strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners; and reduce costs. Perficient's professionals serve clients from a network of offices across North America and offshore locations in India and China. Traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, Perficient is a member of the Russell 2000 index and the S&P SmallCap 600 index.

Perficient is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national, origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

The GTTS organization is responsible for protecting the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of information and computing assets associated with Cisco’s US Government and Trust service delivery, while enabling business productivity. ESCO is proud to announce it is now formally A Weir Group Division. The result of our combined resources is one of the most admired engineering businesses in our markets. With our strengthened position in global mining markets, we are now able to leverage our ability to serve customers around the world more than ever. We look forward to continuing to solve our customer’s complex problems by engineering, manufacturing, and servicing mission-critical equipment for mining, industrial, and construction industries. Our work is challenging and creative, and to keep us on the leading edge we invest in our employees for the long term, not just with competitive pay and generous benefits, but with ongoing learning and development opportunities, and now by offering an even wider range of career opportunities across a variety of locations worldwide.

The Senior BI Analyst will join a team of four seasoned and progressive solution innovators and leverage world-class analytics, tools, and methods. ESCO is breaking into exciting areas of advanced analytics – this individual will play an important role in advancing our capabilities in this space via our Supply Chain business. We are optimizing our business through digital transformation, and we understand that analytics is at the center of it. In addition to new analytics solutions, we maintain and continuously improve a robust and complex set of existing solutions that are increasingly critical to ESCO's daily business operations and decision-making. As one of the BI team’s key stakeholders, ESCO’s Supply Chain team has long been at the forefront of our data and analytics capabilities and this position will heavily drive taking it to the next level. This role is a combination of Business Analyst (IT/BI/Supply Chain) and data analytics solution designer/builder.
Job Duties:
Work directly with the Supply Chain and Oracle Business Analysts to interpret requirements into innovative, trustworthy, and timely analytic solutions leveraging the latest Microsoft BI toolset; become the resident IT SC expert and leverage knowledge to advance SC analytics initiatives
Design, document, deploy, and support enterprise-grade production data solutions and enhancements; lead development and testing of solutions by on/off/near-shore BI developers and stakeholders; may develop and test own solutions as well
Lead POCs to create breakthrough solutions, performing exploratory and targeted data analyses
Design and build intuitive user interface analytics and visualization solutions
Manage timely report to resolution of production issues
Establish and adhere to sound timelines and deadlines on projects, maintaining a PMO tracking system
Empower data gurus within Supply Chain through self-service visualization, modeling and reporting capabilities
Adhere to established development, testing, and change management standards typical of the IT industry (BABOK or equivalent)
Consult on ongoing advancement of BI architecture, tools, and methodologies
Job Qualifications:

Five+ years’ Supply Chain experience as a team member or Business Analyst
Five+ years IT Business Analysis experience
Two+ years BI experience including one+ year developing PowerBI or equivalent (ex: Tableau)
Solid understanding of BI data modeling concepts using ERP and other data sources, through to BI solution
Familiar with Business Intelligence tools, concepts, and methods/processes
Must be permanently authorized to work in the United States
The successful candidate will also have the following abilities:
Effectively explain/document complex technical concepts to business analysts and users; conversely, explain/document business requirements to developers
Highly skilled in interpretation and development of complex multi-discipline business analytics logic
Persuasive and credible, with ability to obtain buy-in from many sophisticated stakeholders, resolving conflicts if needed
Exceptional solution testing and troubleshooting skills; detail oriented with a reputation for accuracy
Proven ability to coach and train; ability to adapt and manage expectations in a fast-paced, demanding environment with changing priorities
Planning experience and/or familiarity with SharePoint are a plus

$18 an hourTemporary, InternshipOverview

We are committed to provide our Employees a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Creativity and innovation are encouraged for improving the effectiveness of Southwest Airlines. Above all, Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer.
Responsibilities
The Technology Department at Southwest Airlines reports to SWA’s Chief Information Officer (CIO). They work hand in hand to manage the Company delivery plan, execute projects and programs, develop and integrate new products and technologies, and develop methodologies while ensuring the appropriate architecture, quality standards, service management procedures, and security measures are in place.

Technology plays a key role in guiding the strategic future of Southwest Airlines through initiatives that touch every aspect of our business and operation. It empowers and equips Southwest’s Employees with the solutions they need to be successful while providing Southwest’s Customers with the tools they need to have a positive travel experience. Technology Teams have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful work that delivers value to the airline through innovation, modernization, problem solving, strategic planning and more.

The Intern will work full-time as a Business Analyst within Technology utilizing their education and experience to solve problems and while working closely with stakeholders and other team members to provide solutions.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work with business customers to conduct needs analysis relative to systems and business processes in order to create quality technical solutions.

Ensure solutions are aligned with business strategies and comply with departmental standards.

Manage timeframes for designing, coding, testing, and implementing to ensure solutions are delivered ontime and within budget.

Serve as a resource to ensure effective communications between business and Technology Teams.

Participate in systems and acceptance testing.

Scope of work varies depending on the Team assignment.
Qualifications
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

High School Diploma, GED or equivalent education required.

Must be at least 18 years of age.

Must have authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Reform Act of 1986.

EDUCATION:

Progress toward undergraduate or graduate degree in MIS, Business, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems or Information Technology, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering or Business related degree required.

Minimum level accepted: Junior

Must be currently enrolled as a full-time student (minimum 12 credit hours).

Maintained 3.0 or above cumulative GPA.

Coursework in computer science fundamentals, programming languages, and related technical studies is preferred.

Skills/Abilities/Knowledge/Work Style:

Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) required.

Basic knowledge of business analysis, process modeling and redesign is preferred.

Basic knowledge of technical environment required.

Exposure to Agile methodologies preferred.

Fundamental understanding of project management techniques with familiarity or experience with Microsoft Project preferred.

Problem solving ability and strong written/verbal communications skills required.

Ability to stay organized and manage multiple and concurrent assignments under tight deadlines.

Previous analyst internship experience within the past 12 months preferred.

Experience solving business problems in a capstone or case competition preferred.

Works well in a culture that is open, direct, respectful, courteous and compassionate.

Quick learner, self-motivated, team oriented, with a sense of humor.

PLEASE BE PREPARED TO PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION (IF REQUESTED):

Resume.

Unofficial transcript.

“Why Southwest Airlines” essay (Length determined by author).

Letters of Recommendation.

TIME COMMITMENT:

Full-time/40 hours per week

PAY:

$18.00 per hour + flight privileges

This internship position is located in Dallas, TX at Southwest Airlines Headquarters.

All students must apply online at careers.southwestair.com

$60 an hourContractA California based company is looking for a Business Analyst with following skills:Duration: 6+months with a possibility of an extensionEXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED · Demonstrated ability to quickly familiarize with new business processes;· Three (3) years of operational assessment and gap analysis experience;· Minimum of five (5) years of business process analysis experience in a relevant technical field;· Working knowledge of industry accepted business analysis methodologies, standards, procedures and practices;· Effective communication skills in both verbal and written form to all levels of management; and· Possess the ability to communicate effectively, succinctly and accurately in English.EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DESIRED · Experience with Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS).· Past experience on projects working with elections systems including voter registration, voting or election night reporting.PROJECT OVERVIEWIn March of 2018, the U.S. Election Assistance Commission (EAC) awarded grant funds to the Nevada Secretary of State (SOS). The purpose of the grant award is to "improve the administration of elections for Federal office, including to enhance technology and make election security improvements" as the Chief State Election Office deems appropriate.The SOS has identified an initial list of known enhancements and improvements needed to systems owned by the SOS that are appropriate for this grant. However, the scope encompasses partner agencies and vendors including the seventeen county elections officials and their vendors for voter registration and voting systems. Within the first year, the SOS plans to engage in activities that will identify many more ideas for enhancements and improvements to systems for voter registration, vote casting and tallying, and election night reporting.The intent of the SOS is to bring on a project team of MSA consultants that can focus their attention on first understanding and documenting the business processes within the scope of the grant. Next the project team will work with stakeholders and the Grant Steering Committee to develop and prioritize a list of enhancements that qualify within the terms of the grant. The MSA team will own this list of enhancements and will elicit and document requirements detailing what is needed to achieve each enhancement. The MSA team will then manage the process to address each enhancement. Some enhancements may be achieved with the simple submission of tickets while others may require a project to properly address. In either case, the MSA team will manage and track the enhancement until complete including testing, communications, validating work and training appropriate stakeholders as necessary.SCOPE OF WORK· Consultants must perform all activities to the agreed upon project plan/schedule. Work must be completed according to the specifications and standards set by the State.· Develop and maintain operational familiarity with election systems and processes within the scope of the grant;· Engage in activities designed to develop ideas for a list of Ideas for Security and Technology Enhancements:· Interview subject matter experts within the SOS, partner agencies, other stakeholders and the Advisory Committee;· Attend training opportunities, conferences, Tabletop Exercises (TTXs);· Review audits and consultation reports;· Review industry best-practices; and· Network with colleagues from other states and jurisdictions.· Conduct meetings with stakeholders and subject matter experts documenting all outcomes in terms of action items, decisions made, and new ideas identified;Job Type: ContractSalary: $60.00 /hourExperience:Business Analyst: 5 years (Preferred)Work authorization:United States (Required)

The Office of Sponsored Programs & Regulatory Compliance Services (SPARCS) facilitates the submission of proposals, negotiation of agreements, the administration of internally and externally funded projects, and the administration of subagreements that provide funding to NC State University. This includes all aspects of externally sponsored research and scholarship, from pre-award management to non-fiscal post-award management.

All administrative bodies at the university that oversee grants and contracts or matters of regulatory compliance are responsible for seeking guidance from SPARCS to provide optimal stewardship of external funds and regulated research subjects. An Associate Vice Chancellor for Research Administration leads the team, which includes an Associate and an Assistant Director and a team of EPA professionals. This team negotiates and accepts legal terms and conditions for conducting externally sponsored research, and manages compliance, meeting a myriad of federal and state regulations.

External sponsors include federal, state, local governments and private enterprise. They provide funding via grants, cooperative agreements or contracts where deliverables are identified and progress reporting is expected. The office enjoys a robust and close relationship with the development arm of the institution. Both entities foster excellent coordination in determining the best fit between opportunities and sponsorship. Additionally, SPARCS partners with the Office of Technology Transfer to ensure that NC State University remains in the best possible position to execute licensing agreements for intellectual property disclosed and ready for commercial application by our federal, state and industrial partners.

SPARCS also maintains primary regulatory compliance responsibilities, including human and animal subjects, conflicts of interest and commitment management, export controls, facility security matters, and research integrity. Our goal is to provide stellar continuing education necessary to facilitate the understanding of these critical areas of compliance as we endeavor to reduce the overall regulatory burden on the institution’s faculty and staff. This goal extends throughout the SPARCS’ organization and is illustrated in its motto to achieve:
respect by knowing our clienteleleadership through servicecompliance through facilitationimprovement by seeking feedbackexcellence through caring

This pledge extends to the sponsors who enable research and scholarly
productivity, as well as to the faculty and staff who create and transfer
the knowledge and scholarship that epitomizes the very core of our
great institution.

For more information, please visit our website: https://research.ncsu.edu/sparcs

Essential Job Duties
North Carolina State University is initiating the adoption of a vendor-based Enterprise Research Administration (ERA) system. The selected vendor solution will integrate electronic processes for all aspects of sponsored programs administration, including proposal development, routing and approval; award negotiation and acceptance; post-award management; human subjects protections (IRB), animal subject protections (IACUC), conflict of interest, export control, laboratory safety and with links to in-house and third-party online training. ERA will replace and expand on services provided through home-grown electronic systems and paper-based processes.

The Office of Sponsored Programs and Regulatory Compliance Services (SPARCS) seeks two Business Analysts, one specializing in sponsored programs and one specializing in the compliance areas listed above, to support the development, implementation and ongoing maintenance of the ERA system. Each Business Analyst will:
1. Coordinate and support working groups of subject matter experts tasked with understanding the default capabilities of the vendor ERA software and making business decisions to configure the ERA system optimally for implementation in the NC State campus environment.
2. Develop a high level understanding of the major business processes in the assigned areas and current NC State procedures.
3. Develop a thorough understanding of vendor ERA system structure and functionality, including a working knowledge of workflows, data structure, user roles and permissions, and reporting tools.
4. Lead fit-gap and testing activities in assigned areas.
5. Document business decisions necessary for ERA implementation, highlighting changes to current procedures.
6. Develop manuals, training materials, tip sheets and in-system help to support campus adoption of ERA.
7. Serve as liaison with Office of Information Technology partners responsible for technical implementation of ERA.
8. Coordinate with the ERA Communications and Training teams as appropriate to ensure timely and focused project updates and training opportunities are provided to campus stakeholders.
9. Identify risks and obstacles to timely progress and work with Director, working group leads and ERA Project Manager to resolve.

Other Work/Responsibilities
Upon completion of ERA implementation, the Business Analyst will provide ongoing support for training, troubleshooting and enhancement, as well as support additional business processes in SPARCS.

Minimum Education/Experience
Graduation from a four year college or university with a degree related to the area of assignment; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.

Departmental Required Skills
The selected candidate must demonstrate:
Working knowledge of the business functions in his/her area of specialization (sponsored programs or research compliance).The ability to combine business function expertise with a strong understanding of electronic systems to facilitate decision-making and vendor interactions.Outstanding written communication and presentation skills.The ability to effectively manage a team or working group.

Preferred Experience, Skills, Training/Education
Proficiency with Microsoft Office, Google Apps and project management tools highly desired.Experience with implementation of a commercial electronic research administration system or module strongly preferred.Experience with implementation or use of InfoEd Global modules is highly beneficial.

Required License or Certification
N/A
