Are you a recent Finance, Accounting or Business Management Grad? Launch your career with a Global Fortune 500 company! We’re looking for the right candidate to develop their career with our finance team. We’ll provide cross-training and industry knowledge through exposure to multiple parts of our business to prepare you for promotion opportunities in Airgas at locations across the country. You bring your analytical mindset, attention to detail, fresh perspectives and desire to learn.

The Regional Business Analyst is a career position for a recent college graduate. You will be responsible for providing business support for the VP of Finance and the field organization. You’ll have primary responsibility for Cost Accounting for Bulk Installation throughout the region. You’ll work closely with the VP of Operations and the Cryogenic Manager to develop and monitor cost savings and metrics for bulk installation and maintenance projects as well as managing all associated costs.

During the first 2 years of your development you will also cross-train in multiple aspects of Finance at Airgas, including dispute resolution, budgeting and forecasting, analysis of customer and segment profitability, sales and profit margins, operating costs, capital expenditures, acquisitions and due diligence (if available), inventory management, asset management, specialized billing and other ad hoc assignments. This will require a professional who is data savvy with exceptionally strong analytical skills and excellent communication skills to interact with multiple business partners.


Essential Functions:

Primary Duties
 Work closely with VP of Operations and Cryogenic Manager on the status of bulk projects
 Manage the implementation of new equipment, vendors and software.
 Monitor installation schedules and ensure all accounting processes and procedures are in place to align with deadlines.
 Manage Capex requests for new equipment
 Manage the conversion of installation to maintenance projects and coordinate with divisional personnel to close out Capex bulk projects.
 Manage the journal entries and billing process for all Bulk install and maintenance projects
 Approve and monitor sales and work orders
 Act as the primary resource for information on assets related to bulk projects.
 Liaison with field personnel to approve and manage costs associated with install and maintenance projects.

Utilize the various business reports and metrics to evaluate, interpret, and provide critical information in support of strategic and operating decisions.
Ability to conduct business travel approximately 10 – 15% of the time.
Other duties as assigned.
Cross-training and development opportunities

Report and analyze financial and operating metrics, such as same-store sales, gross margins, operating expenses, asset utilization, capital expenditures, etc.
Identify and assist in implementing and tracking areas of improvement for operating cost controls.
Assist in the annual budgeting and quarterly forecasting processes.
Job shadow with A/P, A/R and other finance roles in our Business Support Center located in Tulsa, Oklahoma.
Prepare analyses related to local compensation programs, including gain sharing, commissions & various incentive programs.
Provide support to the VP-Finance and Division finance support teams, District Managers and Area Vice Presidents to better understand historical financial results, trends and validate forecast assumptions.
 Provide backup and support to other Regional finance team members.

Assist with field audit activities regarding internal controls, SOP compliance and SOX compliance, as needed.
Assist with fraud investigations and inventory controls.






Qualifications

Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience:
 Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting or business management, or related course of study.
 Ability to manage multiple priorities and juggle between Divisional and local management and demands.
 Strong computer skill (MS Word, Excel).

Personal Characteristics:
The successful candidate will possess:
 Strong organizational, team-building, and communication skills. The ability to work and navigate within a complex matrixed organization and build effective relationships with all levels and roles in the organization.
 To be successful, the Business Analyst should possess exceptionally strong analytical skills and a thorough understanding of how to leverage a wide variety of data and related computer tools to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the organization.
 Able to demonstrate strong leadership skills and the ability to assume increasing responsibilities in a rapidly-changing environment.

Language Skills:

Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before customers or employees of the Company.

Mathematical Skills:

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands to finger, handle, feel, operate a 10 key calculator or PC; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical office machine parts. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

While visiting plant locations proper personal protective equipment such as steel toed boots and safety glasses must be worn.

JOB SUMMARY
Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. Possesses expertise in the business unit(s) (s) he supports, as well as an understanding of the IT organization's systems and capabilities. Educates the IT organization on the direction of the business. May make recommendations for 'buy vs. build' decision. Provides complex analysis services translating user needs into detailed specifications to allow Information Technology Department to deliver an appropriate solution.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Actively and consistently supports all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience
Analyzes business partners’ operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions
Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology
Translates high level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization and manages changes to such specifications
Negotiates agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business unit(s) and IT from initial requirements to final implementation
Works with business partners within one business function to align technology solutions with business strategies
Supports several moderately complex business processes
Assists Project Managers in development of project plans and uses associated project planning tools as needed
Assumes Project Manager responsibilities in preparing and facilitating the project plan for smaller projects

Coaches less experienced staff

Ability to read, write, speak and understand English
Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC)

Good communication skills (oral and written)
Good interpersonal and consultative skills
Analytical thinking and problem solving
Detail oriented and committed to a high level of accuracy
Knowledge of industry best practice for business analysis
Models systems and data to a logical level, user interface design, and prototyping, decision tables/trees, data flows
Modeling notation (UML, Structured, BPMN)
Writing unambiguous, verified requirements to a testable level (functional and non-functional requirements)
Training on elicitation and elaboration of requirements from a verified source and demonstration of using these skills to provide on elicitation and elaboration of requirements
Education
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field or equivalent work experience

Related Work Experience
4 to 6 years of relevant technical or business work experience

Office environment

Performs analysis of design documents by identifying testing needs, design test cases, run tests, and document test results on subsystems of the large complex Medicaid Systems (MS). Direct staff in supporting QA functions during the duration of project or assignment. Supports customer during User Acceptance Testing. Performs other duties as assigned.




JOB DUTIES:




50% - Essential - Quality Assurance Lead Analyst:
Plans, leads and engages in identifying requirements, set project schedules and implement in to the production environment by collaborating with QA Manager, Development Team Leads, and users. Coordinate the systems testing life cycle for projects assigned to her to include quality assurance tasks and deliverables, i.e, testing, defect management, defect reporting, etc. Supervises and directs the work of QA testers assigned to major projects. Oversees, the tickets for the project and assigns to QA Testers. Leads QA testers in the creation and execution of test scenarios to ensure proper system operation and freedom from defects. Sets priorities and deadlines.

20% - Essential - System, Integration and Unit Testing:
Coordinates with the QA Manager the creation and execution of procedures that meet the agency standards. Analyze business needs, determine requirements, create, and execute text scenarios to ensure proper system operation and freedom from defects. Define, setup, and populate test databases to perform required tests. Test, evaluate, and approve software for compliance with departmental and project standards. Makes system presentations and progress reports to customers and management.

20% - Essential - Project Management Support:
Works with the Project Manager, User Acceptance Test Lead, and Project team to troubleshoot and resolve problems as they are encountered. Resolves minor conflicts that occur and affect QA Testers assigned to her testing team. Documents and reports the issues and resolutions to the QA Manager. Provides estimates on the amount of analysis and testing effort needed based on requirements. Updates/add QA Resources tasks in Timekeeping system.

5% - Essential - Oncall Support:
Participate in the testing efforts needed in order to resolve production problems after normal office hours
as part of the on-call rotation support. Meet with other technical staff on standards committees for all database management software products. Propose new standards and changes to current standards to improve the quality of software products for the MS systems.

5% - Essential - Training:
Cross-training staff in QA and business related subject matter. Provides training and support for customers and staff. Shares policy, system, and technical knowledge with other employees. Assists others in resolving problems.




MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:




A high school diploma and experience in computer system development and modification. A bachelor's degree in a related area may be substituted for the required work experience.




RESPONSIBILITIES




JOB KNOWLEDGE
Firm Job Knowledge - Firm working knowledge of concepts, practices and procedures and ability to use in varied situations

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
Supervises Work of Others - Supervises work of others and may offer recommendations for hiring, termination and pay adjustments but does not have responsibility for making these decisions.

BUDGETARY RESPONSIBILITIES
No Budget Responsibilities - No fiscal responsibility for the department's budget.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst

Join us as we build a next-generation analytics platform to serve our world-class agents. As a Senior Business Analyst, you’ll help build a platform of robust analytics features that lay the foundation for optimizing agent and broker productivity that bring Realogy’s renowned real estate brands into the next era of data-driven excellence.

What we’re looking for:
We are seeking a highly motivated Agile Senior Business Analyst to join our Data team. This individual will possess a strong understanding of business analysis and analytics technology, and have a proven track record of defining and driving technology-based solutions to implement strategic solutions that bridge the divide between business and technical knowledge.

What you’ll do:
As a Senior Business Analyst, you’ll elicit and evaluate business requirements for delivering new or enhanced software systems, appropriately document system requirements, and measure the success of the resultant initiatives.

You will:
Grow into a trusted partner of our Strategy organization and Business Units, coming prepared to the conversation by knowing your partners’ pain better that they do
Partner with cross-functional teams to analyze, decompose and map current state processes and pain points, then determine improvement opportunities including creation of target operating models. You are a listener but not a note taker.
Drive ideation and new solution thinking to delivers significant net new business value to partners
Strive for industry disruption and moonshot initiatives that differentiate Realogy offerings from currently existing ones
Take ownership to lead solutions from concept to implementation by partnering with technology and business organizations to ensure requirements are satisfied and delivered on time
Build and develop business relationships vital to project success
Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders
Work with business product owners to facilitate creation and maintenance of Product Roadmaps and Backlogs
Collaborate and communicate with stakeholders, developers, designers and technical team members
Work with development teams to prioritize agile/scrum backlogs, assuming responsibility for delivery of business value to a portfolio of business partners, as measured by key performance indicators (ie: GCI, EBIDTA,etc).

Skills, accomplishments, & interests you should have:
BA/BS degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related discipline
3+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst
Hands-on experience in a Scrum Agile development environment
Demonstrated experience identifying solutions using standard analysis techniques such as business process and information modeling, root cause analysis, use case analysis, workflow analysis, functional decomposition analysis, process map creation, etc.
Experience in facilitating the solicitation and evaluation of business requirements for delivering new or enhanced software systems, and measuring the success of the associated initiatives
Strong problem-solving and structuring skills, with ability to bring actionable insights through effective communication
Experience working with diverse set of senior stakeholders on requirements, roles and responsibilities, project timelines
Ability to independently and quickly ramp up on new business and technical concepts
Demonstrated passion for developing and overseeing strategic solution execution
Ability to work independently as well as in team environment, providing structure in ambiguous situations
Proficient in JIRA, Visio, MS Excel, PowerPoint and other Office applications
Nice to haves:
PMI-PBA or CBAP Certification is a plus

We are offering full-time positions to highly-motivated, tenacious career-seekers at our company headquarters in San Antonio.

Business Analysts spearhead Labatt’s many continual improvement efforts by identifying problems and opportunities, making detailed assessments through interviews and quantitative analyses, working with internal software developers to codify robust, standardized processes and tools, and finally by working with business people to drive cultural and procedural changes. Business Analysts at Labatt follow our own specialized change management methodology that gains its inspiration from the tenets of Lean and Six Sigma as well as the philosophies of Demming and Drucker. By interfacing extensively with executives, operational managers, employees, engineers, vendors, and customers, Analysts are truly poised to gain dramatic insight into the food industry at large, and more importantly, into Labatt’s highly differentiated poise within the industry.

As an Analyst at Labatt, you will:

-Manage software development processes using Lean Startup and Agile methodologies-Aid in crafting and executing strategic initiatives-Solve some of the industry’s and our company’s hardest problems-Communicate excellently, assessing problems both abstractly and concretely-Analyze, and help the organization digest, large sources of data with untapped potential-Set individual and team goals and demonstrate the resourcefulness to achieve them-Hold yourself and your teammates accountable to achieving robust success-Live by a philosophy of genchi genbutsu-Learn continuously, through training, mentoring, and a strong culture of high-level reading
Your direct manager is a corporate-level executive in one functional area of the business. Analysts who succeed at Labatt will settle for nothing less than the best, and have demonstrated this disciplined, accountable focus time and again in previous experiences, whether academically or at the workplace. A competitive undergraduate degree with outstanding marks is required. The Analyst position demands core values that constitute our company culture, including: a strong focus on excellence, hard work, integrity, teamwork, and customer-orientation.
Here is the link to our online application: http://apply.labattfood.com/

Company Description

Auto-Owners Insurance is a mutual insurance company made up of five property and casualty companies and one life/health/annuity insurer. Along with a competitive base salary, matched 401(k), fully-funded pension plan (once vested), and bonus programs, Auto-Owners is also committed to a work/life balance and provides generous paid time off including holidays, vacation days, personal time, and sick leave. If you're looking to do rewarding work alongside great people, Auto-Owners is the place for you!

We are currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst to be based at our worldwide headquarters in Madison, NJ.

We are building digital platforms to serve agents. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will work to build the next generation of robust platforms that lay the foundation for our agent and broker product lines. As a member of the Brand Digital Marketing team the Senior Analyst will be responsible for one or more business products as well as the direction of the other business analysts.


The Senior Business Analyst responsible for assisting developing solutions that support business ideas and product concepts through gathering and translating testable requirements into application software solutions. They must be a critical thinker capable of contributing independently, mentoring business analysts, and collaborating to drive sound solutions with a diverse team including product managers, software developers, testers, project managers, and teams across the organization. They will serve as a liaison between the customer/business community and the software development team, working with them to obtain requirements through various avenues both Agile and Waterfall using interviews, document analysis, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, workflow analysis and use cases etc. They will need to effectively evaluate information from multiple sources to develop an understanding of the business requests and needs and translate them. They will need to leverage excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to mentor, coach, lead as well as direct the work of others.


Responsibilities:

Assist business analyst team members
Maintain standard processes, templates, workflows and procedures
Conduct interviews, requirements workshops with a cross-discipline team to elicit understanding of business needs
Collaborate with key stakeholders to help design and drive the functional definition of a solution that meets the program level objectives and vision
Write unambiguous, testable requirements with clear acceptance criteria; an integrated scrum team member to assure requirements are understood fully; & define non-functional requirements
Work with Product owners/Product Management to write business cases and acceptance criteria
Assist team to troubleshoot issues; evaluate existing application products which could address client requirements and develops recommendations where appropriate

Requirements:


Bachelor's degree; advanced degree, Computer Science, Information Technology, Science or equivalent work experience
5 - 7+ years of experience in Business Analysis
Proven experience in eliciting requirements, creating user stories, test cases, and wireframes
Experienced in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions using data visualization techniques and tools. Documenting systems design, creating specifications, flow charts, and other related diagrams based on user or system design specifications.
 Advanced knowledge in generating process documentation
Excellent verbal, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; is a team player.
Very strong written skills showing the ability to convey details accurately in a well-structured and precise manner that describe end user problems and solutions.
Solid experience in and understanding of Scrum Agile development or Scaled Agile Framework, Waterfall, and SDLC processes
 JIRA knowledge desired.
Proven problem-solving skills, is logical and analytical.
Experience in working with distributed, offshore teams.
Experience in managing and mentoring team
Preferred CBAP (Certified Business Analyst Professional) or PMI-PBA (PMI Professional in Business Analysis)
Preferred previous experience in Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) and Content Management System (CMS)

10 essential functions:


Support the daily settlement of Card Services activity through the various processing platforms and internal systems. Retrieve and analyze data from various sources and input information into balancing spreadsheets and files to ensure all activity is processed in its entirety. Research any out-of-balances in daily settlement files to determine variance and resolve timely. Prepare SAP and Accounting Entry System (AES) upload sheets to post entries to the BB&T General Ledger (GL) and Enterprise Owned Demand Accounts (EODA).
Research and request information to timely clear outstanding items in support of the reconcilement process.
Calculate, prepare and process entries for daily postings to fund payment networks for cardholder and merchant activity.
Review and analyze Secured Card closures and process required fee reversals, review outstanding activity, apply collateral to outstanding balances, and release collateral within specified timeframes.
Research payments with incomplete/missing data and post payment to correct account. Research and correct teller errors to provide prompt application of credit to a client's account. Process Internet payments for Constant Credit accounts. Research and process returned payments, including non-sufficient funds (NSF), unauthorized debit, and declined Webpays. Research and process payments in which client paid the wrong account or client is requesting a refund due to overpayment on account.
Research and clear Proof Services Correction (PSC) tickets and Branch Operations Clearing tickets.
Review and research fee reversals in which the client initiated the request, ensuring all reversals are processed in accordance with BB&T Policy. Process Harvester fees, Servicemembers Civil Relief Act (SCRA) reversals, and Military Lending Act (MLA) reversals as required by Compliance.
Analyze accounts with a credit balance and research the source of the credit. Refund credit balances in accordance with Regulatory requirements and BB&T Policy.
Research Balance Transfers loaded into various vendor queues, including edit rejects, pending balance transfers, research, and authorization rejects. Analyze and correct all rejected Balance Transfers according to specifications and reject invalid requests.
Assign GL accounts and centers to invoices. Enter invoices and requests for disbursements to third-parties into the BB&T vendor payables system.

POSITION SUMMARY:

As a member of the Business Process Governance team the Sr. Business Analyst, Planning and Reporting Process Management will be responsible for supporting the lodging operating and capital budget processes and lodging operations reporting on a global basis, the development and delivery of global management reports that provide accurate, timely and actionable information on global business results and capital investments and the development of routine reporting of key business indicators that serve as an early warning system of business changes and risks.
EXPECTED CONTRIBUTION
Support the facilitation of the global operating budget/business plan and capital budget processes. Assist in the development and communication of guidelines, timelines and resources to support the processes
Facilitate enhancement and support of hotel global operating budget and forecasting tools. Develop/enhance automation of these tools, leveraging advanced visual basic knowledge, and create interfaces with other tools and data sources as needed.
Provide support, configuration, and development of requirements, and testing for the global capital budgeting tool/system.
Work with continent offices to facilitate training on forecasting and budgeting tools as needed.
Support team’s efforts to continually improve planning tools and techniques with an emphasis on automation.
Contribute to the design and delivery of key global management reports and metrics providing comparable analysis of business performance, insight to business results, trends and risk areas for Continent and Headquarters leaders
Prepare key metric reports comparing operational results across properties and brands to focus attention on hotels/brands that fall short in key areas
Prepare and distribute the weekly sales flash report
Execute programs and processes for sharing of information among the global market analysts and for facilitating the ongoing improvement of management reporting and planning processes across the continents and brands
Support chart of account maintenance for market operations; partner with continent teams, Financial Applications Business Support and other Business Process Governance team members to ensure continued alignment and consistent mapping of accounts in transaction and reporting applications
Fulfill data gathering/analysis requests utilizing various financial reporting tools, including PeopleSoft nVision/Query and Hyperion SmartView/Financial Reports
Provide and update hotel operating unit metadata as needed for new unit setup and ongoing maintenance
Build relationships with all Finance teams to promote the delivery of services that meet or exceed stakeholder expectations
Performs other duties as assigned to meet business needs

Minimum 5 years of relevant accounting/finance experience required

Knowledge of generally accepted finance and accounting policies, principles and controls
Knowledge of hotel and administrative accounting and reporting processes and systems
Understands the need for effective data and business process governance.
Strong qualitative and quantitative analytical skills; ability to take large volumes of complex information and present it in a clear and concise manner appropriate for decision-making; uses data and a cogent problem solving methodology in decision making and impact assessment.
Initiates, supports and manages change within the organization, taking steps to remove barriers or to accelerate its pace.
High degree of initiative and ability to work effectively both independently and in a collaborative work environment
Exceptional organizational skills; effective in prioritizing work and following through on commitments; effective project management skills

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Joining the Stanley Black & Decker (SBD) team means joining one of the world’s largest, fastest-growing, and most dynamic companies. Stanley Black & Decker is unique in that we’ve got a rich and storied history dating back to 1843, but that hasn’t stopped us from evolving into a vibrant, diverse, global growth company poised and ready for the future.

Being a part of our team means living our core values of integrity, accountability, respect, speed, stretch, vision, and boundaryless. It means thriving in an environment of constant innovation and positive change. It means delivering tools, services, and solutions that the world counts on when it really matters. It means maintaining the highest standards in everything you do, every day.

It also means joining a team that has been globally recognized as one of the most innovative, sustainable and rewarding companies in the world. With over 50,000 employees world-wide the Company has World Head-Quarters in the US and a Global Emerging Market (GEM) Head-Quarters in Miramar, Florida.

JOB SUMMARY


Stanley Black & Decker is looking for an inspired, proactive, and experienced Senior Business Analyst to manage digital technology projects from ideation to deployment. The ideal candidate lives and breathes digital, has a passion for new technologies and strong experience launching projects in partnership with multi-disciplinary teams and multiple stakeholders.
The Business Analyst is responsible for identifying business needs and determining solutions maintaining a focus on customer satisfaction, innovation, relationship building, change management and driving positive results.
This individual will collaborate with Business Teams, Project Managers, Shared Services Teams and vendors to lead and manage all aspects of GEM Digital projects from strategy briefings and project discovery through launch.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


Leads a partnership with internal and external technical and non-technical teams
Defines the strategic direction of the cross-functional team by identifying clear and measurable business requirements and execution standards
Facilitates requirement sessions with stakeholders and creates comprehensive requirement documents by decomposing high-level information into general understanding terms and details
Utilizes modeling approach to represent requirements information in graphical forms that augment textual representation
Monitors day-to-day activities of digital builds, such as mobile applications, web experiences and digital products
Ensure that projects and prototypes are completed as planned and with the highest standards
Engages closely and collaboratively with designers, engineers and UX to shape product roadmaps and execution schedules
Understands how policies, systems and processes impacts requests, projects, cross-functional operations
Shares business knowledge and understanding among team members and stakeholders
Brokers consensus among stakeholders with conflicting needs

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES


Proven track record of managing cross platform digital projects (desktop, tablet, mobile) with large groups of distributed stakeholders and project team members
Strong knowledge of all phases of digital development from concept to information architecture to design, development, and QA
Experience with SharePoint, Salesforce, eCommerce, DAM, PIM and CMS platforms, metadata modeling and workflow automation
Working understanding of business process and system process within one or more knowledge areas
Knowledge of system development methodology, project management, system architecture and analytical/problem solving skills
Experience working on digital innovation, UX and mobile first responsive design
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment a must
Excellent presentation, communications skills, solid organizational skills, strong leadership capability, visual skills, ability to prioritize
Minimum of 5 years of systems analysis experience with understanding strategic business information systems

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS


Over 7 years of experience of digital leadership experience in a multinational global company
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Management, Computer Sciences or related fields
Certificate in Business Analysis (preferably in a quantitative discipline) or equivalent work experience
IIBA and/or PMI-PBA certification is a plus

The job description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment. Stanley Black and Decker reserves the right to revise or change job duties and responsibilities as the need arises. Requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills, and experience required.

RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans and implementing technology to help transform organizations.
Working as a consultant you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result is a career defined by you, supported by RGP and built on tangible accomplishments.
As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, there a few things you should know:
We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them.
We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth-minded.
We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues.
If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more.

 THE RGP CONSULTING EXPERIENCE
RGP has a unique consulting model that provides opportunities for consultants to work in different ways. Most consultants work in a model where they have the flexibility and autonomy to choose projects aligning to their experience, skills and desired lifestyle. Other opportunities exist in team-based, strategy and solutions work. In all models, you will feel the full support of RGP to assist you in your work and guide you on your chosen path.
PURPOSE OF THE ROLE
As a Business Systems Analyst, you will help our clients execute their project and system initiatives, combining systems knowledge with functional experience in accounting, information management, human capital, internal audit, and supply chain to help Clients ensure project success.
ATTRIBUTES OF CONSULTANTS WITH RGP
Respect for people and opinions and confidently offer your point-of-view with clients and among colleagues
A drive for proactively cultivating relationships with clients and colleagues
Optimism when faced with challenges and complex situations, coupled with the drive to solve client issues
Dedication to continuous improvement and development of your skillset and talents
A strong personal identification with RGP’s values – loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability and talent
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE
Define and document business requirements and functional specifications from business users and subject matter experts; perform business needs analysis and design workflows, including “as is” and “to be” process mapping
Lead requirements validation and traceability analysis through stakeholder engagement meetings
Perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and system testing; write test plans as required
Analyze large, complex data sets and provide insights to the business
Provide data support (e.g., request handling, ad-hoc analysis, etc.) to meet the needs of finance operations and other stakeholder groups
Collect timely feedback from stakeholder groups in order to ensure terms of requirements and specifications are being met through solutions being built
Perform interface analysis, including proper mapping of how the technology infrastructure and systems share data to achieve business goals
Provide insight for the user interface with the systems
Assess and mitigate risks in systems and business structures
DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree in business, information systems or similar discipline is required; Master’s degree preferred
5 to 7-plus years of experience as a business analyst
Functional background in Finance or Accounting, Insurance, Financial Services or Management Information Systems is strongly preferred
Previous system implementation and process improvement experience; deep knowledge of large ERP packages a plus
Strong understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
Advanced MS Excel skills required: pivot tables, v and h lookups, import/export, modeling, etc.
Advanced MS Visio and MS PowerPoint skills
Excellent skills in planning and organization as well as verbal and written communication
Ability to adapt quickly to new situations, changes in direction and adjusted priorities

Equal Opportunity Employer
RGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or veteran status, and encourage all applicants to apply.

Description:
At Vatica Health we are on a Mission to improve the quality of healthcare and keep populations healthy at a lower cost. We innovate and deliver scalable, end-to-end technology solutions and value-add clinical services that enable Providers, Payers and Patients to THRIVE in the new world of value-based care. We are a fast growing, early stage, small company solving today’s most complex problems with a talented team of disruptors, inventors and change agents who are not satisfied with the status quo and crave to make a difference. We are a ‘Powered Health’ portfolio company supported by a network of resources, experience and industry connections.

The Problem: The shift to value-based care is challenging. Providers lack the infrastructure, expertise, technology, services, payer-alignment and patient-engagement to effectively improve the cost and quality of care.

Our Solution: Vatica Health pioneered the delivery of the industry’s first Provider-centric, Risk Adjustment and Quality (PRAQTM) solution that measures and improves care quality and performance to accelerate the transition to value-based care. We build and deliver innovative technology and services that measurably improve care quality and outcomes, payer and provider financial performance and overall population health.

Working at Vatica Health – Do You Have What It Takes?

We are seeking smart, hands-on, driven, collaborative team players with a thirst for learning and new experiences. You have an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for producing amazing work that measurably impacts our industry. You seek an opportunity to work with industry experts to support your continual learning and customize your own career track. Our work environment is virtual – no cubes, walls or doors. We leverage state-of-the-art technology to communicate, collaborate and get work done - fast. We focus on results, not inputs. We are flexible, fun and focused. If this sounds like an environment that you would thrive in – we want to talk to you!

Junior Product Owner Role Description

As a Junior Product Owner at Vatica Health you study and understand what functionality our customers and users require from our software to excel in their job responsibilities. You are the expert in our product, embedded business and clinical processes and supporting data structure. You create clear and complete user requirements that are easily understood by our developers and deliver high value to our users.

This is an entry level position focused on building tactical and operational skills required to advance within the product management career ladder.

Your Responsibilities

Understand Company and product vision and strategy
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of the Customer and each user’s job responsibilities related to use of our software,
Gather and define requirements in comprehensive and discrete Agile User Stories and Epics within Jira
Work collaboratively with the Product Development team, to create, groom and maintain the product backlog for multiple Scrum teams onshore and offshore
Contribute to and lead Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions
Function as a liaison between internal and external stakeholders to ensure requirements are complete, clearly defined and understood
Participate in daily scrum standups, reviews and retrospectives
Validate that software functionality developed meets the requirements during sprint reviews
Build and share subject matter expertise about our products and business
Define product integration and interoperability requirements to enable the exchange of information with Provider, Health Plan and Consumer software applications
Assumes Business Analyst, Product Owner and other responsibilities as required.

Requirements:
Required Experience

Experience working as a Business Analyst or Product Owner designing and developing commercial, cloud-based software solutions (2+ years). (Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) Certification a plus)
Agile software development experience (1+ years)

Desired Experience

Experience working for a commercial healthcare software product vendor - specifically physician practice EMR software and/or health plan quality or risk adjustment software
Comfortable working remotely as part of a virtual team Experience with current health IT interoperability standards and integration methods including HL7 messaging, C-CDA and direct integration using an integration appliance such as Mirth Connect.
Experience with working with offshore and onshore teams and the challenges that entails

Required Knowledge and Skills

Product Management – experienced and skilled in the discipline of product management in a commercial software company (Pragmatic Marketing training and certification a plus)
Entrepreneurial spirit – thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic, high-intellect environment with minimal structure and frequent change
Communication – effectively communicates with and aligns different parties including customers, partners, a peer network of stakeholders, senior executives, technical resources as well as partner staff in other countries
Problem Solving – rapidly assimilates information from a variety of internal and external sources, formulates workable solutions and makes high quality decisions with limited time and data
Self-starter and Quick Learner – takes initiative to take on new responsibilities and build new skills and knowledge as needed to grow our company and serve our clients
Time Management – effectively manages time and priorities to complete most important assignments on time
Quality – extremely high attention to detail, passion for continuous improvement and operational excellence and commitment to deliver the most amazing products
Flexibility and Focus – comfortable working remotely and unsupervised as part of a geographically distributed global and culturally diverse team. Weekend and evening work will occasionally be required.
Sense of Humor – ability to work hard and have fun at the same time.

Software Packages


Proficient in Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Project, Visio, Skype
Proficient in Agile software automation tools such as Atlassian JIRA Software

Education Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, business, health informatics, marketing or a related discipline
Advanced degree in business management (MBA), marketing or planning is a plus.

Overview
The Visiting Nurse Service of New York (VNSNY) is the nation's largest not-for-profit home- and community-based health care organization, serving the five boroughs of New York City, and Nassau, Suffolk, and Westchester Counties. For 125 years, VNSNY has been committed to meeting the health care needs of New Yorkers with compassionate, high-quality home health care. We offer a wide range of services, programs, and health plans to meet the diverse needs of our patients, members, and clients from before birth to the end of life.
Each day, more than 13,000 VNSNY employees- including nurses, rehabilitation therapists, social workers, other allied professionals, and paraprofessionals- deliver compassionate care, unparalleled medical expertise, and 24/7 solutions and resources to more than 48,000 patients and members, helping them to live the best lives possible in their homes and communities.
Responsibilities
Responsible for developing, designing and implementing workflows and procedures that support the day-to-day management of VNS Patient Accounts. Conducts detailed audits and analyses, prepares reports, and makes preliminary recommendations based on findings. Determines project scope and collaborates with Manager to develop and implement best approach to resolve operational and regulatory discrepancies. Works under general direction.

Education: Bachelors Degree in Accounting, Business Administration or the equivalent work experience required. Experience: Minimum three years business experience preferably in Managed Care or Health Care Management (Hospital or Home Care) setting required. Effective oral/written communication skills required. Personal Computer skills including Microsoft Word and Excel required. Strong analytical skills, including analysis of data and recommendations based on findings required.

Position Summary
The Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for developing a robust supply chain for new projects. Individual works closely with the Logistics and Purchasing Team. The position will be responsible for defining & delivering integrated Global Supply Chain business solutions using Oracle Advance Supply Chain Planning (ASCP) and Demantra Demand Management (DM) modules of Oracle E-business Suite applications.

Organizational Relationship
This position reports directly to the Manager – Business Transformation

Accountabilities
As part of the role, the person is expected to interact with supply chain operations, identify gaps and improvement opportunities in the Supply Chain Planning process, and design solutions using Oracle ASCP, Demantra, extensions, and other related home grown systems.
Performs analysis and evaluation of options, alternatives, and system capabilities.
Utilizing production planning and MRP information from Oracle to develop off-line spreadsheet/database models that will be used to determine capital expenditure [machine, fixture] and headcount decision making, sourcing decisions, and schedule feasibility/optimization
Recommends system functional improvement to meet user requirements.
Ensures system and process user requirements are properly defined and met and tasks are accomplished within defined timeframes at the highest quality with attention given to detail and scalability
Ensures the solution delivered actually adds value to the business and will help prepare all satisfaction, utilization, and ROI calculations of the solution
Manage Supply Chain team members' adherence of standard processes, maintenance of quality and performance to service levels and schedule.
Identify system issues and other unique issues, escalate and resolve as appropriate - be responsible for systems problem management activities for the supply chain team.
Establish positive working relationships with other team members so that the team receives comprehensive information to build according to the requirement
Should have in-depth functional understanding of ASCP and Demantra modules with basic technical knowledge about applications and database related to these applications. Skilled in Demand Planning, good understanding of Supply Chain Planning, and fair understanding of Oracle Value Chain Planning process flows and best practices is essential.
Responsible for BR100 and MD50 documentation and collaboration with onsite and offshore development team along with testing of developed component for an application.
Working knowledge of Oracle Web ADI is a plus to maintain master data related to planning and forecasting.
Consistently demonstrates the 6 For Success: Be trustworthy, Commit to your team, Listen to understand, Serve your customer, Prepare and plan, and Deliver the result.
Perform other duties as may be assigned at management’s discretion.

Characteristics & Attributes
Experience maintaining supply chain systems, preferably in an implementation capacity (Full project lifecycle preferred).
Ability to anticipate potential problems, determine and implement solutions
Outstanding critical thinking skills. Ability to analyze business needs and translate into system requirements
Must be extremely organized and capable of tracking, managing, and resolving many issues simultaneously.
Excellent interpersonal skills, customer service, communication, analysis and problem solving skills required.
Expertise required in functional areas of Oracle R12 – ASCP, Demantra, Purchasing, Inventory, Bills of Material, Order Management modules.
Experience integrating with external order entry, order capture, Point of Sales, and 3PL systems desired
Proven ability to work with all members of a project team, including business, technical, and management.
Education & Experience
Degree in the field of business administration, business management, computer science, accounting, MIS, Supply Chain or Manufacturing.
Candidate must have 4 years of experience working in an ERP environment, preferable in Oracle ERP.
Strong business process understanding of Demand/Supply Planning and Sales & Operational Planning processes.
To be successful the new hire requires keen analytical skills, integrated thinking, and a drive for results.
Strong communication skills are essential as role will require heavy collaboration with business teams to problem-solve and solution-shape.

The Business Analyst works closely with the IT technical team and/or outside vendors to
design, develop, document and test solutions that meets the business requirements.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

interactions with others.

appropriate sources, and skillfully pose questions to draw out pertinent information.

Ability to access and effectively navigate project systems and technologies.

Effectively influences without authority and leads change by building trust and credibility.

Ability to institute change leadership across levels and manage through influence.

Process and results oriented in setting and pursuing aggressive goals, demonstrating a strong
commitment to organizational success and marshaling resources to accomplish goals and objectives.

Experience working with web architecture, integration to host systems and related components.

Understands the need for and consistently practices effective teamwork with others.

Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.

Competent to work on most phases of systems analysis while considering the business implications of
the application of technology to the current and future business environment.

Understanding of system modeling using standards such as Unified Modeling Language (UML).

Strong analytical skills and creative thinking abilities.

Principal Responsibilities

Serves as the primary liaison and point of contact between IT and the assigned functional
business area for routine software development and enhancement projects.

Coordinates the process of obtaining functional requirements from applicable business
stakeholders and subject matter experts utilizing elicitation techniques.

Performs research and analysis for proposed projects in order to determine feasibility and present

Facilitates the development of software solutions and is responsible for the knowledge transfer of

Creates detailed documentation of functional, system (non-functional), user and reporting
requirements that may include but is not limited to: Use Cases, Logical Models, Process Flow
Diagrams, Report Specifications and Data Mapping & Flow Diagrams.

Performs profiling and analysis of data from source systems.

Supports quality assurance and control efforts through the use of data analysis as part of pre- and
post-implementation reviews for software development projects.

Provides support to functional and user acceptance testing groups as part of project
implementation.

Assists others with creation of the value proposition (ROI) for proposed projects.

Maintains a system enhancement request database and coordinates the related
application enhancement release schedule.

Works jointly with other IT Managers to create detailed project work plans for
software development and enhancement projects.

Coordinates status meetings and produces progress reports.

Maintains and builds working relationships with software application vendors.

Performs other job related duties as assigned.

Overview
Nashville, Tenn.-based Bridgestone Americas, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation, the world’s largest tire and rubber company.
Bridgestone Americas and its subsidiaries develop, manufacture and market a wide range of Bridgestone, Firestone and associate brand tires to address the needs of a broad range of customers, including consumers, automotive and commercial vehicle original equipment manufacturers, and those in the agricultural, forestry and mining industries.

The companies are also engaged in retreading operations throughout the Western Hemisphere and produce air springs, roofing materials, and industrial fibers and textiles. The Bridgestone Americas family of companies also operates the world’s largest chain of automotive tire and service centers.

Guided by its One Team, One Planet message, the company is dedicated to achieving a positive environmental impact in all of the communities it calls home.
Position Summary
As part of the Consumer Replacement Tire Sales Analytics Team, the Sales Analyst will support the Sales Organization in making data-driven decisions to drive improved business results through generating business insights with data. The Analyst will be responsible for the cleaning, integration and presentation of data from a multitude of sources (customers, internal, 3rd party), systems and formats. In addition to the data processing, the Analyst will be responsible both for reporting – static and dynamic – and generating the analysis and recommendations that support the broader business strategy.
Responsibilities
Data Integration: Identify critical data sources and collaborate with others across the organization to integrate data into a consistent and usable format. Will require advanced data querying skills utilizing tools such as Alteryx, SQL or similar.

Analysis: Utilize analytical and quantitative methods to understand, predict, and improve consumer replacement sales channels. Could include evaluating key business metrics such as profitability, ROI and market share.

Reporting: Design, build, and maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor business performance. To do this, Tableau Desktop will be used to develop dashboards and dynamics reports, after gathering business requirements and end-user objectives.

Complete special projects as needed

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing or related field with 2-5 years of related experience.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (advanced)
Alteryx, SQL, SASS or related programming skills
Tableau Desktop or similar
Must show discretion as teammate will handle confidential information.
Strong analytical skills and familiarity working with financial measures
Candidate must adapt to a fast paced environment, with a close attention to detail
Strong communication skills both written and verbal, very organized, detail oriented, schedule minded with strong follow-up skills
Self-starter, team player who can independently manage time and projects wisely

About the Position
The Golden State Warriors are looking for a dynamic and passionate Business Analyst to join our growing Business Analytics and Strategy team. In this role, you will be a partner and support the Warriors Ticketing, Suites, and Youth Basketball departments. You will have chance to create and handle analytics and forecasting efforts related to events, working cross functionally across business teams and integrate and analyze a variety of data types and sources to provide important insights. This position will allow you to explore new ways to ensure the best-in-class fan experience, drive business growth, and use data to identify and implement process improvements.

This is an excellent opportunity to share your expertise and improve your craft, while learning more about this growing and exciting sports and entertainment organization that values your initiative, creativity and work towards results.

This is a full-time position and is based in Oakland, CA.

Analyze all data related to: Ticketing (primary and secondary markets, pricing, inventory), Suites,Youth Basketball
Build reports and presentations to internal business partners
Forecasting future results and working with business partners to develop and recommend dedicated plans of action
Collaborate and be an active partner to executive leaders and create positive relationships and create forward-thinking recommendations
Craft and develop business acumen to help achieve financial fan engagement/satisfaction goals
Required Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics and Finance or similar quantitative discipline; post-graduate degree preferred
3+ years of Analytics experience, preferably related to commerce and/or sales performance in particular
Working experience with SQL, Excel, Tableau and extensive experience analyzing new data sources and technologies
Highly motivated with clear communication skills explaining complex concepts
Have real passion for intellectual curiosity and ability to ask appropriate questions

Primary Objective:

Responsible for delivering metrics/analysis that identify market trends to support revenue growth, forecasting to ensure the sales pipeline is maintained and reflects real revenue opportunities, utilizes salesforce.com, works with finance regarding commission calculations, manages pricing compliance in the ERP system and manages basic supply chain activities for OEMs.

Major Areas of Accountability:

1. Analyzes sales statistics, business processes and customer information to evaluate operational performance of the sales team. Provides analysis to management on a monthly and/or quarterly basis with recommendations to increase sales effectiveness.


2. Utilizes SalesForce and Qlikview as a company expert on these systems. Design, develop and distribute reports from these systems. Modifies processes and reports as changing business environment dictates. Coordinates with business units, IT and finance to define changes to adjust programs and reporting accordingly.


3. Provides reports to Sales Manager to track performance to goals for sales engineers by compiling monthly/quarterly/annual bookings and shipment revenue, breakdown of sales by distributors or OEM’s, customer order history and other information as requested. Facilitates Sales Teams request for data analysis and reporting.


4. Manages monthly/quarterly account review process for sales management. Helps administer sales commissions based on goals and incentive programs provided by management.


5. Generates and refines forecasting models based on data from sales team, SalesForce, Qlikview and other internal transactional databases to provide sales pipeline forecasting and analysis.


6. Manages and maintains pricing compliance across the product portfolio including ensuring pricing approval documentation is complete and accurate prior to entering pricing into ERP system, managing special pricing offers and review dates, analyzing expected EAU against actual sales and providing analysis back to the sales team, and reviewing margin exception reports for compliancy.


7. Analyses sales statistics, business processes and customer information to evaluate operational performance of the inside and outside sales team by designing and reviewing sales reports. Provides analysis to management on a monthly and/or quarterly basis with recommendations to increase sales effectiveness.


Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree with a major in Business, Finance or Accounting preferred (or equivalent eight years related business experience) and minimum two years’ experience in a Business/Pricing Analyst role
Proficient in Microsoft Office. Programs to specifically include Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Special knowledge of Excel pivot tables and formulas required. Advanced knowledge of Excel a plus.
Operational excellence with a CRM tool required. Experience with Salesforce.com preferred Proficiency in segmentation, data management, data measurements, and/or statistical analysis.
Experience with Enterprise Resource Management and Business Information Systems. Working knowledge of BAAN/LN and Qlikview is desired.
Must be able to clearly communicate all reasoning behind analysis of business metrics, queries and/or reports
Demonstrated ability to drive process improvements, problem-solve, and produce results
Commitment to excellence in customer service and accountability
Strong written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to function independently and with limited supervision
Demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgment to solve problems and make recommendations
Competencies would include: analytical thinking, initiative, multi-tasking, flexibility, teamwork and cooperation.

Job Description
We are looking for a Business Analyst to join the Prime Now Whole Foods Market and 3P team. Our vision is to enable Prime customers to be able to get ultra fast delivery and pickup of groceries from stores they love, driving incremental growth and frequency with Whole Foods and amazon. This Business Analyst will leverage deep dives and metrics to identify key drivers of the business and help establish the definition and reporting of input metrics that drive the business. You will be responsible for diving deep into financial and operational performance, and working with cross functional teams across business, operations, finance, and external partners. This is a highly visible role with direct, ongoing impact to the Whole Foods business on Prime Now.

The ideal candidate will be a general athlete and self-starter who is comfortable performing complex analysis and working with large data sets. He/she can quickly understand the key drivers of our performance across functions as we scale (including marketing/merchandising, inventory management, selection, service availability and costs of fulfillment, etc.), identify key differences relative to other Prime Now/Amazon businesses, and identify areas for improvement. The role will involve a wide range of real-world problem-solving situations, and will require the ability to form strong recommendations supported by robust data analysis.

This is an exciting opportunity to support a recently-launched service which will be highly visible to customers and leadership, and will require a significant amount of autonomy and thought leadership. You will be part of a high-functioning, fast-moving team responsible for delivering on strategic goals with direct impact for our customers.

Responsibilities include:
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards on the key drivers of our business, and across a broad range of metrics.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Develop think-big ideas in relation to this brand new customer offering and make recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve performance

Successful candidates will demonstrate the following:
Have a passion for sourcing, manipulating, and visualizing data
Present to stakeholders, clearly communicating strategic findings and recommendations
Translate technical concepts into business terms
Work in rapidly changing and complex environment
Deliver key metrics to measure overall performance and provide foundation for continuous improvement
Learn new technologies, processes, and tools
Independently identify and set priorities in an ambiguous, fast-moving environment
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in finance, statistics, mathematics or related field preferred.
2-4 years experience as a Business Analyst, in finance, or in another quantitative field.
Advanced proficiency in Excel or similar analytical tools.
Strong bias for action: ability to work successfully in a dynamic, ambiguous environment.
Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to work successfully with functional teams across the organization.
Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Exceptional attention to detail.
Enthusiasm for developing new ideas and creative solutions.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience utilizing SQL and working with large datasets.

Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success.

If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price.


PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITION

The Retirement Plan Services (RPS) reporting Business Analyst supports all RPS business units through plan and participant data analysis and reporting across the RPS line of business (Omni, TRAC and I/O). Report types are ad-hoc, recurring, and project-related to support T. Rowe Price’s presence in the retirement industry and provides internal clients financial and service-specific information. The analyst ensures data and report consistency and enforces policies for all published data. Acts as primary liaison between the business user of data and the GBS&T team for day-to-day troubleshooting and on new product initiatives. Mines data and performs ongoing analysis in search of trends and data anomalies. Plays a major role in any infrastructure reporting projects.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES

On a daily basis, analyzes assigned report requests, contacts requestor to clarify and understand desired output. Based on analysis, determines if a solution already exists, or proceeds with report documentation and develops report. Performs and leads efforts for data mining in response to specific questions and in support of RPS initiatives. Uses basic oral and written communication skills to make technical and non-technical material understandable. Insures reports are verified, formatted adhering to General Manager Group standards, delivered and posted on the discovery site as applicable.

Participates in projects, as assigned. Investigates and recommends solutions for reporting and system enhancements for more effective utilization. Participates in documenting business and functional requirements, and designs report mock-ups. Creates appropriate project documentation (i.e. glossary, testing strategy, progress reports, etc.) Plan, lead and participate in meetings in order to liaise with GBS&T and business units on various initiatives.

Expands data and reporting capabilities by integrating new data into the Cross Plan Reporting environment. Identifies gaps, documents need, defines data and participates in the development effort. Creates and document test plans and executes testing on all new data and resulting reports to insure a high level of quality.

Act as a subject matter expert (SME) on data projects managed outside of the Cross Plan Reporting environment, but utilizing RPS data.

QUALIFICATIONS

Required

College degree and 1 year of related work experience, or
Associate degree and 3 years related work experience, or
High School diploma/equivalent and 5 years related work experience
Retirement Plan Industry knowledge
Detail oriented and accurate
Independent thinker
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word
Proficient in creating and executing SQL statements on Oracle, DB2 and SQL Servers platforms
Proven ability to form and foster strong positive business relationships
Ability to work in a team environment, draws conclusions, and initiates results
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Responsive to client needs
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and make decisions

Preferred

4 year college degree in Business or Technology major with 4 years related work experience
Understanding of Database Management concepts
Use of Report Writing tool, such as Business Objects
Use of coding languages such as VBA
Experience with testing strategies, test cases and execution
In depth OMNI specific data knowledge

ContractJob Category: Provider Relations
Department: Provider Network Management
Location: Los Angeles, CA, US, 90017
Position Type: Full Time
Requisition ID: 2544

Established in 1997, L.A. Care Health Plan is an independent public agency created by the state of California to provide health coverage to low-income Los Angeles County residents. We are the nation’s largest publicly operated health plan. Serving more than 2 million members in five health plans, we make sure our members get the right care at the right place at the right time.

Mission: L.A. Care’s mission is to provide access to quality health care for Los Angeles County's vulnerable and low-income communities and residents and to support the safety net required to achieve that purpose.

Job Summary

Under the general direction of the Senior Manager of Contracts and Regulatory Oversight, the Senior Business Analyst, Contracts and Regulatory Oversight is a critical thinker who is responsible for eliciting, analyzing, communicating, testing and verifying requirements for services delivered through of the L.A. Care (LAC) Provider Network Management (PNM) organization, and the Provider Network Management organizations of LACs contracted Plan Partners. The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for maintaining a subject matter expertise of the operational, reporting, and accrediting requirements for all lines of business (Medicaid, Medicare, and Commercial) and support his or her team in ensuring the LAC PNM organization, and partner with the Executive Director of the Plan Partners line of business to ensure the LAC contracted Plan Partners, are compliant.
The Senior Business Analyst is required to complete and maintain a comprehensive function-based index that codifies contractual, regulatory, accreditation requirements into major categories, stratifies sub-function level requirements for each product line, and leverages the requirements to monitor and oversight the PNM organization, and the LAC contracted Plan Partners. The Senior Business Analyst is required to utilizing a standardized template to document each requirement identified in the index and its corresponding authority source(s), and utilize a corresponding standardized template to document LAC’s performance with each requirement identified in the index. The completed form would summarize the manner by which LAC demonstrates compliance with the corresponding requirement, e.g., policy, desktop procedures, workflow(s), and internal performance measures.



Duties

Elicits, documents, analyzes, communicates, tests and verifies requirements for services delivered through contracted, delegated entities. Assesses the requirements of the organization with respect to its operations and functions. Reviews the LAC PNM organization, and the LAC contracted Plan Partners entity policies, procedures, internal controls, and training materials. Reviews transactions, source documents, disclosures, training and outcomes for compliance with contractual, regulatory, and accrediting requirements, and LAC business policies. Assists with the analysis of delegated entity contracts to identify gaps and opportunities for improved oversight, and is responsible for maintaining documentation to support evidence of compliance with all requirements, and for the reporting of performance data.
Designs and documents business process requirements for all related business, and operational systems critical to core business functions within Provider Network Management (PNM). Analyzes the business processes in an organization for inefficiencies. Make recommendations for solutions or improvements that can be accomplished through new process or technology, or alternative uses of existing processes or technology. Identifies opportunities for improving PNM and all delegation non-delegated oversight processes and using technology to eliminate problems that affect productivity, output, distribution and ultimately, the LACs bottom line. Conducts monitoring and oversight assessment activities to review the ongoing performance of processes and controls conducted and implemented by the LAC PNM organization, and the LAC contracted Plan Partners; assesses these and other activities for compliance with contractual, regulatory, and accrediting requirements, and LAC business policies.
Develops key performance indicators, alerting requirements, and supporting metrics, to proactively inform the LAC PNM, Plan Partner Executive Director, Utilization Management, Quality, and Compliance departments, and the Internal Compliance Committee (ICC) of possible risks and issues with compliance, and develop remediation and corrective action plans as appropriate. Reports analytical performance metrics on requirements, which may be in the form of visualizations such as graphs, charts and dashboards, detailing the significant results they deduced to inform senior-level business stakeholders, so they may make informed decisions. Analyzes data in support of business functions, process knowledge, and systems requirements. Partner with internal LA Care departments including Compliance, Quality Assurance, Provider Network Management, Health Services Delivery, and others to ensure providers are compliant with all requirements. Takes proactive preventative steps to resolve issues and manage risk. Participates in governance committees and other meetings where delegation risk issues are regularly addressed. Leverages and communicates all analysis to aid a diverse set of stakeholders in making informed decisions about which initiatives to implement and how to implement them.
Develops, implements, and maintains policies and procedures, and desk-level procedures. Monitors, and analyzes remediation and corrective action plans, and uses critical thinking and problem solving skills to help ensure successful, and complaint delegation partnerships and department quality.
Supports all aspects of monitoring and oversight within L.A. Care.
Performs other duties as assigned.



Education

High School Diploma/GED
Associate's Degree or Bachelor's Degree



Experience

Required:
With High School Diploma:
7 years of experience in contract and/or regulatory and/or accreditation requirements analysis in managed care or other related health care industry; or,
