Job Description
At Amazon, we’re working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. We are looking for a highly quantitative Business Analyst to join our Social Responsibility (SR) team.

As a business analyst in Social Responsibility, you will lead efforts to help teams across Amazon understand how SR and customer obsession overlap. This involves determining the potential business case for initiatives, understanding supplier behavior, and communicating insights to relevant teams.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about mastering complex datasets for models/reports development, identifying process outliers that highlight operational savings, and building data visualizations. They have experience making data-driven decisions that drive change across teams within a large organization. They are intellectually curious, highly self-directed, exhibit a strong attention to detail, are well-organized, can manage multiple projects simultaneously and deliver results in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment. They will turn research into actionable business intelligence that presents recommendations for senior leaders and socialize these findings to teams across Amazon. This role will set up and lead reporting for the organization and present results to senior management.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from accredited institution.
5+ years of experience in a business analyst, data analyst, or statistical analyst role (3+ years with a Master’s or 1+ with a Ph.D.)
Proficiency with SQL (e.g., multi table joins, table creation, and data validation) and Microsoft Excel.
Experience with basic statistical techniques (e.g. hypothesis testing, linear regression)
Ability to dive deeply into data integrity issues.
Ability to learn new business and data analysis techniques independently.
Ability to use SQL to develop complex queries for ad hoc analysis requests
Proficiency with Tableau.
Excellent communication skills
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business, Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance or related field.
Demonstrated writing skills at a level suitable for presentation to executives.
Familiarity with advanced statistics, modeling, market segmentation, or machine learning tools
Experience with Redshift
History of engaging with cross-functional teams for implementation of project/program requirements.
History of conducting root cause analysis and implementing fixes.
Experience communicating with senior management as well as with colleagues from technical and non-technical backgrounds.
Experience influencing teams across a large organization

Business Analyst - ADBK27809
Job ID: ADBK27809 Location: Foster City, CA Position: 1 Position Visa Status: USC or GC
Please send your profile to us at hr@adbakx.com

The Access Operations Team uses Google's data-driven approach to provide critical business insight. In this role, you'll use analytics in order to ensure Google's goals are met in product areas across the company. You strive to help teams push strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. Your work helps to knit together the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
You will have the opportunity to join a new team at Google Fiber to lead the development of the analytical infrastructure to manage our operation and support our growth.
The Business Analyst will work cross-functionally to develop and maintain reports and analysis, including the associated tables and data pipes, to support the Mission Control function at Google Fiber. Mission Control is the single source of truth for operational reporting and analysis to measure the varied and complex set of activities required to deliver fiber optic service to a household.
At Access, our mission is to create abundant internet on networks that are always fast and always open. Google Fiber provides superfast Internet to homes across the U.S. We want to bring Google Fiber to customers even faster, so we’re focused on making deployment more efficient and less intrusive.
Responsibilities
Support the development and maintenance of reports, associated scripts/pipes, and appropriate data governance.
Work with data sets to solve non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed.
Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.
Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale. Develop comprehensive understanding of Google Fiber data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed to support our operation.
Collaborate with other analysts and engineers responsible for other Google Fiber systems that generate reporting data.
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Finance or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience analyzing data through statistical, quantitative modeling and forecasting.
Experience with SQL, R or other environments for data analysis.
Experience in spreadsheets (e.g., vlookups, macros, scripts)

Preferred qualifications:
Experience collaborating with multiple cross-functional teams, including Data Scientist, Research and Product teams.
Programming experience developing API's in Python or similar environments.
Experience in telecommunications or other similarly complex business with field operations.
Excellent oral/written communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills

Leading uniquely at the intersection point of technology and social good, Blackbaud provides software, services, expertise, and data intelligence that empowers and connects people to advance the social good movement. About the Role:
The Implementation Analyst works with the portfolio team and is a major contributor to the requirements specification deliverable and writes the business and functional requirements. This person understands the Implementation & Activations business and ensures that there is integration between business and technology.

The Implementation Analyst understands configuration and/or business workflow processes and is analytical with problem-solving and conflict resolution skills to help identify, communicate and resolve issues.
May perform feasibility analysis, scope projects, and work with the project management team to prioritizes deliverables, and negotiate on product functionalities.
Creates Business Requirements Documentation (as applicable) and translates it into functional specifications.
Coordinates data extraction from various databases.
Partners with development and analytic teams to provide reporting on software solutions.
Participates in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.
Configures the software solution to meet the customer’s business process requirements .
Sets appropriate expectations with the customer as it relates to project scope, timeline, and budget.
Identifies and presents Change Orders to the customer when the customer’s requirements and/or budgeted project hours fall outside of the project scope.

Specific responsibilities will be:
Accurately defines the information that must be gathered for problem solving.
Solves problems creatively and efficiently, and seeks guidance from Sr Implementation Analysts.
Asks critical, insightful questions, and probes for information that facilitates problem solving.
Provides analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation.
Evaluates risks, benefits and opportunities of various solutions.
Understands customers, proactively gathering information to learn about their needs and expectations.
Responsive to any data indicating a customer opportunity or change in customer needs.
Seeks guidance and effectively executes direction provided from Senior Business Analysts and Managers
Committed to ongoing improvement, achieving success, and management by data.
Receives guidance on the design, management, and simplification of systems and processes, involving major functions or business units whether interfacing with external or internal customers.
Seeks information or solutions needed for assignments and/or projects.
Challenges self and others to push the status-quo.
Thinks outside the given parameters to see if there is a better, more effective way.
Communicates ideas and information effectively.

Desired Qualifications
Excellent written and verbal communication
Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
Detail oriented
Ability to manage time and tasks efficiently
Basic problem solving and conflict resolution
Positive attitude centered on achieving high client satisfaction, both internal and external
Experience with Blackbaud products is nice to have

Why you’ll want to come work here:
Competitive salary (commission/bonus based on type of role), 4 weeks paid time off, great benefits (medical, dental, vision, FSA), 401K match
Gift matching, volunteer for vacation program, and endless community involvement opportunities
Named to Forbes’ Fast Tech 25 and Fortune’s Change the World List; we are growing and offer incredible opportunity for advancement
Tremendous company culture and office perks as well as a new cutting-edge new headquarters completed in 2018


Stay up to date on everything Blackbaud, follow us on Linkedin , Twitter and Facebook .

OtherIf you have a curious sort of disposition, are great at explaining things, and can demonstrate the ability to help customers learn how to apply our cloud based software applications then keep reading!

Grant Street Group continues to anticipate the growth of its SaaS model to our public sector clients. Whether it is tax processing, electronic payments, or internet bond auctions, we have tools to make government work better.

We are looking for talented folks who:

Want to know why things work the way they do.
Excel at explaining things with the right amount of detail.
Are capable communicators with the spoken and written word.
Know how to collaborate within a team environment.
Are dedicated learners with the ability to use software.
Our business analysts come from all sorts of academic, business or technical backgrounds. Their common threads? Strong academic performance, great writers, and the ability to engage others in meaningful, fun, and entertaining conversations. If this sounds like you then we do want to start talking about your future and ours!

Our extraordinary company culture is the foundation of our unmatched customer service — just ask our clients! We reward teamwork, professional excellence, and individual responsibility. Using the best collaboration tools available, we offer a technology-rich work environment that makes it possible for us to support on-site and telecommuting positions tailored to the needs of our employees. If you are passionate about your work, you have entrepreneurial spirit and you want to be on a team of exceptional professionals, then this could be the opportunity you are looking for.
If our description fits who you are, apply today! We’ll take it from there. To learn more about the various aspects of this role, check out our job responsibilities section below.

Apply Now – Business Analyst (Remote)
Business Analyst Job Responsibilities
If you read our business analyst job posting and thought, “That sounds great, but what is this job actually like?”, then keep reading!

The core function of our role as business analysts at Grant Street Group is to be a liaison between our developers and our clients, and this requires us to wear many different hats.

So what do all of these “hats” really mean?
Problem Solving: Every day you work to solve complex problems. When you analyze a calculation, investigate the cause of a bug, or propose a new process you are venturing into unfamiliar territory to find a solution. Our clients and developers rely on your problem solving skills to ensure our software is built and supported effectively.
Client support: When a customer has a question, problem, or suggestion, they come to you! You are known as a subject matter expert and our clients rely on that expertise regularly. Whether the issue is major or minor, you know that Grant Street Group takes Software as a Service literally.
Prioritization: Our software is ever-changing. With that comes the need to prioritize what, when, and how changes are made. Since you’re working with the software and our clients daily, who better to prioritize than you? Business analysts are constantly asking themselves: Does this feature need to be completed before a certain time? What is the impact of this bug? How can other clients benefit from this change? We use a ticketing system to track pieces of work such as functionality requests and bug fixes. We then prioritize them for developers to work on.
Technical Specifications: It’s your job to convey to the developers what changes need to be made. What happens when you click this button? What does the page look like? How is this file transferred to an external system? In this way, you are directly affecting the product and our clients’ experience.
Testing: When a developer completes a change, you get to test it out (in a beta environment) to ensure that it’s working correctly. Does the new behavior match the specification? Does everything else surrounding the change still work correctly?
Implementations: We’re a growing company and adding new clients is an exciting part of that growth! Since you’re a subject matter expert, you coordinate with new clients to configure the software to best fit their needs. Think of yourself as a consultant. What business processes does the client need to accomplish? How can our software fit in with and help that process?
Training: Helping clients learn about how our software works is also part of your role. Whether it’s a new client coming up to speed on how tasks are completed, or an existing client that is incorporating a new feature into their process, you’re a resource for providing the information and tools they need.
Does this sound exciting and overwhelming at the same time? Most of us thought so too. If you haven’t had experience in this area before, know that many of us lacked business analyst experience before we came to Grant Street Group. What we did have was intellectual curiosity and a passion for problem solving. If you’ve already had business analyst experience, that’s great, and we’re excited about the possibility of you continuing on that path with us.
So now that you know what we do, why are you a great fit? You’ve probably spent a large majority of your life asking “Why” and then making sure that you figure out the answer. You love using all parts of your brain equally, and the thought of speaking with a client or learning about a database schema equally intrigues you. You’re the one that people rely on in team projects. You’re always itching to know more and you hold yourself and others to a high standard.
Before you begin the interview process, keep in mind that we have a tendency to pay special attention to those that put in extra effort in their applications. We are radical proponents of the belief that you are more than just a resume. If you’re excited about this opportunity, we can’t wait to get to know you!

Job Description:

The Access Management Operations (AMO) function within Global Information Security is responsible for enabling simplification of our access processes, standardizing solutions and risk reduction across the enterprise, as well as collaborating with internal partners to encourage adoption of the bank’s cybersecurity standards by external stakeholders.

Candidate will be responsible for partnering with the GIS Governance & Policy team to drive alignment of application Laws, Rules and Regulations via GIS policies to access controls and processes while working to ensure long term sustainability. Position requires a proficient understanding of standards, baselines, security procedures and policies. Position is among the Access Management Operations space within the Global Information Security organization. A risk oriented perspective is required, along with the ability to understand and help document BAU processes. Self-starter and highly analytical thinker required. Ability to work well in teams as well as with business partners. Utilizes technical and business knowledge to support secure, risk-based practices, exercising judgment within broadly defined practices and policies. Results oriented, business focused, and successful at interfacing across multiple organizational units, at various levels. Self-starter who is comfortable working as part of a highly-leveraged team across geographic locations. Demonstrated record of strong leadership capability in a matrixed, multi-layered organization.

Job Description
Customer service is the heart of Amazon. We’ve built a reputation for excellence with recent examples of being named #1 in customer service, and #1 most trusted.

"Our vision is to be earth's most customer-centric company; to build a place where people can come to find and discover anything they might want to buy online."

Amazon is looking for a smart, motivated, and driven Business Analyst to focus on improving the customer experience. You will pull and analyze multiple types of data to discover and solve real world problems. This position requires high judgment, focus on speed and accuracy, and an ability to balance customer and associate experience with financial impact. It also offers broad exposure to various business and technical teams within Amazon.

This position will be located at our customer service center in Huntington West Virginia.

Responsibilities include:
Developing intuitive, insightful reporting on the key drivers of our business
Interacting with internal stakeholders to deep-dive outlier events
Ad-hoc project work supporting the re-invention of how we manage our business
Enabling effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources, compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Identifying process and system improvement opportunities by monitoring existing metrics, analyzing data, and partnering with internal teams

Successful candidates will demonstrate the ability to:
Translate technical concepts into business requirements and present findings and recommendations to stakeholders both in written and verbal format.
Work in a rapidly changing and complex environment.
Learn new technologies, processes and tools in an effort to complete task and responsibilities.
Independently identify and set priorities in an ambiguous environment.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or any related field from an accredited institution
3+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst or equivalent Amazon experience
Proficient with the following programming languages and statistical software: SQL, Excel, Minitab, R and Python
Experience working with complex data sets in data warehouse environments
A proven record of taking ownership and driving resolution
Highly skilled verbal, written communication, and data presentation
Effective communication with both business and technical teams
Ability to take loosely defined business questions and translate them into clearly defined technical/data specifications
Passion for operational excellence with a commitment to delighting customers
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree in Statistics, Engineering, or Economics
Advance experience with Tableau, Micro strategy, or equivalent data visualization solutions
Experience applying advanced statistical methodologies
Experience with Lean Six Sigma methodologies

Associate Business Analyst – Inhalation Production Development (IPD) US Sites – Durham, NC

At AstraZeneca, science is at the core of everything we do. But more than that, science is who we are. Our research sites are collaborative, innovative and dynamic environments that allow our scientists to keep pushing the boundaries. We work alongside scientists at leading institutions to better understand disease, identify potential new drugs and accelerate drug development. We’re also pioneers in creating a more open research environment.

The role holder will be an Associate Business Analyst for Inhalation Product Development (IPD) sites in USA. Sites in scope are Pharmaceutical Technology and Development sites in North Carolina and California.

They will develop a deep end-to-end understanding of the business process and technologies supporting IPD in US to:
Ensure required business objectives from IPD in US are met.
Support standardization IT technologies and infrastructure through application of global standards to the specified region.
Identify where investment to support process improvement is possible/required. Develop and shape project proposals to secure investment.
Identify and trial innovative solutions to create opportunities for business process.
Support project delivery, change and deployment activities at sites in line with global standards to maximize business value from investments.
Act as a System Owner for key systems as required
The Associate Business Analyst has repeated practice performing business analysis and design either alone delivering small to medium size business change activities; or as a member or lead a BA team in a large or global business change. The Business Analyst operates with a high level of interactive communication, demonstrating high levels of inclusion and cultural sensitivity.

The role will partner with the Regional teams and Capability Lead, taking responsibility to deliver high quality business cases, business process designs and ensure that proposed solutions meet established AstraZeneca quality and compliance standards and business solution needs.

The Business Analyst will share best practices in relevant communities of practice, contributing to internal IT processes and standards for business analysis and design.

The Business Analyst is expected to perform at advanced level in the following:

Business Needs Identification - Operates at a functional level in assessing and defining business need and areas for improvement. Proactively seeks out opportunities to enhance and improve in line with strategic goals. Actively monitors and identifies capability gaps and proposes potential solutions through research internally and externally.
Business Analysis Planning - Selects the appropriate analysis approach to a piece of work depending on its complexity, level of risk, known assumptions, constraints and dependencies. Proficient in scoping and recommending appropriate approaches. Capable of planning and managing their own and other team member’s activities to meet deliverables and deadlines. Accountable for performance and quality of analytical work delivered, both their own and the work of others.
Stakeholder Analysis & Change - Effectively identifies stakeholders from all areas of the business, and actively builds and maintains relationships according to individual stakeholder needs and levels of influence. Contributes to communication plans and change management for project and stakeholders.
Requirements Analysis and Design Definition - Responsible and accountable for requirements management plans including elicitation, approvals, processes, RAID and scope impacts. Highly responsive to changing business priorities with ability to plan ahead, accounting for potential changes and corrective actions. Advanced requirements elicitation and management skill-set; including traceability, testing and validation. Leads the work with the business to identify functional and technical requirements, translating the requirements into design specifications reflecting Functional Design, User Interface Design and Business Process Design. Closely partnering with the Architecture team, ensuring the technical solution will deliver the agreed business benefits.
Business Case Definition - Shapes and defines the business case, producing detailed business justification for investment including ROI and benefits realization.
Solution Evaluation - Highly proficient in analyzing and assessing solution proposals and able to articulate supporting reasoning. i.e. assessing business readiness, maximizing value vs. spend.
Work collaboratively with
Business Relationship Managers and Business Analysts to develop and maintain the business relationship, support business process change and act as point of contact for application development
Business customers to identify business requirements and effectively communicate impact, cost and benefits of new and changed demands
Process owners to identify and devise solutions that optimize business process performance, capability and competitiveness
IT Architecture, Delivery and Support to ensure clear understanding of requirements and effective testing so that the solutions delivered to the business are efficient and effective, meeting the customer experience expectations.

Work collaboratively with or take responsibility for:
Test Lead to define the testing approach and the components of testing to ensure traceability of requirements and effectiveness of overall solution.
Change Management/Communication Lead to ensure the Change Management and Communications plans and delivery support the Stakeholder Analysis.
Experience required
Degree in relevant discipline or formal certification in business analysis practice or equivalent experience
Experience using business analysis tools/techniques to design and deliver business change
Strong engagement, communication and stakeholder management skills, including excellent presentation and influencing skills
Experience of working in a regulated environment
Experience of working with third party suppliers/vendors
Desired requirements:
Practical usage of Agile Methodology
Experience of working in a global organisation
Pharmaceutical business awareness/business domain knowledge

Business Analyst - 20033717 & 20043210 (180004AO)

Job Duties

NOTICE: Current employees of ODJFS in the SEIU 1199 union have selection rights before all other applicants. Applications from all other candidates will only be considered if an internal SEIU 1199 applicant is not selected for the position.


NOTICE: Applicants must have 24 months of recent experience (within the past 5 years) using the State Automated Child Welfare System (SACWIS).

NOTICE: THIS POSITION IS BEING REPOSTED. PREVIOUS APPLICANTS NEED TO REAPPLY.

MISSION STATEMENT:


The Ohio Department of Job and Family Services (ODJFS) is a $3.5 billion agency with approximately 2,500 employees. The ODJFS develops and supervises the state’s public assistance, workforce development, unemployment insurance, child and adult protective services, adoption, child care, and child support programs. ODJFS’ mission is to improve the well-being of Ohio’s workforce and families by promoting economic self-sufficiency and ensuring the safety of Ohio’s most vulnerable citizens.

This position is held within the Office of Families and Children. Learn more about the office by visiting Jobs and Family Services - Office of Families and Children webpage.


Office of Families and Children

Vision: Ohio’s children, youth and vulnerable adults have a safe and permanent family that nurtures and promotes their overall well-being.

Mission: Through partnership with public and private agencies, we support the delivery of services to improve outcomes that promote safety and well-being.

THIS POSITION IS BEING REPOSTED. PREVIOUS APPLICANTS NEED TO REAPPLY.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:

Under general direction, as part of a team, provides program technical assistance to data systems professionals and technicians engaged in establishing and enhancing child welfare automated systems (i.e., Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System [SACWIS]; Business Intelligence Channel [BIC]; Results Oriented Management [ROM]) and other data systems for storing, processing and retrieving child welfare information (e.g., adoption and placement data; child abuse and neglect tracking; intake and assessment; resource management; program eligibility and financial tracking); remains current in program policy changes; provides program technical assistance to Office of Information Services (OIS) personnel and contractors in determining scope and requirements derived from federal system requirements document (e.g., interprets federal and state statutes to ensure compliance in child welfare automated system design); reviews design documents; plans, develops and recommends performance criteria and test case scenarios (e.g., creates realistic child welfare scripts); conducts system tests to ensure expected outcomes and to test user scenarios; assists with data conversion from current child welfare automated systems; assists in implementation of new systems; develops marketing material for partner agencies; develops webinars, procedure manuals and user support documentation; monitors adherence of system development to federal and state requirements; provides help desk customer service to county Public Children Service Agencies (PCSAs), Title IV-E Juvenile Courts, private non-custodial agencies (PNAs) and private child placing agencies (PCPAs); trains PCSAs, PNAs and PCPAs to ensure program compliance through use of state’s child welfare automation systems; monitors counties knowledge and use of state’s child welfare automation systems by identifying user and/or software problems through help desk activities with PCSAs, PNAs, and PCPAs staff; responds to PCSAs, PNAs and PCPAs inquiries regarding child welfare automated systems user-related issues; provides technical assistance; determines security profiles for agency staff; analyzes data; creates reports and assists with Federal Reporting requirements; identifies source of problems and prepares corrective action steps.


Participates in and/or supplies technical solutions to meet federal requirements (e.g., establishes schedule of activities with time tables for completion); identifies source of problems and prepares corrective action steps; monitors PCSAs, PNAs and PCPAs to ensure readiness and compliance; develops and conducts training workshops and seminars on new and modified procedures; prepares responses to inquires from government officials, constituent groups and general public; represents child welfare automated systems and prepares and delivers speeches and presentations at meetings/conferences; participates in development/revision of program policies and procedures.


Performs related duties as assigned (e.g., compiles periodic activity and project status reports or ad hoc narrative and statistical reports; travels to, and participates in, staff meetings, conferences and training; maintains logs and files; participates on special assignments).


Qualifications

The following are the minimum qualifications for this position. For further consideration, applicants must clearly identify how qualifications are met within the education and/or experience sections of the application.

The ideal candidate must have:

Completion of undergraduate core coursework in social or behavioral science, pre-medicine, business administration, public administration, human services as defined in series purpose, or comparable field.

OR

24 months experience in social or behavioral science, pre-medicine, business administration, public administration, human services as defined in series purpose, or comparable field.

AND

24 months recent experience (i.e., within past 5 years) in delivery of human services that include explaining and applying child protective services laws, policies, and procedures mandated by Ohio Department of Job & Family Services and using State Automated Child Welfare System (SACWIS).

AND

6 months training and/or experience in operating personal computer & using Microsoft Office system software, such as Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, or like software package.

Major Worker Characteristics

Knowledge of

human services program delivery pertinent to assigned process automation project
federal and/or state laws, rules, regulations and best practice scenarios for human services program delivery pertinent to assigned process automation project
public speaking
technical writing
interviewing/facilitation
automated business rules & rules engines*
Skill in
operation of personal computer and software programs (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel, Access)
Ability to
define unusual problems, collect data, establish facts and draw complex/technical conclusions
read and comprehend legislative or policy-related materials
create and/or edit technical/instructional materials to be presented in print or oral form to variety of human services personnel
handle routine and sensitive contacts with governmental and/or business officials, and/or general public
work independently or as part of team


Supplemental Information

Unless required by legislation or union contract, starting salary will be set at step 1 of the pay range (currently $26.81 per hour). If this position is filled internally, the wage rate will be determined in accordance with such.

All answers to supplemental questions must be supported by education, work experience, and detailed job duties provided on your civil service application.


Unless the posting requires, please do not include attachments, as attachments will not be considered as part of your application.

TRAVEL REQUIRED, AS NEEDED. MUST PROVIDE OWN TRANSPORTATION OR, IN ODER TO OPERATE A STATE VEHICLE, YOU MUST HAVE A VALID DRIVERS LICENSE.

Status of posted positions: You can check the status of your application online by signing into your profile and clicking the “My Jobpage” tab to view completed submissions and submission details. If you have questions/inquiries, other than your application status, please direct them to the HR_Support_Center@jfs.ohio.gov.


Background Check Information

The final candidate selected for the position will be required to undergo a criminal background check. Criminal convictions do not necessarily preclude an applicant from consideration for a position. An individual assessment of an applicant's prior criminal convictions will be made before excluding an applicant from consideration.

Job Description
IT Business Analyst - Operations

Fairbanks Morse Engine (an EnPro company) is currently seeking a IT Business Analyst to join our Information Technology division at our headquarters in Beloit, WI. The IT Business Analyst will mainly be responsible for leading the systems business analysis and support services within the Operations function, focused primarily around the Oracle eBusiness Suite (Oracle EBS). The IT Business Analyst will also be tasked with strategic functional alignment, business and technical analysis, problem solving, Oracle configuration, application support, project justification, report generation, data extraction, and project scoping activities. Moreover, the IT Business Analyst will be expected to collaborate with end-users, business leaders, developers and vendors to support, maintain, and administer policies and procedures for ensuring security and integrity of the company's critical business applications.

NOTE: Partial telecommute option may be available. Contact an EnPro Talent Acquisition representative for more details.


Responsibilities of the IT Business Analyst:
Collaborate directly with Operations function and nurture close working relationships
Develop intimate knowledge of business strategy, business model, and processes to identify improvement opportunities and value-add capabilities
Assist with the implementation of Oracle's eBusiness Suite (Oracle EBS) modules
Provide end-user training and support to a diverse, non-technical user base
Liaise with various business groups and users to understand and analyze business problems
Lead efforts with gathering detailed customer requirements
Document functional and technical specifications for application configuration
Provide research, analysis, and problem resolution, including creating and monitoring of service requests with Oracle support and Corporate IT Shared Services
Configure Oracle applications and interpret functionality for business users
Identify and lead functional and business process improvements to support future growth
Assist with testing and implementation of interfaces and additional Oracle modules
Perform regression test functionality after application of patches, critical performance updates, and upgrades
Document and communicate changes throughout user organization and support change management and compliance


Required Qualifications and Education of the IT Business Analyst:
Bachelor's degree in technology or related field
5+ years of experience with and in-depth functional knowledge of Oracle Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems with preference for a
Strong analytical approach to business process design with emphasis on cross-functional inter-dependencies
Knowledge of Systems Life Cycle development methodologies
Strong experience in a team environment serving an end user community, particularly with gathering requirements and interpreting end user needs into technical solutions
Understanding of database concepts such as schemas, tables, and views as well as experience in developing SQL queries
Due to access to protected information for US government programs, US citizenship is required for this role. The successful candidate will be asked to provide proof of citizenship at the time of hire. Acceptable proof of citizenship includes a US Passport, US birth Certificate or Naturalization Certificate.


Preferred Qualifications of the IT Business Analyst:
Strong focus on Oracle operations modules from both a functional and technical perspective
Experience as a member of a team performing an Oracle implementation
Operations knowledge background


Benefits
Fairbanks Morse Engine offers significant career development opportunities as well as salary and benefits packages including health and life insurance, 401(k) with company match, full tuition reimbursement, vacation, and paid holidays.

About Fairbanks Morse Engine
Fairbanks Morse Engine is the critical power solutions expert - a strategic partner and a trusted source for application-specific, fuel- flexible power systems that deliver optimal performance in mission critical applications. These applications include base load and standby power generation and emergency back-up power for nuclear plants; ship propulsion and shipboard power for the United States Navy and Coast Guard and commercial vessels, and mechanical drive applications such as crude oil and water pumping.

An EnPro Industries company, Fairbanks Morse Engine, can be found powering the world forward in a wide range of municipal, institutional and industrial applications. EnPro Industries is a diversified manufacturer of proprietary engineered products used in critical applications with more than 5000 people worldwide with products sold in over 100 countries across the globe.

As a division of EnPro Industries, we offer employees nearly unlimited opportunities to develop their professional interests and passions while also giving them the tools and resources to pursue their personal fulfillment outside of work.

It is not intended to limit or in any way modify the right of any supervisor to assign, direct, and control the work of employees under his/her supervision. Ability to competently perform all the essential duties of the position, with or without reasonable accommodation, demonstrated commitment to effective customer service delivery, and the ability to work productively as a member of a team or work group are basic requirements of all positions at Fairbanks Morse Engine.

OtherIf you have a curious sort of disposition, are great at explaining things, and can demonstrate the ability to help customers learn how to apply our cloud based software applications then keep reading!

Grant Street Group continues to anticipate the growth of its SaaS model to our public sector clients. Whether it is tax processing, electronic payments, or internet bond auctions, we have tools to make government work better.

We are looking for talented folks who:

Want to know why things work the way they do.
Excel at explaining things with the right amount of detail.
Are capable communicators with the spoken and written word.
Know how to collaborate within a team environment.
Are dedicated learners with the ability to use software.
Our business analysts come from all sorts of academic, business or technical backgrounds. Their common threads? Strong academic performance, great writers, and the ability to engage others in meaningful, fun, and entertaining conversations. If this sounds like you then we do want to start talking about your future and ours!

Our extraordinary company culture is the foundation of our unmatched customer service — just ask our clients! We reward teamwork, professional excellence, and individual responsibility. Using the best collaboration tools available, we offer a technology-rich work environment that makes it possible for us to support on-site and telecommuting positions tailored to the needs of our employees. If you are passionate about your work, you have entrepreneurial spirit and you want to be on a team of exceptional professionals, then this could be the opportunity you are looking for.
If our description fits who you are, apply today! We’ll take it from there. To learn more about the various aspects of this role, check out our job responsibilities section below.

Apply Now – Business Analyst (Remote)
Business Analyst Job Responsibilities
If you read our business analyst job posting and thought, “That sounds great, but what is this job actually like?”, then keep reading!

The core function of our role as business analysts at Grant Street Group is to be a liaison between our developers and our clients, and this requires us to wear many different hats.

So what do all of these “hats” really mean?
Problem Solving: Every day you work to solve complex problems. When you analyze a calculation, investigate the cause of a bug, or propose a new process you are venturing into unfamiliar territory to find a solution. Our clients and developers rely on your problem solving skills to ensure our software is built and supported effectively.
Client support: When a customer has a question, problem, or suggestion, they come to you! You are known as a subject matter expert and our clients rely on that expertise regularly. Whether the issue is major or minor, you know that Grant Street Group takes Software as a Service literally.
Prioritization: Our software is ever-changing. With that comes the need to prioritize what, when, and how changes are made. Since you’re working with the software and our clients daily, who better to prioritize than you? Business analysts are constantly asking themselves: Does this feature need to be completed before a certain time? What is the impact of this bug? How can other clients benefit from this change? We use a ticketing system to track pieces of work such as functionality requests and bug fixes. We then prioritize them for developers to work on.
Technical Specifications: It’s your job to convey to the developers what changes need to be made. What happens when you click this button? What does the page look like? How is this file transferred to an external system? In this way, you are directly affecting the product and our clients’ experience.
Testing: When a developer completes a change, you get to test it out (in a beta environment) to ensure that it’s working correctly. Does the new behavior match the specification? Does everything else surrounding the change still work correctly?
Implementations: We’re a growing company and adding new clients is an exciting part of that growth! Since you’re a subject matter expert, you coordinate with new clients to configure the software to best fit their needs. Think of yourself as a consultant. What business processes does the client need to accomplish? How can our software fit in with and help that process?
Training: Helping clients learn about how our software works is also part of your role. Whether it’s a new client coming up to speed on how tasks are completed, or an existing client that is incorporating a new feature into their process, you’re a resource for providing the information and tools they need.
Does this sound exciting and overwhelming at the same time? Most of us thought so too. If you haven’t had experience in this area before, know that many of us lacked business analyst experience before we came to Grant Street Group. What we did have was intellectual curiosity and a passion for problem solving. If you’ve already had business analyst experience, that’s great, and we’re excited about the possibility of you continuing on that path with us.
So now that you know what we do, why are you a great fit? You’ve probably spent a large majority of your life asking “Why” and then making sure that you figure out the answer. You love using all parts of your brain equally, and the thought of speaking with a client or learning about a database schema equally intrigues you. You’re the one that people rely on in team projects. You’re always itching to know more and you hold yourself and others to a high standard.
Before you begin the interview process, keep in mind that we have a tendency to pay special attention to those that put in extra effort in their applications. We are radical proponents of the belief that you are more than just a resume. If you’re excited about this opportunity, we can’t wait to get to know you!

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst

Join us as we build a next-generation analytics platform to serve our world-class agents. As a Senior Business Analyst, you’ll help build a platform of robust analytics features that lay the foundation for optimizing agent and broker productivity that bring Realogy’s renowned real estate brands into the next era of data-driven excellence.

What we’re looking for:
We are seeking a highly motivated Agile Senior Business Analyst to join our Data team. This individual will possess a strong understanding of business analysis and analytics technology, and have a proven track record of defining and driving technology-based solutions to implement strategic solutions that bridge the divide between business and technical knowledge.

What you’ll do:
As a Senior Business Analyst, you’ll elicit and evaluate business requirements for delivering new or enhanced software systems, appropriately document system requirements, and measure the success of the resultant initiatives.

You will:
Grow into a trusted partner of our Strategy organization and Business Units, coming prepared to the conversation by knowing your partners’ pain better that they do
Partner with cross-functional teams to analyze, decompose and map current state processes and pain points, then determine improvement opportunities including creation of target operating models. You are a listener but not a note taker.
Drive ideation and new solution thinking to delivers significant net new business value to partners
Strive for industry disruption and moonshot initiatives that differentiate Realogy offerings from currently existing ones
Take ownership to lead solutions from concept to implementation by partnering with technology and business organizations to ensure requirements are satisfied and delivered on time
Build and develop business relationships vital to project success
Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders
Work with business product owners to facilitate creation and maintenance of Product Roadmaps and Backlogs
Collaborate and communicate with stakeholders, developers, designers and technical team members
Work with development teams to prioritize agile/scrum backlogs, assuming responsibility for delivery of business value to a portfolio of business partners, as measured by key performance indicators (ie: GCI, EBIDTA,etc).

Skills, accomplishments, & interests you should have:
BA/BS degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related discipline
3+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst
Hands-on experience in a Scrum Agile development environment
Demonstrated experience identifying solutions using standard analysis techniques such as business process and information modeling, root cause analysis, use case analysis, workflow analysis, functional decomposition analysis, process map creation, etc.
Experience in facilitating the solicitation and evaluation of business requirements for delivering new or enhanced software systems, and measuring the success of the associated initiatives
Strong problem-solving and structuring skills, with ability to bring actionable insights through effective communication
Experience working with diverse set of senior stakeholders on requirements, roles and responsibilities, project timelines
Ability to independently and quickly ramp up on new business and technical concepts
Demonstrated passion for developing and overseeing strategic solution execution
Ability to work independently as well as in team environment, providing structure in ambiguous situations
Proficient in JIRA, Visio, MS Excel, PowerPoint and other Office applications
Nice to haves:
PMI-PBA or CBAP Certification is a plus

About Meredith Corporation:
Meredith Corporation (NYSE: MDP; meredith.com) has been committed to service journalism for 115 years. Today, Meredith uses multiple distribution platforms — including broadcast television, print, digital, mobile and video — to provide consumers with content they desire and to deliver the messages of its advertising and marketing partners.

Meredith's National Media Group reaches nearly 200 million unduplicated American consumers every month, including 85 percent of U.S. Millennial women. Meredith is a leader in creating content across media platforms and life stages in key consumer interest areas such as celebrity, food, lifestyle, home, parenting, beauty, fashion, news and sports. Meredith also features robust brand licensing activities including more than 3,000 SKUs of branded products at 5,000 Walmart stores across the U.S. and at walmart.com., as well as innovative business-to-business marketing solutions provided by Meredith Xcelerated Marketing.

Meredith's Local Media Group includes 17 television stations reaching more than 11 percent of U.S. households. Meredith's portfolio is concentrated in large, fast-growing markets, with seven stations in the nation's Top 25 and 13 in Top 50 markets. Meredith's stations produce 700 hours of local news and entertainment content each week, and operate leading local digital destinations.

Salesforce Business Analyst

Des Moines, IA

The Salesforce Business Analyst reviews, analyzes and evaluates complex processes, systems and user needs for planned projects involving Saleforce CRM and other sales tools. This position documents business requirements and needs and generates associated business solutions that accomplish Meredith's needs. The Salesforce Business Analyst assists the IT staff in understanding the operational needs for both automated and manual solutions to business processes. In addition, this position acts as the functional subject matter expert and technical support lead within the department and division.

Essential Job Functions

Weight %

Accountabilities, Actions and Expected Measurable Results

40%


Collaborates with business users to gather all requirements to prepare business specifications. Translates requirements into business functionality.
Documents workflows and results of business analysis and obtains sign-off from users on specifications.
Assists the application development team in translating application functionality into application architecture and technical specifications.
Communicates the business strategies, goals, and needs to the application development team and serves as business interface to manage expectations.
Designs and executes test plans to ensure business requirements and functional specifications meet objectives.
Understands business processes and workflows and identifies necessary changes to these. Recommends solution improvements to the business.
Documents and communicates procedures and usage recommendations to ensure adoption.
Conducts training sessions to implement new or improved systems and procedures.
Evaluates and understands applications that can be used to improve business process and workflow.
Complete assigned project deliverables according to project plan and expected quality.

30%


Provides technical knowledge to ensure efficient design, development and implementation of processes and systems.
Colaborates with Salesforce developers on complex business solutions.
Leads meetings for purposes of presentations, reviews, approvals, etc.
Understands the long-term business objectives and suggests strategies to meet those objectives. Introduces innovation to business processes through technology if appropriate.
Collaborates with the business to create vision and prioritize business objectives.

30%


Provides application support and technical resolutions to system issues.
Communicates to stakeholders regarding functional procedures
Monitors Corporate objectives to understand the business drivers.
Provides guidance and knowledge transfer to other team members.
Provide support of business unit outside of business hours as needed.

100%

Are you looking for a new opportunity to use your technical and analytical skills in a blended role? If so, this position may be perfect for you! We are seeking to hire 2 exceptional Technical Business Analysts who will report to the Operations Manager of the Data Center. The ideal candidates will be multi-talented, hands-on contributor who will provide implementation and support services of automated processes for the Episys (Credit Union) clients. Candidates will be the main point of contact for these clients, ensuring success of day to day processing, research, testing and documentation of Episys batch jobs, as well as, setup and support of automation tools such as OpCon and MoveIT. This is not your typical BA position, but a role with emphasis on providing solutions and then implementing through hands-on experience with the system.
About this Team:
The Outlink Credit Union Episys Support Team assist the data center that host the core database (Episys) for clients. This team is made up of 16 employees with the main data center located in Lenexa, KS with additional support staff in Allen, TX, San Diego, CA as well as numerous remote staff throughout the US. Candidates will be required to work on an on-call rotation schedule of one time per quarter.
This role can be worked out of the following locations: San Diego, CA, Allen, TX, Lenexa, KS or 100% Remote.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 18 months of experience in one of the following prior roles;
IT or Application Support
Technical Analyst
Must be available for scheduled after-hours on-call level 2 support. After-hours on-call shift is from 5pm PT – 4am PT for a 2 week period.
Must be available to work 1 mandatory weekend a year for failover event.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree Preferred.
Data processing or IT experience at a credit union a huge plus.
Knowledge Episys, OpCon or MoveIT a big plus.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Performs needs analysis to develop automation specifications for projects. Defines the system and functional requirements. Performs requirements gathering and project scoping.
Implements and monitors automation projects from initiation through delivery.
Ensures that automation projects are completed on schedule.
Provides assistance with running automated tests and training on automation to other teams as requested.
Maintains effective communication with customer to project completion.
May provide assistance in the areas of training, staff meetings and periodic written documentation.
Assist in developing documentation of process life-cycle, encompassing all areas of automation which include the MOVEit task, OpCon scheduling and related Episys jobfiles.
Contributes to process and product improvements.
Research processes currently setup in MOVEit, OpCon and Episys.
Process adjustments to existing setup in MOVEit, OpCon and Episys.
Implement new processes in MOVEit, OpCon and Episys.

Job Duties

NOTICE: Current employees of ODJFS in the SEIU 1199 union have selection rights before all other applicants. Applications from all other candidates will only be considered if an internal SEIU 1199 applicant is not selected for the position.


NOTICE: Applicants must have 24 months of recent experience (within the past 5 years) using the State Automated Child Welfare System (SACWIS).

NOTICE: THIS POSITION IS BEING REPOSTED. PREVIOUS APPLICANTS NEED TO REAPPLY.

MISSION STATEMENT:


The Ohio Department of Job and Family Services (ODJFS) is a $3.5 billion agency with approximately 2,500 employees. The ODJFS develops and supervises the state’s public assistance, workforce development, unemployment insurance, child and adult protective services, adoption, child care, and child support programs. ODJFS’ mission is to improve the well-being of Ohio’s workforce and families by promoting economic self-sufficiency and ensuring the safety of Ohio’s most vulnerable citizens.

This position is held within the Office of Families and Children. Learn more about the office by visiting Jobs and Family Services - Office of Families and Children webpage.


Office of Families and Children

Vision: Ohio’s children, youth and vulnerable adults have a safe and permanent family that nurtures and promotes their overall well-being.

Mission: Through partnership with public and private agencies, we support the delivery of services to improve outcomes that promote safety and well-being.

THIS POSITION IS BEING REPOSTED. PREVIOUS APPLICANTS NEED TO REAPPLY.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:

Under general direction, as part of a team, provides program technical assistance to data systems professionals and technicians engaged in establishing and enhancing child welfare automated systems (i.e., Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System [SACWIS]; Business Intelligence Channel [BIC]; Results Oriented Management [ROM]) and other data systems for storing, processing and retrieving child welfare information (e.g., adoption and placement data; child abuse and neglect tracking; intake and assessment; resource management; program eligibility and financial tracking); remains current in program policy changes; provides program technical assistance to Office of Information Services (OIS) personnel and contractors in determining scope and requirements derived from federal system requirements document (e.g., interprets federal and state statutes to ensure compliance in child welfare automated system design); reviews design documents; plans, develops and recommends performance criteria and test case scenarios (e.g., creates realistic child welfare scripts); conducts system tests to ensure expected outcomes and to test user scenarios; assists with data conversion from current child welfare automated systems; assists in implementation of new systems; develops marketing material for partner agencies; develops webinars, procedure manuals and user support documentation; monitors adherence of system development to federal and state requirements; provides help desk customer service to county Public Children Service Agencies (PCSAs), Title IV-E Juvenile Courts, private non-custodial agencies (PNAs) and private child placing agencies (PCPAs); trains PCSAs, PNAs and PCPAs to ensure program compliance through use of state’s child welfare automation systems; monitors counties knowledge and use of state’s child welfare automation systems by identifying user and/or software problems through help desk activities with PCSAs, PNAs, and PCPAs staff; responds to PCSAs, PNAs and PCPAs inquiries regarding child welfare automated systems user-related issues; provides technical assistance; determines security profiles for agency staff; analyzes data; creates reports and assists with Federal Reporting requirements; identifies source of problems and prepares corrective action steps.


Participates in and/or supplies technical solutions to meet federal requirements (e.g., establishes schedule of activities with time tables for completion); identifies source of problems and prepares corrective action steps; monitors PCSAs, PNAs and PCPAs to ensure readiness and compliance; develops and conducts training workshops and seminars on new and modified procedures; prepares responses to inquires from government officials, constituent groups and general public; represents child welfare automated systems and prepares and delivers speeches and presentations at meetings/conferences; participates in development/revision of program policies and procedures.


Performs related duties as assigned (e.g., compiles periodic activity and project status reports or ad hoc narrative and statistical reports; travels to, and participates in, staff meetings, conferences and training; maintains logs and files; participates on special assignments).


Qualifications

The following are the minimum qualifications for this position. For further consideration, applicants must clearly identify how qualifications are met within the education and/or experience sections of the application.

The ideal candidate must have:

Completion of undergraduate core coursework in social or behavioral science, pre-medicine, business administration, public administration, human services as defined in series purpose, or comparable field.

OR

24 months experience in social or behavioral science, pre-medicine, business administration, public administration, human services as defined in series purpose, or comparable field.

AND

24 months recent experience (i.e., within past 5 years) in delivery of human services that include explaining and applying child protective services laws, policies, and procedures mandated by Ohio Department of Job & Family Services and using State Automated Child Welfare System (SACWIS).

AND

6 months training and/or experience in operating personal computer & using Microsoft Office system software, such as Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, or like software package.

Major Worker Characteristics

Knowledge of

human services program delivery pertinent to assigned process automation project
federal and/or state laws, rules, regulations and best practice scenarios for human services program delivery pertinent to assigned process automation project
public speaking
technical writing
interviewing/facilitation
automated business rules & rules engines*
Skill in
operation of personal computer and software programs (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel, Access)
Ability to
define unusual problems, collect data, establish facts and draw complex/technical conclusions
read and comprehend legislative or policy-related materials
create and/or edit technical/instructional materials to be presented in print or oral form to variety of human services personnel
handle routine and sensitive contacts with governmental and/or business officials, and/or general public
work independently or as part of team


Supplemental Information

Unless required by legislation or union contract, starting salary will be set at step 1 of the pay range (currently $26.81 per hour). If this position is filled internally, the wage rate will be determined in accordance with such.

All answers to supplemental questions must be supported by education, work experience, and detailed job duties provided on your civil service application.

The Company and the Role:
Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, the two essential raw materials in concrete. Lehigh Hanson companies also produce ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.
Lehigh Hanson is part of the HeidelbergCement Group, a global leader in aggregates, cement, concrete, and other downstream activities. The Group employs over 60,000 people at more than 3,000 locations in 60 countries.

Lehigh Hanson is seeking a qualified IT Business Systems Analyst.
This position is responsible for support, implementing and maintaining new and on-going configurations of our Sales and Distribution systems (Apex, CDM). This position works closely with software vendors and business users to ensure business processes are optimized.
This position is perfect for a proven Business Analyst who would like to align themselves with a progressive and growing company to enhance their skills and career. While working in a fast paced, performance culture, you will begin your career with a proven leader in the cement and construction materials supply.
This position will reside at the corporate office in Irving, Texas.
Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Female / Veteran / Disabled

What you’ll get to do:

Provides functional/business support (including after hours) for users of our sales and distribution applications
Responsible for version updates, testing and validation
Proactively identifies opportunities to improve business processes and the use of business application tools and technologies
Provides analysis, development, testing and implementation of interfaces, system changes and data conversion
Provides supplemental training material development and classroom delivery
Develops and maintains system use guidelines and procedural documentation
Serves as subject matter expert for specific for Cement and Materials business applications
Analyzes end-user functional requirements, maps business processes, develops workflows, develops functional and technical specifications, and develops effective business solutions according to defined schedules and budgets
Who we are looking for:

College degree in related field preferred or equivalent work experience.
Application Support experience with a strong customer service focus
Experience in Dispatch Systems and Plant Automation is desired.
Prefer 5 years of experience in an Information Technology (IT) role; an emphasis on support, aligning business requirements with IT solutions.
Knowledge of Citrix, Networking (includes switches and firewalls), Windows 7, Windows 10, Server 2008, SQL.
Knowledge of aggregate and or cement operations and their corresponding front office business processes is an asset
Knowledge of process and systems analysis methods.
Proficient in system and user documentation development.
Excellent communication and team-working skills.

Our corporate office supports the Lehigh Hanson plants in North America and offers a competitive benefits package that includes a 401(k) savings plan with company match, tuition reimbursement, and employee purchase program. Amenities include an on-site deli, free covered parking, and free fitness center.

No search firms please.

The Business Analyst, Product Line Management, is tasked with gathering operational and workflow requirements from internal and external customers. This individual will complete analytical assessment of processes to identify root cause of incidences and provide recommendations for workflow process modifications. This individual will interface with internal customers to act as a functional and technical liaison for the end user group community. The Business Analyst will be responsible for implementing, documenting, and monitoring business processes and associated workflow automation and applications.

.

Gather operational and workflow requirements to document, implement and monitor workflow processes. Identification of root cause(s) of workflow/process incident management.

Identify critical process opportunities for enhancement and propose tangible solutions to avoid repeatable errors.
Document detailed technical design for workflow automation, end user documentation and job aids.
Complete special projects and provide project support as requested by senior leadership.

Must be capable of executing and publishing written requirements utilizing the business intent and goals, while providing technical details to support workflow or system development
Ability to develop and/or present training to operations trainers and/or business users
Strong organizational, customer service, interpersonal, and time-management skills
Ability to work independently or in a team environment, respectful of all positions at all levels
Intermediate level skills in applications such as Microsoft Excel, Word, and Visio

The Access Operations Team uses Google's data-driven approach to provide critical business insight. In this role, you'll use analytics in order to ensure Google's goals are met in product areas across the company. You strive to help teams push strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. Your work helps to knit together the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
You will have the opportunity to join a new team at Google Fiber to lead the development of the analytical infrastructure to manage our operation and support our growth.
The Business Analyst will work cross-functionally to develop and maintain reports and analysis, including the associated tables and data pipes, to support the Mission Control function at Google Fiber. Mission Control is the single source of truth for operational reporting and analysis to measure the varied and complex set of activities required to deliver fiber optic service to a household.
At Access, our mission is to create abundant internet on networks that are always fast and always open. Google Fiber provides superfast Internet to homes across the U.S. We want to bring Google Fiber to customers even faster, so we’re focused on making deployment more efficient and less intrusive.
Responsibilities
Support the development and maintenance of reports, associated scripts/pipes, and appropriate data governance.
Work with data sets to solve non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed.
Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.
Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale. Develop comprehensive understanding of Google Fiber data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed to support our operation.
Collaborate with other analysts and engineers responsible for other Google Fiber systems that generate reporting data.
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Finance or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience analyzing data through statistical, quantitative modeling and forecasting.
Experience with SQL, R or other environments for data analysis.
Experience in spreadsheets (e.g., vlookups, macros, scripts)

Preferred qualifications:
Experience collaborating with multiple cross-functional teams, including Data Scientist, Research and Product teams.
Programming experience developing API's in Python or similar environments.
Experience in telecommunications or other similarly complex business with field operations.
Excellent oral/written communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills

The Product Owner is responsible for the strategy, roadmap, prioritization, development, and implementation of key products within the association, both internal and customer-facing. They will partner and represent the business and user community and the project team while carrying out their responsibilities for determining which features and functions are required in order to meet the company’s mission and strategic goals.
The Product Owner is responsible for driving and defining the launch and continuous improvement of new and existing products and services and must be resourceful, flexible, and accessible. This individual should have proven leadership and communication skills, and be versed in agile methodologies. The Product Owners will be responsible for collaborating with other Product Owner peers to ensure seamless integration in the Association solution sets.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES:
1) Leads the facilitation of solutions across the organization, collaborating with business, legal, risk, operations, and technology teams to prioritize and deliver solutions that align with the company’s mission and strategic goals.
2) Collaborate with the assigned business delivery team and product leaders to manage the product backlog according to business value.
3) Define, groom, and prioritize user stories.
4) Collaborates with the Scrum Master of the business delivery team to establish product release timelines and perform sprint planning with the business delivery team.
5) Establish initiatives and align with cross-functional goals.
6) Ensure product aligns with company mission and strategic goals.
7) Responsible for ownership of product voice and vision.
8) Collaborates with other product owners on dependencies.
9) Adopts an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of sprint goals.
10) Continually drives product development towards a meaningful balance between user needs, business objectives, resource utilization, and technical feasibility.

Perform other functions as assigned.

LEVELS OF SUPERVISION EXERCISED AND RECEIVED:
This position will work at the direction of PMO and the oversight of Operating Committee.

TYPICAL EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
1) Five or more years of experience working as a product owner or business analyst in a technology environment.
2) Bachelor’s degree is desired.
3) Strong understanding of technology language and use of applications in business.
4) Comprehensive understanding of the market, users, and roadmap of the product/application.
5) Able to build strong interpersonal relationships with business delivery teams, leadership, senior management and internal/external stakeholders.
6) Proven ability to clearly define a set of requirements that pinpoint business challenges and identify technical and business changes required to address them.
7) Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate clearly and concisely across technology and business teams.
8) Certification for Product Ownership preferred but not required
9) Understanding of the product lifecycle.
10) Understanding of agile methodologies, industry standards and best practices.
11) Proficient computer skills, Microsoft office suite, and applicable databases.
12) Travel up to 25% may be required.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
All hiring is contingent on eligibility to work in the United States. We are unable to sponsor or transfer visas for applicants.
Must have the ability to perform basic office tasks and sit at a desk for an extended period of time. Job requires extensive use of computers and phones. While performing the job, the employee is required to sit, crouch, kneel, crawl, reach and have the ability to lift up to 40 pounds. Ability to work with typical hardware and cabling practices required. Must have strong written and verbal communication skills to adequately convey ideas and work well with a team. Ability to talk and hear, sit and use their hands and fingers, and reach in all directions is essential in performance of the job. Must be able to interact effectively with people at all levels of company. Work during established business hours and may require occasional weekend and/or evening work.
