Public Consulting Group, Inc. (PCG) is a $400 million, fast growing, for profit company providing management consulting and technology services to help public sector education, health, human services, and other government clients achieve their performance goals and better serve populations in need.
Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, PCG has more than 2000 professionals in 47 offices throughout the U.S, in Montreal, Canada, London, England and Lodz, Poland. The firm draws on more than two decades of consulting to public sector clients in all 50 states, Canada and the EU to deliver best-practice solutions and measurable results to state and local public agencies, health plans, insurance departments, and private providers that do business with government agencies.
PCG is committed to a diverse workforce which is a reflection of our clients and the people they serve. Our organizational culture attracts and rewards people who are results-oriented and interested in making an immediate impact on their community as well as their own career.
Overall Responsibilities:
Assigned short-term and long-term tasks on a variety of consulting and operational projects. Travel to client sites for meetings, observations, focus groups, and data collection. Expected to complete a wide range of work assignments that may include data collection, quantitative analysis, report design, report drafting, and preparation of various materials for client presentations. Work with a diverse set of public sector health and human service agencies, including but not limited to the following: state/local departments of developmental disabilities, aging, employment services, transitional assistance, vocational rehabilitation, early childhood, early intervention, child welfare, juvenile justice, and youth services. An understanding of human services operations, technology and the complex array of government funding streams that support human services is preferred but not essential.

Specific Responsibilities:
Support complex projects and/or producing sophisticated deliverables.Assist with and support the implementation of major project phases or tasks.Contribute to the preparation and presentation of status reports for clients.Assist with PowerPoint reports, written deliverables, and Excel-based data analysis.Collect, enter and analyze project related data.Support business analysis of human services operations and IT systems, including early education, elder care, food stamps, mental health, developmental disability, child welfare, juvenile justice, cash assistance, etc.Support requirements sessions for technology initiatives.Provide support to clients using company’s software products.Conduct policy, regulatory, and other research on best practices and innovation.Develop competency in federal and state policySynthesize research and policy into concise written documents.Coordinate and facilitate site visits including interviews, observations, meetings, and focus groups.Design and administer surveys and develop reports analyzing results.Participate in business development activities including proposal writing and production.Other responsibilities as necessary.
Required Skills:
Excellent organizational, oral presentation, and written communication skills.Strong analytical skills, including the ability to analyze and organize data and display in professional charts and graphs.Ability to work both in a team situation and autonomously.Proficiency in Microsoft applications, in particular Access, PowerPoint, and Excel.Overtime and travel up to approximately 50% is required.Ability to develop complex reports.Database systems experience preferred.Previous research experience preferred.

Required Experience:
Bachelor's Degree is required.1-2 plus years of relevant work experience in the fields government, information technology, human services, workforce development, finance, , or the consulting field preferred.

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, we pride ourselves in building great products, services, and customer experiences. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you can accomplish.
The IS&S Marketing Group has an opportunity to redefine how consumers engage with great content and services. We are looking for a Product/Business Analyst, who will be supporting the CRM platform at Apple. As an analyst, you will work closely with partners for optimal definition, delivery, training and advocacy of premier CRM and growth enablement solutions. Work collaboratively with a team of cross-functional business partners to obtain and define business needs/requirements, develop product roadmap(s), achieve optimal design, ensure effective prioritization, establish critical metrics and ensure effective delivery of partner requirements. Ability to adapt to change, self-driven, and multitasking in a very fast paced environment are key success factors for the right candidate.

Key Qualifications
Technical background and strength, especially in CRM.
Strong social skills, with ability to collaborate and communicate at all organizational levels.
Ability to anticipate and effectively solve complex problems.
Strong project management and organization skills, with the ability to seamlessly multi-task.
Ability to build consensus and alignment, act with urgency, drive results and take educated risks.
A do-er and self starter who works well in a face-paced, dynamic, team environment.
Highly responsive and adaptable.
Description
•Responsible for creation of prioritized, actionable product roadmaps, requirement documents and delivery of solutions in alignment with Apple’s needs and goals with a specific focus on premier CRM, self-service, reporting and marketing automation solutions.
•Ensure clarity of expectations and accountability via measurable goals and objectives.
•Develop and maintain subject matter expertise, best-practice insight, and optimal solution utilization.
•Assist the Campaign Operations to improve and enhance the CRM system.
•Manage the prioritization of work, helping to ensure quality and on time delivery within budget; maintain product roadmap(s), initiative and feature definition and work with the product stake-holders to deliver executable user stories to the engineering team(s).
•Prioritize day to day requests and strategic roadmap work to achieve optimal benefit to the business.
•Ensure and manage an effective user acceptance testing framework in place for all product releases.
•Maintain close, positive relationships with internal clients to continuously understand challenges and identify new opportunities.
•Help build standard reports / dashboards for reporting across the business, ensuring that complex information is presented clearly and in easy-to-use formats.
•Manage the quality and consistency of data capture across all customer touch points.
•Establish processes to ensure the quality of all data is good at and current.
•Communicate frequently and effectively with all internal partners to ensure that platform product development, usability and its impact on the business is understood.
Education
BS/BA required.

Job Description
Customer service is the heart of Amazon. We’ve built a reputation for excellence with recent examples of being named #1 in customer service, and #1 most trusted.

"Our vision is to be earth's most customer-centric company; to build a place where people can come to find and discover anything they might want to buy online."

Amazon is looking for a smart, motivated, and driven Business Analyst to focus on improving the customer experience. You will pull and analyze multiple types of data to discover and solve real world problems. This position requires high judgment, focus on speed and accuracy, and an ability to balance customer and associate experience with financial impact. It also offers broad exposure to various business and technical teams within Amazon.

This position will be located at our customer service center in Huntington West Virginia.

Responsibilities include:
Developing intuitive, insightful reporting on the key drivers of our business
Interacting with internal stakeholders to deep-dive outlier events
Ad-hoc project work supporting the re-invention of how we manage our business
Enabling effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources, compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Identifying process and system improvement opportunities by monitoring existing metrics, analyzing data, and partnering with internal teams

Successful candidates will demonstrate the ability to:
Translate technical concepts into business requirements and present findings and recommendations to stakeholders both in written and verbal format.
Work in a rapidly changing and complex environment.
Learn new technologies, processes and tools in an effort to complete task and responsibilities.
Independently identify and set priorities in an ambiguous environment.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or any related field from an accredited institution
3+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst or equivalent Amazon experience
Proficient with the following programming languages and statistical software: SQL, Excel, Minitab, R and Python
Experience working with complex data sets in data warehouse environments
A proven record of taking ownership and driving resolution
Highly skilled verbal, written communication, and data presentation
Effective communication with both business and technical teams
Ability to take loosely defined business questions and translate them into clearly defined technical/data specifications
Passion for operational excellence with a commitment to delighting customers
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree in Statistics, Engineering, or Economics
Advance experience with Tableau, Micro strategy, or equivalent data visualization solutions
Experience applying advanced statistical methodologies
Experience with Lean Six Sigma methodologies

 License and Certification Qualifications: Valid Georgia Educator Certificate preferred.

Education Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent required. Bachelor's degree in related field preferred.

Experience Qualifications: Three years of experience in business administration or school technology support working with information systems/program management required. Experience working with third party vendor risk management preferred.

Skills Qualifications: Strong written and verbal communication skills, including working closely with executive level management; ability to organize and complete multiple tasks/projects concurrently; ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and changing business requirements; excellent understanding of business complexity and project interdependencies; ability to work successfully with colleagues; ability to project and generate a positive attitude; and high degree of skill in Microsoft Applications including SharePoint and Microsoft Project.

Primary Responsibilities: Responsible for acting as an intermediary between the business community, technical community, and local schools working with information technology project teams to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design, using appropriate tools and models, from which applications and solutions are developed. This position is also responsible for the management of the third party vendor review process, including assessing third party security and maximizing protections for all aspects of student and staff information.

1. Document requirements and capture business needs for projects within Data Governance.
a. Provide documentation support for requirements gathering, process analysis, gap analysis, design of new functionality, and product testing.
b. Partner with business sponsors and technology team members to track, analyze, translate, and fully document business requirements and changes for functional and business specifications.

2. Manage the process of gathering information, categorizing, and processing requests.

3. Coordinate testing efforts with quality assurance and user acceptance testing.

4. Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported, and resolved in a timely manner.

5. Report on common sources of technical issues or questions, communicate key insights and findings, and make recommendations to the Director of Student Data Management.

6. Document system processes and work flows within Data Governance.

7. Manage and maintain the project management site and provide effective and timely project status reports.

8. Assist with the daily management of operational functions of the project team, including preparation and minutes for standing meetings, reporting processes, and information flow.

9. Oversee the management of the third party vendor review process, including assessing third party security and maximizing protections for all aspects of student and staff information.

10. Assess potential and existing providers, legal contracts, procurement, and a wide range of personnel across the district to categorize, rank, and process potential and current third party vendors.

11. Provide continuous quality improvement within Data Governance.

12. Perform other duties as assigned.

Physical Demands:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit for extended periods of time. The employee is also required to talk, hear, stand, and walk. The employee may be required to use hands to finger, handle, feel, and/or reach. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

FundsNetwork™ is the industry’s largest open-architecture fund “supermarket” platform. Fidelity FundsNetwork plays a critical role in providing Fidelity’s clients across PI, WI, and FI access to over 20,000 products managed by external asset managers. The primary areas of responsibilities for the Strategic Programs & Analytics team are:
Lead FundsNetwork technology program efforts
Provide robust reporting, analytics, and insight to external investment firms and internal business partners
Develop and deploy strategic initiatives for FundsNetwork

Bachelor's degree or equivalent business experience

The Purpose of Your Role
We are seeking a dynamic individual with a consistent track record of collaborating with business partners, understanding business requirements, translating business requirements into system requirements, and making recommendations regarding system functionality.  The individual in this role will be critical to driving the success of the FundsNetwork business and ensuring we’re delivering best-in-class capabilities to many of the top asset managers in the financial services industry.

Collaborate with other Fidelity business units and external vendors

Manage and/or deliver operational readiness documents, business process changes/improvements documents, and user training and materials
Mentor and/or manage junior business analysts
Balance scope, quality, effort, schedule, budget and risk at all times
Assess user requirement information for accuracy and completeness

Partners with appropriate team members to research and find solutions

Participates in the preparation of client webinars, conferences, demos and other presentations to both clients and internal Equus team
Develops strong working relationships with clients and internal teams

Benefits
What is Equus?
Equus Software is a market leading Software Company specializing in Global Mobility Software. We provide award-winning service to our portfolio of high-profile global clients. Our team is known for providing creative software solutions to solve our clients’ complex business problems.
What we can offer?
Variety: As part of our team, you will work in a fast paced and challenging environment where no two days will be the same.
Training: You will learn about the world of Global Mobility; and receive training on our in-house project management processes, software configuration and product development, with the guidance of our Client Account Managers, Senior Business Analysts and software development teams.
Knowledge: You will be able to take full advantage of being part of a fast-paced, close-knit community and make full use of the knowledge of the Global Equus Team with direct access to everyone from BA to CEO.
Growth: Equus is winning new clients all the time and there is plenty of room for the right candidate to move up the career ladder as the company grows.
Innovation: One day each quarter, we are given free time to innovate. We can create anything we feel would make our jobs or our clients experience better.

Salary: We are offering a competitive starting salary plus an excellent benefit package.

The Information Technology (I.T.) division of Enterprise Holdings builds and implements powerful solutions that help to drive and support the global operations of our brands and businesses, including Alamo Rent A Car, Enterprise Rent-A-Car and National Car Rental. With 9,000 branch locations across the world and more than 97,000 employees, Enterprise Holdings and its affiliates own and operate almost 1.9 million cars and trucks.

Here, you will be part of a team that creates and delivers leading-edge technologies and expansive systems that impact every aspect of our growing businesses. We provide the resources to enable and develop our more than 2,000 innovative I.T. professionals in a variety of career paths. This is where it all starts. All systems GO!

Responsibilities:
The Vehicle Services team is responsible for building and maintaining the services and vehicle data that comprise the fleet of cars within Enterprise Holdings. As a Lead Business Analyst on this team, you will work with them to enforce the full lifecycle of the vehicle from the time our cars are ordered to when they are finally sold as used vehicles. The team interacts closely and supports the suite of Vehicle Management client applications that the business uses to interact with the Vehicle lifecycle. The Vehicle Services teams also works closely with many different rental client teams such as tablets, kiosks, mobile applications and rental application systems to rent, track and maintain our fleet. In the next fiscal year, there will be several new initiatives that will focus on simplifying our vehicle solution as well as continuing to expand the mobile solutions needed to maintain our fleet.

The Lead Business Analyst will play a key role in shaping product design by leading the gathering of requirements on concept development, resolving issues, performing gap and risk analysis and delivering detailed development documentation to support Agile product development. The Lead Business Analyst will also be responsible for leading other Business Analysts and collaborating with them on a daily basis.

As a Lead Business Analyst in the Vehicle Services team, you will serve as the primary interface between the business, client software teams, product owners, software engineers and QA testers to implement new functionality and modifications in various Vehicle Services Products. You will play a leading role in in shaping product design by gathering, interpreting, reviewing, validating, documenting, and maintaining business and functional requirements across all our products to support the Agile product development. This will also include using SQL to perform gap and risk analysis to support our products. You will also be responsible for participating and leading the Agile ceremonies in a SCRUM Master role. You will present information, track and respond to client questions as they interact with our services. You will be responsible for demonstrating your leadership capabilities in meeting facilitation, collaborating, conflict resolution and obtaining your desired results from team members.

This position gives the right candidate an exciting opportunity to work closely with Product Management supporting our Vehicle Services organization in an Agile environment.

To be successful you will need to demonstrate strong skills in the areas of personal ownership and accountability, relationship management, team building, organization, prioritization, problem solving, change management and executive level written and oral communication.

Assists in developing annual O&M and Capital budgets.Assists in identifying issues that lead to deviations from budgets.Perform ad hoc financial analysis and assist in monthly forecasting activities.Manages data requests from plant engineering, operations, maintenance, and plant management.Manages capital project creation and completion process in support of plant engineering.Prepare journal entries for submittal to accounting.Serves as departmental subject matter expert on the Enterprise and Asset Management system, WAM.Utilizes software applications (WAM, Peoplesoft, Hyperion, PowerPlan, PI, Microsoft Office Products, etc.) to perform various analytics and ad-hoc reporting.Develops and distributes regular daily, weekly and monthly plant performance and financial reporting packages.Data entry and administrative tasks as assigned.

Education and Experience Requirements:
The preferred candidate will possess a bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, engineering, information technology or a related field. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of two years of experience working with various computer systems and database applications; as well as a strong technical background around maintenance and reliability applications. This role requires strong analytical capability, project management skills, excellent communication skills and the ability to work well in a dynamic work environment. Prior experience in the utility industry and/or technical related field around reliability and maintenance is preferred. A strong level of computer proficiency, organization, customer service orientation, teamwork, critical thinking and attention to detail is important to be successful in this role.

Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities Required:
High level of proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel applications.
Self starter with the ability to work with little supervision.
Strong technical writing skills and keyboarding competency.
Ability to maintain effective working relationships with other personnel including subordinates, peers, managers, vendor’s, contractors and other contacts.
Ability to read, interpret and apply information from files, drawings, catalogs, reports and manuals.
Ability to perform basic mathematical computations involved in planning, estimating and purchasing.
Ability to handle multiple priorities and work in a highly demanding team atmosphere. Ability to keep multiple jobs in controlled motion – simultaneously.
Excellent organizational and time/priority management skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated communication skills (verbal and written).

Licenses, Certifications, Bonding and/or Testing Required:
Successful candidate must possess and maintain a valid driver’s license.

Working Conditions:
Much of the time will be spent in an office environment. Some travel will be necessary. Must have satisfactory work record including good attendance.

Service Market Logistics (SML) is part of Group Trucks Operations (GTO). We are an organization of approximately 4,000 employees globally in more than 40 locations. Every day, we are delivering world-class operational excellence for our customers, based upon smart logistics solutions. Our job is to develop, manage and optimize the Service Market supply chain for all Volvo Group brands and JV’s. The scope for Service Market Logistics includes Flow Optimization, Inventory Management, Distribution Center operations, Customs & Trade, as well as the development of logistics solutions to ensure the highest possible parts availability, delivery precision and quality everywhere in the world. We strive for an innovative and diverse workplace, exercising the Volvo Group values with high focus on customer success.

SML North America (NA) is a part of SML and has about 1,000 employees across the United States, Canada and Mexico. We operate the Central Distribution Center in Byhalia, MS as well as Regional Distribution Centers across the NA region.

Mission/Purpose of the Position
The Operation Business Analyst position is part of the Supply Planning & Dealer Inventory Management (SP/DIM) organization within SML NA. The SP/DIM organization is responsible for parts availability, backorder recovery, delivery precision and inventory.

The Operational Business Analyst is a member of a team working to ensure SP/DIM North America Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) and Performance Indicators (PI’s) by performing reporting, analysis and proposal actions for Volvo Trucks, Mack Trucks, VCE and Penta. This position will also be part of, and be responsible for, key activities/projects to further develop the SP/DIM operations in North America. The Operational Business Analyst will monitor and analyze the SP/DIM KPI’s and PI’s, as well as have the opportunity to develop methods and processes for improving and innovating the planning process, reports and tools needed.

Scope & Influence
This position reports to the Director of Supply Planning & DIM and is located in Byhalia, MS.

Essential Functions
Provide follow-up on KPI’s and PI’s to the SP/DIM NA management. Analyze the impact on PI’s and KPI’s and develop proposals on mitigating actions
Generate and follow-up on weekly KPI Dashboards and map major root causes and drive actions to sustain or fill the gap to target KPI
Follow-up and development of life cycle segments together with Theoretical Optimization team
Support SP/DIM NA teams by developing necessary follow-up tools and reports
Support SP/DIM NA teams to create and maintain weekly or monthly communication packages
Act as liaison between Operations and SP/DIM functions in implementing standard reporting across the SP/DIM organization
Participate in continuous improvement activities within SP/DIM and be responsible for needed data mapping and analytics
Work with the process network and Parts Linq maintenance team to secure process development and best practice implementations
Create follow-up activities and reports, on own initiative and on request, within own team
Act according to the Volvo values
Other duties as assigned by Management
Minimum Education and Experience
BA/BS degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Mathematics/Statistics, Business Administration or a related field, or equivalent experience
3 to 5 years of relevant experience preferred
Experience working with logistics in a complex global supply chain
Holistic view and ability to grasp the full supply chain
Broad knowledge of the logistics area
Knowledge of where to find relevant logistics data, how to retrieve it, and how to validate the data in terms of relevance, correctness and completeness
Demonstrated ability to work successfully in a global environment
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced team environment striving towards operational excellence guided by Volvo’s Values and the Code of Conduct
Necessary Technical/Functional/Language Skills
As all documentation is in English, proficiency in the English language is required
Strong problem solving, research and analytical skills
Ability to apply and analyze large amounts of data for developing projections and estimates
Ability to analyze business processes and develop systems-based solutions that will improve the current state
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to communicate efficiently and effectively within a multi-cultural and international environment
Ability to compile and present findings and possible recommendations to a diverse audience
Ability to manage and prioritize a high volume of detailed tasks
Comfortable learning new technologies
Ability to develop and maintain productive business relationships
Excellent computer skills, (Microsoft Office applications)

Summary of Work




This position will function as a business analyst on the ND Health Enterprise Medicaid Management Information System ( MMIS) . Work involves serving as a liaison between business users and information technology in order to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate requirements for new or changed business processes, policies, and information systems.
Key Requirements/Tasks:
Soft skill requirements include negotiation, facilitation, communication and organization skills. Work requires applying principles, methodologies, standards, and best practices to identify business needs and determine solutions to business problems. Solutions may include software/systems development, process improvement, and/or organizational change.
This position is responsible for leading and oversight of the business analysis support for special projects of the MMIS.
Provide operational expertise in different areas of the Medicaid System.
The Business Analyst must understand system configuration that supports the functions of the MMIS. They must understand the purpose and relationship of system parameters to maximize the MMIS performance and functionality.
Key tasks performed will be to analyze, document, communicate and validate requirements for business software applications. Review of use cases, design documents, change requests, action items, and issues related to assigned functional areas.
Review and provide approval of test cases and test scripts. Participate in test methodology and system training. Participate in the test execution of different areas of the system during User Acceptance Testing.
Review lesson modules and assist with the creation of training manuals. Assist with internal and external training of the system.
The position requires that ability to communicate effectively with a variety of personnel, including Information Technology analysts/developers, Business Administration staff, Vendor SME’s, and Project Management staff.
Must be able to work well with people and effectively communicate business concepts, rules, and requirements. Individual must be a team player that is also able to work independently.
This position requires activities across many work plans. This requires a great deal of organization to handle multiple priorities. Areas of major projects include detail system design specification definition, establishment of test plans, user acceptance testing, organizational readiness, training, and implementation of system/business process changes.
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Reviewing submitted change requests and providing support to supervisor on if the system is adequate to provide the needed business function or if there truly needs to be a change request submitted. The Business Analyst must understand complex business and system rules to make these determinations and involve subject matter experts from multiple functional areas.
The person in this position will be responsible for finding efficiencies, ensuring that meetings are timely and productive, and keeping the group moving forward.
This person will need to make recommendations to the DHS Business Information Systems Administrator or Lead Business Analyst regarding system and business issues determined during review of deliverables.
This person will need to advise the DHS Business Information Systems Administrator or Lead Business Analyst on impacts that will affect the project and make recommendations on what needs to be included and what can be deferred.
This person must advise supervisors of problems that could affect project time, scope or budget.
Preference will be given to those applicants with medical claims experience.
Regrettably, the Department of Human Services does not offer or provide sponsorships.



Minimum Qualifications




Business Analyst I requires a bachelor’s degree with a major in computer science, computer or management information systems, project management, business administration or a field closely related to those listed; AND three years of work experience involving business analysis activities such as requirements planning and management, elicitation, documentation and solution assessment. Additional work experience as described may substitute for the education requirement on a year-for-year basis.
DHS defines business analysis experience as work involving serving as a liaison between business users and information technology in order to elicit, analyze, communicate, and validate requirements for new or changed business processes, policies, and information systems. Work requires applying principles, methodologies, standards, and best practices to identify business needs and determine solutions to business problems.
Candidates will need to be a team player and have an excellent eye for detail, be analytical and also be able to deal with the abstract, strong communications (both written and verbal), maintain good relationships with all levels of staff, understand the business objective and be able to prioritize work. Specific soft skills include: analysis, creativity, interviewing, presentation, time management and organization.


Application Procedures




Please provide details in the employment history sections of the application form on how your education, experience and skills will qualify you for this position. Supplemental information such as a cover letter and resume may be included, but the initial review and score will be based on the information provided in your online application.
Please fill in all information requested on the application form, such as dates of employment, hours worked per week, credits earned, etc. INCOMPLETE SECTIONS WILL NOT BE GIVEN CREDIT.
The Department’s Human Resource Division staff will score applications against the minimum qualifications and preferences listed on the job announcement and qualifying military service. After the scoring is completed, a certified list of eligible candidates and the applications will be forwarded to the hiring manager for further consideration and possible interview, based on the final scores.
The Department of Human Services does not offer or provide sponsorships. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States.
All application material must be received on the closing date by 11:59 pm or before the closing date.
A copy of your qualifying degrees transcript and any applicable certifications or licensures must be provided at the time of an interview.

The role works closely with all Manufacturing team members in identifying and defining key business process flow improvements through data analysis problem solving. Lead the development of policies and procedure documentation for proposed process improvements. The Manufacturing Business Analyst will also be responsible for maintaining current systems data analysis processes and procedures.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Analyzes current business processes (plan vs. actual) to identify areas of constraints and translate into mitigation plans and process improvements.
Recommends technical/business problem solving solutions that are comprehensive, fiscally responsible and encompasses cutting edge technology.
Gathers and analyzes, documents and test data.
Identifies root causes and can addresses issues and concerns with comprehensive countermeasures.
Gathers and analyzes documents and test data.
Identifies outliers, leading indicators, trends, and pitfalls to develop proactive mitigation plans.
Prepares reports supporting department goals and objectives.
Designs, establishes, develops, reporting standard for manufacturing.
Maintains database and provides quality assessment to ensure data accuracy and constancy.
Implements business Continuous Process improvement.
Aids in creation and maintenance of department metrics, KPI, and related analytical tools.
Conducts capacity planning and analysis to develop internal production plans.

Overview
If you want an exciting job with one of the largest off-price retailers in the nation, join the Finance team at Burlington Stores, Inc.! Are you a detail-oriented finance professional with analytical experience? Would you thrive in an environment that encourages creativity and thinking outside the box? Are you a team-player who would work well in a fast-paced finance department where you have to think on your feet and solve problems as they emerge? If so, this may be the right opportunity for you!
Position Summary:
Position to provide Accounting & Finance support to the multiple departments related to Store Capital Projects to including New Stores, Remodels, Misc Construction & Fixture/Signage initiatives. This will include reviewing invoices to ensure Company’s payment guidelines are met; creating and/or approving Purchase Orders with verification to Approved Plan prior to entry; Obtaining lien waivers from vendors to include verification prior to payment; maintenance of folders/files associated with payments, PO’s, and lien waivers; and additional reporting as required by the Finance Construction – Manager and Sr. Management.
Major Duties and Responsibilities
Review invoices/payments to ensure compliance with Company’s payment guidelines to ensure all invoices/payments include proper G/L coding & project code, all lien waivers are attached (when necessary), and proper authorization is obtained. This includes processing invoices timely, notifying Mgt. of any potential issues immediately upon them being known, and any necessary tracking to provide payment info to Mgt.
Create and/or approve purchase orders related to Store Capital Projects to ensure proper G/L & project coding, proper authorization, and verification to Approved Capital Plan prior to PO creation.
Prepare Tenant Allowance packages to provide Lease Administration with proper documentation to submit requests for payment to landlords which includes lien waivers, information for cost certifications, and any additional information dictated by the lease.
Prepare additional reports and ad hoc requests as directed by the Finance Construction Manager or Sr. Management.
Experience/Education
Minimum 2 yr Accounting Degree or related degree ; Preference- 4 year degree. 0-2 Years Accounting/Finance background with experience in construction accounting and/or procurement preferred. Advanced experience in MS Office , proficiency in computerized Accounting & Finance applications. Experience with Cognos or Oracle G/L helpful.

Contribute. Grow. Lead...with OxyChem. Looking for a challenge? Desire to achieve your true potential? OxyChem is a growing, action-oriented, safety driven chemical manufacturing company continually striving to be the best in the business while staying focused on environmental protection. The secret to our success has and will continue to be our people.

Occidental Chemical Corporation (OxyChem) is a leading North American manufacturer of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) resins, chlorine and caustic soda – key building blocks for a variety of indispensable products such as plastics, pharmaceuticals and water treatment chemicals. Other OxyChem products include caustic potash, chlorinated organics, sodium silicates, chlorinated isocyanurates and calcium chloride. For every product it makes, OxyChem’s market position is No. 1 or No. 2 in the U.S.

In a fast-paced industry that demands precision, we create a supportive workplace where the safety and well-being of our employees are paramount. We are committed to rewarding top performers, offering very competitive pay and benefits, and providing career development opportunities. We are looking for a Business Analyst at our corporate headquarters located in Dallas, Texas.

Essential Job Duties
Provide financial/accounting expertise to OxyChem business teams including effective analysis regarding short and long term performance forecasts and actual performance results
Coordinate and review monthly business projections, annual business plans and strategic forecasts; ensure financial projections are consistent with management's objectives and are prepared on sound operating and business information
Conduct monthly financial closings including analysis of product pricing, profitability and sales/ operating variances
Prepare, evaluate and review the financial aspects of major commercial contract proposals and ensure adherence to financial terms
Prepare pricing calculations for major customer contracts, customer profitability analysis and analysis of company logistics costs
Identify and recommend improvements to financial controls within the business areas
Monitor product inventory levels and coordinate with business teams on achieving optimum levels
Prepare monthly and quarterly financial data and analysis to support business goals and ensure compliance to accounting/financial regulations and objectives
Coordinate with accounting and cross-functional departments on financial closings, plans and projects
Provide routine and ad-hoc financial support to management and business teams as required for product line profitability, product integration impact, asset optimization and other value-added analysis
Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Accounting and/or Finance required
5-10 years of professional financial/accounting experience required
Experience in manufacturing environment preferred
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Prioritization, organization and timely decision making skills
Proficiency in Microsoft applications required; SAP and TM-1 experience preferred, with strong spreadsheet/financial modeling skills
Preferred MBA degree and/or CPA certification

Job Description
At Amazon.com we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. In Seller Support we are building and operating exceptional solutions to provide world class support to Sellers on Amazon's Marketplace business, which exceeds 45% of the total Amazon.com platform sales and growing. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history as a Business Analyst for the Seller Experience team based in Seattle.

Are you data savvy, business focused, with a desire to use your analytical prowess to help others understand Seller needs and drive change through rigorous data analysis?

The successful candidate will be highly analytical, an expert with SQL and Excel, experienced with significance testing and A/B experimentation, resourceful, customer focused, team oriented, and have an ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines.

In this role you will:
Be an important member of a team that improves the experience of selling on Amazon by eliminating defects, proactively identifying and resolving selling issues, and discovering seller insights.
These objectives by diving deep into Amazon’s data lake to reveal trends, support machine-learning based automation, poll sellers and analyze how sentiments predict behaviors, perform cohort analysis, and run experiments to test hypotheses and to quantify impacts.
Work closely with product managers, SDEs, Technical Product Managers, data engineers, process engineers and senior management to define and build reporting and analytic solutions that allow us to make data-based product and business decisions that make it easier to sell on Amazon.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Analyze and solve business problems with focus on understanding root causes and discovering forward-looking opportunities.
Rigorously examine metrics and design new metrics that provide guidance about the state of the business.
Communicate complex analyses and insights to stakeholders and business leaders, both verbally and in writing.
Create and maintain tools and reports which support Senior leadership and various teams throughout the organization.

Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.
Basic Qualifications
BS/BA in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, quantitative Social Sciences or related field.
3+ years of experience of writing SQL queries.
Advanced excel skills (pivot, macros, v-lookup etc.)
Experience with A/B testing and statistical significance testing.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases.
Strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills with the ability to translate complex analysis into actionable recommendations.
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, quantitative Social Sciences or related field
Advanced analytical and quantitative skills with demonstrated ability in using data and metrics to identify root causes
Proficiency in a statistical software such as R, Stata, SAS, SPSS, or Minitab
Experience with predictive analytics, data mining, and data visualization
Experience with survey research
Experience working with wide variety of business data sources

Description:
Under general supervision, the Business Analyst is responsible for delivering mutually agreed upon functional requirements for the IT team. This position participates in all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle including both package and custom development, taking a business requirement through to implementation, and post-implementation. The Associate may interact with his or her supervisor several times a week to receive guidance and feedback. Many non-routine activities will require a supervisor’s advance approval.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*
Under the guidance of a senior business analyst, gather business case details for proposed projects.
Collect & manage business and functional requirements through implementation:
Create or revising any requirements documentation
Track changes, analyzing proposed changes for impact
Coordinate team & stakeholder communication for new and/or updated requirements
Identify and participate in the resolution of requirements conflicts involving scope, schedule, budget or quality.
Monitor and report on requirements metrics.
Ensure that all requirements are compliant with IT policies throughout the project.
Obtain stakeholder acceptance for all deliverables.
Manage requirement traceability matrix throughout project lifecycle.
Create, coordinate, and conduct user acceptance testing, including coordination of resources, documentation of issues found and follow up through resolution as required.
Design and maintain end user training and support team documentation.
Develop strong relationships with the supported business function by building subject matter expertise in their business processes and the systems that support those processes.
Coordinate project activities including scheduling meetings, publishing agendas and meeting minutes/action items where applicable, and follow up reports.
Develop subject matter expertise on the front-end and back-end data systems that support and interact with GameStop systems, and the flow of data between those systems.

RELATED COMPETENCIES
Building Partnerships – Identifies opportunities and takes action to build strategic relationships between one’s area and other areas, teams, departments, units, or organizations to help achieve business goals.
Operational Decision Making - Securing and comparing information from multiple sources to identify business issues; committing to an action after weighing alternative solutions against important decision criteria.
Planning and Organizing - Establishes courses of action for self and others to ensure that work is completed efficiently.
Technical/Professional Knowledge and Skills – Having achieved a satisfactory level of technical and professional skill or knowledge in position-related areas; keeps up with current developments and trends in areas of expertise.

BASIC AND PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE)
A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited program in Information Systems, Computer Science or other related field required
At least 2 years of Business Analyst, Information Systems or Quality Assurance experience required
Experience in implementation and delivery of software preferred

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS, JOB SKILLS, ABILITIES
Proficient knowledge of methodologies, processes and tools commonly used by Business Analysts
Possess willingness and ability to work with legacy technologies
Possess leadership skills as demonstrated by a disciplined approach to innovation and the capacity to create and embrace the vision for the end goal or project deliverable, including a determined commitment to project completion
Proficient ability to communicate effectively with others using written and spoken English including the ability to provide clear, constructive feedback to team members
Ability to work under demanding time constraints and production goals
Ability to spend time in the user environment as needed to analyze business operations and perform post-implementation support and validation
Proficient project planning skills, including the ability to organize, prioritize and control job responsibilities in order to meet deadlines in an environment with overlapping and potentially conflicting priorities
Possess proficient analytical, problem solving and decision making skills
Proficient knowledge of implementation and delivery of software
Working ability to remain effective under stress, and respond to pressure in a manner acceptable to others and to the organization
Demonstrated capacity for gathering and scrutinizing data to identify issues, opportunities, patterns, and sustainable business solutions
Knowledge of Retail Systems and processes preferred
Knowledge of Microsoft .Net Object Oriented technologies preferred
Participation in groups or affiliations concerned with the development and revision of the Body of Common Knowledge for BAs preferred
Consistently demonstrates a commitment to GameStop policies and procedures, including but not limited to, attendance, confidentiality, conflict of interest, and ethical responsibilities

SonderMind is digital health company changing the game in behavioral health by increasing access and utilization of this important part of our well-being. We are creating a national, digitally-integrated network of behavioral health providers that lets them focus on providing great care, while we provide the rest. This network, combined with a variety of software offerings, generates the data and capability needed to serve the consumers, employers and health systems looking to access high-quality behavioral health care.

Our therapist network continues to grow and requires a dedicated teammate to lead business intelligence and data analytics efforts.

The work will vary from day-to-day but the consistent theme is that you will work across SonderMind as the key point of contact for all business intelligence, data aggregation and analytics activities. You will be expected to:

Successfully conduct ad-hoc and regular reporting data requests
Set-up process to handle analytics requests from the whole SonderMind team
Be the expert on all key SonderMind data sources

Demonstrated ability to exercise extreme ownership of your workstreams, to follow through and make sure they're taken care of, and to ensure issues are escalated appropriately will be disproportionately valued in the interview process.

This is a ground-floor opportunity to grow with a venture capital-backed company with plans to become a national force for changing this important segment of healthcare. Our team is made up of experienced healthcare, technology and product professionals who work very hard and thrive in a fast-paced environment that is constantly changing. As an early team member, we will expect you to demonstrate a willingness to take risks and never act as a cog in the wheel.

Gotta Have This:

Demonstrated experience in collecting, organizing and analyzing key business performance metrics, to include developing actionable management reports
Demonstrated excellence in large-scale Excel analytics and modeling (e.g., pivot tables, H and Vlookups, large embedded IF statements, cell and range naming)
Ability to create dashboards and reports that communicate results to all members of the SonderMind team.
General understanding of statistics and a willingness to learn how to conduct such analyses (confidence intervals, probabilities, etc.)
Bachelor degree with a major or area of focus in STEM coursework.
At least 2 years of post-undergrad work experience.

Nice to Have This:

Experience in healthcare and/or fast-growing technology organizations
Experience with financial analysis
Strong SQL skills, coupled with experience using business intelligence tools and raw data sets.

Benefits
Experience and Career Growth. You will be part of the core team as the company enters a major growth phase. We always look to promote first from within and everyone on the team is taking on multiple roles. We don’t know how to say “that isn’t my job.”

Startup Environment. From our location directly across from Union Station, to an office with a Stormtrooper greeting people entering the office, to brick walls covered by whiteboards, things are changing and improving EVERY SINGLE DAY.

Health, Vision, Dental and 401k. Excellent employee benefits.

Therapy Benefits. Of course, we encourage our team to engage in proactively maintaining strong behavioral health and offer all employees access to SonderMind therapists.

Please apply with your resume and cover letter, providing an example that demonstrates why you would be an outstanding match for this role.

At gTech’s Users and Products team (gUP), our mission is to help users get the most out of Google. We represent the voice of Google's users and many of our partners globally, sharing insights with the larger Google organization to enable exceptional customer and product experiences.

gUP builds innovative solutions that take user experience and engagement with Google to the next level, supporting users across products, countries, cultures, incomes, and identities. We advocate for users through partnerships with product areas at Google (and some Alphabet businesses), supporting Google’s consumer products ecosystem and enabling numerous launches for Google’s consumer products each year.

We are committed to building an ever more diverse, equitable, and inclusive gUP, and consider this the foundation upon which individual, team, and user success are built. We're also committed to innovation not only in the content of our work, but in the way we work. Check out this blog post on our Chameleon program.
Our team supports a global organization with strategic and analytical insights to provide better, faster, more efficient services to products across Google.
You are a team-oriented business analyst who will use your strong set of business analytical skills to help craft stories and and insights to help the team make wide-ranging business decisions. Your keen sense for sniffing out inefficiencies and desire for better, simpler data will drive continuous improvements and innovation in our processes and operations.
Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
Responsibilities
Ensure that the team manages our finances wisely by creating internal infrastructure for budget management, tracking and reporting.
Provide analytical leadership in how we gather, structure and present key operational data.
Support our cross-functional teammates with understanding and using our key business metrics.
Contribute to and drive monthly, quarterly and annual business planning cycles, drive visibility into resource allocations, budgeting and investment decisions.
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or similar discipline or equivalent practical experience.
5 years relevant work experience in business analysis for management consulting, investment banking, internet or media industry.
Experience in business strategy and stakeholder management.
Experience in project management, including working with stakeholders on defining and executing projects within budget and timelines.

Preferred qualifications:
Master's or advanced degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience communicating for a variety of audiences.
Strong business analytical skills with experience in spreadsheets software and database query (e.g. SQL-like language); comfort working with disparate data sets to answer business questions and tell a strategic story.
Ability to self-start work in a fast-moving environment, and comfortable dealing with ambiguity.
Excellent problem-solving skills; ability to identify ways to address a complicated problem at various levels of depth.
Solid organizational and project management skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally and manage multiple projects.

Calling the adventurers ready to join a company that's pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling. At KLA-Tencor, we're making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen.

Are you an experienced Senior QA Analyst? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, quickly changing environment? Are you excited about technology and innovation? This role might be the perfect fit for you!

NRT LLC is seeking a Senior QA Analyst. The ideal candidate will work out of the Madison, NJ headquarters; however, we will consider candidates with the ability to work out of our Edina, MN offices.

As the Senior QA Analyst, you will perform leadership activities in the following areas: QA Best Practices, Test Automation, Analytics and Reporting. You will understand business needs, interpret business needs into viable test plans to deliver solutions that satisfy users and business partners. The environment includes many frequent changes in tasks and direction, requiring this individual to be able to focus concurrently on multiple, high-priority, and high-visibility deliverables and issues simultaneously.

You’ll… Participate in Agile sprint and release planning, the development of user stories and associated acceptance criteria, the creation of quality assurance activity tasks, Product Owner demos, and Agile retrospectives Provide continuous feedback through the update of the Product Backlog (using department Agile tools) and daily standups to communicate task progress, issues, and risks to Agile teammates and peers in other work groups Lead the effort to identify what to automate and determine the layer which the automation should be conducted Lead the effort to or develop automated test scripts throughout the development lifecycle
 Lead the effort to drive continuous process improvement of quality procedures and practices to drive efficiency throughout the development lifecycle. Work collaboratively with all members of the Agile team to create appropriate conditions to test or to determine non-production factors that limit testing
 Participate in the generation of Quality Assurance related KPI’s and establishment of quality goals Use analytics to assess the effectiveness of the QA processes and team Design and execute tests as requested after the deployment of builds, enhancements, hot fixes, or other technical changes Design and execute tests ensuring the security and integrity of company applications Design and execute data related tests to verify exports, imports, reports, data migrations and other technical changes Lead, design and execute tests on complex integrated systems
 Provide training and mentoring to team members

Your background includes…
 5+ years of proven QA experience with software testing, including development of testing documentation 5 years of client-facing work experience 5 years of collaboration with software development teams that includes user interface specialists, database specialists and/or business analyst specialists 5 years of experience applying quality assurance techniques in a team environment that utilizes common software development life cycle practices 5 years of work experience in a cross-functional team environment

You possess…
 Experience with testing complex integrated systems Ability to understand the larger technology eco-system; not only individual components Ability to make recommendations/decisions based on business value Ability to assess and communicate risks as well as the needs of the QA team Experience with black box testing, design reviews, automated testing, manual testing, integration testing, system testing, load/performance testing, and documentation of both test activities and defects Strong knowledge of automation tools available in the market and previous experience working with automated tools

IT Business Analyst, Library Systems and Integration Support

Position Summary

The Library Systems and Integration Support Analyst will work within an applications management team that provides support and integrations for the Library Services Platform (LSP) and other applications. As a member of the Library Systems and Integration Support team, this position collaborates with Information Technology Services (ITS) and other library staff in support of library applications, services, and systems in accordance with departmental and university specifications. 3 positions available

Responsibilities

Serves as a liaison between functional stakeholders and the technical team delivering or developing the system solution, working under guidance of a project manager.
Understands the functional requirements of each context, translate the functional requirements into technical documentation, and present them to the technical team for implementation. Conversely, translates technical constraints and limitations back to the functional teams for adaptation or reconfiguration of workflows that are required to meet operational effectiveness and efficiency.
Develops user acceptance test cases mapped back to functional requirements to validate solution against functional requirements. Assists in coordinating user acceptance testing and other activities preceding go-live.
Accounts for the custom scripts and integrations for the current integrated library system (Aleph), and become familiar with the data, configurations, and integrations currently in place in order to account for them in future migrations into library service platforms.
Works with staff across the Duke University Libraries, the Professional School Libraries, and Duke Kunshan University Library to find and document common workflows, practices, and configurations, or recommend business process changes where needed to match best practices or simplify the complexity.
Collaborates closely with the departments of the Digital Strategy and Technologies division on shared activities where needed.
Maintains current awareness of trends, issues, and emerging technology projects relative to information technology and supported applications within the Duke University Libraries, across the University, and in industry.
Performs other related duties incidental to the work described herein.

Supervisory Responsibilities

None

Qualifications
It is the expectation that all Duke University Libraries staff members will demonstrate exceptional workplace behaviors in the execution of their specific position responsibilities. These behaviors are customer focus, collaboration, creative problem solving, continuous learning and a commitment to diversity.

Education

Required: Bachelor’s degree, or associates degree and equivalent combination of education and experience.

Preferred: Master’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Library Science, or a related field.

Experience

Required:
Two years of experience as a business analyst or in automation or enterprise application administration
Ability to analyze technical requirements and translate them in to automated ETL workflows in a data warehouse environment
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new tools based on conceptual understanding of technology
Demonstrated ability to write documentation that explains complex technical concepts.
Excellent time management and project management skills
Demonstrated ability to independently manage a complex workload, prioritize tasks, and use good judgment in providing services based on goals with minimum supervision and to move quickly across changing priorities
Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to work with and build collaborative working relationships with a variety of people having varying degrees of technical knowledge in a dynamic and complex environment

Preferred:
Prior experience working in an academic research library
Experience as a team member in a full scale implementation of an IT system including all phases such as blueprinting, gap analysis, system design, configuration, testing, training, and go-live support
3 years IT analyst experience
Experience working in a technical environment and communicating with developers, formulating requirements, and performing acceptance testing

Working Conditions

Must be able to work in an environment in which exposure to materials containing dust and mold is possible
Normal office environment
Occasional weekend and evening work required
Occasional travel required

These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the employee in this position. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of a person in this position.

Salary and Benefits

Salary dependent on qualifications and experience. Comprehensive benefits package includes 15 days vacation, 13 holidays, 12 days sick leave; health, dental, disability and life insurance and support for professional development and training.

Duke offers a comprehensive benefit package which includes both traditional benefits such as health insurance, leave time and retirement, as well as wide ranging work/life and cultural benefits. Details can be found at: http://www.hr.duke.edu/benefits/index.php.

THE COMPANY

Provide statistical analysis and modeling on business questions using tools like R and Python
Work as a peer with business stakeholders and help them answer meaningful business questions using data

Work effectively with teammates and win credibility quickly

The Arizona Department of Education (ADE) Grants Management Section is seeking a Business Analyst.

Exceptional verbal and written communication

ABILITIES REQUIRED:
Provide great customer service and technical support to internal and external customers

Organize and manage multiple priorities and projects coupled with the flexibility to quickly adapt to ever changing business questions and needs

Use video, audio, and other types of equipment to conduct meetings

Prepare official reports for Directors, Deputy Associate Superintendents, and Associate Superintendents

JOB SUMMARY
The purpose of this position is to provide analytical support through research, data collection and data management of information for the organization.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for data collection, data input and/or aggregation and data auditing to support accurate key metric reporting and analysis performed by the organization.

Assists in generating Business As Usual (BAU) reports. Supports ad-hoc presentation/analysis development and responds to information requests from management.

Other duties may be assigned.

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

None.

REASONING ABILITY
Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

Experience in the use of Microsoft applications with emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY
Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

THE ROLE: Business Analyst
Join Vivint’s Business Analytics function supporting the call center senior leadership. The team focuses on solving Vivint’s highest priority and most impactful call center business problems including customer acquisition, customer retention, and operational challenges. If you enjoy using SQL, math, statistical tools, or Tableau to solve problems, you will fit right in. We will invest in you and help you think like a consultant to drive answers and action.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work with business leaders to prioritize their highest value questions
Create answers and drive action by using Tableau, Excel, and PowerPoint to share insights
Write SQL efficiently to handle big data (we have five call center sites and receive millions of calls each year)
Lead cross functional teams in structuring and solving open ended problems
Present recommendations and strategies to multiple levels of the organization (front line agents to C-suite leaders)
Implement recommended solutions
REQUIRED SKILLS:
Experience with Tableau and SQL, or willing to study and learn these, since they will be your daily tools
Highly analytical with strong, demonstrated problem solving and critical thinking capabilities
Ability to influence and lead those that do not directly report to you
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree preferred
Ability to communicate (written and oral) clearly and concisely at all levels of the organization
“Owner’s” attitude, including a willingness to tackle problems through to solutions
Ability to work both independently and across functions
Successful track record of thriving in a fast paced, flexible environment
Ability to dynamically meet business needs (change is the norm)
Strong team player who places the best interests of the organization above personal objectives
Strong results-orientation

$57,000 - $61,000 a yearHow to Apply
A cover letter is required for consideration for this position and should be attached as the first page of your resume. The cover letter should address your specific interest in the position and outline skills and experience that directly relate to this position.
Job Summary
Since 1841, the College of Literature, Science, and the Arts (LSA) has been the heart of The Michigan Difference, educating young leaders through a rich liberal arts curriculum and creating new knowledge through world-class research and scholarship. We offer more than 100 degree programs in over 75 academic departments and programs. Every LSA program is among the best in the U.S. with more than 40 programs in the top 10 and 5 programs are the best in their fields. Our alumni network is over 200,000 living LSA graduates and 90% of our seniors go on to enter the workforce or attend graduate school. Learn more about LSA at http://www.lsa.umich.edu/.
As part of the largest College at the University of Michigan, LSA Finance employs more than 70 staff who provide financial and research administration support to over 100 units. We are currently seeking well-qualified applicants for a Business Analyst Intermediate role to provide financial reporting, analysis, and support services for LSA units. The business analyst is a key member of the Liberty Centre Business Office, who partner with Unit Administrators to provide shared financial management and business analyst support. As one team, the analysts and business office staff work together as the financial resource for assigned units.
Responsibilities*
Work with unit administrators to develop budgets and assist with understanding and interpreting financial performance against budgets. Troubleshoot budgetary and accounting related questions. Provide accurate and thoughtful guidance regarding UM, LSA, and unit financial policies and procedures. Develop regular and ad hoc reports and analysis. Review and approve transactions. Promote a strong internal controls environment and help create and manage processes to ensure controls are in place. Provide training to LSA staff on budget and finance topics. Assist unit leadership with a wide range of financial related strategic questions. Advise on operational efficiency within units to help promote effective use of financial resources. Complete regular thorough and timely reviews. Coordinate with LSA Regional Business Office staff on financial activities.
Required Qualifications*
BBA in accounting, finance, or business administration or equivalent work experience; minimum two to five years of progressively responsible experience in finance, financial analysis, forecasting, and budgeting; extensive knowledge and experience using spreadsheets (preferably Excel) and advanced spreadsheet functions; demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with staff at all levels and with varying levels of financial and budgetary knowledge; demonstrated ability to work under pressure of deadlines and competing priorities; demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team, ability to complete tasks in a timely manner; adaptive to a changing environment.
Desired Qualifications*
Significant experience with Business Objects and M-Pathways highly desired.
Additional Information
The target salary range for this position is $57,000 - $61,000. The actual salary offered may be higher based on the qualifications and experience of the selected candidate.
The College of Literature, Science, and the Arts seeks to recruit and retain a diverse workforce as a reflection of our commitments to serve the diverse people of Michigan, fulfill the College’s Guiding Principles, and sustain the excellence of LSA.
To learn more about diversity, equity, and inclusion visit
http://lsa.umich.edu/lsa/about/diversity-equity-and-inclusion.html
To learn more about LSA’s Guiding Principles visit http://lsa.umich.edu/lsa/faculty-staff/human-resources/lsa-staff-guiding-principles.html
Background Screening
The University of Michigan conducts background checks on all job candidates upon acceptance of a contingent offer and may use a third party administrator to conduct background checks. Background checks will be performed in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.
Mission Statement
The mission of the University of Michigan is to serve the people of Michigan and the world through preeminence in creating, communicating, preserving and applying knowledge, art, and academic values, and in developing leaders and citizens who will challenge the present and enrich the future. The University of Michigan is committed to foster learning, creativity and productivity, and to support the vigorous exchange of ideas and information, not only in the classroom but in the workplace by:
Creating a work environment in which people treat each other with respect and dignity, regardless of roles, responsibilities or differences.
Providing support, direction and resources enabling us to accomplish the responsibilities of our jobs and to reach the goals that are set for professional and personal growth.
Application Deadline
Job openings are posted for a minimum of seven calendar days. This job may be removed from posting boards and filled anytime after the minimum posting period has ended.

Overview
The Business Analyst will coordinate and facilitate improved processes across various functional areas of the company. This individual will work closely with business primes to define and document requirements and business processes that encompass their daily work. In some cases, the processes will drive features in software used to support various segments of the clinical trials process.
Responsibilities
Facilitate and document processes and functional activities for various areas of the business with the goal of improving efficiency and/or quality as well as adapting business processes to meet new or changed business needs
Discuss user interface and technical details of technology solutions with business primes and technical engineers
Translate business practices into requirements, functional specifications, technology documentation, and/or procedural documentation as well as review, edit, and incorporate business process and related technology materials written by others
Provide input to establish standards and procedures for a variety of major business processes including input to procedural document development
Create graphical images, flow charts, diagrams, and/or HTML content for inclusion in online documentation related to business processes and technology solutions
If applicable when defining a process and related technology, ensure computer systems regulatory compliance for business applications
Research unique approaches for technology solutions to address business processes and needs and provide guidance to others on selecting the best solution
Update and manage JIRA (project and issue tracking tool) to reflect requirements, priorities, tasks, and/or test cases associated with delivering software projects
