Job Description
Since 1995, Amazon has focused on being “the world’s most customer centric company.” Our customers are worldwide, and include not just consumers, but also our sellers. World-class retail brands and individual sellers increase their sales and reach new customers by leveraging the power of the Amazon e-commerce platform. Over 2 million sellers offer new, used, and collectible selections to Amazon customers around the world. To meet our sellers’ needs, our smart, diverse, customer-obsessed employees are constantly innovating and building on new ideas.

Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) is an Amazon service for our sellers. The FBA team partners with sellers and our Amazon fulfillment centers to create a seamless experience for sellers to leverage our world-class facilities. 71% of sellers who use FBA report more than a 20% increase in unit sales after joining FBA. In a very real way, we are changing lives with the work we do. Our FBA employees wake up every day thinking about how to enable our sellers to be successful on our platform. Enabling seller success allows us to provide Amazon customers with unparalleled selection and pricing. FBA is a win for sellers and a win for customers.

The FBA Supply Chain team is seeking a Business Analysts to leverage and drive key insights to identify areas to improve total supply chain costs for Amazon Sellers, Amazon and ultimately Customers. Are you interested in driving improvement ideas for one of Amazon’s largest businesses? Are you experienced with and excited by mining large and complex datasets? The successful candidate will be highly analytical, have an extremely high level of customer focus and a passion for process improvement.

FBA is searching for motivated self-starters who can work in a fast paced, data-driven environment. The successful candidate will be an analytical problem solver, have an extremely high level of customer focus and a passion driving improvements to the Seller Experience.

As you further your career as a Business Analyst in FBA, you will focus on improving driving recommendations for total supply chain improvements . You will analyze sellers’ data, discover and solve real world problems and build metrics and business cases to improve the seller’s experience. We are focused on your success and want to build strong leaders. You can expect to leverage your analytical skills and have full ownership of the projects you work on.

In this role you will:
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable formatPut on your marketing cap to drive adoption of our product for all Sellers worldwide as well as new incremental features of the productMeasure the delivery metrics of FBA key metrics. Propose and implement projects to improve these metricsDriving Seller experience business case recommendations
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering or a related field3+ years of professional experience in analytics, business analysis or comparable consumer analytics positionAdvanced working knowledge of data mining using SQL, ETL, data warehouse as well as ExcelExcellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.Proven problem solving skills, project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skillsAbility to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast paced environmentBachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field.
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree is preferredBusiness, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field.4+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analysis role.Ability to deal with ambiguityUnderstanding of data warehousing, data modeling concept and building new DW tables

Job Title: Business/Operational Analyst
Department: Finance
Company: Dimension Development
Reports To: Assistant CFO

Job Description Date: January 1, 2016

Job Purpose: Thoroughly analyzes financial and operational key performance metrics and clearly communicates findings to stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities:
1. Use proprietary software (Dimension Development Hotel Accounting Program) as well as external sources to identify, generate, gather, verify, review, research, analyze, comprehend, interpret, and report on key performance indicators and financial information.
2. Analyze variances and data trends and prepare reports, charts and other outputs as required. To convert information into insightful findings and actionable recommendations to optimize existing and future operations across the company.
3. Provide high-quality recurring and ad-hoc performance reports to assist senior management with operational decisions, as required.
4. Assist the Assistant CFO with the development and maintenance of various analytical models.
5. Prepare a monthly reporting package that includes financial, operational, competitive, and customer satisfaction metrics. To analyze key business trends.
6. Work closely with all regional and property leaders to identify areas of improvement. To support and contribute expertise to projects relating to the achievement of property financial, guest service, and operational goals.
7. Assist hotel leadership with the actual implementation of new processes.
8. Assist with the preparation of annual budgets. To consolidate budget data from business unit leaders, evaluate data received and follow up directly with budget holders as appropriate. Ensure that all budgets are accurate, comprehensive and completed on time.
9. Serve as a super user of business intelligence tools (such as Broadvine and MicroStrategy) in the creation of dashboards and reports.
10. Research and evaluate different analysis tools, business intelligence tools, and modeling techniques to identify possible opportunities for process improvement.
11. Other duties as assigned.

Job Skills:
1. Track record of problem solving complex issues and continuous process improvement skills.
2. Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are required, and will be tested, including pivot tables and advanced formulas. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office.
3. To maintain a thorough understanding of financial and operational metrics across the industry.
4. Ability to work proactively, independently and as a strategic partner in a cross-functional team environment. To establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with fellow team members, management, external contacts, guests, and the public. Demonstrated ability to manage conflict/resolution.
5. Demonstrated strong analytical skills. To define and analyze problems and identify root causes. To set challenging and productive goals; prioritizing tasks, accepting responsibility, and overcoming obstacles.
6. To work successfully in a dynamic, fast-paced setting, and effectively manage multiple priorities within a broad team of cross-regional and cross-functional members. To perform a variety of duties, often changing from one task to another of a different nature, with frequent interruptions and distractions. To adapt to frequent changes in the workload and be able to adjust priorities quickly as circumstances dictate while completing tasks within established timeframes.
7. To thrive in an environment that is both strategic and creative, and which requires rapid learning, multitasking and prioritizing under tight deadlines
8. To remain highly-driven and self-motivated. To remain positive, productive, and professional in high stress situations.
9. To maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail at all times. To be well-organized and detail-oriented in order to manage multiple tasks, deadlines, and expectations simultaneously.
10. To sustain a high level of confidentiality.
11. To demonstrate partnering, influencing, and communication skills at all levels of the organization.
12. To maintain excellent written and verbal communication and comprehension skills, including the ability to clearly explain complex analytical topics to a wide audience who may or may not be familiar with analytics or the subject matter.

ContractThe Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy of the information loaded into the claims system, as well as acting as a liaison between provider contracting and claims, PSA and reprocessing departments. Analyst is recognized as an expert in the financial and reimbursement provisions of provider contracting. This position weaves together insurance knowledge, technology, policies and procedures and management practices to ensure contracting objectives are achieved through contract performance. Analyst will provide analytical consultative and decision support to department and KFHPW leadership regarding specialized work processes or initiatives, business plan objectives and goals, and desired consumer, staff or financial outcomes.

Essential Responsibilities:

Analyzes and interprets contract provisions for entry into the system to ensure accurate adjudication of claims by identifying and designing required configuration changes, reviewing completed configurations and testing changes to ensure they are error-free.

Works with Provider Systems Admin (PSA) and claims to ensure operational feasibility. Sets up contract templates for entering into the system. Leads meetings to ensure proper contract setup.

Provides analytic consultation and decision support to divisional/KFHPW leaders and other KFHPW departments regarding specialized work processes or initiatives, business plan objectives and goals, and/or desired consumer, staff, or financial outcomes.

Monitors and analyzes indicators. Identifies and helps resolve performance problems including significant data analytics.

Tracks contract provisions for system updates. Monitors contract expirations and renewals. Represents Provider Contracting on various committees and task forces.

Evaluates proposed systems expansions, enhancements, and design changes. Coordinates implementation of approved changes.

Participates in development of performance indicator reports. Interprets agreements. Performs risk assessments and audits contracts. Ensures contracts meet organizational guidelines and applicable payment standards. Monitors compliance with contract terms and conditions.

Accountable for developing and monitoring a plan to ensure negotiated contracts financial terms are configurable to support auto pricing thus improving the auto-adjudication of claims, lowering administrative expense for the Region.

Work closely with claims management and other KPNW departments to identify business rule changes, such as provider contract or member benefit changes, that require configuration changes.

Determine the most efficient manner in which to utilize the existing rules in claim system and other ancillary systems to achieve the desired claims processing results.

Research issues and system problems to determine root causes, and provide options for resolution. Partner with Claims Management team to identify issues that need to be resolved or opportunities for processing improvements. Analyze and make recommendations to management regarding system or process enhancements needed and communicate system problems.

Act as the department subject matter expert regarding one or more areas of Configuration and claims adjudication strategies. Research and troubleshoot issues to determine source of problem and determine options for resolution.

Job Description

External Job Description
As one of the largest e-commerce companies in the world, Amazon processes billions of secure on-line transactions via a number of payment mechanisms, including credit cards, direct debit and electronic gift certificates. Transactions are processed on behalf of thousands of merchants, including Amazon.com. Amazon is known across the globe as the most trusted company on the Internet. We are committed to delivering an exceptional customer experience.

The Payments Services owns and maintains the software which processes 20+ payment methods worldwide. The Business Operations Team supports the larger Payments Services organization which includes software development, product management and technical operations. The Business Operations team is the first contact for payment transactional issues, receiving escalations from internal clients such as Customer Service, Finance, Accounting and Fraud as well as third party partners and banks relied upon to process payments. Additionally this team is responsible for driving operational efficiencies and escalation reduction opportunities. This team also manages the operational relationship with third party payment partners, advocating for customer experience and driving operational improvements.

The Payments Business Analyst is responsible for driving operational excellence accross global payments product. In this role you will identify and drive to resolution payments issues impacting customers on a global scale. You will work to identify, execute, and drive projects with internal and external business partners to improve the Customer Payments Experience across Amazon. You will collaborate with teams across Amazon to improve business processes to increase operational efficiencies.

The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter that can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment with limited supervision. He or she must be a fast learner, who can quickly absorb the nuances of Amazon's varied payment offerings as well as the behavior of Amazon's internal systems. He or she will be analytical in their decision making, with a demonstrated ability to drive issues to completion.

Primary Responsibilities:
Work in a deep area of coverage, routinely working on issues ranging from small to large number of customers impacted and driving root cause resolution with engineering teams and/or external partners.
Manage operational workflows working with internal business teams in small to medium sized geographies or products.
Identify and drive continuous improvement activities.
Serves as escalation point for program / project team members. Owns, tracks, or escalates issues to ensure that they are addressed, documented, and resolved.
Displays energy and initiative in solving problems. Will follow all possible avenues to get the job done, are proactive.
Work requires creativity and judgment. Responsibilities include both routine and non-routine in nature and vary from day to day.
Identify and evaluate potential risks/obstacles with minimal direction from program managers. Consult, determine, and execute appropriate corrective action.
Proactively drive customer experience and operational excellence for payment methods used by Amazon customers.
Successfully build business requirements that technical teams use to implement projects you sponsor.
Basic Qualifications
BA/BS degree.
5+ years relevant experience.
Demonstrated superior written and oral communications skills with the ability to interact with internal customers and external partners in a professional manner.
Preferred Qualifications
Payments industry experience.
Proficiency with SQL
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated problem solving ability.
Skilled in prioritization. Makes the right tradeoffs between schedule, resources, and scope in order to address major risks, challenges and obstacles.
Data driven and can successfully obtain and use data to support arguments.
Previous experience in which high levels of initiative, judgment, and tact has been demonstrated.
Proven ability to operate in high pressure situations and successfully handle multiple priorities and possess a high level of discipline while remaining flexible.
Candidate should possess superior customer service skills in dealing with users at all levels in a team environment.
Excellent judgment and independent decision making skills.
Proven ability to interact effectively in a cross-functional team.
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite.

We Offer

We are the Global Markets (GM) and Intermediate Holding Company (IHC) Chief Data Office and are responsible for data governance and data quality and controls vertically across the GM division and horizontally across various departments for the IHC as defined by the Group wide Data Management Framework.

The Data Quality & Control workstream in the GM/IHC CDO is responsible for management of data quality issues raised to the GM/IHC CDO for root cause analysis and remediation. This includes engaging with key functional stakeholders and their respective CDO to understand root cause and impact from data issues raised to the GM/IHC CDO, driving remediation prioritization for these issues, and managing remediation delivery working with key IT and Change delivery groups.

We are looking for a Project Manager/Business Analyst to build out our data issue management capability in Raleigh. This person in the role will be expected to:

Drive issue RCA (Root Cause Analysis) data issues prioritized by GM/IHC CDO.
As part of RCA engage with stakeholders from the Front Office, Functions (Risk/Finance/Ops/GC/etc.), and Change and IT delivery groups to drive solution definition and planning.
You will manage delivery of prioritized implementation project and hold Change, IT, and other Functional groups accountable for successful delivery within time and budget.
You are expected to meet aggressive deadlines and be able to engage with business partners from multiple teams to drive agreement around on issue root cause analysis results, solution definition and remediation planning. The role requires you to have:
Subject matter expertise in front to back processes and technology supporting Global Markets, General Counsel, Risk & Finance, Operations and other functions, that they can effectively leverage to deliver quick turnaround on data issue root cause analysis.
You have shown capability in delivering change on front to back technology and process reengineering initiatives.
Demonstrated project management skills in driving delivery around a portfolio of projects spanning various front to back functions.
Credit Suisse maintains a Working Flexibility Policy, subject to the terms as set forth in the Credit Suisse United States Employment Handbook.

You Offer

Your experience in the Financial Industry is a must, and within Global Markets desirable.
Your experience in one or more functional areas e.g. Regulatory Reporting, RWA Calculations, Market Risk or Credit Risk a plus.
Your knowledge about front to back processes a plus.

Job Description
Do you love data? Do you get a thrill out of fixing complex problems? Do you like visualizing data to tell a story?

Join the Recruiting Analytics and Data (RAD) team to help us bring insights to teams the recruiting teams hiring across Amazon. Learn and use new computing AWS technologies Comprehend, QuickSight and Redshift. As Amazon continues to grow, our recruiting teams need access to real time data insights. RAD’s job is to equip these teams with the ability to measure their recruiting strategies to continually improve every touch point of the candidate journey.

RAD plays a critical role in shaping the future of reporting and analytics for our expanding global teams. As one of our new team of Business Analysts, you will help us migrate to Quicksight (a cutting edge new dashboard platform) and own our Monthly Business Reviews for senior leadership of HR. You will help us launch KPIs and standard process for every step of our recruiting process. You can shape the future data roadmap for all of our global recruiting teams. This isn’t easy – much of this work will be starting from scratch or attempting to tie together varied best practices across decentralized, global teams.

But you are joining at just the right time as we are beginning to transition to new innovative AWS products that make accessing and manipulating data so much easier. You will also be coming in right as we are beginning to launch research project for optimizing our efficiency. You will have an opportunity to learn from other research scientists and engineers working on unique projects across HR. You will present findings to senior leadership. You drive large scale standard and consistent process change by developing and publishing a data definition library. And you won’t be alone. Our RAD team includes other business intelligence and data engineers — all of whom will be partners for you in realizing our vision and enabling the growth at Amazon that’s critical for our customers. You’re just right for this role because you like diving into data, learning new tools and having a global impact!

Other Responsibilities:
Develop dashboard in AWS Quicksight focused on sourcing strategy
Collect and analyze data from large datasets from multiple sources
Develop Monthly Business Reviews for Senior Leadership
Build data definition and standard query library
Basic Qualifications
BA/BS degree in relevant field OR 5+ years of direct analytics experience, or equivalent combination of degree and experience
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel (e.g., complex statements, VBA, conditional formatting)
Familiarity with SQL/relational databases
Experience manipulating large sets of data from multiple systems
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, MicroStrategy, QuickSight, COGNOS
Project management experience
Preferred Qualifications
BA/BS degree in statistics, decision-making sciences, or related field AND 5+ years of professional experience with a heavy emphasis on data and analytics
Experience in analytical intensive roles within consulting, talent/HR, operational, or marketing environments
Proficiency in statistical analysis tool: R, SaS, SPSS, Stata
Proficiency with multiple statistical software packages (e.g. R, SAS, SPSS, AMOS, MPlus, STATA)
Business-relevant knowledge of AWS Big Data technologies, like RedShift, S3, Aurora, Data Pipeline, QuickSight, Kinesis etc.
Excellent written and verbal communication; high quality document and report preparation
High degree of accuracy and expertise in the use of leading edge tools for all data creation, research, and analyses
Excellent problem solving abilities.
Ability to create, maintain and disseminate information to stakeholders for multiple projects/work streams at one time
Ability to work independently, as well as an active member of both business and HR teams

$40,000 - $45,000 a yearAbout FIU


Florida International University is classified by Carnegie as a R1: Doctoral Universities - Highest Research Activity and recognized as a Carnegie engaged university. It is a public research university with colleges and schools that offers 196 bachelor’s, master’s and doctoral programs in fields such as engineering, computer science, international relations, architecture, law and medicine. As one of South Florida’s anchor institutions, FIU contributes almost $9 billion each year to the local economy. FIU is Worlds Ahead in finding solutions to the most challenging problems of our time. FIU emphasizes research as a major component of its mission. FIU has awarded more than 220,000 degrees and enrolls more than 54,000 students in two campuses and three centers including FIU Downtown on Brickell, FIU@I-75, and the Miami Beach Urban Studios. FIU’s Medina Aquarius Program houses the Aquarius Reef Base, a unique underwater research facility in the Florida Keys. FIU also supports artistic and cultural engagement through its three museums: Patricia & Phillip Frost Art Museum, the Wolfsonian-FIU, and the Jewish Museum of Florida-FIU. FIU is a member of Conference USA and more than 400 student-athletes participating in 18 sports. For more information about FIU, visit http://www.fiu.edu/.

How to Claim Vet Preference


Since 1945, the Florida Legislature has made a provision to give preference in the hiring process to United States war veterans in recognition of their military, naval, or air service who meet specific conditions. The conditions are as follows:
Veterans with a VA service-connected disability
Spouses of veterans with permanent and total service-connected disability
Honorably discharged veterans with wartime service.
Unmarried widow or widower of a veteran who died as a result of a service-connected disability
A veteran who has served in a qualifying campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized, to include the Global War on Terrorism Expeditionary Medal.
Florida International University honors this policy and will comply with Veterans' Preference guidelines when filling staff positions. Any applicant claiming Veterans' Preference will be required to attach a DD214 with each application submitted for verification.
If there are any questions concerning Veterans' Preference, please contact Recruitment by calling 305-348-2500.
For additional information on Veterans' Preference, visit http://www.floridavets.org/.

Disclosures


Clery Notice
In compliance with the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Crime Statistics Act, the University Police department at Florida International University provides information on crimes statistics, crime prevention, law enforcement, crime reporting, and other related issues for the past three (3) calendar years. The FIU Annual Security report is available online at: https://police.fiu.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/54/2016/04/Campus_Security_Report__Safety_Guide.pdf.

To obtain a paper copy of the report, please visit the FIU Police Department located at 885 SW 109th Avenue, Miami, FL, 33199 (PG5 Market Station).

Pay Transparency
Florida International University will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.

The GCS mission is to ensure our business partners are able to successfully transact with the American Express Network, according to the AXP specifications, rules, and regulations.

The GCS analysts are responsible for ensuring that customers can successfully connect and transact with the American Express network flawlessly. Ability to successfully manage multiple projects simultaneously
Excellent problem solving skills
Ability to organize, document, and follow tasks through to completion

Ability to build relationships, cooperate, and collaborate among various business units

Tremendous will to win and work ethic

Familiarity with authorization messages and submission file formats (ISO, GCAG, GFSG)

Part-timeBusiness Analyst
Tysons Corner, VA or Remote Opportunity

Immediate opportunity! We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst with extensive Contracting Office experience to support the Administrative Office of the US Courts, the administrative arm of the Federal Judiciary.

Spectrum is seeking a qualified Business Analyst with contracting experience to support the Administrative Office of the US Courts (AOUSC) initiatives in program and acquisition excellence. This work will be on a Project by Project basis as-needed. We expect the duration of the first Project to be approximately 4 months of intermittent full-time and part-time work, with the possibility of follow on work later.

Job Responsibilities:
Project 1: Our Business Analyst will be a part of a team of experts who are developing a training program for AOUSC’s Procurement Management Division (PMD) acquisition workforce. Our Team will use a list of high level competencies and map these competencies to recommended training courses for development of employee knowledge. We will also research and identify the external and internal training sources for the recommended training courses. Our Team will also interview the acquisition workforce and draft a training model for AOUSC/PMD’s acquisition workforce employees to follow that includes strategies for implementation, communication and follow-up.

Required Experience and Knowledge:
Minimum 4 years of experience conducting business analyses and studies, needs assessments, requirements analysis/definition, and cost/benefit analyses
Experience analyzing trends, reporting regulations and business conditions
Develops and analyzes metrics, performance measurements, requirements, reports and recommendations.
Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in any combination of the following fields:accounting, business, finance, law, contracts, purchasing, economics, industrial management, marketing, quantitative methods or organization and management.

$80,000 - $90,000 a yearJob Description
Responsible for the development, testing and documentation of business functional requirements for various departments and groups within the company, assist in the implementation of various technology solutions, assist in projecting and tracking benefits of these solutions and function as a liaison between IS and various departments.
Standard Work Hours: 8:00 am - 5:00 pm

Salary: $80,000-$90,000
Responsibilities

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following:
Maintain continuous contact with internal and/or external customers to remain current on their operating environment and business needs
Assist in the on-going gathering of requirements for each customer group
Assist in the development of business functional requirements for each customer group
Work with the corporate IS staff to best understand what role IT can serve in addressing these functional requirements
Assist the customers in quantifying the value of addressing the functional requirements, where IT is a primary component of the solution.
Assist in determining the best approach for tracking financial benefits associated with IT projects
Assist the corporate IS staff in selecting the right technology to match the functional requirements
Serve the role of liaison between the customer group and the corporate IS staff to facilitate an effective working partnership during the project
Assist in any business process reengineering efforts associated with the implementation of the project
Assist in the Testing/Quality Analysis of IT Projects and applications
Assist in the on-going Support of applications
Perform selective project management functions on IT projects, as appropriate
Other duties as assigned
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
This position currently has no supervisory responsibilities
Qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed in this document are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
A 4-year degree in a technical field or related studies
A minimum of 4 years' experience in analyzing business processes and implementing technical solutions
Knowledge of and aptitude for computers and computer systems
Exposure/experience to managing teams in an IT project environment
Experience with wholesale distribution or logistics industries is a plus
SKILLS Technical Core
Experience with creating, maintaining and presenting documentation for test plans, requirements, scope and other project-related documents
Experience with Microsoft Office applications required
Experience with relational database development process
Experience with multiple database products
Experience with creating and executing SQL queries
Experience with creating functional and technical flow diagrams and chart
Language
Ability to communicate at ALL levels of an organization
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations
Ability to document business processes and procedures
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public
Ability to manage IT professionals within an IT project
MATH
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume
Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry
ORGANIZATIONAL
Must be detail oriented and exceptional in organization techniques
Must be self-motivated, with ability to set and achieve goals, and set priorities of multiple tasks in order to meet deadlines
Must be able to coordinate activities of other employees
REASONING ABILITY
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and make sound business process decisions
Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
Professional certifications are a plus but not required.
APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS
Knowledge of the applications in use is a plus but not a requirement beyond what is listed in the SKILLS section. Individual will be required to update application skill set as application(s) are upgraded or enhanced.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or feel.
The employee is regularly required to walk reach with hands and arms stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl and talk or hear.
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and ability to adjust focus.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

Job Description:
Teamwork makes the dreamwork.Our philosophy is that happy employees make for happy members, which is why we start each day with a motivational moment. These 15-minute company meetings can be anything from lazer tag to hide and go seek; the only rules -everyboday must participate and nobody is allowed to talk shop. Vibrant values employees above all else. We believe in putting our people first and making them our top priority. We are committed to providing our employees with opportunities for professional and personal development, By focusing on our people, our members ultimately benefit.
In a nutshell: Analyze and manage our organization’s projects, procedures, and applications to help the organization operate more effectively and efficiently. In addition, solve organizational information problems and specifications by analyzing requirements, documenting system design, vendor management, and recommending system controls and protocols.
The Nitty Gritty:

Requirements Gathering: Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis. Improves systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.

Project Coordination: Coordinate and schedule project meetings and release schedules to keep all active players in a project informed and involved. Responsible for updating and distributing the master project schedule and calendar. Monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, and recommending actions.

Information Evaluation: Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans.

Communication and Deliverables Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements. Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams. Test and communicate application releases.

Project Management: Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget. Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions. Maintains system protocols by writing and updating procedures. Provide references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support; training users.

Improves procedures and processes: Identifies opportunities for improvement and defines the issues: identifies objectives: considers current procedures and measures performance: recommends and implements optimal solutions; measures observed improvements: drafts documents and reports.

Document Coordination: Review documents outlining processes on a regular basis. Identify outdated language and revise accordingly. Communicate inconsistencies in language to broader team when necessary to identify an appropriate resolution.

Advises and assists personnel: Ensures the management of changes proposes solutions to achieve objectives; facilitates the implementation of continuous-improvement projects; supports employees and the management team; provides training. Provide tier 1 training to internal help desk employee(s).

Focus on Ongoing Professional Development: Participate in education and training provided by the credit union. Maintain an up-to-date and comprehensive knowledge on all of Vibrant’s products and services.

Subject Matter Expert (SME): Provide outstanding tier 2 support to business units to resolve questions, account corrections, and quick problem resolution. Create and accurately follow processes for daily, weekly, and monthly tasks. Implement new products as designed by the business. Work closely with other business units to ensure Vibrant stays compliant with local and federal regulations. Specialize in one of the following areas and cross train in the others:

Shares: Subject matter expert of all features and functions of share accounts. i.e. Savings, checking, money market, certificate, IRA, etc. This includes building and maintaining share products and services within Vibrant’s core system and applications.

Loans: Subject matter expert of all features and functions of loan accounts. I.e. Mortgage, auto, secured, unsecured, etc. This includes building and maintaining loan products and services within Vibrant’s core system and applications.

Card Services: Subject matter expert of credit and debit card functions. This includes building and maintaining cards and card related functions within Vibrant’s core system and applications.

What to expect when you're expecting...to get the job:
Provide exceptional experience to help drive sales and service.
Be quick to engage when there is an opportunity for interaction.
Positively contribute to your individual Team dynamic and the organization as a whole.
Dare to be different. Have fun doing it.
Successfully meet individual goals and objectives.
How to get your Vibrant mojo:
Engaging: Vibrant employees are consistently present. They invest a high level of focus into their primary role, regardless of if they’re directly servicing members or ensuring that our behind the scenes procedures are running efficiently.
Active: Vibrant employees are fire starters. They are quick to take initiative, are decisive, help wherever help is needed, and jump into whatever task is needed to get the job done.
Unique: We expect our employees to bring a level of dedication and initiative to their work that surprises our members. We will push the boundaries of unique and outstanding service. We dare to be different.
Fearless: We expect our employees to be bold, daring, and confident. Our employees will be unflinching in their dedication to providing a unique and surprisingly different experience.
Tenacious: We are relentless in our pursuit of greatness. Vibrant employees have an internal spark and drive that would surprise the everyday individual.
Required Experience:

Do you have what it takes?
Four year degree or equivalent six years or more experience; or equivalent combination of education, business experience and project management framework preferred.
These are the must haves aka minimum requirements for the job:
To be successful in this position, an individual must be task-oriented, dependable, tactful, accurate, and patient. It is essential that this individual understand and abide by the strict confidentiality policies that are necessary in any financial institution. Fiserv DNA Core experience preferred, but not required

From: Vibrant Credit Union

Toast Overview:
Toast is a rapidly growing startup building the first all-in-one restaurant management software platform. Toast's Android tablet based system helps restaurants operate more efficiently and connect with their customer base in new and innovative ways. We're growing fast and have a customer base comprised of cafes, restaurants, bars and nightclubs across the country. We work hard and care about our customers' success and we have a lot of fun doing it. As a startup, we move fast and have a lot of opportunity for career growth, so if you're passionate about your work and want to be in a fun and growing industry, join us! You will be helping Toast to grow our business across the US and internationally.

Job Overview:
In this role you will focus on our Support and Restaurant Success business lines to build a best in class customer experience. As a member of the Customer Success Operations team you will work with CS leadership to develop actionable insights through reporting, and KPI definition. We are looking for a highly motivated, energetic candidate with experience analyzing datasets of various sizes and levels of cleanliness.

What you will do:

Generate insights that will allow CS managers to quickly and accurately see how our KPIs and processes are performing.
Participate in the development and implementation of new processes and procedures to drive improved KPIs and customer experience.
Drive complex analytical analysis, ad-hoc reporting and ensuring all members of the CS team have the data and insight they need to make better decisions
Partner with key stakeholders and business leaders to provide strategic support and recommendations across various CS Ops initiatives.
Partner with centralized finance and business intelligence teams for alignment and achieving objectives
Report on monthly KPIs and OKRs

Do you have the right ingredients?


1-3+ years of in BI or business analytics, or advanced degree in a quantitative field
Excel expert & proficient in SQL
Experience with SFDC dashboard & reports
Ability to efficiently analyze volumes of data and present concise and clear recommendations of results
Experience with in-depth analytics using excel and other BI tools
A highly quantitative problem solver who loves to dig into different kinds of data and can confidently and successfully communicate their findings to stakeholders in different departments
Ability to work effectively in a dynamic, changing environment and to adapt while focusing on key goals and objectives
Technically Innovative with strong business acumen; can deliver communication to non-technical stakeholders
Work experience in a high growth tech or SaaS company

Job Description
Amazon's Customer Service (CS) department is seeking an experienced business analyst to join the WW CS Consumer Operations Insights and Standards (COINS) team. We are looking for an outstanding business analyst to join us in delivering a new business process improvement platform, which sets a new standard for the speed, quality and customer satisfaction by which we resolve business problems, respond to changes and opportunities and enable people across the company to contribute to process improvement.
As we‘re combining a suite of enabling technologies in the areas of model-driven development, business process management and business intelligence, we’re creating solutions that let business analysts perform the complete cycle of delivering better automated solutions from engaging customers and prioritizing opportunities, through automating and testing the improved solution with little or no involvement of software engineers, to training and tracking the delivered business impact.

This position can be located in any NA CS site (including CPT and SJO) and could require travel up to 20%.
**This role requires a valid visa/work permit**

Support and contribute to COINS achieving functional goals.
Analyse metrics, key indicators and other available data sources to discover root causes of process defects.
Works across multiple internal & external teams. May lead virtual teams in completing projects/activities.
Engage directly with our internal customers to find, prioritize, improve and assimilate better business processes.
Scope, document and submit requirements for systems changes, backed up by business case and impact analysis.
Propose simple, scalable and effective ideas and best practices in your domain of expertise.
Analyze and model data, processes and business rules.
Continuously track the realized business value and ongoing customer satisfaction from delivered solutions, be it self-service, automation or customers contacting CS.
Independently performing analysis using tools like SQL, MicroStrategy, Tableau and R.

At AstraZeneca we believe in the potential of our people and you’ll develop beyond what you thought possible. We make the most of your skills and passion by actively supporting you to see what you can achieve no matter where you start with us.

The Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Business Analyst has experience performing IT business analysis within a multi-system manufacturing environment, working with key business partners. The role holder has a broad and deep understanding of manufacturing business processes, and can drive standard best practice approaches to implementation across multiple pharmaceutical and biologics production technologies at facilities with diverse geographies, regulatory requirements, and cultures.
The MES Business Analyst will be accustomed to adapting to a variety of complex scenarios within plants where manufacturing processes and equipment differ, and be able to work strategically keeping the enterprise solution in mind. The MES Business Analyst operates with a high level of interactive communication to set clear direction for others, demonstrating high levels of inclusion and cultural sensitivity.
The role will partner with the local and global Business Process Owners (BPO) of the Manufacturing Execution process. In this partnership, the MES Business Analyst will be an active member of governance boards, supporting the BPO in driving the adoption of standard AstraZeneca processes across the manufacturing site network.
The MES Business Analyst will take a best practice approach to process documentation, maintaining a comprehensive set of standard and site process flows (ex: swim lane diagrams). They will also work closely with the manufacturing architects and engineering so that the business processes deployed in MES are underpinned with the appropriate technology, and the users’ needs are supported.
The MES Business Analyst will be an active participant in an MES Center of Excellence. In this role they will closely collaborate with other site based MES specialists, informing on Master Batch Record / Generic Master Batch Record (MBR/GMBR) standard methodology design principals. The design principals will align with the standards established by both the MES BPO and Quality MBR BPO standards.

Typical Accountabilities

The MES Business Analyst is expected to perform at experienced level in the following:

Business Needs Identification - Operates at an enterprise level in assessing and defining business need and areas for improvement. Actively seeks out opportunities to enhance and improve in line with strategic goals. Actively monitors and identifies capability gaps and proposes potential solutions through research internally and externally.
Business Process Mapping - Selects the appropriate documentation approach depending on process type. Proficient in scoping and recommending appropriate approaches. Capable of planning and leading their own and other team members' activities to meet targets and deadlines. Accountable for performance and quality of analytical work delivered, both their own and the work of others.
Partner Analysis & Change - Effectively identifies partners from all areas of the business, and actively builds and maintains relationships according to individual partner needs and levels of influence. Contributes to communication plans and change management for project and partners.
Business Solution Assessment - Highly proficient in analyzing and assessing solution proposals and able to articulate supporting reasoning. i.e. assessing business readiness, improving value vs. spend. Leads the work with the business to identify functional and technical and GMP compliance requirements, translating the requirements into design specifications reflecting Functional Design, User Interface Design and Business Process Modelling. Closely partnering with the Architecture team, ensuring the technical solution will deliver the agreed business benefits.
Manufacturing and Packaging Processes - Has a diverse set of experiences with shop floor manufacturing environments, preferably in the Pharmaceutical, Biologics or life sciences sector. Understands the importance of the user’s role in executing the manufacturing process, their interaction with electronic systems, and the constraints they face when performing their duties.

Work collaboratively with:
1. Senior Business Stakeholders to ensure that solutions fulfil their future strategic needs and challenges
2. Business Process Owners to develop and maintain the business relationship, support business process change and act as point of contact for MES deployment and change
3. Site Business customers to identify business needs, mentor local MES staff, and effectively communicate impact, cost and benefits of new and changed demands
4. IT Delivery and Support to ensure clear understanding of requirements and effective testing so that the solutions delivered to the business are efficient and effective, meeting the customer experience expectations.
5. Site and Global Engineering Teams to ensure that specified line equipment is able to integrate seamlessly with the AstraZeneca standard solution for MES

Work collaboratively with or take responsibility for:

6. Test Lead to define the testing approach and the components of testing to ensure traceability of requirements and effectiveness of overall solution.
7. Change Management/Communication Lead to ensure the Change Management and Communications plans and delivery support the Partner Analysis.

Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Essential
Validated experience of working with complex integrated systems, using creative and strategic thinking to deliver extraordinary results.
Strong engagement, communication and partner management skills, including excellent presentation and influencing skills at senior levels
Experience of mentoring, coaching or developing others
Experience of working with and managing third party suppliers/vendors
Experience of running high levels of risk by making reasoned judgements of complex situations, developing creative solutions and applying comprehensive multi-functional and industry understanding.
Experience with Manufacturing Execution Systems
Experience with production processes within Enterprise Resource Planning systems such as SAP
Degree in relevant engineering or IT discipline
Desirable
Exposure to User Centred Design (User Experience, User Interface and Business Process Engineering)
Lean SIGMA training
Practical usage of Agile Methodology
Experience of working in a global organisation with complex/geographical context
Working in a highly regulated industry
Pharmaceutical business awareness
Cross industry business awareness
Demonstrable experience of successfully deploying MES technology in a regulated manufacturing environment
Through understanding of industry standards for enterprise and control system integration such as ISA95 and S88
Experience with production automation systems
Experience with the Werum PAS|X MES system
Experience with Data Historian Systems

Calling the adventurers ready to join a company that's pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling. At KLA-Tencor, we're making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen.

Who are we? We research, develop, and manufacture the world's most advanced inspection and measurement equipment for the semiconductor and nanoelectronics industries. We enable the digital age by pushing the boundaries of technology, creating tools capable of finding defects smaller than a wavelength of visible light. We create smarter processes so that technology leaders can manufacture high-performance chips—the kind in that phone in your pocket, the tablet on your desk and nearly every electronic device you own—faster and better. We're passionate about creating solutions that drive progress and help people do what wouldn't be possible without us. The future is calling. Will you answer?
Group/Division
The Global Service Support Organization (GSS) team headquartered in Milpitas, CA is our service organization that consists of Service Sales and Marketing, Spares Supply Chain management, Field Operations, Product Training, and Technical Support. The GSS organization partners with our field teams and customers in all business sectors to maintain the high performance and productivity of our products through a flexible portfolio of services. Our comprehensive services include: proactive management of tools to identify and improve performance; expertise in optics, image processing and motion control with worldwide service engineers, 24/7 technical support teams and knowledge management systems; and an extensive parts network to ensure worldwide availability of parts.
Responsibilities
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY:

As part of the Global Ops Service organization, you will be mainly responsible for managing the Reserves processes, maintaining internal Access Database, reviewing and analyzing the data and ensuring we are compliant and adhere to our financial responsibilities. Will also include inventory analysis and reporting to areas of responsibility

Other areas include, plans, performs and implements process improvement initiatives (such as Lean or Six Sigma and Root Cause Analysis). Responsible for developing metrics that provide data for process measurement and identifying indicators for future improvement opportunities. Provides input and analysis on data and provides recommendations to management. Could act as main contact point between Manufacturing, Sales, Marketing, GOPS Manufacturing and many times will be interacting with field personnel regarding customer issues. RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We create quality, innovative technology solutions that solve complex, meaningful problems for our clients.
At RedMane our people are our business and we put a great deal of focus not only on hiring the right people, but also on keeping them happy and engaged. We have an open, non-hierarchical culture that is collaborative, inclusive and fun.
RedMane has a full-time, Chicago-based opportunity for business analysts as we continue to grow our business. We offer you:
Interesting and challenging work, in a supportive and empowering environment
Opportunity to make a significant contribution that will be recognized and valued
A chance to interact with like-minded peers that share knowledge and know how
The tools, skills and information to enable you to deliver excellence and foster your creativity and innovation in a non-bureaucratic setting
The Role:

Responsibilities
Elicit, analyze, and capture business requirements and technical specifications (for both current and new systems) from business users and stakeholders.
Translate business requirements into user stories containing acceptance criteria suitable for implementation and testing by the development and testing teams.
Negotiate, manage, and prioritize competing requirements from multiple stakeholders.

Keep abreast of competing services/products/industry trends and use those to generate new ideas and product enhancements.

Adhere to documented corporate and departmental policies and procedures.

Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate the problem and solution to different audiences (both technical & non-technical).

Job Description

PepsiCo Information Security is seeking a self-motivated, Business Analyst, supporting the Risk and Compliance Director and Solutions Capability Manager responsible for the delivery, stability, and cost-effectiveness of the Information Security organization by ensuring successful delivery of PepsiCo's Info Sec strategy through baseline and investment initiatives. Also ensuring appropriate governance is defined and sustained, and continuously evaluating cost-effectiveness opportunities through benchmarking, capability assessments, and analysis. You will work closely with the Enterprise Program Management Office and Information Security Project Owners to organize, launch, and monitor new projects in support of the Information Security Strategy. The position:
Supports the development of proposals and initiatives, developing project charters collecting the business case, scope, and deliverables
Supports the Info Sec leadership team during the annual planning process by facilitating the development of project cost estimates for labor, hardware, software, and other associated project costs

Supports the technology business management initiatives ensuring accurate measuring and reporting of the cost to deliver Information Security services
Supports periodic capability and financial benchmarking exercises
Supports the financial forecasting process for the Info Sec organization
Responsible for effectively maintaining strong working relationships with individuals and groups involved in Project Management, Finance, Organizational Governance and Strategy

Education:
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business Management, Finance or related discipline
Experience:
2+ years of experience in portfolio level management, project, and program management
Working knowledge of information security industry frameworks (e.g. ISO, NIST, COBIT)
Proven efficiencies with productivity software such Microsoft Office
Excellent oral and written communication skills, be comfortable working in a team environment as well as able to work well independently
Self- starter with the ability to prioritize and respond to problems or issues, maintain flexibility, and adapt to changes in the business environment

Job Description
Amazon is looking for a smart, driven, problem solver to provide support for our evolving HR tools and processes. In this role, you will develop deep expertise on the HR Services and People Technology solutions used by Amazon and will work with business owners, technologists, and HR partners to understand and document strategy, requirements and timelines. You will participate in cross-functional teams through the process and policy design, delivery, implementation, and support of new HR tools and services as well as contribute to change management.

What you'll do:
Deliver Solutions - Implement global technologies and services to meet long term HR and Payroll business needs; partner with development teams on system design and gap analysis, and prioritization of critical initiatives
Business Requirements – Facilitate global workshops to coordinate the collection of global business requirements including process deviations and localizations; prepare global process maps and documentation
Implementation - Support the rollout of new tools and systems to global teams including delivery of standard operating procedures, workflow diagrams, training materials and post-launch support resources
Operational Excellence - Drive global HR process optimization and standardization while balancing the business need for flexibility and appropriate localization
Subject Matter Expertise – develop deep knowledge of core hire-to-retire processes used by Amazon, advise the business on regional and global requirements and best practices for optimizing the use of Amazon People Technology
Basic Qualifications
3+ years of HR or related experience
Bachelor's degree in business, HR or related field
Experience implementing processes and providing support for core HR solutions
3+ years of work experience writing SQL, data modeling, data mining (SQL, ETL, data warehousing) and using databases in a business environment with complex datasets
Advanced Excel skills; experience with business intelligence tool
Preferred Qualifications
Works effectively as part of a global team, possessing strong analytical, organizational, and problem solving skills, can flourish handling multiple tasks, workload, changing priorities, and tight deadlines
Great organizational skills with exceptional follow through and attention to detail
Passion for customer/user experiences; uses technology to scale programs and improve efficiencies
Able to learn large scale complex systems quickly
Excellent written and verbal communications skills - able to interface with all levels of the organization, specific strength in influencing decision makers and managing expectations

DEPARTMENT: Information Technology

HIRING AUTHORITY: Chief Information Officer

F.L.S.A. STATUS: Exempt

EMPLOYMENT RELATIONSHIP: Just cause subject to probationary period

CURRENT HOURS AND STARTING TIME: Full-time (37.5 hours per week) position. The starting time for this position is currently 8:00 a.m. There may be weekends and evenings required based on project needs or on an emergency basis.

JOB SUMMARY:

Under the direction of the Manager of the Project Management Office, Project Manager, or Manager, works with users and Information Technology staff to analyze, specify, design, and implement information business solutions and system applications for County departments; adheres to business analyst, system development and project management methodologies; analyzes a complete system, business operations, and related interfaces to support a joint application and business environment; maintains a high degree of understanding of business and system analyst methodologies and programming techniques.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities

Acts as a liaison between information technology and the customer to identify the various support, business and budgetary needs that will optimize the customers' business operations.

Acts as a primary business subject matter expert as it relates to a client's functional organization and operations; and ensures business solutions are in line with Information Technology strategic vision and guidelines.

Acts as the primary resource to elicit business needs, and will create, refine and elaborate requirements to ultimately provide approved business requirements from both stakeholders and technical teams.

Provides requirement management and communication techniques to keep both the project team and stakeholders in agreement while a solution is being defined, and ensures design exactly meets the specifications outlined.

Reviews and analyzes business requirements, procedures and problems to automate processing and improve existing computer systems with respect to cost, resource utilization, and time requirements.

Develops detailed business, functional, and non-functional requirements using standard methodologies.

Uses structured analysis and design techniques to evaluate business operations.

Defines data and system functions, and explains to both technical and non-technical resources how they are being used. Creates workflows and supporting documentation explaining how the business should utilize programs.

Evaluates computing system and procedures and conducts special studies to investigate new technologies and methodologies for implementing effective and efficient application systems; provide recommendations as needed.

Acts as team leader for various projects, as directed.

Reviews designs and deliverables with Division Manager and/or Project Manager(s) along with customer and technical team.

Assists in the development of information systems standards, procedures, and policies.

Works cooperatively with customers and Information Technology department staff, including vendors, to ensure fulfillment of business requirements.

Writes and ensures test cases encompass: system integration, user acceptance, performance testing.

Creates unit, system integration, user acceptance, performance and regression test plans.

Reports project status on a regular basis.

Ensures documentation, training and team engagement is provided for production support turnover.

Maintains system/project technical and customer user documentation.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities


QUALIFICATIONS (Education and Experience):

REQUIRED:

A minimum of either: a four (4) year Information Technology related degree from an accredited college and/or Vocational Certification along with three (3) years of experience in Information Technology; or, ten (10) years of proven experience in Information Technology along with active industry certifications. Either scenario must satisfy the functions, responsibilities and skills covered in this document.

SKILLS AND SPECIFICATIONS:

Experienced in the core disciplines of business and system analyst methodologies and techniques, as well as industry trends in these areas.

Familiar with the various tools and templates used to produce effective and meaningful organizational analysis and communications.

Knowledge and understanding of current application & web development, database, infrastructure and networking standards as well as industry trends in these areas.

Navigate complex business scenarios and define requirements with customers to deliver efficient business value.

Ability to think strategically and drive solutions that are cost justified and show measurable business value.

Ability to simultaneously support multiple projects and work assignments.

Ability to interpret and explain technical computer procedures to non-technical users and staff at all levels.

Ability to work well in a team environment to provide problem identification and resolution, as well as conveying knowledge and training.

Technical aptitude and ability to think logically in the solution of problems, root cause and corrective actions.

A thorough understanding of the change control process and adherence to it.

Ability to prepare and present technical written and oral reports in a clear and concise manner.

Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, user department personnel, outside service vendors and the public.

Ability to direct and organize the work of others and produce creative and critical thinking of others.

Ability to effectively speak, write and understand the English language.

Ability to speak and understand language other than English is preferred.

Exhibit strong written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to use interpersonal skills that foster a team, cooperative and service oriented environment. It is essential to have the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical individuals alike whether it involves one-on-one conversations, project team discussions, customer discussions, or vendor negotiations.

Ability to mentor peers and other supporting team members. It is essential that open communications and knowledge sharing is integrated into our core team behaviors.

Maintains knowledge of Information Technology through attendance of seminars, workshops and other media to stay current and drive new solutions.

Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with elected officials, Administrators, Department Heads, staff, union officials and public.

Ability to conduct oneself with tact and courtesy.

Ability to maintain the confidentiality of information.

WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

On-call for after hours support, as well as the ability to work after hours when needed.

Sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in an office setting; to stand or sit for prolonged periods of time.

Continuously required to bend, kneel, reach, and twist; to lift, carry, push, and/or pull up to 50 pounds.

Manual dexterity and regular fine-finger and hand/wrist motions are required for operating a keyboard and writing.

Works in an office environment and uses a computer, telephone and other office equipment as needed to perform duties.

The noise level in the work environment is typical of that of an office with frequent contact with customers.

Work is preformed primarily in a standard office environment with some travel to different sites.

General Requirements and/or Disclaimers

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties of personnel so classified.

Complies with P.A. 390, as amended, known as the State's Emergency Management Act and the County's Emergency Management resolution as well as all related plans, policies and procedures covered by these statutes.

Be physically able to perform the essential functions of the position, with or without reasonable accommodation.

The U.A.W. Local 412, Unit 49 (Information Technology Employees) bargaining unit represents this position. Therefore, there may be contract language which could require consideration in the selection process.

Job Description:
As a Business Analyst, you will support the client engagement team to help our clients analyze, define and execute strategies to support strategic goals or initiatives in key business areas within HR supply chain.

To achieve these highly visible results, our ideal candidate will use Microsoft office tools, as well as strong research and communication skills to support project delivery through data and process analysis, interpretation and reporting of various findings, assisting with project management and status reporting, as well as contributing in writing and structuring client presentations.

Successful candidates will be intellectually curious and committed to enabling a high growth company achieve enduring success You will bring your strong determination to succeed, your ability to juggle multiple responsibilities under tight deadlines, your ability to work both independently and as part a cross functional team, as well as your sharp attention to detail.

While serving in this capacity, you will have the unique opportunity to interact with subject matter experts, including thought leaders and executives in healthcare, financial, legal and specialized market-experts who have proven track records in helping companies meet or exceed aggressive goals.

Key Responsibilities:
•

Providing data analysis support and interpretation of findings

Participating as a cooperative team member in projects involving other associates in the firm

Utilizing exceptional organization and planning skills as well as being highly detail orientated and analytical

Working through barriers to execution

Manage competing priorities and multiple work streams

Being intellectually curious and committed to enabling a high growth company achieve enduring success

Having strong professional development orientation

Additional Qualifications:
•

Minimum 2-4+ years of related experience in industry or professional services;

Understanding of financial and healthcare issues and operations a plus;

Interest in healthcare issues a must;

Strong ability to manage and analyze data, think strategically, present effectively;

Skilled in using common project management methodology;

Strong Microsoft Office Skills, particularly Excel and PowerPoint;

About Our Firm:
Optimatum is a New York City-based vendor management firm that focuses exclusively on the HR supply chain. Our turnkey solutions improve the financial and operational performance of health care plans of our clients located nationwide through our unique multidisciplinary approach, which includes forensic analysis, the maintenance of existing vendor relationships, while at the same time increasing transparency and accountability. The net impact is meaningful reductions in cost while at the same time improved plan performance.

In our employer sponsored health care group, our clients reap direct efficiencies of 10-12% on their healthcare costs within one year, and 5-7% in subsequent years while maintaining existing vendors and current benefits without shifting costs.

Through our HR Transitional Services for Acquisitions Divestitures, we are at the epicenter of the Biggest Deal Boom In A Decade delivering expedited deal closure and accelerated harvesting of post day-one synergies which all reduced target employee integration risk.

In a world where 70 to 90%* of all MAs fail to achieve strategic and financial objectives with reasons often attributed to HR-related factors, we are here to solve the issues in this hot market.
