$55,000 - $70,000 a yearPOSITION SUMMARY
The Research & Planning section (R&P) supports the accomplishment of the Virginia Alcoholic Beverage Control Authority’s (ABC) mission and objectives through the successful fulfillment of projects in the areas of business research, data analysis, stakeholder surveys, strategic planning, policy & program analysis, fiscal impact analysis, revenue forecasting, and store network planning. R&P also handles Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) response and coordination, procedure development, performance measurement and the application of process improvement to Authority operations. R&P is currently seeking a business analyst with considerable knowledge of methodologies for improving organizational performance, analysis of retail and other operational data and principles of project management. Considerable skill in the use of a personal computer, utilizing spreadsheet, database, flowcharting, word processing, project management, and presentation software applications is required. The R&P business analyst should possess the demonstrated ability to define and lead work processes, communicate effectively (orally and in writing), analyze quantitative and qualitative data and draw conclusions.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Duties include researching and analyzing the effectiveness, application and impact of new technologies, systems, programs and management approaches to operational services. This position will not focus primarily on technology projects (i.e. new system requirements or new system implementation); yet will lead the evaluation of operational program areas and projects related to ABC’s policy and operational initiatives. This position will evaluate alternative ways to deliver ABC services, determine the effectiveness of advertising and marketing campaigns, assist with legislative studies, analyze sales and interpret trends by product, brand, category, price tier, geographic area, etc. This position will lead or assist with projects sponsored by operating division directors or a member of the senior executive team and will have access to subject matter experts as needed to meet research or project objectives. A strong background in data analysis (to include retail operations data), business intelligence tools, process improvement, business writing and stakeholder outreach is preferred. The R&P BA should effectively facilitate work teams, develop project and communication plans, provide team support, conduct training, etc. to see that the ABC Authority moves through research projects in a timely and efficient manner. The BA will ensure the timely distribution of reports and key findings, as well as work with Information Technology Services and other work units to identify efficient report distribution methods.
The R&P BA should effectively manage all phases of assignments including issue identification and scope, work planning, quantitative/qualitative analysis, documentation, and reporting. The BA should develop and maintain an effective system to formally document and track the status of all project activities and recommendations, and research deliverables should be free of substantial errors and omissions. The BA should display effective leadership skills and considerable independence and initiative in managing projects and actively involve stakeholders in research and/or project implementation. The BA should manage outside vendors and data sources as needed to complete research assignments.
The R&P BA should provide clear direction to team members by setting realistic goals, objectives, and measurements, effectively facilitate team consensus-building and decision-making processes, keep work teams organized and on track with project plans and task assignments, and produce documents and recommendations in a timely and accurate manner.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Graduate from college or university with course work in market research, economics, statistics, public or business administration required. Master’s Degree and/or certificate in project management or business analysis preferred. A minimum of 5 years of experience in business research, retail operations analysis, data analysis and project management is preferred. Project management certification through PMI/AMA or data analytics certification a plus.

For full consideration, all applicants must fully complete all sections of the online application. A resume will not substitute for an incomplete application.


The Virginia Alcoholic Beverage Control Authority does not provide sponsorship.


We are an equal opportunity employer without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, political affiliation, veteran status, or disability.


AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service alumni are encouraged to apply.


ABC will provide, if requested, reasonable accommodation to applicants in need of accommodation in order to provide access to the application and/or interview process.


Criminal history record checks are required prior to employment.

Advises and recommends areas of program planning, business requirements management, budget execution and program coordination.
Prepares needs assessment. Validates resource requirements and develops cost estimate models.
Conducts and coordinates financial, product, market, operational, and related research to support strategic and business planning within the various departments and programs of the client group.
Interprets, evaluates, and interrelates research data, and develops integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making.
Plans and coordinates the development of primary and secondary market research studies in support of strategic planning and specific marketing initiatives, as required, and presents findings of studies to client committees.
Provides consultative, advisory, technical, and staff support, as appropriate.
Ability to use survey and market research methodologies, systems, and techniques.
Experience Level: BA or BS required plus minimum 3+ years of direct relevant experience.

Textron Systems' businesses are industry-leading developers and integrators of unmanned systems, advanced marine craft, armored vehicles, intelligent battlefield and surveillance systems, geospatial management and analysis systems, intelligence software solutions, precision weapons, piston engines, test and training systems, and total lifecycle sustainment and operational services.

About Textron: Textron is home to globally-recognized businesses, organized within five segments: Bell, Textron Aviation, Industrial, Textron Systems and Finance. Our businesses produce hundreds of products for customers around the world, in a range of industries spanning aerospace and defense, specialized vehicles, turf care, fuel systems, and tools and test equipment. The company continually invests in next-generation products and services designed to win in the marketplace.
Job Summary:

The Assoc Business Analyst will work with the Warehouse leadership and team to develop, execute and maintain improvements to exisiting processes and develop new processes to improve performance. The Assoc Business Analyst will be responsible for metrics, defining and managing the process for the team and develop and manage agreed upon metrics to support consistent execution and program reporting requirements.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyze company-wide operations, including performance and productivity data, error rates and their root causes.
Interpret results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining independently.
Analyze reports to identify operational issues throughout all warehouse sites.
Conduct ad hoc analyses on various departments and branches
Design, develop, implement and maintain business solutions and recommendations to improve performance.
Manage operational process improvement projects.
Maintain and publish standard reports for executive operations.
Maintain databases and develop weekly / monthly metrics reports.
Prepare and deliver insights and recommendations based on analyses
Foster relationships across programs and programs
Work with warehouse to support and lead process improvements as it relates to ISC
Understand appropriate company and industry best practices and/or historical data to support continuous improvement and process development.

Qualifications
 JOB REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor degree in Manufacturing Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or Technical Degree
0-1 year experience in an operation environment
Project management skills
Strong analytical skills
Excellent communication skills
Strong attention to detail
Strong organizational and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and with minimal structure while exercising judgment
Strong Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work well under pressure to meet established deadlines
Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Office (Excel, Project, Power Point, Word, Outlook) and database software

Position Purpose: Serves as a Claim-Pro system technical support representative and liaison for both internal and external clients. Supports the development team by providing testing, documentation, and other support duties to free up developer’s time.
Primary Responsibilities:
To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily (the requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability needed). Reliable, consistent and predictable performance of the following job duties is required:
Functions as a Claim-Pro subject matter expert to provide end-to-end support to both internal and external clients. Maintains working knowledge of the Claim-Pro system.
Serves as a point of contact for external clients.
Conducts insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues. Coordinates efforts to identify, document, and resolve system issues.
Independently investigates requests received from internal or external clients, and identifies appropriate course of action.
Creates and maintains help documentation, specifications, and other technical documentation.
Develops, coordinates, and implements test plans based on business and functional requirements.
Determines operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.
Tracks and manages active client projects.
Improves systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.
Validates resource requirements and develops cost estimates.
Communicates effectively at all levels of the organization.
Supports the development team as a resource.
Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Participates in company-wide and departmental quality management activities.
Performs any relevant and related duties as required.
Critical Required Skills:
Interpersonal abilities required to interact with clients and internal personnel in order to gather and compile information to solve problems. Must be able to integrate within the existing work environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Maintaining confidential issues, data, and documentation.
Capable of coordinating multiple tasks effectively.
Competent in developing and organizing documentation.
Self-directed, as indicated through proper time management, and in determining the priority for task completion.
Ability to write well-organized, efficient, and readable documentation.
Ability to understand Claim-Pro custom database layout, format, and information usage.
Strong computer-based skills.
Professional communication significant to internal and external clients.
Ability to make judgments and decisions affecting both internal and external clients.
Working knowledge of Access, word processing programs, and Excel.
Must demonstrate diplomacy/tact in dealing with clients at all levels.
Organizational skills necessary to coordinate and prioritize workload and to maintain tracking systems and related information in readily retrievable formats.
Effective research and problem solving skills.
Must be well organized and detail-oriented.
Willingness to take on new tasks and responsibilities as needed.
Key Challenges:
Maintaining the highest levels of confidentiality.
Must be able to work with a wide variety of people to solve problems.
Building effective working relationships with multiple internal areas and employees, and external contacts.
Effective use of technology and computer systems to support position accountabilities.
Maintaining an effective documentation management system.
Qualifications
Experience: A High School Degree or equivalent. Three to five (3-5) years of technical/customer support experience preferred. General office experience with strong computer skills. A working knowledge and ability to master multiple computer database and software systems (e.g., Access, Excel, Word, Outlook, etc.). Programming and report generation skills required. A working knowledge of medical terminology and medical insurance is helpful.
Position Constraints: The position requires a significant amount of visual and mental effort within a sometimes-stressful environment. Requires significant amounts of time seated at a desk or computer workstation. Small amounts of light lifting (e.g., supplies, paper, computers, etc.). Significant amounts of time will be spent in detailed analysis/verification and review of complex medical information.

Job Description
As we strive to be Earth's most customer-centric company, Amazon has reinvented how hundreds of millions of people shop online – providing customers with the opportunity to find and discover virtually anything they want to buy and providing millions of sellers with a platform for growing successful businesses. We are looking for an exceptional business analyst to help us develop new ways to build trust and loyalty with sellers, a crucial component of our flywheel

Sellers’ trust in Amazon is our top priority and in this role, you will be tasked with building that trust over time by diving deep into how we measure our progress and helping to identify and prioritize key areas of focus. Amazon’s growth requires leaders who move fast, have an entrepreneurial spirit to create new solutions, have an unrelenting tenacity to get things done, and are capable of breaking down and solving complex problems.

The successful candidate will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity and be able to create and maintain efficient & automated processes. They will set the vision, strategy, and roadmap, and work alongside with stakeholders in the organization to make it happen. They know and love working with business intelligence tools, can model multidimensional datasets, and can partner effectively with business leaders to answer key business questions. They are analytical and creative, and don’t quit. This is a role with high visibility to senior leadership and with high opportunity for impact for those willing to roll up their sleeves and dive deep to achieve results.

Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.
Basic Qualifications
Own the design, development, and maintenance of scalable solutions for ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to support analytical and business needs.
Work with team leadership to understand the customer needs and concerns as well as define solutions.
Translate basic business problem statements into analysis requirements. Work with internal customers to define best output based on expressed stakeholder needs.
Use analytical and statistical rigor to solve complex problems and drive business decisions.
Develop queries and visualizations for ad-hoc requests and projects, as well as ongoing reporting.
Design and drive experiments, A/B testing, outlier deep dives and form actionable recommendations. Manage the implementation of those recommendations.
Write queries and output efficiently, and have in-depth knowledge of the data available in area of expertise. Pull the data needed with standard query syntax; periodically identify more advanced methods of query optimization. Convert data to make it analysis-ready.
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation.
Monitor and troubleshoot operational or data issues in the data pipelines
Review and audit existing ETL jobs and SQL queries.
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced degree in data science, statistics, or a related field.
5+ years in the analysis space as a Business Intelligence Engineer, Business Analyst, Data Engineer, or similar roles.
Experience using Python, Ruby, or other scripting languages to automate data retrieval, manipulation, and analysis.
Experience using R, SAS, or other statistical packages.

Overview
Nashville, Tenn.-based Bridgestone Americas, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation, the world’s largest tire and rubber company.
Bridgestone Americas and its subsidiaries develop, manufacture and market a wide range of Bridgestone, Firestone and associate brand tires to address the needs of a broad range of customers, including consumers, automotive and commercial vehicle original equipment manufacturers, and those in the agricultural, forestry and mining industries.

The companies are also engaged in retreading operations throughout the Western Hemisphere and produce air springs, roofing materials, and industrial fibers and textiles. The Bridgestone Americas family of companies also operates the world’s largest chain of automotive tire and service centers.

Guided by its One Team, One Planet message, the company is dedicated to achieving a positive environmental impact in all of the communities it calls home.
Position Summary
The Business Cost Analyst is a key role supporting Firestone Fibers and Textiles Sales, Customer Service, Finance and Manufacturing. This position is responsible for product costing from concept to sales.
Responsibilities
Manage all aspects of product cost for manufacturing operations to include standard cost, cost estimates, planning, and optimization. Coordinate with the plant engineers to ensure the accuracy of the bill of materials and routings. Assist with new product costs and support new product development. Maintain and update the cost deck for Firestone Fibers and Textiles. Details cost analysis and modeling for current product modifications and new product development. Assist in calculation of 3rd party trade sales prices for the sales department. Continuous analysis and appropriate modification of standard cost system and approach to best suit business and financial requirements.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or technical-related area from accredited university
Cost Accounting or Manufacturing experience.
Working knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)
Proficiency with MS Office applications; Advanced Excel skills
Knowledge of Accounting Systems and accounting flows
Computer systems and software expertise with SAP, JOMAR and related systems
Experience with Lean, six sigma, or similar continuous improvement tools is preferred

Why does the job exist?
The IT Business Analyst I will perform Health & Human Services (HHS) 2020/Medicaid Management Information System Replacement (MMISR) project analytical work to include: business analysis, technical analysis, and data analysis. This position serves as a liaison between business partners/project stakeholders and IT project team members/stakeholders.
How does it get done?
¿ Assist with the facilitation of Joint Application Design (JADs) or Joint Application Requirement (JARs). Assist with the management and oversight of deliverables produced from vendors.
¿ Assist with the application management of requirements management tool.
¿ Gather research to provide an evaluation and analysis on different areas within the project.
¿ Compile Information from a multitude of sources and present findings from research, provide recommendations to project team members for new opportunities for enhancing business or IT processes, software, and/or hardware.
¿ Develop reports and presentations on information gathered for executive review and feedback.
Who are the customers?
The Human Services Department (HSD) employees, contractors, vendors, partner state agencies, and the citizens of New Mexico.
Ideal Candidate
¿ Experience in both areas of information technology and business administration with the proven ability to professionally communicate and gather requirements.
¿ Experience In documenting, analyzing, and presenting opportunities which would facilitate discussion. Proven ability to be detail-oriented, highly innovative, motivated and very flexible.
¿ Proven ability to produce work that will be based off research that Is gathered from different sources such as vendors, business process from project stakeholders then presented to project stakeholders along with recommendations.
¿ Contribute In team meetings, sharing ideas and experiences when trying to resolve a problem.
Minimum Qualification
Bachelor's degree in any field and two (2) years of experience in information technology or business analysis. Substitutions Apply. See Substitution Table below. PMI-PBA certification may be substituted for one year of education.
Substitution Table
These combinations of education and experience qualify you for the position:

 Education
Experience

1 High School Diploma or Equivalent AND 6 years of experience
2 Associate's degree AND 4 years of experience
3 Bachelor's degree AND 2 years of experience
4 Master's degree or higher AND 0 years of experience

Education and years of experience must be related to the purpose of the position.
If Minimum Qualification requires a specific number of "semester hours" in a field (e.g. 6 semester hours in Accounting), applicants MUST have those semester hours in order to meet the minimum qualifications. No substitutions apply for semester hours.

Employment Requirements
Must possess and maintain a valid New Mexico Driver's License.
Working Conditions
Work is performed in an office setting with exposure to Visual/Video Display Terminal (VDT) and extensive personal computer and phone usage. Some sitting, standing, bending and reaching may be required. Direct Program and cross-agency interaction and some travel may be required.Must be able to lift 25 lbs.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
We are seeking an analytical, process/detail-oriented Business Analyst who can partner effectively with sales compensation leadership. The role will be part of the Sales Planning & Operations team with a Global focus. The Business Analyst will work cross-functionally with several teams at Facebook (including sales, operations, business operations and business intelligence), with the objective of enabling Sales Compensation to make effective, analytically driven, and strategic operating decisions.

This is an individual contributor role that requires a deep understanding of the internet/tech and media ecosystem, exceptional analytical skills, bias toward action, strong partner and communication skills, and a background in data-driven decision-making. The candidate will have an analytical background and experience in managing data pipelines and dashboards, ability to synthesize and make recommendations based on imperfect data from multiple sources (internally and externally), strong business intuition to guide their analysis, and ability to work both independently and cross-functionally (partnerships, sales, finance, product marketing, product engineering, and business intelligence/IT).

The ideal candidate will be passionate about Facebook, view the world through an analytical lens, be interested in advertising, be intellectually curious, learn quickly, and be able to move fast while keeping focused on high-impact projects. This is a full-time position and is located in our Menlo Park, California office.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Compile and analyze data to develop metrics and dashboards to assess any risk, detect irregularities, and identify trends within the overall effectiveness of the sales incentive compensation program

Ability to synthesize impact on financials/economics on our business and provide business analytic strength to help drive initiatives critical to ongoing growth

Perform weekly/quarterly data audits and system maintenance to accurately reflect payee records and comp design components such as component weightings, quotas, accelerator rates and tiers

Product and revenue performance analysis

Understand and highlight daily/weekly/quarterly revenue trends

Demonstrate operational efficiency

Develop and maintain standard existing in-quarter reporting

Project manage improvements to drive higher efficiencies in day-to-day operations using a data-driven approach

Participate in the design/implementation process for system enhancements and complete user acceptance testing for calculation logic, data tables and reporting in the incentive compensation system and related CRM and revenue tools

Business Analyst

Chicago, IL

QUALIFICATIONS
Undergraduate degree with strong academic performance (business, math, economics preferred)

Record of achievement and leadership (minimum 1 to 3 years of work experience)

Demonstrated qualities of being a self-starter

Skill and aptitude for analytics with Tableau skills preferred

Ability to work collaboratively, including with a virtual team

Flexibility and adaptability to changing needs and priorities

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Willingness to travel

WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH

At Strategic Resources, Inc., we uncover the keys to more profitable growth and build tools for leaders to confidently create real value in their business. You will work directly with one or more of the principals of the firm, partnering side-by-side with them as you solve our clients’ most challenging business problems. In addition, you will work with senior leadership at our clients – most commonly owners, presidents, CEOs, and CFOs – getting exposure to C-suite thinking and building meaningful relationships. You will join a team invested in your training and development and a growing practice with ample opportunity to evolve and grow.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

You’ll work in teams of typically 3 – 4 team members, playing an active role in all aspects of the client engagement

This includes gathering data and information, performing analysis, collaborating with team members and clients, and formulating and communicating recommendations.

We are a data-driven organization, so heavy emphasis will be placed on analytical work as a basis for client engagements. We are also highly collaborative, working side-by-side with clients, so you can expect meaningful dialogue, interaction, and engagement with other team members in your day-to-day role. We pride ourselves on being results-oriented, so you will “see things through,” helping clients identify the right strategy but also execute to drive impact and outcomes.

We look at the business analyst position as the first step in a long and meaningful career with Strategic Resources, Inc. We afford our people flexibility in where and how they work, allowing you to achieve the work-life balance you desire.

COMPENSATION

Competitive base salary plus bonus eligibility

Interested applicants, please submit a CV and contact Ben Hess at bhess@strategicresourcesinc.com

WHO WE ARE

At Strategic Resources, Inc., we uncover the keys to more profitable growth and build tools for leaders to confidently create real value in their business. We accelerate the performance of businesses that build community as advisors to owners and senior leaders of local privately held and family-owned businesses. We are "roll up our sleeves" long-term partners with results-oriented relationships that go from strategy through execution to get things done. Most recently, our focus has been on helping businesses “turn the corner” from an emphasis on cost-cutting toward longer-term, “outside the four walls” opportunities that drive profitable growth, create real value, and help businesses compete successfully in today’s changing business environment.

Learn more on our website at www.strategicresourcesinc.com

JOB DESCRIPTION
Famous Software is revolutionizing information management in the fresh food supply chain. We use a team approach to software development and customer support. This position will give you the opportunity to work with some of the produce industry’s leading product experts, Software Developers, Software Engineers, Business Analysts, and Database Managers. You will work in a team to create and enhance fully-integrated, world-class Oracle/Windows-based supply chain business solutions.
On our team, Software Business Analyst is an analytical planning and testing position. You will confirm user needs, develop written software requirements documents, and work closely with software developers to resolve design issues and assure feasibility before coding begins. In the process you will have the opportunity to interact with Famous Software employees at all levels of seniority.
ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Work in a collaborative team environment to implement new products and features
Gather business requirements, develop project plans, and develop functional specifications for an ERP system and its supporting systems
Document the business requirements, functional requirements, process flow diagrams (including impact to other UI, functions, and modules), testing requirements, and use cases in a format that can be consumed by project team members Conduct and participate in scope and/or analysis review meetings, including those for other business analysts' projects
Author and/or review scope and analysis documents
Coordinate, communicate, and collaborate between project team members
Provide work effort estimates based on input from project team members
Validate that the solution developed behaves as expected before handing it off to Quality Assurance
Review Quality Assurance test plans and participate in the Quality Assurance testing cycle
QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS
3 - 5 years of experience as a Software Business Analyst engaged in ERP systems
Degree in Accounting, Business, Information Systems, or Agribusiness is essential but experience will also be considered
Solid understanding of enterprise accounting (AR, AP, GL and inventory) and business transactions such as sales, purchasing, inventory management, and finance
Good understanding of Software Development Life Cycle, applicable to enterprise software applications
Experience in gathering and documenting business requirements, system requirements, use cases, and process flow diagrams for business applications
Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills
Excellent and effective oral and written communication skills
Competence in the use of the Microsoft Office Suite including Outlook, Word, Excel, Project, and Visio
Experience in the fresh produce industry is a plus
RELOCATION AND TELECOMMUTING
At this time, Famous Software does not offer relocation packages. Additionally, telecommuting is not an option for this position.
HOW TO APPLY

diverse, effective workforce through equal opportunity employment.

Job Description
Amazon is seeking a Business Analyst, Customer Experience Strategy, based in Seattle, WA. You will join an expanding team that measures our customer's experience with a wide-range of Amazon products and services around the world. You will have the opportunity to design, collect, analyze and present customer findings to business partners to drive customer-centric change.

Key Job Responsibilities
As a Business Analyst you will lead data collection and analysis for programs across multiple product lines and geographies. Your work will have a direct impact on how business partners shape improvement initiatives to improve customer experience. We have a great, diverse team that thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic, and innovative environment. We are looking for a new team member that brings a strong analytical skill set and is not afraid of new challenges.

Responsibilities include:
Customer research and analytics: Design surveys and sampling logic, manage distribution via internal tools, coordinate with business partners and vendors, validate/summarize data, and support synthesis of findings into reports. Our team primarily uses Net Promoter Score (NPS) and satisfaction with customer experience (CX) attributes to provide insights into our customer's perception about the quality of Amazon's products and services. Analysts have an opportunity to work with both qualitative and quantitative data to produce insights.
Data management: Help maintain and build new features within our data management and infrastructure processes to support scalability throughout the company. Our analysts use a wide range of tools to support this work, including: Excel, SPSS, Minitab, and an assortment of AWS services (e.g., Redshift, Lambda, and ML). We use these tools to produce high quality reports that leverage visualization and statistics to create impactful narratives.
Manage ambiguity: Understand complex business problems across business units, geographies and product lines to create hypotheses and translate this into analysis requirements and identify meaningful insights that help Amazon improve our customer experience.
Develop and share best practices and results: Drive continuous improvement around customer research and analysis around NPS with our global team and business partners.

Ability to synthesize data into written narrative (in English) and communicate findings to diverse audiences (e.g., technical, non-tech, executive); requires strong verbal and written communication skills with some experience facilitating discussions with both large and small audiences
Advanced knowledge of Excel is required, including use of lookups and pivot tables
Preferred Qualifications
Preferred Qualifications

Experience in areas such as management consulting, statistics, technology, retail, consumer goods or market research firms
Diverse work experience/background

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY:
The Department of General Services delivers cost effective, high quality, reliable and sustainable services by managing quality facilities, ensuring efficient fleet operations, and maintain exemplary administrative customer service that supports Baltimore City agencies in the advancement of their goals. The agency has four major divisions which are responsible for providing management and oversight of the infrastructure and services that enable City agencies to provide for a range of citizen needs from: EMS, ambulances and Fire suppression and police patrols to, payment of vendor invoices for work done to maintain city buildings. The Business Process Improvement Office is a part of the Administration division and has a part of its core mission increasing automation in government work and, taking the agency paperless.
The City’s Department of General Services is implementing a 4 year vision to take the agency entirely paperless. This position is responsible for executing that vision to impact how government works.
ABOUT THE COMPANY:
At our core, Comtech Command & Control Technologies employees are driven by innovation. We are leaders in the advanced global commercial and government communications market. A career at Comtech enables you to design, develop, produce and market innovative products, systems and services for advanced communications solutions. You will facilitate and enhance the way people, businesses, and governments communicate around the world.
Comtech Command & Control Technologies is a leading provider of mission critical solutions to government and civilian agencies with a focus on C4ISR solutions using any type of network, whether mobile, fixed, static, terrestrial, marine, airborne or in space. In order to help our customers, combat a growing number of cyber-attacks on their systems, we provide training and certification and vulnerability compliance assessment. Comtech designs, develops, produces and markets innovative products, systems and services for advanced communications solutions. We are technology leaders in the markets that we serve and conduct our business through Government solutions. Our market segments consist of: Tactical Communications, Space & Component Technology, Mobile Datacom, and Cyber Security Solutions.
PRIMARY DUTIES:
Fully understand and help further the vision of a paperless state in 4 years by actively implementing the project to build and deploy paperless workflows, identifying and empowering stakeholders and working with the Director of BPIO to continue development of key staff across the agency into internal champions.
Conduct interviews, investigations to effectively analyze, document and diagram existing work processes, both at the intra-division, inter-division and inter-agency level.
Design, demo, and deploy workflows that eliminate the government’s need to purchase and use paper. Learn and serve as an administrator for the workflow management system in use for paperless initiative implementation –Integrify.
Participate in the analysis of the operational and metadata on workflows to develop insights that can be used to inform and improve existing and future processes or sub processes, creating a continuous process improvement feedback loop.
Support the growth and impact of the paperless program by designing workflows, prioritizing projects and identifying new features
Support the Integrify workflow management software system through: monitoring performance and system maintenance per requirements, the setup of accounts and, system upgrades with new releases and models.
Develop expertise and training material to effectively guide or oversee the training of new staff members on relevant technology as part of the paperless initiative.
Assist in the preparation and editing of case-studies and presentations on the status and impact of the Paperless Initiative
Work with the Director of BPIO to identify the best way to ‘open’ or host a repository for the workflow development outputs to facilitate a larger regional conversation and resource pool to leverage the workflow design and deployment process for common public sector administrative functions.
SKILLS REQUIRED:
Degree or advance certification in related field or demonstrable experience in related field supported by references and a body of work
Proven experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives
2+ years of experience in Project Management or IT project implementation
Past experience leading a project and or team
Experience in workflow and process analysis, analysis of operational behavior and metrics
Demonstrated resourcefulness, aptitude for solving problems and effective software troubleshooting
Preferences include:
Experience with government processes and procedures
Ability to create relevant SQL queries and automation scripts in Python to support elements of paperless initiative and or for automation of sub process tasks
Equally high levels of organization and self-motivation
Strong written verbal communication skills and demonstrated strong commitment to team environment dynamics

STD, LTD, Supplemental Life insurance and AD&D
Comprehensive 401k plan and Employee stock purchase plan
Tuition Assistance

10 paid holidays

COMPANY OVERVIEW
For over a century, Neiman Marcus Group has served the unique needs of our discerning customers by staying true to the principles of our founders: to be the premier omni-channel retailer of luxury and fashion merchandise dedicated to providing superior service and a distinctive shopping experience in our stores and on our websites. Neiman Marcus Group is comprised of the Specialty Retail Stores division, which includes Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman, and our international brand, mytheresa.com. Our portfolio of brands offers the finest luxury and fashion apparel, accessories, jewelry, beauty, and home décor. The Company operates more than 40 Neiman Marcus full-line stores in the most affluent markets across the United States, including U.S. gateway cities that draw an international clientele. In addition, we operate 2 Bergdorf Goodman stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City. We also operate more than 40 Last Call by Neiman Marcus off-price stores that cater to a value oriented, yet fashion minded customer. Our upscale eCommerce and direct-to-consumer division includes NeimanMarcus.com, BergdorfGoodman.com Horchow.com, LastCall.com, and CUSP.com. Every day each of our 15,000 NMG associates works towards the goal of enabling our customer to shop any of our brands "anytime, anywhere, and on any device." Whether the merchandise we sell, the customer service we offer, or our investments in technology, everything we do is to enhance the customer experience across all channels and brands.

Business Analyst - IT
Springdale, AR

CommissionJob Title: Retail Business Analyst

Our Values:

At Morris Furniture Company, our values represent our distinctive core beliefs-the Morris way of doing business. Our Mission is “Making Homes Great” and we bring our mission to life through our values of: Professionalism, Quality, Ownership, Collaboration, and Integrity.

Purpose:

The retail business analyst position will provide analytical insights, support and recommendations to the various business leaders of the company. This role will lead the preparation and review of the annual budget and quarterly forecasting process, investigating a variety of internal financial and operational issues, and assisting with the month-end close process and analysis.

General Description of duties
Finance business partner for the organization and identify and prioritize areas for improvement using data points across various departments including Marketing, Merchandising, Sales, IT, Human Resources and Operations
Manage data in a way that reduces “data overload” for company leaders and provides them with the most important data on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis
Create the annual budget and quarterly forecasts of future business conditions
Investigate operational and financial results, develop KPI’s and make recommendations for improvements
Assist with the month-end close process by financial statement preparation and analytics
Complete financial modeling for commission and compensation plans for Sales and Delivery

What you'll do
As an Associate Business Analyst, you will work with senior staff members in order to review and understand the content, format and accuracy of key customer deliverables, evaluate their sufficiency and make recommendations to the project team to advance the implementation process. You will ultimately be responsible for managing customer communication, managing requirements gathering and working as the key resource to review customer data,. You will gain experience and broad exposure to Billtrust’s products and begin the journey to becoming a technical and functional expert who ultimately provides our customer with direction and guidance on configuring the Billtrust platform to meet their business objectives.

Provide assistance to Business Analysts and Solution Architects while working with other Billtrust Teams in fielding questions/concerns as it relates to a client implementation and how to support approved in-scope requirements
Complete necessary tasks on projects in time when assigned to specific tasks designated by project plans

Consistently learning and keeping up to date on Billtrust products, capabilities and new features

Recommend, and make improvements to the Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and Desk Top Procedures (DTP) documentation that is leveraged by the team for implementing clients
What you'll bring to the team
Experience with written and oral communication in gathering and documenting requirements, creating functional design specifications, business writing skills
Comfortable interacting and communicating effectively with technical and non-technical business partners at all levels of organizations both internally and externally
Experience and effective in problem solving, analytical and decision-making skills

What you'll get
Competitive salary, stock options and 401(k) with company match: We appreciate our employees and we make sure they know it.
Benefits: We offer full-time employees multiple healthcare packages, including free and low cost options.
Open PTO: Work-life balance is important. We believe in giving our employees time to truly relax and recharge.
Paid Parental Leave: To keep our employees and their families healthy.
A Lively Culture: Ping-pong, bean bag toss, hackathons- we enjoy friendly competition.
Casual Dress: Every day is “Casual Friday’, we want you to be comfortable when you come to work.
Minimal Bureaucracy: An entrepreneurial environment of ownership and accountability allows you to get work done.
Who we are
Billtrust is the best-in-class provider of Payment Cycle Management and accounts receivable solutions, helping businesses accelerate Invoice-to-Cash. We provide a flexible, automated, cloud-based product portfolio that meets diverse buyer requirements and speeds cash application through tailored invoice delivery, secure multi-channel payment enablement, and intelligent matching and payment posting. Our platforms process $15B+ annually and help companies like Kraft Foods, New Balance Athletics and Ferguson Enterprises get paid faster and more efficiently. For the past 17 years, we have achieved remarkable success with year-over-year growth and we attribute that growth to our people and culture - We encourage employees to have autonomy, think creatively, share ideas – even with our CEO – and to challenge the status quo every day without a lot of red tape.

Marriott International is the world’s largest hotel company, with more brands, more hotels and more opportunities for associates to grow and succeed. We believe a great career is a journey of discovery and exploration. So, we ask, where will your journey take you?
POSITION SUMMARY

Project Catapult is the next step in fulfilling Marriott’s vision of a single integrated Workforce Management Platform and includes the implementation of cloud-based Human Capital Management (HCM) and payroll applications, as well as the replacement of the US based Payroll system. Project Catapult will be implemented in 2020 and will include Payroll for US and UK initially.

As a member of the Project Catapult team, the Senior Payroll Business Analyst will assist in implementing a new payroll application and business process solution for Marriott International. Specifically, the Senior Payroll Business Analyst will primarily support activities during the design, development, build, and test phase of the project including System Test, Integration Test, and User Acceptance Test. The Senior Payroll Business Analyst will participate in design sessions and support activities related to designing and documenting payroll business processes. She/he will also play a role in test script preparation and execution to include identifying and documenting test conditions, producing and reviewing test scripts, executing test scripts, documenting errors found during testing, assisting in error resolution and providing status updates as required.

The Senior Payroll Business Analyst will also assist with general business and process analysis, the development of training materials, and go-live and post production activities.

EXPECTED CONTRIBUTIONS

Provide payroll subject matter expertise to the project team through the design, build, test and rollout of the new payroll solution.
Perform system user acceptance testing.
Enhance the skills of users and “coaches” by providing input into the development of training materials (i.e. job aides, on-line help, classroom, etc.).
Assist in tracking and resolving issues.
Perform other duties as assigned to meet business needs.

Demonstrates experience in creative and innovative application of technology for business change.
History of consistently delivering business results.
Ability to communicate ideas, both orally and in writing.

Description
Ultimate Software is seeking a Business Analyst passionate about shaping the future of Human Resources. Do you enjoy solving large complex problems? Do you excel on fast-paced, tight-knit teams? Are you obsessed by both technical and functional details? As a Business Analyst, you will connect business, design, and architectural requirements to deliver inspiring and enduring solutions for our customers. This is a very hands on role that requires daily collaboration with our product, user experience, and engineering teams. If you like getting in the weeds and the thrill of building something from scratch this Business Analyst opportunity is for you.

Here at Ultimate Software, we truly put our people first. We strongly believe in teamwork, and we encourage and trust our people to reach higher, learn more, and live up to their potential. Ultimate is ranked #1 on Fortune's “Best Places to Work in Technology” for 2018 and #3 on the “100 Best Companies to Work For” list in 2018. Ultimate is also ranked #1 on the Fortune’s “100 Best Workplaces for Millennials” for 2018 and #3 on its "Best Workplaces for Diversity” list for 2017.

Own new features, enhancements, and defects from conception through delivery and support
Research, refine, and prioritize functional, design, and technical requirements in collaboration with product, design, research, and engineering teams
Write detailed, actionable acceptance criteria and other supporting artifacts
Ensure the development process is running smoothly and delivering

(Knowledge, Skills and Abilities)

Analytical; ability to synthesize large complex problems into small, digestible parts

Adaptive; learns new concepts quickly and retains the essence

Experience working closely with the software architects, engineers, and testers

Wherever you contribute here at McKesson, you will have the ability to make a real impact in the lives of others.

Train new resources and support other on-boarding activities

Track and resolve technical issues

Provide reports from SAP, Business Objects, Remedy, Salesforce, and other tools that support knowledge of team process efficiency and effectiveness, as well as pinpointing issues for resolution
Provide data reports to support team projects
Provide reports to business customers as required
Initiate, implement, and maintain process team metrics
Track, monitor, and publish process performance
Design and initiate process improvement opportunities

Qualifications

Thorough knowledge of master data processes, policies, procedures and systems, organizational skills, communication skills, data analysis, and process improvement experience

Experience with SAP or similar software preferred. Preferred Six Sigma process improvement experience (Greenbelt/Blackbelt training)

Education

Job Summary
The University of Kentucky Clinical Research Support Office (CRSO) provides support to investigators and study teams conducting clinical trials. Services provided by the CRSO include maintaining a clinical trial management system (CTMS), conducting coverage analysis, developing study budgets, negotiating payment terms with sponsors, and regulatory services.

The CRSO is currently seeking qualified candidates for a Clinical Research Budget Analyst position reporting directly to the Clinical Trials Financial Manager. This position serves a financial project manager for assigned projects by providing proactive clinical trial budget development and start up support. The role reviews complex study protocols and associated documents to analyze costs related to performing the clinical trial and develops budgets consistent with protocol requirements, coverage analysis determinations, and ensures cost coverage for UK related expenses to manage clinical trials all while collaborating directly with investigators, study teams, and other UK departments. Where applicable, this position negotiates directly with clinical trial sponsors; performs reviews and prepares responses to sponsor budget offers and counteroffers to arrive a satisfactory budget terms. The Clinical Research Budget Analyst is responsible for analysis, projections, adherence to UK policies and processes, applicable reporting, and financial data entry into the clinical trial management system (CTMS) in use at UK (specifically OnCore CTMS). The ideal candidate works well independently and on teams, is organized, collaborates with others, exercises sound judgement, and possesses attention to detail.

Skills / Knowledge / Abilities
Proficient in Microsoft Office products.

Does this position have supervisory responsibilities? No

Preferred Education/Experience
Preferred candidates will have the following experience/skills:
Working knowledge of Medicare, Medicaid, and/or commercial payer guidelines, including NCD 310.1.Knowledge of medical coding (i.e., HCPCS / CPT coding) and terminology.Knowledge of regulations regarding the use of human subjects in clinical trials, outcomes research, nursing research, and other research areas.Proficiency in the development of clinical trial study budgets (federal and non-federal sponsor types).Knowledge of drug/device development process and the pharmaceutical and/or medical device manufacturing industry is preferred.Knowledge of regulatory, financial, and administrative requirements of third-party billing for clinical trials is preferred.Knowledge of accounting principles for research is preferred.Understanding of ancillary costs associated with clinical trials.
Experience working with a hospital charge master.
Strong competency in Microsoft Office programs (especially Word, Excel, and PowerPoint).

This role will be challenged to analyze, review, and develop solutions that support the department’s operational and business planning.

Consistently exhibits behavior and communication skills that demonstrate commitment to superior customer service, including quality and care and concern with each and every internal and external customer.

DaVita Medical Group manages and operates medical groups and affiliated physician networks in California, Colorado, Florida, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania and Washington. Argo Group, through its operating subsidiaries, offers high-quality commercial Property and Casualty (P&C) insurance products and services tailored to the needs of businesses and public entities. At Argo Group, we leverage the success, discipline and expertise of our people and an understanding of our customers’ needs to provide a diverse portfolio of products and services. This approach helps those we insure drive down their ultimate cost through prevention and aggressive claims handling. Simply stated, our products and services help keep businesses in business.


Our divisions specialize in providing superior commercial insurance and reinsurance solutions to clients in both admitted and non-admitted markets. We have an exciting opportunity for a Strategic Business Analyst to work within our Argo US Underwriting Department. This is an executive level management role responsible for providing technical excellence across Argo US. The position may reside in any of our Argo Group US, Inc. offices and reports directly to the Chief Underwriting Officer.

The primary responsibilities are as follows:
Manage the US Underwriting ArgoNet team site (structure/format)
Work with actuarial and finance to develop new portfolio reporting capabilities
Represent US Underwriting on Data Governance project work
Produce CUO management reports as needed (L/R v ROAC, Account Tiering/eRe)
Coordinate business planning reviews with Finance/Actuarial & BU Leaders
Coordinate Agenda for US Underwriting Council (take minutes/record action items)
Maintain/coordinate BU schedules for Large Loss Reviews & Peer Reviews
Maintain Reinsurance Treaty structure inventory (bar charts / history)
Maintain Underwriter email distribution lists for CUO communications
Coordinate with Learning & Development (adoption of Degreed, Training Content)
Provide annual calculations for legacy accounts written on Retrospective Premium or Large Deductible programs
Manage template inventory for Argo US Letters of Authority


The successful candidate will be a motivated, solutions-oriented self-starter and possess the following:
Must have good business acumen (i.e. understand how an insurance company works and makes money, including how this role impacts both Argo Group’s and our customers’ ability to be profitable).
Establish persuasive business cases to support recommendations
Minimum 5 years Business Analyst experience
A bachelor’s degree, preferably in business administration, insurance or a related field is required. Additional industry designations, such as an AU or CPCU are highly desired.
A strong focus on execution and a proven ability to consistently produce and deliver expected results to all stakeholders.
Client focus – the ability to effectively determine specific client needs and to provide value added solutions.
Intellectual curiosity. Consistently considers all options and is not governed by conventional thinking.
Ability to build commitment both internally and externally. Ability to communicate corporate vision and to gain support for your views, opinions and decisions.
A team builder, someone who understands that success is dependent upon the performance of the team. Creates strong morale and spirit within the team: shares wins and celebrates success as a team
Ability to develop and communicate underwriting management reports for accurate and timely reflection of underwriting regulatory compliance
Ability to create clear, concise and effective presentations.
Ability to build rapport and foster collaborative, productive relationships with business partners and organizational peers with a focus on timely and meaningful exchanges of information.
Ability to identify and resolve conflicts in a timely, objective manner, using sound judgment to reach a solution.
Ability to travel


What will you need to be successful here?

A genuine excitement to not only meet, but exceed, our customer’s expectation on each and every interaction with the customer.
An eagerness and desire to learn the underwriting function with the intent of furthering your underwriting career.

Job Description
Amazon is looking for a smart, motivated, and driven Business Analyst to focus on improving the Amazon customer experience, from the unique advantage within Customer Service. You will analyze multiple types of data to discover and solve real world problems. We do this every day with ingenuity and simplicity, leveraging impactful data and analytics to amplify the opportunities on behalf of the Amazon customer. This position requires high judgment, focus on speed and accuracy, and an ability to balance the Customer and the Customer Service associate experience with financial impact; it also offers broad exposure to various business and technical teams within Amazon.

The ideal candidate has an accomplished professional background, demonstrated proficiency in advanced mathematics and/or statistics, and experience as an analyst in a business environment. They are comfortable analyzing data from multiple sources to create strategic recommendations in a thoughtful, concise manner and obtaining organizational buy-in at senior levels. They are well-organized, can manage multiple analyses/projects simultaneously, and is intellectually curious. A strong business analytics candidate should have solid skills in SQL coding and report building in Tableau or advanced Excel.

The Business Analyst (BA) is a core member of the America's Customer Service Customer Experience (CSCX) program team, who proactively engages with key business stakeholders across Amazon.com to bring forward the voice of the customer to identify and deliver customer-impacting solutions. Areas of concentration for the CSCX BA could be the Prime Member experience, Amazon Fulfillment customer experience, Merchant Fulfillment customer experience, or opportunities within the Amazon Retail customer experience. There is no shortage of opportunity to relentlessly advocate on behalf of our customers and to drive measurable results.

Responsibilities include:
Developing intelligent, insightful reporting on the key drivers of our business
Interacting with internal stakeholders to deep-dive outlier events
Ad-hoc project work supporting the re-invention of how we manage our business
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Identify process and system improvement opportunities by monitoring existent metrics, analyzing data and partnering with internal teams
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics
4+ years of experience in analytics or operations
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Advanced SQL writing and experience in data mining (SQL, ETL, VBA, data warehouse, etc.) and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets
Experience with data visualization software, preferably Tableau
Strong verbal and written communication & data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Experience managing multiple competing priorities and projects in a fast-paced environment
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years of professional experience in business intelligence or data analysis
Strong knowledge of advanced statistics
Creative in finding new solutions, designing innovative methods, systems and processes
Extensive experience working on complex, cross-functional initiatives in a dynamic environment
Excellent organization skills to work across functions and upwards
Ability to use data to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analysis
Ability to take loosely defined business questions and translate them into clearly defined technical/data specifications

Title:Business Analyst

Position Overview:We are looking for aBusiness Analystwho will be part of our Innovation Assessment and Insight Practice (IA&I) and will be expected to actively work in a multi-disciplinary fast paced environment. This is a client facing role and requires a broad range of skills and the ability to step into different roles depending on the size and scope of the project; its primary responsibility will be to engage with clients to understand and analyse their business processes and extract insight that identifies opportunities for technology driven improvement and innovation.The Innovation Assessment and Insight Practice (IA&I) creates client focused innovation through data driven assessments and thought leadership on industry trends, technology and innovation. It will provide objective, data driven insight that challenges both our clients and Conduent to transform and lead their markets. It supports direct client engagements to deeply understand their opportunities and challenges taking a consultative approach underpinned by deep technical expertise and structured assessment methodologies to produce quantified innovation opportunities. Your recommendations will directly impact how our clients use technology and process to improve the way they do business as well helping to set the direction for Conduent's innovation roadmaps.

Is effective and persuasive in both written and oral communication.Time management and multitasking skills to effectively meet deadlines under time-to-market pressureRequires travel (on average 25-50%)

GENERAL PURPOSE:
As a member of the Business Information team, the Business Analyst will play an important business facing role. In this role, he/she will work directly with our business partners gathering data/reporting requirements, working with our IT partners in determining the best solution and supporting the testing and delivery process. The Business Analyst will also support the full BI Request Management process and will follow the requests from submission to delivery.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Information Management –

Gain a solid understanding of the business reports and tools.
Develop an understanding of the strengths/limitations of the various tools and technologies available. Suggest alternate methods of data presentation.

Gather and document business requirements for report and data requests.
Leverage the available reporting tools; confirm the data integrity via thorough testing.
Lead creation and review of all test-related deliverables including test approach, test scenarios, test cases/conditions, scripts and results.

Routinely manage user acceptance testing for moderately complex projects and obtain sign-off from the business.

Develop training materials and job aides to support reporting rollouts.

Identify and mitigate any project related risks.
Relationship Management –

Develop partnerships acting as a liaison between the technical and business teams to understand, troubleshoot, interpret and provide guidance on reporting and data needs.

Facilitate meetings; issue tracking/resolution, escalation etc. as you follow a report/data request from submission through to delivery.

Lead training classes, collect user feedback, and support the users as needed.

Lead post deployment validation as instructed by project leadership or management.

COMPETENCIES:
Analysis and Judgment
Results Driven
Business Acumen
Interpersonal Effectiveness
Communication
Technical Competence with data gathering
Customer Service
Presentation and training abilities

QUALIFICATIONS AND SPECIAL SKILLS REQUIRED:
Bachelor’s degree with a concentration in Business, Economics, Finance or Computer Science, or an equivalent diploma
3 years of retail experience in the business, business support or equivalent work experience
Commensurate level of working business knowledge preferred
Hands on experience with BI tools (i.e. MicroStrategy, Microsoft SSAS, etc.)
High degree of proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Experience with merchandise planning processes and tools is a plus
Visio skills is a plus
Ability to understand and apply instructions or suggest alternate proven methods to move projects forward
Ability to follow established practices, policies and procedures
Ability to build and maintain stable working relationships
Strong communication skills
Strong analytical skills
Able to create simple to complex analytical solutions
Ability to take an abstract analytical problem and break it down into actionable tasks

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ADA:
Job requires ability to work in an office environment, primarily on a computer.
The job also requires sitting, standing, walking, talking on the telephone, attending in-person meetings, typing, and working with paper/files, etc.
Job occasionally requires bending, kneeling, reaching, and lifting up to 10 pounds.
May also require occasional driving and/or traveling overnight for business functions or site visits.
Vision requirements: Ability to see information in print and/or electronically.
Consistent timeliness and regular attendance.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

None

The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) is a partner-focused organization that prides itself in providing great service, in creating innovative solutions, and most importantly, in having amazing people. We value having an open, inclusive and collaborative culture, where Googlers feel supported and able to do their best work. In offices around the globe, we foster and celebrate an environment where all team members feel welcomed and respected. OPG partners with online publishers and app developers around the world to grow their businesses using our portfolio of products including the AdSense, AdMob, and Google Ad Manager platforms. We offer a solutions-based approach across advertising, analytics, and site or app design, and pride ourselves in finding new opportunities for our partners to better engage users and advertisers. Over a million web publishers and app developers rely on our solution globally, and ultimately, we're proud to enable Google to be one of the foremost funders of digital content in the world.
The Publisher Intelligence team is a business analyst team responsible for helping OPG make the best decisions possible using data. As an Analyst on the Publisher Intelligence team, you will be responsible for scoping, initiating and delivering on analytical projects, such as modeling publisher behavior, creating complex SQL workflows and evaluating the impact of projects and products via statistical methods. This requires not only deep analytical and modeling skills but also the ability to develop strategic recommendations based on analysis and communicate and operationalize them (often in conjunction with various other cross-functional stakeholders).
Your role is not about simply grinding out numbers; it is about building new business processes based on data and models to increase efficiency and improve customer satisfaction. You will work in a collaborative role working closely with the various teams within OPG and throughout Google to drive the business decisions that will make our partners more successful.
Google helps our partners find better ways to reach their audiences and manage their digital businesses. In return, our partners provide great content for our products, and they syndicate Google products to enhance their sites and apps. Global Partnerships team members expand and nurture these relationships by continually finding new opportunities and solving technical problems for our partners. The wider Global Partnerships team includes a variety of different organizations, including CorpDev, Emerging Business Development, Strategy and Operations, Google for Entrepreneurs, Area 120 and our Display Advertising Business.
Responsibilities
Initiate, analyze and socialize data projects in conjunction with various cross-functional stakeholders.
Manage and develop data infrastructure in order to bring order and insight to complex datasets.
Understand, analyze and interpret trends in the market that affect the display ads business.
Communicate findings from data and analyses to senior stakeholders, influencing them to make the best decisions possible.
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of work experience as a data analyst, business analyst, product analyst or consultant.
Experience managing and querying datasets using SQL or other languages.

Preferred qualifications:
Bachelor's degree of a quantitative nature (Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, etc.).
Experience with scripting and data analysis languages, such as Python and R.
Organizational and project management skills.
Excellent presentation and verbal/written communication skills.

Drive results with minimal authority

Jobs at Kroger: At Kroger, we hire people who have a passion for helping others and who want to build a relationship with our Customers. No matter what stage of your career, you can build your future at Kroger. We look for people who want more, aspire to be more and work hard to achieve their goals. Our focus on keeping the Customer first is what makes us successful. As the largest traditional grocery chain in the U.S. and one of the world's largest retailers, we employee more than 443,000 Associates across 35 states and the District of Columbia. We offer many opportunities not only in our stores, but in Manufacturing, Logistics, Marketing, Finance, Human Resources, and many other fields.

Company Overview
Kroger Family of Companies employs nearly 443,000 associates who serve customers in 2,796 retail food stores under a variety of local banner names in 35 states and the District of Columbia. Kroger and its subsidiaries operate an expanding ClickList offering – a personalized, order online, pick up at the store service – in addition to 2,253 pharmacies, 787 convenience stores, 324 fine jewelry stores, 1,439 supermarket fuel centers and 38 food production plants in the United States. Kroger is recognized as one of America’s most generous companies for its support of more than 100 Feeding America food bank partners, breast cancer research and awareness, the military and their families, and more than 145,000 community organizations including schools. Careers with The Kroger Co. and our family of companies offer competitive wages, flexible schedules, benefits and room for advancement.

Given the growth that Efficio is going through, we are looking for Business Analysts (BAs) to provide support to project teams working on consulting assignments.

Business Analysts roles are targeted at graduate entry level candidates and are the first step into management consulting.

Although based out of our New York office, our BAs will be on client site up to 4 days a week and therefore need to be flexible to travel.


Working under the guidance of an experienced consultant, their key role is to collect, analyse and synthesise data from a variety of sources. The insights and understandings from their analysis provide important inputs to the project team's recommendations and solutions.


BAs also provide input to client presentations, and work with other team members on day-to-day delivery of projects - for example, they may assist with developing and issuing RFPs and evaluating proposals from suppliers. They interact with clients and their suppliers as needed.


BAs are typically involved in client facing projects at client sites from day one, so they need to be able to learn fast and get up to speed quickly and work effectively under pressure. They must be able to work independently, while also being team players who are willing to contribute wherever needed to ensure the success of the project. The ability to prioritise their work effectively in the face of sometimes competing demands is also essential.


BAs are expected to challenge existing ways of doing things and suggest new ideas. However, they are also expected to be able to justify their conclusions and recommendations with relevant experience and rigorous, fact-based analysis.


Efficio has a collaborative, supportive culture where performance is recognised and success is celebrated. BAs are supported to continually develop their skills and expertise through a comprehensive training and development programme including formal training (through the Efficio Academy), on-the-job training, and coaching and mentoring from experienced consultants and Efficio executives. The opportunities and support that come from a role as an Efficio BA make it an unmatched springboard into a top-tier consulting career.

Essential RequirementsAn exemplary academic background; preferably with a top degree in Engineering, Science, Business, or Economics


Must have the right to work in the USA

Desirable RequirementsStrong analytical skills and problem solving ability


Ability to isolate key issues and draw sound conclusions


Proficiency in the use of Excel and PowerPoint


Proactive, inquiring approach


Strong communicator with the ability to influence stakeholders
