Position/Job Summary
The Project Manager / Business Analyst position is responsible for the direction, coordination, implementation, risk management and completion of multiple projects simultaneously and the overall management of the Information Technology Project portfolio. This will be achieved through collaboration with business and technical staff to gather and translate business requirements into technical definitions which will be used for implementing a solution that aligns with the College’s overall strategic objectives. In addition, this position will perform system, application and data analysis and solution research that where appropriate will result in opportunities to increase efficiencies and enhance the environment across functional boundaries.

Position/Job Responsibilities
1. Lead projects and cross-functional project teams to ensure projects are conceived, designed, planned, tested and executed effectively. This will include tracking, managing and efficiently communicating projects throughout their life cycle while managing risk to ensure that project objectives are met within time, budget, and quality targets.

2. Collaborate with business and technical staff to clarify and document project requirements and objectives, acquire resources, manage third party contractors and control project scope. Assist in the collection and documentation of project objectives, manage stakeholder and project team member expectations and where appropriate identify opportunities that may cross functional and technical boundaries.

3. Analyze, define and document requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, interfaces with other systems, internal and external checks and controls, and reporting. Working with Information Technology staff to ensure that application security meets the business needs and security requirements. Document the business and technical requirements in a consistent manner along with obtaining sign off from business areas. As appropriate, review and suggest business process improvements as part of the project implementation.

4. Work with the Director for Engagement and Client Technologies to implement project management and business analysis best practices, standards, processes and tools within the Information Technology department. Maintain an in-depth knowledge of project management and business analysis methodologies and tools and make recommendations for improvements. Maintain awareness of new and emerging project management and business analysis technologies and their potential application to client projects and requirements.

5. Working with stakeholders, IT management, and Ithaca College legal counsel, review IT related vendor contracts to ensure they accurately reflect project scope and seek optimal value in vendor service to include ROI metrics, performance monitoring, favorable termination criteria, and renewal / annual monetary terms.

6. Develop and demonstrate a multicultural awareness and contribute to cultivating an inclusive, diverse and respectful College community. Demonstrate civil and inclusive behavior when interacting with staff, faculty, students and visitors to the College. Promote a flexible, collaborative and inclusive work and living environment and engage in educational opportunities to increase awareness and understanding of diversity and inclusion.

Position/Job Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a business or Information Technology and a minimum of two years of project management and business analysis experience with projects of various sizes and complexity, or the equivalent combination of education and experience; solid understanding of project management and business analysis skills, tools, techniques, and formal project methodologies; thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements; demonstrated excellent interpersonal and communication skills focusing on consensus building, facilitating collaboration between IT, the business units and the vendors, conflict management and change management, ability to effectively work and interact professionally within a diverse and inclusive environment; ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of managers and subject matter experts and the proven capacity to function independently and as part of a service oriented team are required. PMI-PMP, CCBA, PMI-PBA or other related certification, and experience working in a higher education environment are preferred.

EEO Statement
Ithaca College is committed to building a diverse academic community and encourages members of underrepresented groups to apply. Experience that contributes to the diversity of the college is appreciated.

Instructions for submitting your application:
Interested applicants must apply online at http://ithaca.edu/jobs/ and attach a resume and cover letter. Questions about online application should be directed to the Office of Human Resources at (607) 274-8000. Screening of applications will begin immediately.

Work authorization (select one): Visa sponsorship is not provided for this position

Department description


College Description
At Ithaca College, a comprehensive residential campus community of 6,500 students, we strive to be at the forefront of the higher education landscape. We offer a distinct integrative learning experience that makes students ready for the personal, professional, and global challenges of our age.

We seek candidates who embrace integrative learning and want to be a part of this exciting time in Ithaca College history. We encourage creative collaboration and innovation in our faculty and staff, providing support and resources for them to grow in their fields and lead students to their own innovative ideas and achievements.

We welcome different ways of thinking and look for candidates with unique points of view and life experiences. We are inclusive of individuals with a wide range of cultural, personal, and professional backgrounds, talents, and skills. Our campus is a vibrant and rewarding community where diverse minds can learn, succeed, and excel.

When reviewing candidates, we are looking for indicators of a number of core competencies. Prospective candidates must be adaptable, collaborative, inclusive, respectful, responsive, results driven, and sustainable. They must communicate effectively, demonstrate leadership, exhibit professional integrity and ethics, take initiative, value personal and professional development, and show that they will engage in the college.

Nestled in the heart of New York State’s scenic Finger Lakes region, Ithaca College sits atop South Hill overlooking picturesque Cayuga Lake and is just minutes away from the city center. Combining small town warmth and charm with the vibrancy of a college community, the thriving and culturally diverse city of Ithaca has been rated by Kiplinger’s as one of the top 10 places to live in the United States.

To learn more about Ithaca College, visit us at http://ithaca.edu

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as a liaison between MARIS users and development teams whereby he/she assists in defining requirements to support agency(s) needs.

Provide inputs on developing project plans and monitoring performance.

Business Analyst

The Business Analyst will work with the Vice President of Sales Operations and Sales Management Team to support sales planning & analysis. The team will look to the Business Analyst to help establish/streamline policies and procedures throughout the department, support best practices in sales forecasting, reporting, and communications. As the Business Analyst, your responsibilities would include data analysis, reporting, market research, competitive analysis, planning, and sales process optimization. Ideal candidates will have Business Analysis experience, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced and fun environment.

The Basics
Track and analyze key metrics – pipeline growth, quota attainment.
Collect, consolidate and generate weekly sales forecasts (month and quarter focus) and roll up each week’s numbers to Sales Management.
Compile key pieces of information related to performance against sales objectives to be reviewed by Management and report approved plans to Finance for processing.
Proactively analyzes win-loss data and reports on key findings to sales leadership.
Develop presentations that analyze sales and marketing activities and achievements from SalesForce.com or similar SFA applications.
Reporting and analysis for the Sales and Marketing departments, including: executive reporting of sales and marketing results, key metrics and KPIs, campaign tracking and analysis, and ad hoc strategic analysis.
Implements and manages reports and dashboards in Salesforce.com ensuring sales reps and leaders have access to key data required to successfully manage the business.
Monitors the accuracy and efficient distribution of sales reports and external intelligence essential to the sales organization. Recommends revisions to existing reports, or assists in the development of new reporting tools as needed.
What You Bring
3-plus years in a Business Analyst or similar role; management.
Bachelor’s in Accounting, Finance, Business, Marketing or related degree (MBA preferred)
Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical abilities.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Ability to perform SalesForce.com administrative functions is a plus.
Excellent systems skills including Excel & PowerPoint are required.
What We Bring
Excellent benefits package including medical, dental, and vision, and a 401k with company matching so you can continue planning for robust financial wellness.
Employee discounts on things like, mobile products and services, gym memberships, and a variety of additional entertainment options.
Work Life Balance. We get that we all live busy lives, to the degree your role allows, we recognize the need and value of balance and seek to support our employees’ engagement in the pursuit of it.

In-depth knowledge of business operations and processes with ability to articulate these processes to others.

People leadership experience.

Business Analyst - Junior

This position assists project leaders by scoping the proposed solution leading to accurate cost and time estimates. In addition the position will create and assist others in the writing of user documentation, instructions, test scripts and procedures.


The candidate is expected to learn all aspects of one or several commercial segments of WFS and become the IT SME in the financial operations of that segment.


This position contributes individually to IT deliverables and produces simple IT work products individually. Main responsibilities include:
Review, analyze and evaluate business systems, processes, and company needs
Gather business needs
Run and facilitate workshops with business users and IT staff
Prepare and deliver presentations to technical and non-technical audiences
Provide analysis, definition, and direction to software development activities
Lead system enhancements initiatives by designing and formulating solutions. Act as the liaison between the business and the technical team members through the solution delivery process.
Assist project leaders by scoping the proposed solution leading to accurate cost and time estimates
Lead functional acceptance testing of enhancements, patches and upgrades.
Perform system troubleshooting in a production support environment.
Assist users in solving both functional and system issues within agreed-to service level agreements (SLAs).
Provide end-user instruction, training and support to resolve application issues.
Assist in designing and formulating solutions.
Act as the liaison between the business and the technical team members through the solution delivery process.

Systems development life cycle (SDLC) experience preferred
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Responsible for supporting Sales Operations team by systematically picking orders, preparing mass pick files, manage system blocks when needed, inventory reconciliation, etc. Review inventory to ensure optimization of order book conversion and finding excess reduction opportunities. Drive and manage problem solving and continuous improvement initiatives as related to order management, system promising, and business operations execution.

Collaborate with Sales and Service to execute specific ball, accessory, and equipment picks that may not otherwise go automatically.
Make decisions on optimal pick percentage and pick date ranges to manage warehouse capacity and meet customer expectations for deliveries.

Coordinate product launch preparation (blocking, pricing, aligning ship dates to supply)
Proactively work cross-departmentally to optimize CRM and ERP systems, ensuring accurate availability and promising is effectively communicated
Support Oracle training documentation

Responsible for reporting KPI’s and ad-hoc based on business needs

Overview

You possess a high level of customer focus and service excellence as you seek practical solutions
You have strong collaboration skills with internal/external customers and cross-functional teams
You have superb social skills, “can do” attitude and team player in global environment
You possess effective time-management skills and the ability to prioritize work assignments

About Next Street
Where teamwork and entrepreneurship meet
Next Street was founded in 2005 with the belief that small businesses and nonprofits are the engines of inclusive growth in underserved markets. Serving as trusted advisor to some of the country’s most dynamic organizations, we are a mission-driven consulting firm bringing strategic and financial expertise to revitalize communities, grow businesses, and create jobs. Our work includes directly serving small businesses and nonprofits to help them grow, as well as advising public and private institutions at a systems level to drive sustainable and equitable development solutions in communities across the US.
We look for professionals who aim to combine their diverse backgrounds and experiences with a passion for mission, offering our team members an unparalleled opportunity to work at the intersection of doing well and doing good. Next Street is a for-profit ‘business for good’ and a certified B Corporation with offices in Boston, New York City, and Chicago.
About the Position: Business Analyst
A junior level position, the Business Analyst will play a supporting role in developing and improving Next Street’s internal business infrastructure in partnership with Corporate and firm leadership. The Business Analyst will report to our Finance & Operations Manager, with significant day-to-day collaboration across other members of our Corporate team. Your work will include supporting multiple dimensions of firm operations, examples include working in Salesforce, data reporting/analytics and technology solutions. As a small firm, we offer significant opportunity to stretch and we are seeking candidates with an entrepreneurial drive, a collaborative spirit, and an appetite to contribute in building the firm.
Your work:
Partner across members of the Corporate team to learn, manage, and improve Next Street’s overall business systems technology infrastructure, including:
Researching technology platforms and identifying new or creative ways to streamline aspects of the firm’s internal business operations
Managing the design and implementation, ongoing maintenance, and continuous improvement efforts
 Leading day-to-day project management and coordination for upgrades or changes on software platforms
Overseeing and enforcing systems/data policies and controls
Work with Corporate and firm leadership on the ongoing development and production of reporting/analytics solutions, with the goals of:
Driving real-time knowledge and decision-making
Streamlining existing reporting tools in use
Strategically automating dashboards and increasing functionalities
Support the Finance & Operations Manager specifically with the day-to-day financial and operational management functions of the firm, such as:
Improving and streamlining the firm’s processes and procedures
Managing and maintaining key financial and operational analytics
Assist with additional strategic or special project initiatives as needed


We are looking for someone with:
Bachelors Degree in Business Administration or Finance
2+ years of experience working in a professional environment, preferably in a business or finance role
Experience in Quickbooks or Salesforce
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel
Deep interest in Next Street's mission and work
Excellent planning, prioritization, and organizational skills, including the ability to effectively manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
A passion for continuous improvement and exploration of new solutions or technologies
Strong attention to detail and a problem-solving mindset
A desire to build a business and an appetite to take entrepreneurial initiative
A demonstrated capacity for collaboration and teamwork at all levels of tenure
A willingness to challenge and be challenged, regardless of seniority


Want to learn more?

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will identify and research business needs and then determine solutions to business problems. Solutions often include a software-systems development component but may also consist of process improvement, organizational change or strategic planning and policy development. You will work closely with business and technical teams and understands the business needs as to ensure there is integration between business and technology. The Senior Business Analyst also understands development processes (SDLC) and/or business workflow processes and is very analytical with problem-solving and conflict resolution skills to help identify, communicate and resolve issues.

A Senior Business Analyst may perform any of the following activities: Feasibility analysis, scope projects, and work with the project management team to prioritizes deliverables and negotiate on product functionality; create detailed Business Requirement Document (BRD) or Business Process documentation (as applicable) and translate it into functional specifications; provide analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation; partner with development and analytic teams to provide reporting on software solutions; participate in Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.

Key activities that will ensure client and project success include:
Ability to influence others to gain consensus on a desired outcome
Ability to assume the responsibilities of an overall solution owner, with limited advising: gathers and analyzes information and uses it to develop effective solutions to difficult problems or situations; devises workable solutions or consults with secondary resources to devise solutions; proactively raises risks and implements fixes and changes as needed to keep small problems from becoming big problems.
Investigates and acts to meet customers’ current and future needs. Gives customer needs priority and responds quickly to customer concerns. Builds positive and fruitful customer relationships.
Effectively uses systems and processes to measure, monitor, manage, or impact performance. Puts resources and or processes into logical, comprehensible order.
Creative and critical thinker with the ability to develop original ideas, approaches, and solutions to typical, unusual or difficult situations and problems. Exhibits constructive, non-traditional thinking. Creates, from scratch or from plans, high-quality designs or work products.
Negotiates or mediates sound agreements in business or organizational situations where there is disagreement or difference in interest.
Successfully closes negotiations achieving best possible outcomes. Creatively approaches negotiations.
Writes, speaks, and presents information effectively and persuasively across communication settings.
Ability to present in various group settings with or without the use of technology.
Exhibits composure while in the spotlight and conveys information eloquently.

Requirements
Preferably 3-5 years of experience in consulting, software/technology, or non-profit
Can effectively connect with a variety of audiences both internal and customer.
Ability to mentor, coach, and guide Associate and Staff Business Analysts as needed
Experience with direct marketing, accounting, or fundraising campaigns highly desirable
Knowledge of Blackbaud products and the non-profit industry are a plus
CBAP certification or PMI-PBA desirable but not required
Ability to travel up to 75%

Why you’ll want to come work here:
Competitive salary (commission/bonus based on type of role), 4 weeks paid time off, great benefits (medical, dental, vision, FSA), 401K match
Gift matching, volunteer for vacation program, and endless community involvement opportunities
Named to Forbes’ Fast Tech 25 and Fortune’s Change the World List; we are growing and offer incredible opportunity for advancement

Agile Business Analyst

Position Summary:

The overarching goal of Business Analysis role is to promote the design and build of quality services to enable business processes.

Business analysts facilitate business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of all or part of a business in terms of business functions and processes. The Business Analysis role is responsible for supporting the 1) development of functional and non-functional requirements during the initial phases of the software development lifecycle and 2) management of requirements throughout the duration of the lifecycle.

Senior business analysts facilitate business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of all or part of a business in terms of business functions and processes. They successfully manage the requirements development process through the elicitation, analysis, specification and verification of multiple levels of requirements while providing continuous improvement to the process and methods. Work is often self-initiated. They may have significant responsibility for the work of others and assisting the team in whatever format as possible – testing, UI, Story Writing, Process modeling, etc. They develop business relationships with customers. A senior business analyst undertakes work which requires the application of fundamental principles in a wide and often unpredictable range of contexts. We are looking for someone with intermediate skills in Agile and the Story Author role in Agile. Product Owner experience a plus.

Essential Functions of the Job:

The responsibilities of the Business Analysis role is to:

Plan, estimate and socialize the business analysis approach. This information will be provided to and used by the team and project manager for the purpose to estimating time and effort.
Identify the business need for the change by understanding the problem the business is trying to solve or the opportunities to improve the business. This may include assessing the current capabilities of the business to support the business need.
Requirements that are created must be (at all levels) understandable, unambiguous and capable of being implemented and tested.
o User stories
o Acceptance criteria/Scenarios
o Process flow diagrams
o User role definitions
o Activity diagrams
o Data glossary & definition
o Sequence diagrams
o Data flow diagrams
o User interfaces




Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities:

Develop requirements through the elicitation, analysis, specification and verification. This yields multiple levels of requirements in support of the business vision
Performing an active role in the User Story and Backlog creation process
Provides creative/innovative ideas in the context of the product owner’s vision
o Writes user stories, acceptance criteria and accepts functionality
o Writes technical stories as appropriate
o Investigates the “back story” to provide clear acceptance criteria
o Interacts with subject matter experts
o Advises the product owner on prioritization of the product backlog
o Getting user stories in the hands of the developers and testers as quickly as possible

Advising developers & testers
o Support them as they ask detailed questions
o Provide clarification during development of story functionality

Key Attributes of a BA
o Facilitator
o Logical
o Dependable

Knowledge and Skills Requirements:

Thought leadership and technical guidance to engineering staff
Be able to be flexible in project assignments as the project’s prioritization may change on a frequent basis

Other Requirements:

Be able to be a critical thinker and open to exploring ideas concepts that may be foreign to them

Job Requirements:

Education:
University degree in a technical field preferred

Experience:

IT background with experience across the systems development life cycle with experience in different project phases
Very good understanding of the customer strategy, services and business processes
Knowledge of service transition methodology, tools and templates
Ability to create User Stories and work in an Agile environment
Track record of customer focus, based on openness, trust, and delivering on promises
Be able to proficiently use TFS, Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Visio


Language Requirements:
English


Soft Skills/Behavioral Requirements:

Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills
Ability to work and team effectively with IT Services groups and other management personnel including on a global, virtual basis
Track record of customer focus, based on openness, trust, and delivering on promises
Management skills to manage more than one transition simultaneously
Excellent written and verbal communication skills – must be able to communicate fluently in English both verbally and in writing
Be a skilled Story Author
Be able to effectively collaborate with other disciplines throughout the business analysis process
Be able to time box activities such that Requirements can be base-lined prior to design and build processes
Be able to perform impact assessments prior to processing changes in order to provide clear and concise holistic impact(s) to a system based on change(s) requested

Job Description:
JOB OBJECTIVE : Finance role responsible for maintaining the financial integrity and accuracy of assigned vendor funds programs.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Financial accounting responsibilities include the calculation of rebate receivable and inventory reserve for vendor programs.
Program description optimization – make recommendations to sourcing regarding changes to vendor agreements in order to maximize revenue.
Program tier optimization - regularly track and suggest alternative purchasing plans in order to optimally achieve purchasing tiers and related revenue.
Communicate with vendor to ensure compliance with sourcing agreements, resolve issues and streamline the process
Provide direction to accounting department regarding the allocation of payments to individual business units.
Assist in the creation of sourcing agreements to ensure that agreements are clear and understood by all parties
Ensure that negotiated vendor program details are accurately reflected in rebate calculation software
Reconcile vendor payments against defined program parameters to ensure receipt of accurate and timely payment
Analyze and compare vendor submitted information to our internal information to ensure that all eligible purchases are included in the rebate calculation
Responsible for collection of vendor payments and supporting data
Meet with sourcing managers on a regular basis to update them on the status of their respective programs
Communicate with sourcing managers and Finance on vendor program status and issues

Other
Represent the company in a professional manner at all times ensuring quality customer service
Abide by all policies, rules, and regulations of the company including all applicable safety rules, regulations and procedures
Support corporate programs, goals, and initiatives of the company
Work overtime as needed

Four year degree s trongly preferred; or equivalent work experience
Medium to advanced knowledge of Excel, Access, Cognos and Sharepoint
Strong analytical and organizational skills
Must possess excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a fast paced environment
Fundamental knowledge of the supply chain process

PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENTS:
Effective financial management of assigned vendor programs
Timeliness and accuracy of work product
Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines

The University of North Carolina Health Care System has an opening for a highly motivated individual interested in joining our team to provide operational and administrative support to our Managed Pharmacy Solution team as a Managed Pharmacy Solutions Business Analyst. Managed Pharmacy Solutions consists of pharmacist-led Population Health Management through the Carolina Assessment of Medications Program (CAMP) Clinic and Pharmacy Benefits services.

The Managed Pharmacy Solutions Business Analyst serves in an analytical and consultative capacity providing data driven insights and actionable information to drive improvement, increase efficiency, and implement best practices. The Managed Pharmacy Solutions Business Analyst will work with a team of pharmacists, technicians, and analysts to provide daily support regarding operations of population health and pharmacy benefits services.

Analytical and independent problem solving skills, including experience analyzing and communicating data into insights that drive decisive actionAbility to manage multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneouslyOrganizational SkillsSelf-initiativeCollaborativeAttention to detailCommunications with team and stakeholders regarding data, information requests, and status

ContractTitle: Business Analyst

Start Date: Immediate

Rate: Negotiable

Duration: 6 month - CTH

Location: San Antonio, TX

This is a contract to permanent role is not eligible for visa sponsorship per client policy. Candidates must be authorized to work for any employer in the US as a precondition of employment. Vendor submittals that require sponsorship will not be considered.

Overview:
The Business Analyst's responsibilities for working with stakeholder to elicit, analyze, specify and validate business requirements to meet business needs. This includes, but is not limited to, developing business requirements and assisting business teams with documenting and submitting requests for system development, maintenance, and enhancements. Coordinating the review and testing of system changes. Tracking day-to-day compliance with standard operation procedures including controls for SSAE 16 (SOC-1) audit. The Business Analyst will assist the department’s leadership developing departmental strategies to meet the evolving regulatory and contractual requirements.

Responsibilities:

Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, simplify requirements, decompose high-level information into details
Collaborate with business users, developers and subject matter experts to analyze trade-offs between usability and performance needs
Use industry standard requirements gathering techniques
Capture information necessary to evaluate impact of requested changes
Evaluate and scope requirement change requests
Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions
Handle multiple initiatives simultaneously
Act as a liaison between the clients, technology teams, QA teams and support team
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

Minimum of 5 years' relevant work experience within health care or the insurance field.
Knowledge and understanding of the government-sponsored health plans and public sector managed care industry, more specifically Medicare Advantage plans and Medicaid Managed Care Organizations (MCOs) and their requirements highly desired.
Proficient with technology, including:
Defining rules and workflows for BPMS
Working with multi-tiered systems, including CMS
Working with database concepts
Portal Design
UI/UX
Requires understanding of a broad range of business processes and related systems
Requires ability to develop good working relationships with business sponsors, business partners, and technical staff

Business Analyst
Job Functions and Responsibilities
Business Analyst: The Business Analyst facilitates business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of all or part of a business in terms of business functions and processes. They manage the requirements development process through the elicitation, analysis, specification and verification of multiple levels of requirements (business, stakeholder, solution) and support the ongoing management of the requirements. Business Analyst creates viable and consumable specifications including acceptance criteria in preparation for the sign-off, construction and testing of solutions. The Business Analyst is expected to act independently to deliver and manage requirements to schedule, budget and scope; and is self-driven and motivated.

building organization and structure to requirements to drive out and define detailed requirements in an efficient mannerWork with the project manager and the business customer(s) to define requirements stakeholders, requirements conflict resolution procedures and the requirements team structureUnderstands multiple project management methodologies/software development approaches and defines the appropriate deliverables through project phases (i.e. planning, analysis, specification and validation)Proficient requirement meeting facilitator, demonstrated experience in facilitating sessions (10 to 20 people) using techniques to help define scope and requirements during the lifecycleResponsible for ensuring change control and change management procedures are followed within the project team as they relate to requirementsDetermine, understand and document the business case and project scopeEnsure that quality business analysis standards are met through the effective implementation or use of approved processes, best practices, methodologies and deliverablesSelect the appropriate methods to elicit and document requirementsDefine the procedures on how the requirements will be managed (i.e. base lining requirements, requirements, change control and requirements traceability)Assess change requests related to requirements to assess overall impact

The Business Analyst will be responsible for drawing conclusions and making recommendations to management on an appropriate course of action by analyzing sales data, census data, competitive information, scan data, pricing figures, industry data (such as Adams or Impact) and any other applicable sources of information. Analyses may include sales forecasting, opportunity identification and evaluation of program performance. Role also entails the development of sales templates as needed.
Responsibilities
Prepares materials for supplier-planning meetings by aggregating and reviewing Focus Marketing data, internal sales data, spend data, important demographic and socioeconomic developments and pricing and category trends. Attends and contributes to meetings as appropriate by providing any commentary on analyses or pulling relevant data during the meeting as necessary.
Evaluates the potential impact of pricing modifications or prospective programming elements by reviewing pertinent sales data, research and comparable examples to forecast sales.
Uncovers market and brand opportunities by developing an understanding of category, customer and market dynamics and using this knowledge to assess brand performance.
Measures risk to sales plan (gap analysis) by comparing the plan to historical sales data, current trend information and marketplace developments; reports potential shortfalls to management.
Develops sales templates; collaborates with Business Managers, Division Manager or General Sales Manager to identify business needs and designs appropriate, replicable reports. Trains administrative staff on process to recreate/run templates.
Package data for sales materials by working with Business Manager/Marketing Director to ascertain needed information and converting data into concise facts and visuals that can be easily incorporated into sell sheets, concept sells or presentations.
Uncovers drivers for important changes in sales performance by reviewing appropriate competitive and internal data.
Measures ROI on selected programming by working with Business Managers and Marketing Director to determine evaluation criteria.
Develops business review content by working with the Supplier, Business Manager and Sales Management to analyze sales performance, develop business case, and incorporate data into templates.
Completes all necessary training programs by attending, participating, and passing all required tests as defined by management. (e.g. FOCUS MARKETING, ANALYTICAL TRAINING).
Maintains customer and supplier confidence by keeping appropriate information confidential.
Maintains a safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules and regulations.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Qualifications
High School diploma or equivalent required.
Ability to hold a Solicitor’s Permit required.
Financial, marketing or business analysis experience; consumer packaged goods or data provider (e.g. IRI, Nielsen) background a plus.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bi-lingual a plus, but not required
Bachelor’s degree preferred and/or equivalent training and work experience
Thinks outside the box; searches for innovative solutions
KNOWLEDGE / SKILLS
Highly fluent in Excel and relational database programs. Strong knowledge of Power Point.
Must be a result oriented professional with excellent verbal/written communication skills using diplomacy and discretion as well as strong customer service skills.
Ability to multi-task, works independently and/or within a team, pays attention to detail and meet deadlines.

POSITION SUMMARY: The Business Analyst will perform economic and financial evaluations to support the activities, goals and objectives of the Business Development Department. He/she will perform analyses that determine preliminary and final financial rates of return for business development projects. He/she will monitor business development projects and work with the Business Development Department and various other corporate groups to assess anticipated vs. actual performance.

This position will also play a key role in the yearly budgeting process and preparing information and documentation for regular board of director meetings. This person will be charged with the task of preparing authorization requests (AR) for capital expenditures.

This position will report to, receive direction from, and review activities and analyses with the Supervisor of Financial Analytical Services. The position will be integral to the Business Development team. Regular interaction with corporate engineering, operations, contract, accounting, gas/NGL marketing, business development, planning and treasury personnel, along with executive management and customers, will be required to create, evaluate and report data, statistics and information related to corporate and business development projects.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
Performs discounted cash flow evaluations that incorporate existing and potential revenues, capital requirements, operating and maintenance expenses, growth opportunities, operating synergies, gas and liquids supplies, risks, and other aspects related to new project development.Accurately develops, reviews, and maintains economic and financial models, including budgets, which provide detailed analyses/valuations of business development projects.Prepares authorization requests (ARs) for capital projects.Prepares ad hoc analyses and materials that support business development activities.
SUPERVISORY DUTIES:

None
JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor Degree with major in Finance or Accounting.Must possess knowledge of gas and liquids gathering and transportation, processing, fractionation, and marketing businesses.Must exhibit keen reasoning and attention to detail in order to develop accurate and complete analyses, economics, and financial models.Experienced in collecting, analyzing, and summarizing statistical data.Must have extensive experience working with and creating MS Excel spreadsheets.Must be a great team player and be able to work closely with other MarkWest associates and customers.Must be a self-starter who requires minimal supervision.Must have very strong written and verbal communication skills.Must have strong work ethic with very high integrity.Must be respected among industry peers for knowledge and professional conduct.
WORKING CONDITIONS:

Physical Demands:

This position requires sitting throughout most of the day. It will involve some lifting and filing. On occasion there will be outside office assignments that can involve walking around construction sites, industrial locations, field and/or wooded areas.

Working Environment:

Generally working in an office environment, however, may require visiting and walking around some construction and industrial sites, farm properties, driving on rural roads, and other field locations, to acquire familiarity with facilities, properties and settings.

Materials and Equipment Used:

The materials and equipment used on a regular basis will be a personal computer, phone, fax, copier and map printer/plotter.


About Marathon Petroleum Corporation
Headquartered in Findlay, Ohio, Marathon Petroleum Corporation (MPC) operates an integrated refining, marketing and transportation system.
MPC is the nation's second-largest refiner, with a crude oil refining capacity of approximately 1.9 million barrels per calendar day in its six-refinery system. Marathon brand gasoline is sold through approximately 5,600 independently owned retail outlets across 20 states and the District of Columbia. In addition, Speedway LLC, an MPC subsidiary, owns and operates the nation's second-largest convenience store chain, with approximately 2,730 convenience stores in 21 states.
Through subsidiaries, MPC owns the general partner of MPLX LP, a midstream master limited partnership. Primarily through MPLX, MPC owns, leases or has ownership interests in approximately 10,800 miles of crude oil and light product pipelines. Also through MPLX, MPC has ownership interests in gathering and processing facilities with approximately 5.9 billion cubic feet per day of gathering capacity, 8.2 billion cubic feet per day of natural gas processing capacity and 610,000 barrels per day of fractionation capacity.
MPC's fully integrated system provides operational flexibility to move crude oil, NGLs, feedstocks and petroleum-related products efficiently through the company's distribution network and midstream service businesses in the Midwest, Northeast, East Coast, Southeast and Gulf Coast regions.

Job Function: MarkWest
Travel Expected: Up to 25%

Job Description
Come be part of earth’s most customer-centric company! As Amazon grows, we need smart, creative, action-oriented individuals from all cultures and communities to join our Worldwide Returns & ReCommerce organization. Worldwide Returns & ReCommerce enhances the relationship with Amazon’s customers through support options and a returns process that is simple, transparent, and convenient. We work to reduce returns by helping customers keep what they bought and removing defects that would cause a return (Zero Defects). When items are returned or damaged, we maximize reuse and recovery to achieve Zero Cost of Returns and Zero Product Waste, benefiting people, planet, and profit.

We are looking for a skilled Business Analyst to support Returns business teams. The ideal candidate has strong business acumen, excellent analytic abilities and superior written and verbal communication. They must demonstrate ownership and work well with diverse stakeholders. The candidate will have a strong bias towards data-driven decision-making and will be comfortable with ambiguity while working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. As an Analyst on the Returns team, you will be working closely with Sr. Managers, Sr. PMs, Data Engineering, and Business Intelligence Engineers, to analyze data, measure performance, and inform high-impact decisions across Returns teams in Defect Elimination, Customer Experience and Returns Transportation.

Your responsibilities will include:
Identifying, developing and executing data analyses to answer key business questions and uncover areas of business opportunities
Work with various Returns business teams to design and implement metrics and reporting solutions to support business objectives
Learn and understand a broad range of Returns data resources and provide consultation to business leaders and PMs
Manage and execute entire medium-sized projects or components of large, complex projects from start to finish including data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, and root cause analysis and problem solving.
Basic Qualifications

3-5 years of experience as a Business/Financial Analyst, BI Engineer or Systems Analyst preferably in an internet-based company with large, complex data sources.
Ability to identify projects independently while working across multiple internal and external teams
Ability to work effectively with Data Engineers and BI Engineers to mine the right data sources efficiently and accurately.
Proficient SQL skills, mastery of Tableau and Excel.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use hard data and metrics to solve ambiguous analyses, complete root cause analyses, and derive recommendations that drive business results
Ability to manage timelines and deliverables of multiple analytic projects while providing effective program communications
Strong verbal and written communications skills that enable you to communicate insights and recommendations to Sr. Leaders
Bachelor’s degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business, Finance or any related field from an accredited institution.
Preferred Qualifications
Preferred Qualifications

Advanced degree in Business Administration, Math, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Finance, or any related field from an accredited institution.
High levels of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information.
Experience working in a lean, successful start-up or on a new product team where continuous innovation is desired and ambiguity is the norm.
Experience in Data Mining and Visualization (AWS BI solutions, ETL, complex data warehouses)
Familiarity and comfort with statistics and use of statistical applications such as R, Stata or SAS.

Work with the Technical Analyst and development team to ensure that they understand the specifications. Work with training team to document system scenarios and identify roles impacted and helps develop a change management/training plan. Conduct business process modeling and generate applicable scenarios for the technology functionality testing team.

You will be responsible to identify, assess, and document business requirements, recommending business priorities, and advising business on options, risks, and costs. Conduct research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business unit, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible. Assist Quality Management team to ensure that requirements documentation can be easily translated into test plans, and ensure that the proper testing plans have been completed. Facilitate implementation of new functionality through training sessions, demos, and the development of appropriate documentation. Provide relevant test scenarios for the testing team. Work with test team to develop system integration test scripts and ensure the testing results correspond to the business expectations.

Experience setting up test scenarios
Experience/understanding of business process reengineering and business modeling concepts, business systems development and analysis

Strong analytical skills and writing skills, to include solid experience in writing functional and technical specifications

JOB TITLE: Business Analyst
DEPARTMENT: Solutions and Innovation
REPORTS TO: EVP of Solutions and Innovation

PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
The Business Analyst (BA) is a key member of the Product team that works with subject matter experts and stakeholders to innovate ideas and identify essential product features and functionality for development. By collaborating with subject matter experts, examining requirements from a variety of perspectives, and documenting information clearly, the BA is a leader in ensuring solutions are brought to life expediently, accurately, and efficiently. BA’s are key in managing scope and maintaining alignment between stakeholders, as well as staying organized. Through the creation of requirements documents, traceability matrices, statements of work, and internal specification documents, the BA ensures all understand what they need to understand to achieve the vision.

The Business Analyst works with clients, Operations, Technology, Product, and Project Management to ensure the highest level of accuracy and planning in meeting goals. This role reports to the Executive Vice President, Solutions and Innovation.

Essential Functions

BUSINESS OBJECTIVES
Ensure stakeholders have appropriate clarity to be successful.Facilitate effective use of resources.Develop technical solutions.Improve product performance and value.Increase operational efficiency and collaboration.Enable Cloudbreak to win new business and retain existing business.

o Use multiple channels to draw forth needs, vision and stimulate discussion.
o Conduct interviews, hold focus groups, participate in discovery meetings, analyze and discuss use cases.
o Document needs
o Produce customary project artifacts such as business requirement documents, summaries, traceability matrices, flow charts, and diagrams.
Planning
o Discuss scope of projects with stakeholders.
o Ensure sign off.
o Assist in resource allocation.
o Map out timelines with project managers.
o Help manage expectations.
Project Management
o Monitor adherence to requirements.
o Identify scope creep.
o Elevate changes for discussion and resolution.
o Document change orders.
Testing

o Outline and assist in management of User Acceptance Testing process.
o Document exceptions.
o Facilitate resolution of exceptions with project manager.

Position Profile:

The Business Analyst within the Product Management department will have primary responsibilities including translating business needs into requirements, workflows, and designs that can be utilized by development and QA staff to achieve product, business and customer goals. The Business Analyst is required to have an in-depth understanding and knowledge of our products, in how they are installed, structured, and function.


Job Responsibilities:

Elicit business requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, business scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Work independently with customers, users, external and internal resources, both functional and technical, to define concepts and solutions.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal resources to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements, Business Requirements, Use Cases, UI Screen design / workflow requirements and technical Interface designs, through appropriate assessment and functional specification documents.
Present proposed solutions to Product Managers for review and approval prior to providing to customers.
Along with reviewing and assessing customer feedback, refine and represent functional and technical designs as requirements, cost and time restrictions change.
Work with QA to develop test scenarios, performing functional testing, and/or oversee testing prior to delivery to customer
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Serve as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development teams through which requirements flow.
Conduct requirements knowledge transfer sessions with the technical and support teams in the organization.
Required Skills and Experience:

Bachelors or master’s degree in computer science, business, or related field (1-5 year of equivalent experience will also qualify)
Able to demonstrate working knowledge of agile software development methodology
Familiarity with common operating systems e.g. Windows, Linux and applications such as Microsoft Office, Microsoft Project)
Able to display strong experience with systems analysis and functional design as it relates specifically to screen mock-ups and site navigation.
Experience working with an internal development team consisting of other Business Analysts, Software Architects, Software Engineers UX Designers, and Quality Assurance Testers.
Project planning skills with the ability to handle large work-load, facilitate the activities of dynamic workgroups, and multi-task in a demanding environment.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with technical, business, and management staff.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to develop cohesive working relationships with internal and external clients.
Be professional, organized and be able to prioritize and manage own workload
Possess characteristics such as adaptability, positivity and proactiveness. Must also be calm under pressure and have strong customer service skills
Crypto-currency, blockchain and/or capital markets knowledge preferred
AlphaPoint is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability or genetic information, gender identity or national origin

Understanding of and experience with extracting business requirements from direct interviews with users, business process owners, and IT.

Regarding user interviews, candidate must be able to identify and understand workflows, data touch points and interactions with systems such that use cases and user stories can be created that “leave no stone unturned” and are comprehensive, exhaustive and ensure the solution will meet ALL requirements.

Business Analyst candidates should have an eye toward BPI and Innovation while understanding the WHY of current state BPs, workflows, data sources, data uses, and be able to identify ALL “players” (human, software, data source, etc.) in each BP / workflow. Their work product should expose data integration points. Their experience and skill should allow them to quickly identify where the integration challenges and major affected systems lie inside the solution AND at the boundaries.

Regarding IT, the candidate MUST be able to speak (and understand) their language and use their terms correctly. Successful Bas understand and have experience in BOTH business and technology. Their career path should be headed toward Solution Architect and recent work experience should exhibit that aspiration. They should enjoy being mentored by EA / SA roles. They should understand major HW platforms, SW packages, the role of databases, why SOA adds value and what that value is, the role of “Cloud”, the impact of Mobile, and some appreciation of custom SW vs. package integration.

In all cases, their work products should “stand alone” and be clearly understood by other team members anywhere in the world without rework or excessive explanation.

The CRM Business Analyst will support the government Product Owner in collaboration with business stakeholders to develop product solution business requirements for Agile Scrum development teams. As such, they must develop an in-depth understanding of the customer’s business processes, user profiles, solution objectives, expectations, and priorities and be able to articulate and effectively communicate those topics to the development teams in the form of both use cases and user stories. The successful candidate will have experience in eliciting requirements, translating requirements to user stories, elaborating processes into use cases and assist in mapping business functionality to system technical requirements as well as writing a variety of associated design and requirements documentation. Excellent written and verbal communication and collaboration skills are essential to this role.

Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with client stakeholders to understand business needs and processes and elicit clear, concise user requirements supporting the business case
Define “as-is” and “to-be” business processes; conduct and document gap analyses
Requirements management and analysis using specified IBM Rational tools
Translate user requirements, into simplified, well-organized user stories accompanied by clearly defined acceptance criteria
Collaborate with an Agile team to facilitate development and testing in support of user requirements
Use business requirements to drive the design or review of test cases, process change requests, and help manage project scope, product acceptance, installation and production deployment

Required Qualifications
5 years of relevant experience
Bachelor's Degree (Degree in Engineering, or a related scientific or technical discipline is required)
8 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education
Experience working with customers, users and project leads in analyzing, designing, implementing and supporting IT business applications and systems
Knowledge in testing functionality, matching to requirements, and in having primary responsibility for individual projects and systems

Candidates who do not meet the required qualifications will not be considered.

Additional Minimum Qualifications
Demonstrated success in eliciting business requirements and process flows
Demonstrated experience managing requirements documentation in a tool such as IBM Rational Tool Suite
Experience working in an Agile scrum solution development and testing environment
1+ years of experience analyzing requirements for custom MS Dynamics CRM 2015/2016 applications
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Must be able to pass a background check to obtain a VA Public Trust (High-Risk) clearance

Preferred Qualifications
Experience working in the Federal Government, Veteran’s Administration (VA) experience a plus
Experience performing business analysis and requirements elicitation/elaboration at Department of Veterans Affairs
2+ years experience with either VA Veteran-focused Integration Project (VIP) or CRM or VBMS
Experience working in a geographically dispersed project team environment
Active VA Public Trust (High-Risk) clearance

Discover Vanderbilt University Medical Center:
Located in Nashville, Tennessee, and operating at a global crossroads of teaching, discovery and patient care, VUMC is a community of individuals who come to work each day with the simple aim of changing the world. It is a place where your expertise will be valued, your knowledge expanded and your abilities challenged. It is a place where your diversity — of culture, thinking, learning and leading — is sought and celebrated. It is a place where employees know they are part of something that is bigger than themselves, take exceptional pride in their work and never settle for what was good enough yesterday. Vanderbilt’s mission is to advance health and wellness through preeminent programs in patient care, education, and research.

Department/Unit Summary
Our department sources, purchases services, supplies, and equipment which supports education, research and patient care. Our mission is to collectively support the purpose and goals of Vanderbilt University Medical Center by sourcing and purchasing quality products, equipment and services at competitive prices, payment management of vendor invoices, payment cards and travel by providing excellent customer service that meet or exceed the Medical Center’s requirements, and to perform our services to the highest ethical and professional standards.
Sourcing includes 12 Sourcing Officers, 3 Analysts, 1 Clinical Coordinator. Purchasing includes 14 team members; Disbursements includes 18 members supporting invoice processing, payment, travel and payment cards; Supply Chain Systems team includes 4 members supporting PMM, OptiFlex/POU, eProcurement and PeopleSoft.
Your Role:
Responsible for analyzing financial and business data and offering detailed analysis and solutions that can be acted upon.
Partner with others in the organization to interpret and manage financial and business reports in an effort to identify areas for improvement and document recommended changes.
Monitor and maintain both budget and process data and provide updates to senior management on current trends and projections.
Understand business problems and opportunities in the context of requirements and recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.
Key Functions and Expected Performances:
Develop communications such as PowerPoint presentations, proposals, policies and procedures, and business summaries to enhance and support strategic or operational plans.
Perform financial and business process analysis, draws conclusions, and makes recommendations to leadership.
Apply process improvement methods applicable to the field and designs plans for implementation.
Analyze trends affecting budget/accounting needs and recommend procedural changes as needed.
Analyze and review financial data and prepare financial statements and reports.
Participate in calculation, validation and updating of cost saving initiatives.
Develop budget and forecasting models that analyze the overall business plan. Manage and prepare budgets based upon current standards and provide regular updates.
Research current challenges and trends in the field and brings information and recommendations back to leadership for consideration.
Researches business problems and quickly understands the issues and data challenges of organization.
Inform and advise managers and other key stakeholders of financial issues and matters as appropriate.
Analyze proposed plans and policies, as well as new programs, to determine costs. Makes appropriate recommendations to management in order to strengthen business controls, improve operations, and/or reduce costs.
Develop programs or queries to retrieve and analyze data for projects, program, or reports.
Apply statistically sound analytic methods within program and projects.
Gather data using data mining techniques and tools, analyze information, develop conclusions, communicate recommendations clearly and work effectively with others on a team.
Effectively translate complex data and analyses to all levels within the organization.

Job Description
New Selling Partners are the lifeblood of the Amazon Marketplace, and we are currently expanding the number and types of programs that we offer these partners to ensure that their business is successful on Amazon. As such, we are seeking an experienced Business Analyst who can work with our Sales and Marketing teams to uncover insights that will allow us to accelerate performance and optimize productivity.

In this role, you'll create systems and tracking mechanisms that draw from a wealth of quantitative and qualitative data to measure our performance against our goals and to develop insights on how we can improve performance. These insights will play a key role in making decisions on how we expand or contract programs and how these programs are adopted at scale worldwide. You will also help us create new ideas for how to better serve our Selling Partners and work with teams to test ideas (and scale successful ones).

The ideal candidate will be a naturally inquisitive self-starter who can dig deep into data to make connections that others might miss. You'll translate those connections into actions that can be taken to drive our business, and you'll use your strong communication skills to confidently influence all levels of the organization...and you'll be comfortable working within a team of business partners who view you as the indispensable resource who can help them with their data needs.
Basic Qualifications
4+ years of experience as a Business/Financial Analyst, BI Engineer or Systems Analyst preferably in an internet-based company with large, complex data sources
Proficient in multiple flavors of SQL, (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redshift)
Experience in data visualization platforms (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Quicksight)
Ability to take complex business problems and translate them into clear and accurate results
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause/ analyses
Ability to prioritize multiple concurrent projects while still delivering timely and accurate results
Demonstrated ability to work effectively with Data Engineers and BI Engineers to mine the right data sources efficiently and accurately
Strong verbal and written communications skills at an executive level that enable you to explain complex insights with clarity and precision
Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Quantitative Analysis, or Statistics
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with both business and operations teams with deep experience on existing systems and data sources
Master’s degree, MBA or equivalent experience in Data Analytics, Quantitative Analysis, or Statistics

About Us
With a small team of smart people who like working hard and have fun too, we released the most disruptive enterprise management software in the world: Odoo. Fully open source, full-featured, with apps like CRM, Billing, eCommerce, Accounting, HR, Manufacturing, and 4,000 more. Its online offer is 3 times more affordable than traditional competitors like SAP and Microsoft.
You think it's too good to be true? See for yourself. Preview our 1-click demo and read what people say about Odoo on Twitter.
Start a career with us. We offer you an extraordinary chance to learn and grow. Be involved with a very exciting product and a great team behind it.

Responsibilities
Business Analysts advise Odoo's clients on ways to effectively leverage Odoo's software for maximum operational efficiency.
Evaluate clients' operational processes, sales strategies, and organizational design to discover areas of inefficiency and develop recommendations to better manage their customers and staff.
Analyze customers' needs and business processes in order to map them properly with Odoo.
Quantify resources required for a task/project.
Accompany customers in the full implementation cycle, from software configuration to go-live.
Coach customers on how to use Odoo efficiently through individual training sessions.
Optionally, deliver Odoo functional training sessions on site or online one week every 2 months to train end-users or employees coming from our customers and partners (8-15 people per session).
Support the sales team during pre-sale.

Position Summary:

The ideal candidate will be able to provide detailed functional input into the design and development of Client Relationship Management (CRM) application software to meet end user requirements for usability and functionality. Duties include eliciting business requirements and conducting functional gap analysis to aid in the preparation of comprehensive documentation used in the software development life cycle. The position requires the ability to work collaboratively with all ADP business units, across multiple time-zones, to ensure the on-time delivery of projects; most interactions will be within and across the Employer Services and Corporate IT organizations.

Position Description:

Business Analysis and Documentation * Schedule and facilitate project kick-off and requirements definition meetings and reviews * Elicit business and functional requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process analysis, use cases/scenarios, task and workflow analysis. * Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. * Help drive process standardization/simplification in support of enterprise-wide CRM deployment * Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language. * Prepare and maintain all documentation necessary to accurately capture and communicate business requirements, and deliver the following artifacts as needed: business requirements, gap analysis, scope definition, functional design, use cases and future state business process workflow documents. * Secures business approval of requirements and scope for assigned projects from all core project team members

Communication and Problem Resolution * Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements * Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans * Help socialize the need for process standardization/simplification in support of enterprise-wide CRM deployment * Effectively communicate project status updates, risk assessments and escalations on assigned projects to Stakeholders, Product Management, Development, QA, and other cross-functional teams using multiple communication channels
* Responds and reacts in a professional manner to a variety of critical issues in order to achieve satisfactory resolution. * Anticipates, eliminates and resolves problems in a timely manner.

Product/Project Support * Participate in and represent business enhancements and/or requirements documentation in internal Change Control Board meetings * Provides subject matter expertise to CRM user community for product functionality questions, enhancements and fixes * Provides guidance and knowledge transfer to Quality Assurance team for the development of functional test plans and test scripts * Provides guidance and knowledge transfer to Technical Publications and Learning Services teams for the development of user release and application training materials * Liaison to Tier 1/Tier 2 support teams for questions or issues related to assigned requirements projects deployed to production

Qualifications:

* Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. * Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. * Experienced in facilitating business process analysis and requirements definition sessions with crossfunctional teams * Understands the criticality of analyzing processes and procedures and identifying alternatives and potential unintended consequences * Ability to gather information necessary to make decisions and execute sound judgment in determining the proper course of action * Proven history of successfully overcoming resistance to change while maintaining best-in-class customer service and support * Anticipates, eliminates and resolves problems in a timely manner. * Ability to manage multiple projects and assignments simultaneously and independently. * Works without supervision to meet project deadlines * Accomplishes tasks by monitoring results and adjusting methodology to adapt to a changing environment. * Effectively balance the need to always provide stellar service with the realities of meeting aggressive timelines * Proven history of keeping abreast of current developments and trends in area of expertise and applying process changes as needed * Ability to travel domestically on a quarterly/monthly basis

Education/Experience:

* Bachelors Degree in Process/Industrial Engineering, Communications, Business Administration or related field, or equivalent in education and experience required. * Minimum 4 years experience as business analyst in related industry, with proven proficiencies in basic problem resolution through effective communication and user interaction required * Experienced business analysis and requirements definition of Siebel or other CRM application desired

Position will work with the Global Product Owner for WFS Fleet Technology to design, build, enhance and manage WFS Fleet Technology. The business analyst will drive process changes throughout the Land division and will work to transition newly acquired firms onto the WFS platform. The role will also assist in managing the technologies on an ongoing basis and develop KPI’s to measure operational performance and business efficiency. The analyst will interface with key stakeholders and translate business requirements into system design and work with business partners to implement technology/process changes. Key responsibilities will include:
Develop and maintain business process documentation and lead business process analysis and redesign activities as it relates to order capture, dispatching of orders to customers and confirmation of delivery.
Lead implementation, change management and business readiness activities as it relates to introducing new technology into the transportation, dispatching and fleet management activities at WFS.
Assist Product Owner in defining business requirements and long-term roadmap for Fleet technology and associated technologies (order capture and delivery confirmation); identifying gaps between business needs and existing functionality in technology; understand gaps/changes between existing functionality/processes and the future state model.
Support communication activities with key stakeholders to include delivering project updates, leading communication activities regarding change management, business readiness and implementation.
Lead training coordination, content development and execution activities on new product delivery activities impacting drivers, dispatchers, customers and 3rd party carriers.
Develop and maintain end user training documentation and deliver training to users as required.
Execute project management processes as it relates to user acceptance testing of new technology and business implementation activities. This would involve schedule management, risk management, issue management, communication planning, change management and business implementation.
Support, analyze, and resolve critical production application issues as required.
Ensure consistency of Fleet technology usage conventions, compliance with best practices, and integrity of data and processes.
Develop reports, dashboards, and processes to continuously monitor system and operational performance.
Required Skills:
BA/BS Degree in Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering, Logistics or the equivalent
Strong understanding of project management and business process analysis
3+ years of in depth experience in transportation / logistics highly desirable
3+ years’ experience using TMW, Intellifuels, Touchstar or similar fleet management technology
Experience gathering and consolidating requirements from cross-functional groups. Ability to work under pressure and meet constantly changing timelines.
Knowledge of Agile development methodology
Intermediate Excel skills (Pivot Tables, V-Lookups), ability to use SQL.
Strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams

5 years of experience in business analysis and requirements definition for IT systems

Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. One of the nation’s largest and most respected hospital companies, Universal Health Services, Inc. (UHS) has built an impressive record of achievement and performance. Steadily growing from a startup to an esteemed Fortune 500 corporation, UHS today has annual revenue nearing $10 billion. In 2017, UHS was recognized as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune; ranked #276 on the Fortune 500, and listed #275 in Forbes inaugural ranking of America’s Top 500 Public Companies.

Our operating philosophy is as effective today as it was 40 years ago: Build or acquire high quality hospitals in rapidly growing markets, invest in the people and equipment needed to allow each facility to thrive, and become the leading healthcare provider in each community we serve.

Headquartered in King of Prussia, PA, UHS has more than 81,000 employees and through its subsidiaries operates more than 320 acute care hospitals, behavioral health facilities and ambulatory centers in the United States, Puerto Rico, the U.S. Virgin Islands and the United Kingdom.

The reason our team members choose to work at UHS instead of other sales organizations is because of our entrepreneurial spirit, meaning individually; each one of our team members are self-reliant. However, we recognize the power of a united team with a common mission to build something bigger than we could ever do as an individual. We are a team of entrepreneurs working together for a common mission: “creating lifetime relationships for long-term recovery." This position is located in Brentwood, TN.
