POSITION: BUSINESS ANALYST

Job Summary:
The Business Analyst serves as an expert for data and reporting issues, developing reports to measure quality performance and participate in quality reporting programs, acting as a liaison to the Information Services Division to ensure necessary development and maintenance of the data warehouse and other reporting tools for quality needs, modeling potential financial impact of improvement programs and projects, managing administrative aspects of external improvement programs, and supporting data needs of internal improvement projects.

Description of Job Responsibilities:
A successful applicant must possess a broad understanding of health care, the ability to query and analyze data, project management skills, the ability to communicate effectively to a variety of audiences, and advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel. Experience with Business Objects Web Intelligence, Tableau, Microsoft Access, Epic reporting tools, Epic Ambulatory data, physician reimbursement, and/or quality improvement/programs is preferred. This position reports to thePopulation Health.
Qualifications
Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Public Administration or related field (or equivalent combination of education, training and experience).

Professional Experience Requirements:
If a Bachelor's degree: Two (2) years of experience in professional accounting, management of an operational unit, business analysis or financial analysis.
If an Associate's degree: Six (6) years of experience in professional accounting, management of an operational unit, business analysis or financial analysis.
If a High School diploma or GED: Ten (10) years of experience in professional accounting, management of an operational unit, business analysis or financial analysis.

Overview
JAGGAER is the world's leading provider of comprehensive source-to-pay solutions. Some of the largest Commercial, Manufacturing and Life Sciences companies in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. Additionally, JAGGAER is the leading procure-to-pay provider in the Higher Education and Government sectors. JAGGAER eprocurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.

 The Business Analyst works with project team assignments within JAGGAER’s Professional Services organization for the successful implementation of client Spend Analytic engagements. You will be accountable to the project team for your deliverables and report directly to the Client Delivery Manager. This role requires excellent attention to detail and a focus on delivering quality work and outcomes. We are also looking for someone who is creative and can think outside of the box to solve problems.

Requires an energetic self-starter and team player. A commitment to client satisfaction is paramount. If this sounds like you, please read on.
Principal Responsibilities
Support customers in understanding the company’s spend analytics methodology
Coordinate acquisition of client data and prepare client data for the solution
Normalize client’s supplier data within the solution and eliminate duplicate records to improve accuracy of the results
Classify data, creating transaction data groups that are meaningful for the client, driving ROI from the solution
Audit the accuracy of work completed by the project team
Customize reports according to client's specifications, visualize data and design advanced reports
Resolve or suggest workarounds and alternatives for issues. Drive issue resolution in a timely manner
Conduct high level troubleshooting and work closely with internal departments to resolve application or supplier-related issues
Create, build and maintain customer relationships
Manage special projects and initiatives related to spend analytics on behalf of the project team
Position Requirements
Bachelor’s degree required
2+ years business analyst experience in a software technology environment
Understand the development and implementation of performance measurements for operational reporting.
Experience with design and development of production metrics and reports.
Proficiency with procurement applications from an administration or user perspective helpful
Excellent oral and written communication skills, attention to detail, ability to multi-task, as well as organizational and interpersonal skills are required
Ability to troubleshoot issues and communicate resolution in a timely manner
Ability to relate business processes with technology
Working knowledge of Qlikview a plus
Proficient in the use of PowerPoint, Excel and Word as well as other typical business productivity tools.

About Our Benefits
JAGGAER offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran or military status and other protected class characteristics. We offer a generous benefits package including employee and family health, dental and vision coverage, reimbursement accounts for eligible medical expenses; company-paid life insurance, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability benefits; retirement plan with company match and generous paid time off benefits. Additional benefits include education and well-being reimbursements.

JAGGAER is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and will consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

$4,917 - $8,060 a monthBusiness Analyst III Under the general supervision of the Behavioral Health Services Group Manager, performs advanced business analysis work. Leads and facilitates the service-request lifecycle (through customer-related service request responses, business requirements analysis and documenting, business rules and requirements solicitation from requesters, business requirements peer reviews, technical specifications and related artifacts review, and leading user acceptance testing prior to implementation). This position is classified as a fulltime position (40 hours a week). Work outside of regular hours may be required. Travel to other work location may be required. Performs other duties as assigned.

Essential Job Functions:
1. Performs advanced business analysis work. Leads and facilitates the service-request lifecycle (through customer-related service request responses, business requirements analysis and documenting, business rules and requirements solicitation from requesters, business requirements peer reviews, technical specifications and related artifacts review, and leading user acceptance testing prior to implementation).(35%) 2. Acts as liaison between technical and non-technical customers, effectively providing automated solutions to business problems. Documents clear, detailed, and thorough technical specifications for simple to complex requests (30%) 3. Collaborates with Project Managers, Program SMEs and technical staff to perform analysis, design and planning during project development and implementation stages. (10%) 4. Provides quality assurance-related consultation to users. Communicates technical business processes verbally and via workflow diagrams. (10%) 5. Participates on project teams in the delivery of IT solutions through the analysis and documentation of business processes, requirements and specifications. Promotes productivity and efficiency by studying current practices, helps customers analyze complex technical and managerial processes, identify inefficiencies, and assist customers to realize business value. (10%) 6. Other duties as assigned. (5%) Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.

Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of business analysis. * Knowledge of project management standards and techniques. * Extensive PC skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Outlook and other relevant software applications. * Skill in developing written materials and training. * Skill in developing electronic reports from databases. * Skill in responding to customer inquiries and handling difficult customers in a tactful manner. * Skill in arithmetic, English grammar, and spelling. * Ability to gather and analyze data and facts, and to devise solutions to problems. * Ability to communicate processes and procedures clearly and effectively to others. * Ability to use independent judgment and to plan, organize and coordinate work assignments to meet deadlines. * Ability to establish effective working relationships with supervisory personnel and co-workers. * Ability to effectively communicate (both orally and in writing) processes and procedures. * Ability to promote effective communication between technical and non-technical staff. * Ability to analyze business needs, systems and procedures. * Ability to initiate plans, organize work and make decisions with minimal supervision. * Ability to work effectively with others. * Knowledge of database management, data analysis, and reporting. *

• Graduation from an accredited four year college or university with major course work in business, communications, or IT/computer sciences is preferred. At least four additional years of relevant employment exceeding the preferred minimum experience may be substituted for the education preference. • Preferred minimum of five years’ experience developing business rules and/or business/functional requirements. • Experience leading/managing projects. • Experience preparing business/technical documentation (e.g. procedures, business processes, project documentation, test plans, solution/decision recommendation documents, etc.). • Preferred experience working professionally with a broad range of stakeholders. • Preferred knowledge of immunizations.

Description
JOB SUMMARY

This job provides expertise for standard to moderately complex problem solving and in-depth understanding of system functionality. The incumbent reviews significant amounts of information and analyzes processes to support business unit needs. May troubleshoot errors, conduct impact analyses, and/or solve data rejection. Performs business analyses in one or more operational areas. Identifies process gaps and recommends process improvements for efficiencies. May provide guidance to Associate level employees.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Intake operational objectives and gather information. May perform routine research and evaluate basic output requirements and formats. Communicate business operational requirements to internal groups responsible for developing/testing business requirements in various applications.
Coordinate, monitor, and report on the progress of projects to ensure adherence to defined project schedule. Communicate effectively with customers and colleagues. Successfully articulate issues, problems, and solutions. Conduct pre-and post-implementation review. Assist in the planning/designing and facilitation of functional walk-throughs. May require additional support from more experienced team members.
Manage small to intermediate cross-functional projects and change initiatives involved in the design and delivery of business process solutions, implementation strategies, and control measures, including scoping, leading, and influencing organizational change related to business processes and models.
Facilitate process improvement meetings and/or discussions.
Analyze the functions and operations of a business area/function and identify problem areas. Create process mapping and document current and future state business processes.
Recommend process efficiencies, strategies for improvement, and/or solutions to align technology with business strategies.
Assist in development of desktop procedures and/or training material.
Other duties as assigned.

This role will partner effectively with the Supply Chain organization to define and build capabilities in forecasting, planning and replenishment. Core responsibilities are the following:


Requirements
Assumes full accountability for developing business requirements for complex issues.
Elicits customer, user, systems administration, operations and support requirements from project stakeholders.
Interacts with various levels of IT and management in gathering and validating business requirements.
Clearly documents, reviews and edits requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed solution.
Leads Joint Application Design meetings, driving to the development of a Requirements Document and a technical framework when the session is complete
Identifies non-functional requirements, and provides accurate project estimates.
Analysis
Participates in / presents formal reviews of business use-case model and business object model.
Uses SQL to mine enterprise transaction data
Documents and communicates detailed process workflows in a visual format.
Performs analysis of business and user needs, documents requirements, and develops proper system requirements specifications.
Leads and coordinates business use case modeling by outlining and delimiting the modeled organization
Support
Provide IT support within process improvement initiatives for all key functional areas of Supply Chain including: Replenishment, Allocations, Assortment, Presentation/Space, Planning and Reporting.
Assist with development of training materials for end-users.
Assist with project management tasks including: estimation, resource planning and scheduling
Other
Works on multiple, simultaneous projects of which he/she will apply their applicable technical and system functionality background.
Participates in the creation of detailed RFP/RFI documents and management of vendor responses.
Understands and communicates priority, risk, benefit, effort, stability and organizational impact of business initiatives and re-engineering efforts.
Ensure completion of all deliverables according to user expectations and within schedule, budget and quality constraints.

Minimum BS/BA preferred in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Systems or related degree; or 5+ years’ experience as a Business/Systems Analyst, Business Process Engineer or Software Designer.

Callisto Media was inspired by a single, transformational idea: harness the power of big data to produce timely content that enables consumers to lead richer, healthier, more fulfilled lives.

With deep roots in technology and publishing, Callisto Media harnesses the disruptive power of Big Data, creating unparalleled insights into consumer demand and the science of content. Our titles uniquely serve the needs of the reader, enjoy consistent profitability, and delve into the long tail of opportunity.

We have an enterprising, collaborative culture and are backed by leading Silicon Valley venture capitalists. We use proprietary technology to identify and meet consumer demand by delivering timely content in sync with the market. We’re an intellectually curious team made up of driven analysts, editors, designers, marketers, and engineers based in the Bay Area and New York City who are aggressively expanding the breadth and depth of our portfolio in cooking, specialty diet, health and wellness, mind, body and spirit, parenting, kids, business and more.

Reporting to the Chief Product Officer and based in our headquarters in Emeryville, CA the New Business Analyst will be responsible for conducting market research and managing projects that are related to new product and/or channel development.

We are looking for a very bright, intellectually curious, highly self-motivated, and extremely organized individual that thrives on investigative research and analysis and getting things done.
Does this describe you?
You have exceptional problem-solving skills and are able to break big unknowns down into actionable pieces and steps and investigate accordingly.
You can write clearly and persuasively and outline arguments in ways that all stakeholders can easily understand.
You are comfortable cold emailing and cold calling people to gather information and generate potential partnerships.
You are a skilled presenter and can put together documents and presentations that explain your findings on complex things simply.
You have a reasonable eye for design; your documents and presentations have a high level of fit and finish.
You love personally managing projects with multiple internal and external stakeholders from idea to completion.
You are comfortable working on tight deadlines and have an inclination toward quickly solving problems.
No task is too small – you’re eager to pitch in across the full spectrum from data entry to managing relationships with potential partners.
Join us! We are a team where data drives our decisions. Where culture matters. We put our customers first and they embody our core values. We’re entrepreneurial and focused in our approach. We challenge each employee to experiment and drive results while feeling empowered to do their best work each and every day.

Callisto Media offers a competitive salary, full benefits, 401k, stock options, for full-time employees, as well as a friendly working environment. This is a full-time, onsite position.

$55,000 - $70,000 a yearPOSITION SUMMARY

The Research & Planning section (R&P) supports the accomplishment of the Virginia Alcoholic Beverage Control Authority’s (ABC) mission and objectives through the successful fulfillment of projects in the areas of business research, data analysis, stakeholder surveys, strategic planning, policy & program analysis, fiscal impact analysis, revenue forecasting, and store network planning. R&P also handles Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) response and coordination, procedure development, performance measurement and the application of process improvement to Authority operations. R&P is currently seeking a business analyst with considerable knowledge of methodologies for improving organizational performance, analysis of retail and other operational data and principles of project management. Considerable skill in the use of a personal computer, utilizing spreadsheet, database, flowcharting, word processing, project management, and presentation software applications is required. The R&P business analyst should possess the demonstrated ability to define and lead work processes, communicate effectively (orally and in writing), analyze quantitative and qualitative data and draw conclusions.

Minimum Qualifications
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Duties include researching and analyzing the effectiveness, application and impact of new technologies, systems, programs and management approaches to operational services. This position will not focus primarily on technology projects (i.e. new system requirements or new system implementation); yet will lead the evaluation of operational program areas and projects related to ABC’s policy and operational initiatives. This position will evaluate alternative ways to deliver ABC services, determine the effectiveness of advertising and marketing campaigns, assist with legislative studies, analyze sales and interpret trends by product, brand, category, price tier, geographic area, etc. This position will lead or assist with projects sponsored by operating division directors or a member of the senior executive team and will have access to subject matter experts as needed to meet research or project objectives. A strong background in data analysis (to include retail operations data), business intelligence tools, process improvement, business writing and stakeholder outreach is preferred. The R&P BA should effectively facilitate work teams, develop project and communication plans, provide team support, conduct training, etc. to see that the ABC Authority moves through research projects in a timely and efficient manner. The BA will ensure the timely distribution of reports and key findings, as well as work with Information Technology Services and other work units to identify efficient report distribution methods.

The R&P BA should effectively manage all phases of assignments including issue identification and scope, work planning, quantitative/qualitative analysis, documentation, and reporting. The BA should develop and maintain an effective system to formally document and track the status of all project activities and recommendations, and research deliverables should be free of substantial errors and omissions. The BA should display effective leadership skills and considerable independence and initiative in managing projects and actively involve stakeholders in research and/or project implementation. The BA should manage outside vendors and data sources as needed to complete research assignments.

The R&P BA should provide clear direction to team members by setting realistic goals, objectives, and measurements, effectively facilitate team consensus-building and decision-making processes, keep work teams organized and on track with project plans and task assignments, and produce documents and recommendations in a timely and accurate manner.

Preferred Qualifications
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Graduate from college or university with course work in market research, economics, statistics, public or business administration required. Master’s Degree and/or certificate in project management or business analysis preferred. A minimum of 5 years of experience in business research, retail operations analysis, data analysis and project management is preferred. Project management certification through PMI/AMA or data analytics certification a plus

Special Requirements

Job Description
The Fulfillment By Amazon - Customer Experience (FBA-CX) team is looking for an exceptional and experienced Business Analyst to drive data analysis and insights that will ensure products listed on Amazon meet the high product quality bar.

In this role you will leverage your advanced SQL skills to construct and implement data pipeline to collect data, clean/organize data to get it ready for analysis and perform structured analysis to glean insights that will identify areas of opportunity and in turn shape the product features and programs we roll out to continue to improve customer experience. You should be self-starter who is highly proficient in SQL, has an extremely high level of customer focus, has a passion for process improvement and is excited by mining large and complex datasets

As you further your career as a data analyst in FBA-CX, you will focus on instrumenting automation of metrics that measure customer experience and identify emerging trends teams need to focus on, analyze Customer and Seller data to identify the root cause of customer issues, and recommend solutions, backed by data, to address customer issues. We are focused on your success and want to build strong leaders. You can expect to leverage your data skills and have full ownership of the projects you work on.

Key Responsibilities Include:
Advanced SQL skills to extract, aggregate and load data from multiple data sources
Work with and synthesize large datasets from multiple data sources
Work with BI team to navigate through the data sources and introduce new metrics to audit performance and identify areas where customer experience is degrading
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Automate reporting with a combination of SQL, Excel, and BI tools like Looker
Deep-dive a variety of ad hoc questions on emerging customer experience trends
Manage and execute entire projects or components of large projects from start to finish including project management, data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations
Seek opportunities to inject advanced analytical techniques across the FBA Customer Experience organization

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering or a related field
5+ years of professional experience in data analytics, business analysis or comparable analytics position
Advanced skills in data mining using SQL, ETL, data warehouse as well as Excel
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
Ability to structure complex analysis and perform the analysis to drive insights
Proven problem solving skills, project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skills
Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast paced environment
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree is preferred in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field.
Advanced SQL skills to extract, aggregate, and load data
5+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analysis role.
Experienced in data warehousing, data modeling concept and building new DW tables
Experience with building multi-dimensional data models to serve as a foundation for future analyses
Ability to deal with ambiguity
Understanding of predictive modeling
Understanding of R or Python/another scripting language

Working at ICF

ICF is recruiting for Technical Business Analysts across all levels to help provide on-site client support in Washington, DC. ICF supports IT project and program management services for a federal agency. Regardless of what happens in government with budgets and re-organizations, we can be fairly safe in betting that FEMA will remain critical and well-funded. These positions are part of a very large program that seeks to provide full scale Digital Transformation at FEMA – moving away from a slow-moving bureaucratic machine and towards a truly agile and collaborative enterprise. With something of this size, we should see plenty of opportunity for people to grow and experience different types of work that match their career goals.

Key Responsibilities:
Define and document customer business functions and processes.
Identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access.
Liaise between departmental end-users, technical analysts, IT analysts, consultants and other governmental organizations in the analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance of case management systems to ensure optimal performance.
Analyze the feasibility of, and develop requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing systems.
Track and fully document changes for functional and business specifications.
Identify opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and/or non-system changes.
Read and interpret case management systems and functional technical literature for end-users.
Plan, organize and conduct business process reengineering/improvement projects and/or management reviews.
Develop policies and procedures to improve efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and/or improve internal and external customer service; develop information system documentation to support efficient operations; prepare reports and written findings and recommendations; and monitor changes.
Depending on experience level, serve as a lead for 1-5 other analysts.

2+ years working in a project/program management environment as a Business Analyst, Management Analyst, Project Coordinator, or Junior Project Manager.
Capable of working in an environment that is demanding, sometimes stressful and requires independent thinking, problem resolution and responsible actions with minimal direct oversight by senior management.
Ability to obtain a favorable adjudicated background investigation through FEMA’s Personnel Security Division.

Preferred Skills and/or Experience:
Experience working within a large-scale federal IT PMO or Portfolio management environment.
“Power User” of Microsoft Excel and/or Microsoft SharePoint.

The Yukon-Kuskokwim Health Corporation (YKHC) is located in the Southwestern Alaska town of Bethel, with a total of approximately 6,000 people. YKHC supports 1500 employees, providing the health services to a primarily Yup'ik Eskimo Native population for an area the size of Oregon. Services are provided through a Bethel located hospital and 50 clinics throughout the YK Delta.

The Business Analyst - Junior position requires and individual to develop and implement system planning, designing, upgrading, and maintaining efficient operations of finance systems. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical problem solving, systems knowledge, and critical thinking to resolve systematic and operational issues in order to optimize efficiencies and minimize cost. This individual will mentor and train business systems specialist.

Facilitate system integrity through regular maintenance of Revenue Cycle applications, installation and testing of new software versions with quality assurance measured and reported on.
Develop and deliver corporate reports in a timely manner, ensuring data integrity and validation through all reporting measures.

Supervises and coordinates junior analysts work efforts to maximize department and division priority efficiency.
All other duties, as assigned.

Minimum Education: Associate’s degree in a Business, Accounting, or Technology field. A combination of education and experience may be substituted for Associate’s Degree.

Licensing/Certification: HFMA certification at time of hire or within one (1) year of start date.
Equipment/Tools: Computer proficiency with various software and database systems, calculator, multi-line phone, fax/copy machine.

Knowledge of pertinent healthcare applications, tables, dependencies, workflows and outlays.
Working knowledge of healthcare information systems Siemens Medseries 4 or Cerner preferred.
Ability to perform “drill down” techniques to get to the root cause of barriers to efficient process.
Understanding of claim billing and reimbursement processes. OR Account and auditing principles, accounts payable, budgeting, and general ledger.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Keen attention to detail.
Proven analytical and creative problem-solving abilities.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Run queries as needed
Special projects as assigned.

Job Description for the Junior Business Analyst

The Business Analytics team is responsible for supporting operations by providing meaningful and actionable analytics. The Jr. Business Analyst will be assigned to a specific division where he/she will be responsible for driving operational improvement. The Jr. Business Analyst will be asked to partner with divisional leadership as well as work with Operations Specialists to provide analytics aimed at making their jobs easier. This position reports to the VP of Business Analytics. It is a full time exempt position and the schedule for this position is Monday- Friday 8:00 AM-5:00 PM.

Core Responsibilities of the Junior Business Analyst

Partner with leadership to develop a strategic vision for the department, take a proactive approach to influencing business strategy through data findings and establish meaningful and easy-to-consume reporting that informs teams within the department
Assist in the generation of departmental business intelligence, data management, analytics and data transfer projects/initiatives
Gather data to help compose monthly reviews of the operational and financial performance of the division.
Assess financial and operational performance, identify areas of improvement and develop solutions to help the department grow and become more efficient
Solid project management capabilities with the ability to organize and manage multiple projects simultaneously from origin through execution
Maintain operational reports allowing leaders to analyze the performance of individual members of their team. Identify trends and work with operations specialists to prevent escalations before they occur
Organize, analyze, interpret, and report on large amounts of raw data with the ability to extract relevant conclusions and present the results to the senior leadership team.
Develop SLA tracking dashboards in Tableau


Key Competencies of the Junior Business Analyst

Ability to translate data into analysis and then into actionable insights
Ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner
Strong analytical and quantitative skills
Effective problem-solving skills


Education and Experience for the Junior Business Analyst

Education Level: undergraduate degree (Business, Finance, Accounting, Statistics, Mathematics, preferred)
1-3 years of analytical work experience
Computer Skills: Advanced proficiencies in: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook
High level of proficiency with Excel & PowerPoint


Additional Requirements of the Junior Business Analyst

System Experience: Tableau, Python or R
Ability to develop relationships with internal and external clients
Excellent attention to detail and time management skills including the ability to prioritize multiple time-sensitive deadlines in a complex, fast-paced environment
Proven organizational skills with attention to detail
Exceptional at developing business partnerships
Strong communications skills
Strong interpersonal skills

$60,819 - $83,304 a yearJob Summary
The Business Analyst-Public Safety is a full time, classified service, salaried position performing work for the IT Services Department of Shelby County. This position is responsible for the application of technology into the public safety workflows of the County and informing and advising partners on information systems technologies, their functionalities, benefits, risks, and implementation requirements. Work involves design, maintenance, troubleshooting of complex public safety applications and database environment. Work involves providing technical support for multiple public safety user agencies in a dynamic 24 x 7 environment. This position serves as the primary point of contact for trouble resolution for hardware, software, telecom, radio and network problems associated with public safety operations and related support obligations. Duties include procurement, setup, installation, maintenance, troubleshooting and upgrades of personal and mobile computer hardware, radio equipment, software, peripherals, and mobile devices. Position is expected to provide subject matter expertise on a variety of desktop, radio, mobile dispatching applications and refer problems to other technical staff as appropriate. Develop and implement systems, processes and procedures to mitigate the disruption of services during utility outages and any emergency condition. The employee is also responsible for assisting in technical projects and other support as needed.
Qualifications and Requirements
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience.
Five years' experience in a large mission critical support environment.
Three years' experience with public safety applications.
Knowledgeable of law enforcement and public safety dispatch procedures, terminology and protocols.
Ability to work non-standard hours, on call on a continuous basis (24x7). Comprehensive knowledge with security components of Microsoft architecture and their operational/security considerations.
Demonstrated competency in project management in an enterprise environment managing resources to meet goals on multiple projects.

PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS:
Five years' experience in a support role at public safety dispatch center or law enforcement agency.
Hands-on experience with the following technologies; GIS (ESRI), VMware (VCA preferred), VOIP telecom, IP based LMR radio systems,
IP based access control systems, Microsoft SQL Server scripting ability, SAP BusinessObjects BI and/or Crystal Reports, HTML scripting on several in-house applications and Electronic Health Records.
Physical Demands & Work Environment
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
Work consistently requires standing, walking, pulling, bending, lifting, and carrying equipment.

WORK ENVIRONMENT
Work is primarily performed in an office environment but also requires external conditions when cabling or working with telephony/wireless equipment.
Conditions of Job Offer and Employment
WRITTEN AND PERFORMANCE EXAMINATIONS
No written or performance examination will be required for this position. Applicants are screened and certified based on an evaluation of their education, training, experience and other requirements as outlined in this Position Announcement and denoted on their Job Application and responses to the Supplemental Questionnaire.

BACKGROUND CHECK
As part of the pre-employment procedure all new hires are subject to a full background check. Former supervisors, employers, police and FBI files, plus references provided by the candidates shall be checked as a precaution against obtaining undesirable employees. Reference and background checks may or may not be completed prior to an offer of employment, and the information shall be handled as privileged information available to appointing authorities in considering applicants.

PRE-EMPLOYMENT/POST OFFER DRUG SCREEN
Shelby County is committed to providing and maintaining a drug-free work environment. As part of the pre-employment procedures all new hires and promotional candidates promoting from a non-DOT position to a DOT position will be subject to a pre-employment/pre-promotion drug screen. After receiving a conditional offer of employment, applicants are required to pass a drug test conducted at a test site designated by Shelby County.

The Sr. Business Analyst provides operational support and acts as a data security technical Subject Matter Expert (SME) on the UHC business-focused Data Loss Prevention (DLP) governance team. Collaborates closely with Enterprise Data Services (EDS) team with rollout of new Secure Share program. Supports the establishment of a small centralized UHC DLP governance team to ensure effective controls are in place and working effectively for Secure share usage, including the onboarding of all Acquired Entity users. Establish monitoring to analyze adherence to Secure Share policies, trends of non-compliance and playbook establishment to drive educational awareness in both technical and administrative nature. Ensures vendor data transmissions are in compliance with Secure Share policies. In partnership with UHC Privacy and other teams, assists with Incident Management analysis. Facilitates educational sessions to UHC user community relative to Data as Rest (DaR) violation remediation. Drives awareness of DaR best practices and supports the effort to find alternative methods of storage. Supports DLP governance team in development of UHC access monitoring to ensure individual access is granted through effective verification process and is terminated in a timely manner. Defines technical and operational access protocol standards while supporting educational awareness to UHC community. Partners with Enterprise Information Security (EIS) to review access to applications, services and remote access.

Primary Responsibilities:
Serves as a business-focused data security technical resource on DLP and DaR including secure methods of delivery, policies and data classification
Collaborates with Enterprise IT security teams to implement and help operate effective UHC data security governance for DLP and DaR
Supports development of Secure Share compliance monitoring program
Monitors and reports on Secure Share compliance across UHC
Engages Acquired Entities for Secure Share education and adherence
Develops playbooks and training materials for Secure Share education and DaR education
Review Secure Share reports to identify actionable trends
Identify non-adherence to Secure Share policies and locate user’s manager
Communicate to business leaders and track outreach
Pull reports, identifying where there is a lack of vendor risk assessment, partner with EIS to initiate assessment
Access reports to determine what, if any, critical risks are present with acquired entity vendors and follow process to report those critical risks
Research all new Tier 1 vendor engagements and notify appropriate team members with applicable details relative to the engagement
Notify Vendor Relationship Owners of all new Tier 1 and Tier 2 vendor engagements and support education awareness of Secure Share program
Monitor and address emails received in the team group mailbox
Review all Tier 1 vendor news alerts for incidents and vendor mergers
Drive vendor operational remediation with VRO for vendors with incidents that impact UHC

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Health Administration, related field or equivalent work experience
5+ years of experience in business analysis / operations / governance
Strong knowledge of information data security controls including those surrounding Protected Health Information (PHI), Personally Identifiable Information (PII), and Payment Card Industry standards (PCI)
Experience with process improvement, workflow, and evaluation of business process
Strong technical skills
Intermediate PC skills (Power Point, Word, Excel, Intranet) required
Preferred Qualifications:
Excellent customer service skills
Strong presentation skills
Proven ability to problem solve including multiple priorities and research conflicting and / or inaccurate data

At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Looking for an internship where you’ll really make a difference? Apply at U.S. Bank.

What You’ll Do
We offer a competitive 10-week paid internship where you’ll work on meaningful projects and effect real change at our company. Our interns get hands-on experience solving business needs and helping in the communities where we live and work. You’ll build your resume while making new connections and sharpening the skills you need to succeed at work. Plus, the work you do will be tailored to your interests. A typical employee spends eight hours a day at work. We think you should spend that time doing something you love – not just earning a paycheck.

As a U.S. Bank intern, you’ll have the opportunity to interact with senior executives, get paired with a formal mentor and attend fun events specifically tailored for interns, including a volunteer day where you’ll give back to the community. In your day-to-day work, you’ll learn how employees collaborate to serve all our stakeholders. Your meaningful work experience may even translate into a full-time position in the banking industry upon graduation.

Why U.S. Bank?

Senior Business Analyst

Purpose:
Responsible for analyzing customer requirements and the analysis of information/data. Manages projects if required. Provides input to improve overall efficiency and processes.
The role holder) is responsible for leading the effort to understand the business needs and identify how best to meet those needs. This includes working with the business and the technology areas to gather requirements for development and management. The role leads the effort to analyze, validate and document the business and system requirements.
The role holder is a key facilitator within the IT organization, acting as a bridge between the business and the IT groups, and is accountable for a technology solution that supports the business request or opportunity and is based on the enterprise architecture. This role partners with the Architect during the initial stages of the project/solution to ensure the accuracy of business cases and that the solution will meet the business need.
This role designs, modifies and creates business processes that will be used to implement the business transformation solutions. This is done through research and fact-finding combined with a basic understanding of applicable business processes, systems, and industry requirements.
The role holder determines the process and requirements management methodology practices. The role monitors the effort to ensure that the methodology and quality standards are being met.
Scope:
Multiple business processes, or sub-processes, spanning one or more geographic regions and/or business units.
Autonomy:
Has defined authority and responsibility for a significant area of work, including technical, financial and quality aspects.
Establishes organizational objectives and delegates assignments.
Accountable for actions and decisions taken by self and subordinates.

Influence:
Influences policy formation on contribution of specialization to business objectives.
Influences at level of division internally and influences customer/suppliers and industry at senior management level.
Decisions impact work of employing organizations, achievement of organizational objectives and financial performance.
Develops high-level relationships with customers suppliers and industry leaders.
Complexity:
Can absorb complex technical information and communicate effectively at all levels to both technical and non-technical audiences
Is able to assess and evaluate risk and to understand the implications of new technologies.
Demonstrates clear leadership skills and the ability to influence and persuade.
Has a broad understanding of all aspects of information systems and deep understanding of area(s) of specialization.
Understands and communicates the role and impact of information systems in the employing organization.
Takes initiative to keep both own and subordinates skills up to date and to maintain awareness of developments in the information systems industry
General:
Recognized as an expert in own function
Interprets internal or external business issues and recommends solutions/best practices
Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives
Primarily domestic scope/accountability; may include some international scope/accountability
Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirement
Primary Responsibilities:
Takes responsibility for investigative work to determine requirements and specify effective business processes, through improvements in information systems, data management, practices, procedures, organization and equipment. Applies and monitors the use of required modeling and analysis tools, methods and standards. Conducts investigations at a high level for strategy studies, requirements specifications and feasibility studies. Defines, plans and justifies (in business terms) projects to develop/implement automated and non-automated components of new or changed processes.
Key Tasks:
Takes responsibility for investigative work to determine requirements, and specify effective business processes. Organizes their implementation through improvements in information systems, data management, practices, organization and equipment. Applies and monitors the use of required modeling and analysis tools, methods and standards in an intelligent and effective way.
Co-operates with senior client and IS staff as required, conducting investigations at a high level for strategy studies, requirements specifications and feasibility studies. Maintains technical awareness at a level where alternatives can be analyzed, modeled and classified according to technical feasibility and performance.
Utilizes business experience and skills to assess and advise on the practicability of alternatives, marrying up technical limitations with operational realities.
Takes responsibility as needed for the detailed specification and modeling of recommended solutions using resources, standards, methods and tools as required. Maintains links with appropriate counterparts within both software engineering and service delivery functions and plays a full part in bringing systems to implementation as detailed by organization policies and methods.
Applies available standards, methods and tools in an intelligent and effective way, and produces a consistently high standard of documentation of both a technical and a descriptive nature.
Plans, arranges and controls meetings, workshops and relations with client/user staff during system investigations and throughout subsequent development work. Takes responsibility at a high level for the proper conduct of such relations.
Defines, plans and justifies (in business terms) projects to develop/implement automated and non-automated components of new or changed processes.
Assists clients/users in defining acceptance tests for automated systems, and takes responsibility for their proper execution.
Requirements
Experience in a similar role.
Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst,
Must be currently eligible to work in the US for any employer without sponsorship
Location: This role is onsite in our Morrisville, NC or Austin, TX location.

Business Analyst

Position Overview
We are looking for an experienced, highly motivated Business Analyst (BA) professional to join the Finance Systems and Operations Transformation team. This role will be responsible for analyzing the current-state of mission-critical Finance and Operations capabilities from a people, process, data and technology perspective and perform root cause analysis to inform future-state recommendations. The BA analyzes complex business problems relating to systems and/or process, and assists in providing technical expertise in identifying, evaluating, and developing systems and procedures that meet business stakeholder requirements.

The BA must also partner with individuals in organizations outside of Finance to understand upstream and downstream process and system impacts and be able to influence and drive change in these other organizations when appropriate. This role will also act as the conduit between Business Stakeholders and IT development teams on systems projects. The Business Analyst partners with stakeholders to identify specific policy, process, data, and system changes by assessing existing systems, business processes, best practices and business objectives. Defines and documents functional and non-functional requirements. Provides ongoing support to finance stakeholders regarding application functionality, business processes and data integrity.

Responsibilities
Serve as the liaison between Finance and the IT development team
Consult with project stakeholders to understand business problems and translate them into functional and non-functional requirements. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources and reconcile conflicts
Dissect high-level information into details and communicate these details in a manner understood by relevant audiences
Influence requirements and process to effectively utilize systems and applications that support an improved customer experience
Evaluate processes, data and systems using a systematic, disciplined and data-driven approach
Propose change to policy/process when necessary to move forward with new designs
Perform root cause analysis to identify solutions that address the true source of issues and gaps
Analyze and propose solutions and other changes within the system per user /customer business needs
Manage conflict and negotiation between teams and across organizational lines to drive towards the most effective solutions
Key contact for preparing use cases, facilitating testing of solutions to ensure they meet business requirements, and prioritize defects
Collaborate with Project Manager on tasks related to the planning, scheduling and coordination of project activities. Estimate resource time and costs
Balance business requirements with technical feasibility and set expectations on new projects. Recommend changes in development, maintenance and system standards. Determine resources and timeline

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor degree required (finance, business, information systems); graduate degree preferred
5+ years in business process analysis, business analysis, management consulting and/or change management
Proven track record of analyzing complex processes and driving execution of improvements
Functional knowledge of process improvement methodologies (BPM, Six Sigma, Lean)
Lean, Six Sigma or BPM Certification a plus
Finance Analyst or Finance business intelligence and reporting experience a plus

The Ideal Candidate
Successfully frame and communicate issues to a wide audience in order to gain understanding of the issue and drive consensus on a future vision
Engage, communicate and influence effectively at all levels of the organization (from analysts to senior VPs) and across global teams using data and compelling narratives
Excellent leadership and organizational management skills
Break down very large, complex processes into digestible and concise pieces
Comfortable with ambiguity and able to adapt to rapidly changing business environment
Must be able to achieve results in a culture that favors collaborative decision making
Proactive problem solving and self-starting individual
Must be a flexible and creative individual capable of managing multiple priorities and projects in a diverse environment

3+ years' experience validating data for Business Intelligence projects (e.g., dashboards, reports).
3+ years' experience in a development environment (e.g., web, mobile, products).
3+ years' experience working on complex corporate processes, process improvement and preparing process design documentation
Six Sigma experience would be a plus
Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) or equivalent is a plus.

Develop vetted requirements related to, but not limited to:
Functional/System what a system needs to do, including reporting
Integration interfaces with other systems
Data listing of all fields, their characteristics, error conditions
Security user login, data encryption, activity logging
Compliance regulatory or financial
Assist PL's Product Design and Experience team with capturing user-based requirements (e.g., user experience, visual design).
Assist the development team by capturing performance or maintainability requirements.
Provide estimations for BA-related effort to a Project Manager or other manager.
Work with the QA team to identify and collect test data to support QA efforts.
Develop and maintain relationships with project team members, third party service partners and clients as appropriate.
Raise outstanding issues through established channels.
Work well independently and as part of a team.
Conduct analysis in accordance with established information security and information privacy policies and guidelines.
Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and with other business units or partners.

Essential Job Functions:
Exceptional attention to detail in all aspects of the project.
Exceptional communication skills with a thorough command of the English language.
Deep analytical skills with a passion for solving problems.
Work with clients to initially capture the requirements needed to drive the project to success.
Ability to construct a backlog of actionable items, be they user stories or more traditionally-based requirements documents.
Facilitate requirements meetings and validation with the client.
Produce artifacts as necessary, tailored to the client's needs, including: Visio diagrams, requirements documentation, product backlogs, reports, etc.
Use Premier Logic management systems, including Assembla and SharePoint.

Overview
Combine your exceptional attention to detail with technical aptitude in a fast-paced environment at LiveOps, a provider of virtual call center solutions. As the ambassador between our internal business units and our clients, you will spearhead client implementations and day to day requests on the LiveOps proprietary platform.

As a Professional Services Business Analyst, you will be part of a dedicated team within the Professional Services organization supporting client operations, work internally with a variety of cross-functional groups, and develop technical solutions for business problems.

Your primary mission as a Business Analyst, will be to help define, analyze, and manage implementation projects for LiveOps clients. Managing your projects through the entire lifecycle, you will handle business analysis, defining requirements, and architecting solutions. You will become an expert on the use of LiveOps technology to creatively solve client needs. Your prior experience in a client facing customer support, business analyst, or professional services role will allow you to hit the ground running.

Solid organizational and communication skills, with the ability to effectively multitask multiple client requests daily is key to success.
Responsibilities
Translate client business needs into clear technical requirements.
Fully own and multitask the execution of multiple client programs, including troubleshooting and debugging.
Identify internal inefficiencies and drive process improvement and innovation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to continuously improve LiveOps service delivery and performance.
Respond to client requests for operational support, and troubleshoot issues.
Monitor Processes, investigate discrepancies, and conceptualize improvements.
Qualifications
Strong communication skills (written and oral)
Strong organizational skills
Ability to multitask and juggle multiple programs and clients simultaneously
Integrating Systems and understanding data transfer technology.
Data analysis experience is beneficial
Problem solving and project management skills
Ability to work autonomously and make decisions while maintaining a team-focused atmosphere
Ability to read and understand technical documents, such as xml input/outputs
BS/BA from an accredited 4-year university
Proficient in the Microsoft Office suite of applications
Workers in this position will be in a general office environment and required to sit, stand, walk, bend, stoop and lift up to 50 pounds while operating office equipment and conducting daily duties.

About Liveops
Liveops delivers an on-demand skilled workforce of onshore virtual agents for customer service and sales. With no call center, overhead or wasted idle time, our pay-per-use model scales to meet seasonal or time of day spikes in demand.

More than 400 organizations across service industries including retail, health care, insurance and telecom trust Liveops to deliver an enterprise-grade workforce, with faster program readiness, increased revenue, and greater customer satisfaction scores than traditional call centers.

LiveOps offers a culture of teamwork, passion and fun! We offer outstanding benefits including insurance, 401k match, and a generous PTO plan.

Job Description

We are hiring a Senior Business Analyst to join the Campaign Framework project team, which is part of the Data Sciences practice at Publicis Media. Campaign Framework is the centralized platform that operationalizes and automates global media buying across Publicis Media. Leveraging globally defined master data values and governance processes, the platform enforces clean data entry and automates trafficking with local buying and billing systems.
In this role, you will interface with key agency stakeholders and users to gather requirements, document processes and understand core problems. You will work alongside the UX team, product managers and engineers to inform the development of Campaign Framework. There will be a focus on understanding and communicating the intricacies of platforms in the digital media space. This role will report directly to the Product Director.
To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain complex concepts in digital media. This is an exciting opportunity that will have a direct impact on the development of Campaign Framework and a clear path to grow into a product manager function over time.

Perform requirements analysis with stakeholders, users, and systemsConduct market research against 3rd party platforms and competitive productsManage meetings to gather critical information from various stakeholdersConduct interviews to uncover pain points in operational workflows and empathize with usersDocument and effectively communicate your insights to cross-functional team members and managementBuild artifacts including flowcharts, competitive matrices, and wireframesPrioritize initiatives based on business needs and roadmap

Qualifications

5 years of experience in digital media preferred2 years of experience in an analytical roleDemonstrated knowledge of planning/buying processes and workflows; experience as a planner, buyer and/or ad ops at an agency is a plusExceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skillsExperience consulting with clients to uncover pain points and transfer learnings into actionable requirementsExperience testing hypothesis with dummy data and limited resourcesSolid knowledge of core platforms in media space, such as: Prisma, DCM, Sizmek, Flashtalking, Innovid, AdWords, Facebook, TTD

Advanced knowledge of Microsoft excelQualitative and quantitative analysis, and experience with relevant tools and practices to support analysisExcellent planning, organizational, and time management skillsDiagramming software and Flowchart Maker tool suitesWireframing skills and relevant software a plus

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

The HRPP Business Analyst reports to the Director, Executive Business Operations, providing on-site support to the work of the HRPP organization and as a part of the EVC&P Business Services team.

As a key member of the HRRP organization and EVC&P Business Services team, this position requires significant financial administration experience and independent judgment and plays a critical role in maintaining the financial integrity of the department by providing budget development, cost recovery support activities, ongoing financial monitoring of the units’ resources, resource plan variance monitoring, expense reporting and projections for core operating funding as well as external affiliates invoicing & payments for services provided to Gladstone, the Veterans Affairs (VA), and San Francisco Public Health Department as well as industry and international partners.

HUMAN RESEARCH PROTECTION PROGRAM / EXECUTIVE VICE CHANCELLOR & PROVOST
In partnership with the research community, the UCSF Human Research Protection Program (HRPP) is responsible for ensuring the ethical and equitable treatment of all human research subjects in studies being conducted at UCSF and its affiliates and partners and/or being conducted by UCSF faculty, regardless of site of activity. The HRPP is also responsible for ensuring compliance with federal regulations, state laws and institutional polices, as well as national standards. The mission of the HRPP is to promote the welfare and rights of human research participants; to facilitate excellence in human research; and to provide timely and high quality education, review and monitoring for human research projects.

The Executive Vice Chancellor & Provost’s Business Services organization provides centralized financial management, strategic budget development and oversight and administrative services to the direct offices of the Chancellor (CO), Vice Chancellor for Diversity and Outreach (VCD&O) and Executive Vice Chancellor and Provost’s (EVC&P) and their subunits, departments and programs. These services include strategic & detailed budget development, financial reporting, financial transactional processing, purchasing, and reconciliations as well as access administration. HRPP, as a unit of the Associate Vice Chancellor Ethics and Compliance reporting to the Chancellor and Executive Vice Chancellor & Provost, is provided services by the EVC&P Business Services unit directly by this position.

ABOUT UCSF

The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

Business Analyst in Albany, NY

Overview:
Public Consulting Group, Inc. (PCG) is a leading public sector management consulting and operations improvement firm that partners with health, education, and human services agencies to improve lives. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, PCG has over 2,000 professionals in more than 50 offices across North America and in Europe. The firm has five designated practice areas with extensive experience in all 50 states, clients in six Canadian provinces, and a growing practice in Europe. Often combining resources from two or more practice areas, PCG offers clients a multidisciplinary approach to solve their challenges or pursue opportunities. To learn more, visit www.publicconsultinggroup.com.

Responsibilities:
Business Analysts are the entry-level position in PCG's consulting career ladder. They are expected to play a staff role in a wide range of work assignments that may include the following:

Supporting project managers across multiple projects and clients and working with various project teams.
Providing daily client and project support either onsite or via phone/email (as project experience and knowledge is gained).
Supporting financial analysis and funding assessments for various clients including cost allocation plans, cost reports, and setting rates for public services.
Learning PCG's web-based technologies and supporting the project team through the customization process, implementation, training, and ongoing operational efforts.
Supporting proposal development teams, including writing sections, coordinating efforts and preparing proposal submissions.
Developing presentations for and attending conferences/seminars.
Preparing and presenting written status reports. Supporting the team completing assessment documentation and recommendation reports for clients.
Conducting policy and other research to support the project team and assist in preparing information briefs for both internal and client-facing use.
Defining, documenting, and improving business processes.
Gathering and analyzing a variety of data, including both financial and written policy/procedure information.
Learning and performing tasks related to sales and marketing. Travel (25% - 50%) and work over 40 hours per week is required. This is a salaried position. This position will be located in our office in Albany, New York.
Qualifications

Excellent organizational, oral presentation and written communication skills.
Strong analytical skills, including the ability to analyze and organize data.
Ability to work both in a team situation and autonomously.
Proficiency in Microsoft applications, in particular Excel & SharePoint.
Commitment to life long learning.
Flexibility and willingness to embrace change.

Software development and/or coding.
Public Speaking.
Sales and/or marketing experience or internships.
Prior travel experience (domestic or abroad).
Health and human services programs and/or Medicaid knowledge.
Cost or government accounting.

Bachelor's Degree.
1-2 plus years of relevant work experience in the fields of health care, government, or the consulting field

The Business Analyst works directly with an entrepreneurial, founder/owner/CEO in analyzing multiple businesses that he owns and operates including individual companies in the following sectors: real estate development, construction, leasing, and property management. Job Overview: Each Business Analyst works closely with Division program personnel and system owners to identify user business needs that must be accommodated in the Medicaid Management Information System (MMIS) modular system design. This position needs to work with Division program personnel to solicit accurate and complete business and functional requirements and identify opportunities to improve and automate business processes.

Major Duties or Responsibilities:

Medicaid Program and Computer Business System Analysis

Analyzes system needs and communicates design components
Reviews and analyzes characteristics of existing MMIS and related systems to determine functional limitations and identify needed upgrades and improvements. Meets with system owners and end users to define business, financial, and operational requirements and goals for new system. Interviews or surveys users, observes job function and/or performs the job in order to determine what information is processed and how it is processed.
Performs requirements analysis with a focus on adding value to the business by providing detailed project objectives, identifying specific business needs, and considering trade off analysis, requirements, feasibility, risk analysis, and cost benefit analysis.
Determines the essential activities and needs of the system by identifying patterns, gaps and inconsistencies while defining the characteristics of acceptable solutions.
Identifies, supports, and promotes design of innovative system solutions that meet the business requirements and provide a benefit to the Medicaid program.
Coordinates and participates in design sessions for prototyping the new system. Supports the drawing together and integration of design components to produce the overall system.
Researches Medicaid rules and regulations to support effective system design and coordination of complex business processes between divisions.
Consults with project managers, management, users, and other stakeholders to ensure agreement on system capabilities and functions.
Assesses contractor work product
Reviews and validates system components proposed or produced by the contractor, in collaboration with division stakeholders and vendors, to identify areas where improvements could be made to ensure needs of the division participating in the Medicaid program will be met. Identifies gaps between the requirement and the proposed solution and promotes and supports development of a more comprehensive solution.
Uses analytical skills and techniques to ensure the new system will improve efficiency and satisfy future business needs and improve work flow.
Testing and Implementation Support
Coordinates and performs in-depth tests on the developed system components. Designs and documents user acceptance test plans and scenarios and conducts reviews with end-users to insure system functionality meets requirements. Provides feedback on test results to project managers and vendors.
Provides input to the contractor in the design of end user training.
Provides post-implementation support to staff and users and assist in solving computer related problems.
Research, Writing, and Planning
Researches federal and state Medicaid regulations to ensure system operations are in compliance.
Independently produces project planning, reporting, and regulatory documents, as required.
Writes Advance Planning Documents to satisfy federal participation requirements for system development and implementation.
Other Duties as assigned

Physical and Environmental Demands: A majority of the work is done in an office environment. This position requires occasional meetings in other locations in the Helena area to meet with program staff.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (Behaviors):

Required for the first day of work:
Knowledge of Medicaid business processes.
Thorough knowledge of healthcare claims management, reimbursement methodology, and service delivery.
Knowledge of principles and practices of information systems analysis, design, development, implementation, maintenance and security related functions; administrative procedures of state government; state and federal laws pertaining to information systems development and procurement of contracted services; and the organizational structure of DPHHS.
Strong conceptual, analytical and problem solving ability.
Ability to evaluate program requirements relative to the proposed solution; conduct research; exercise sound judgement in solving programs and making decisions where few precedents exist.
Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing and maintain effective working relationships with division employees, contracted staff, and other state and federal agencies.
Must have the ability to exercise sound technical, interpersonal, and organizational judgement when appraising evaluation and solving complex problems.
Demonstrated ability to manage varying deadlines and multiple projects responding positively to changes in direction, priorities, responsibilities, or assignments.
Ability to exhibit a commitment to the department mission.
Ability to build working relationships with peers based on trust and credibility.
Ability to take a reasonable and common sense approach to solving problems.
Ability to exhibit personal accountability and ownership.
Ability to work in a team environment to achieve objectives.
Ability to take the initiative to learn on an ongoing basis; actively seeks continuous learning opportunities.

Qualifications:

Required Minimum Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Healthcare Management, Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science or related field is preferred.***
Three or more years of job-related work experience.
Knowledge of Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK) is preferred.
Experience with MS Project and/or other project management tools is preferred.

***(Four years of relevant work experience may substitute for the bachelor’s degree. Other equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered on a case-by-case basis.)

Applicant Pool Statement: Not Applicable

Training Assignment: This agency may use a training assignment. Employees in training assignments may be paid below the base pay established by the agency pay rules. Conditions of the training assignment will be stated in writing at the time of hire.

ABOUT KING COUNTY: As the only county in the United States named after Martin Luther King Jr, one of the most influential civil rights leaders in our nation's history, King County is a vibrant community with residents that represent countries from around the world. It is a region with increasing diversity that cherishes the artistic and social traditions of many cultures. Together, we're changing the way government delivers service and winning national recognition as a model of excellence.

We continue to build on an enduring legacy of shared values of equity and social justice, employee engagement, innovative thinking and continuous improvement. With this commitment, King County has adopted a pro-equity agenda aimed at advancing regional change and is developing the systems and standards necessary to achieve better outcomes for all of our residents, regardless of their race or income. All of these qualities make this King County one of the nation's best places to live, work and play.

The King County Road Services Division designs, builds, operates and maintains roads and bridges in unincorporated areas of King County. The division is committed to ensuring the county's transportation system is safe and efficient for all uses and modes of travel. The Division is responsible for 1,500 miles of road and 182 bridges, 5.7 million feet of drainage ditches, over 44,000 traffic control signs, 78 traffic signals, and 50 traffic cameras in unincorporated King County.

Who May Apply - This position is open to all qualified candidates.

Work Schedule -This position is exempt from the provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act, and is not eligible for overtime pay. The work week is normally 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday. This position may be required to work extended and/or flex scheduled work hours to respond to deadlines and emergent work needs, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

Application, Forms and Materials Required: The following materials are required: (1) A King County on-line application, (2) a resume, (3) a letter of interest detailing how you meet or exceed the requirements of this position, and 4) answers to the supplemental questions. Unfortunately, application packets that do not include all the required components and/or do not follow application instructions will be deemed incomplete and will not be considered.

Description

The Business Systems Analyst’s role is to assist in the planning, design, development, and rollout and ongoing user support of efficient business, financial, and operations systems in support of core organizational functions and business processes. This includes gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of IT system investments.

Strategy & Planning
Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, and operations requirements and systems goals, and identify and resolve systems issues.Participate in design sessions in prototyping new systems for enhancing business processes, operations, and information process flow.

About You:
We are looking for an experienced Project Manager/Business analyst for our growing business who will be integral in working with both Clients and internal development teams.
