Business Analyst
Insight Systems Corporation is seeking a Business Analyst for the Feed the Future Knowledge-Driven Agricultural Development (KDAD) Project. This is a Full-time assignment, based in our Washington, DC office.
The Business Analyst (BA) works closely with the client, project management, and technical teams and is responsible for capturing and writing the business and functional requirements. The BA works with the IT Project Manager to outline and quantify deliverables. The BA is the primary liaison with the client and is tasked with understanding their needs and translating those needs into web based content management solutions. The BA has an in-depth understanding of web based systems and Content Management Systems and ensures that there is integration between business requirements and technology. Knowledge of the Drupal CMS preferred.
The Business Analyst also performs workflow analysis and coordinates with the project management team to prioritize deliverables and negotiate on product functionalities. The BA needs a thorough understanding of software development processes – SDLC – along with proven analytical, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills to help identify, communicate, and resolve issues.
Responsibilities
The duties for this position may include, but are not limited to:
Working with clients to gather business requirements for building and maintaining Drupal-based CMS solutions.
Analyzing, translating, and documenting business and technical requirements.
Serving as the liaison between customers and the systems development team.
Analyzing information for quality, completeness, and reporting purposes.
Developing standard operating procedures (SOPs) and related materials such as FAQs and help materials for Web-based systems.
Helping with CMS operations, including QA of posted content, bug tracking, and facilitating communication between the client and the developer/technical support staff.
Supporting the Web Portfolio Manager.
Tackling other ad hoc tasks as required to operate a community-driven website.
Required Education
The candidate for this position should hold a minimum of a BA or BS.
Required Experience
In addition to the above educational requirements, the candidate for this position must also have:
Experience working with Web CMS technology, particularly Drupal
Solid experience writing business and technical requirements
An ownership mentality over the BA’s areas of responsibility
An ability to prioritize and track changes in requirements in the context of a large and complex project
An ability to resolve ambiguity and steer the client toward well-defined requirements
An ability to track decisions and make sure they are reflected in the requirements
Articulate oral and written communication skills
Strong, client-facing interpersonal skills
Strong time management and organizational skills
Strong analytical and reasoning abilities

Description

Parallon believes that organizations that continuously learn and improve will thrive. That’s why after more than a decade Parallon remains dedicated to helping hospitals and hospital systems operate knowledgeably, intelligently, effectively and efficiently in the rapidly evolving healthcare marketplace, today and in the future. As one of the healthcare industry’s leading providers of business and operational services, Parallon is uniquely equipped to provide a broad spectrum of customized revenue cycle services.

Job Summary:
The Patient Access Business Analyst designs, develops and implements process improvement solutions for Parallon Patient Access departments through the use of business analytics methodologies. The candidate, in collaboration with other members of the Parallon Corporate Patient Access team, develops business cases, designs proof of concepts solutions and makes recommendations to improve Patient Access processes including Patient Experience, Staffing Efficiency, Scheduling, Pre-Financial Clearance, and Facility based Registration and Financial Counseling. The Patient Access Business Analyst will work with the management and IT to incorporate findings into process improvement initiatives, workflow enhancements and training opportunities.

Duties (included but not limited to):

General Revenue Cycle Operations Responsibilities:

Strong understanding of Parallon Patient Access operations, including business processes, tools, and technologies
Ability to identify Patient Access process improvement opportunities and implements solutions to improve effectiveness and efficiencies of Patient Access operations and decision making process
Collaborates professionally with all internal and external business partners
Communicates regularly with Shared Service Center and other field executives to ensure smooth data collection and reporting processes
Stays focused and proactively prioritizes initiatives; determines tasks and resources, and schedules with ability to multi-task
Demonstrates strong verbal and written communication skills
Independent, innovative, creative, self-managing individual with the ability to succeed with general directions
Exhibits strong teamwork and leadership skills
Exhibits technical aptitude and experience with different analytics tools
Can resolve simple, moderate and complex issues without assistance
Participate in departmental training and professional development opportunities when available
Minimal travel may be required
Other duties as assigned
Data Analysis and Analytics:

Serves as the department’s Business Analytics liaison and builds strong relationships within department and with other staff outside of the department
Promotes efficiency and repeatability of reporting and analytical tasks, including documentation and automation as appropriate
Exhibits technical aptitude and experience with data tools, such as Microsoft Excel and Microstrategy Visual Insight
Work closely with Parallon IT and Financial Analysis to ensure accuracy and relevance of reporting and dashboards
Develops proof of concept solutions for dashboards and process improvement solutions
Maintains strong attention to detail in order to ensure the accuracy of the data being reported
Performs ad-hoc requests from management
Prepare reports, narratives, visualizations, and presentations for SSCs, Parallon Revenue Cycle leadership, and HCA Executives
Document procedures for data pulls and data preparation


Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree required. Master’s Degree preferred.
2 years of relevant experience. Strong healthcare background/experience preferred. Knowledge of Revenue Cycle business processes; excellent oral and written communication skills in individual and group setting; successful performance requires a high level of teamwork and collaboration across Parallon Business Performance Group and ability to work within a matrix leadership structure.

CEVA Logistics, one of the world’s leading non-asset based supply-chain management companies, designs and implements industry leading solutions for large and medium-size national and multinational companies. Approximately 42,000 employees in more than 160 countries are dedicated to delivering effective and robust supply-chain solutions across a variety of sectors where CEVA applies its operational expertise to provide best-in-class services across its integrated network.
CEVA offers competitive incentive packages, exceptional benefits and an exceptional culture for career building. Start your career with CEVA and build on our Foundations: Unity, Growth and Excellence. CEVA people are passionate about supply chain management.
Job Summary:
CEVA Logistics is currently hiring a Business Analyst – Contract Logistics Supply Chain located in Houston, TX. The Business Analyst provides analyzes and reports on information and data used to evaluate the performance of the CL teams in the North American (NORTAM) cluster. The position is key point of knowledge to help management and operators identify areas where extra focus is currently needed and to alert the same of issues or trends of potential concern. This is achieved thru timely follow up on the reported data, the accurate analysis of the data and by creating tools to reduce time needed to generate these KPI’s.
In this role, The Business Analyst will:
Develop a variety of reports and forecasts, identifies trends, assumptions and risks, and assists with or communicates findings and recommendations
Perform a variety of calculations and analyses audits of financial and business results
Develop proposals or reports to outline current or proposed finance or business operations


Summary of Key Accountabilities:
Main areas of focus and accountability of the role – detail in order of importance the main areas of accountability of the role:
Reviews and responds to more comprehensive internal or external customer requests which includes applying finance and business principles, drafting responses and outlines, and other professional support
Secures timely and high quality reports on the performance of the operations
Tracks and oversees performance, and works with staff when potential problems are identified
Assists with training of current and new staff members in the CEVA BPM-program and the tools in use
Develops KPI’s and programs to track performance and work with stakeholders to improve
Assists with coordinating internal resources to respond to internal or external customer requests, such as gathering, analysing and summarizing information


Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Business Administration or equivalent education and experience with a Master’s Degree in related field preferred
Five or more years of related Logistics operations experience
Basic understanding of warehousing and transportation principles


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities that Contribute to Success:
Applying specialized professional finance and related business principles and practices.
Familiar with finance and business rules within a fast paced environment
Oversee accuracy of data thru follow-up, audit and analysis
Strong financial analytical skills (statistical, quantitative, mathematical)
Advanced level in MS Office, Report writing software
Understanding of basic cost structure of a CL-environment
Capable of acting in group or individually
Address and escalate where needed issues
Able to adapt communication to audience and/or intended result
Must be able to fluently read, write and speak English


CEVA operates in a multicultural, global environment and is a richly diverse organization operating seamlessly as one company. We aim to attract, motivate and retain the best people in our industry, whatever their background. We share the same passion to deliver world-class solutions to our customers. We have the best supply chain professionals in the industry and develop this talent in an inspiring work environment.
CEVA Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunity work place and an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other characteristic. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individual with Disabilities.

Description
The Business Analyst captures and analyzes the business objectives and requirements and helps identify appropriate business solutions to those requirements. The Business Analyst is responsible for maintaining the integrity of the requirements throughout the project or program lifecycle.
Utilizing key HR & Legal stakeholders and other available resources research, facilitate discussions, analyze and evaluate options and provide recommendations to the Program Manager/Project Manager
Collaborates with project stakeholders to ensure end solution meets requirements and gain an understanding of the context and impact of the project to the business line
Conducts business needs and functional/non-functional requirements elicitation and complete functional requirements documentation through the full sign off process for project/program documentation
Documents procedure and policy changes from current state model showing future state impacts of project and manage through the full sign off process
Manages project tasks assigned within scope, quality and timeframe allocated with PM supervision
Identifies and record risks, issues, dependencies and assumptions in accordance with project standards. Agree escalation level with Project Manager, and then manage those assigned through to resolution including updating project risks and issues logs
Deputize for the Project Manager where required

Qualifications
Minimum of 3 years previous experience as a Business Analyst (including requirements development)
Solid understanding of project management techniques/methodologies
Relevant recognized formal qualification in Business Analysis is desirable but not essential
Relevant experience in HR technology is desirable but not essential
Flexibility to work on a variety of projects and teams within Business Change Management
Education
Bachelor’s Degree preferred or a minimum of 4 years relevant Business Analysis experience.
Working towards a relevant recognized formal qualification in Business Analysis is desirable but not essential
Hours & Work Schedule
Hours per Week: 40
Work Schedule: Monday-Friday

Position: Business Analyst

Job Purpose: The purpose of this position is to solve organizational business problems through understanding the business needs, priorities and stated requirements; streamlining business processes; recommending system controls and protocols; leveraging evolving technologies and managing workload flows and priorities.

Job Duties Include: The following reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Management may assign additional duties and responsibilities to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons:
Coordinate and oversee preparation and submission of contract deliverables.
Coordinate onboarding documentation requirements for prime and sub-contractors.
Conduct project planning and develop/maintain execution schedule.
Define processes and procedures governing effective/efficient project execution.
Develop reporting formats for tracking project progress (e.g., actual vs. planned completions, rework statistics, productivity rates, etc.) and ensure timely submission of completed reports at client specified frequency.
Keep Na Ali`i leadership abreast of project execution, and any issues (e.g., production, equipment/facilities, manpower, etc.) of potential impact to achievement of client requirements/deliverables or requirements exceeding defined scope of work.
Resolving issues that arise during development.

Skills/Qualifications: Requirements analysis, planning, database management, self-motivated, presenting technical information, problem solving, multi-tasking, and exceptional oral and written communications.

Education and Experience: This position desires a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution or minimum 5 years professional experience.

The Business Analyst is primarily responsible to act as a liaison between the Information Technology group and the Business Unit partners. This position represents the business perspective of a system development project. The Business Analyst will work with the Business Units to: define business requirements, develop business processes, validate business processes against the system, organize and execute user testing and participate in end user training. The Business Analyst will become the “subject matter expert”, both from a business perspective and a system functionality perspective, for his/her defined area of the system(s). The Business Analyst will own the functional requirements and sign off that the initial business requirements are being delivered with the end solution.
Qualifications
BUSINESS PROCESS DEVELOPMENT
Work with business sponsor to create realistic business use cases that determine the process that a user will execute when using the new and/or enhanced system
Create business process test cases to test the new and/or enhanced system

FUNTIONAL SPECIFICATION DEVELOPMENT
Work with business sponsor to determine business requirements for new and/or enhanced system requests
Create and own functional specifications for new and/or enhanced system development
Hold functional specification review sessions with cross-functional team members (Business sponsors, IT, other Business Analysts, QA engineers, operations, and training group) for review of requirements
Require sign off of functional specification(s) from all cross functional project team members

SCOPE CHANGE CONTROL
Monitor all issues associated with their area of responsibility
Work with business sponsors, other IT function areas and IT management to prioritize issues
Work with PMO to determine resources and timing
Work with Project Manager to track statuses of issues

TRAINING
Conduct/Assist in the development of the training material for the end user group
Conduct/Assist with hands on training sessions for end user group

PROJECT SUPPORT
Responsible for creation and maintenance of accurate project status information that is communicated to the business sponsor(s) on regular scheduled intervals
User Acceptance Testing
Coordinate and execute user acceptance testing sessions
Primary contact for production issues escalation
Determine actual issue
Gather important data necessary for troubleshooting
Work with Business sponsor, PMO, IT management to determine priority and resourcing
Work with IT and Business Sponsor team members to resolve issues.

Bachelor's Degree

5-7 years of experience

4 year college degree or equivalent work experience

A minimum of 5 years cross functional retail experience
Business Analyst work experience required

Company
At Odessa, we’re committed to bringing innovation, creativity and customer-centricity to enterprise applications for the leasing industry. Since 1998, we’ve been working hard to push the established technology norms and are serious about what we do. But we also like to have fun – in fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day. One of our core values is ‘enjoyment’.

Role
Located in Odessa's Philadelphia office, the Business Analyst will primarily serve as a product subject matter expert. The position is responsible for collating client requirements; producing detailed system requirements and design documentation by describing and demonstrating processes within the software application; as well as testing the delivered application to ensure the product meets the outlined requirements.

Core Responsibilities:
Assists in the facilitation of user/process discussions
Accurately diagram a process based on user descriptions and/or documentation
Formulate possible solutions to a given business or application challenge
Conceptualize and document multiple design solutions to meet a requirement, with the ability to describe the impacts of each solution on the end-user
Design changes and enhancements to company's products to meet client business-models
Independently create and follow system test cases when testing the application
Create simple UI mock-ups of proposed changes to screen designs
Describe application logic and how it relates to a given feature or problem
Describe a selected process or demonstrate an application feature to an end-user
Develops requirements documentation, functional specifications and system design specifications for client engagements
Identify issues/gaps between a written requirement and/or design and the delivered software
Experience & Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in IT/Economics/Business Administration or similar field
1-3 years of experience in consulting or consulting-related position/s
Experience with Software Development lifecycle
Experience writing/executing user test cases
Understanding of software requirements and design process documentation
Understanding of basic database design principles
Understanding of Financial / Managerial accounting
Fluency in Spanish highly desirable
Skills & Competencies
Strong entrepreneurial attitude and ability to work in a challenging and rigorous environment
Ability to communicate core financial accounting and lease accounting concepts
Ability to understand and describe how one business process or sub-process affects another business process
Ability to understand and articulate user and usability needs based on stated requirements and/or business process
Able to work within the project deadlines set by project manager and/or team leader
Ability to take detailed and useful notes during a discussion, and translate discussion notes into specific requirements for system design
Written documentation is clear and consistent with OTI documentation standards, and free from spelling and grammatical errors
Ability to check own work and does so prior to document delivery to other team members
Consistently delivers high-quality materials
Understands the importance of time-tracking and consistently adheres to guidelines
Working Conditions
Travel approximately 20-30%.
Traditional office environment with no unusual work conditions
Physical Demands
Odessa promotes an equal opportunity workplace, which includes reasonable accommodations of otherwise qualified disabled applicants and employees. Please contact Human Resources with questions regarding the physical demands of this position: Lifting/carrying up to 15 lbs, Manual dexterity for computer work, Speaking, hearing and vision are required to perform all essential functions.

CommissionPosition Overview: Job Purpose
Oversight Systems is looking for a Business Analyst. In this new position you will be responsible for managing and collecting requirements from stakeholders based on our software product roadmap. You will work with the software product manager, project manager, software development team, and/or project sponsors to document the product’s vision and the project’s scope. The Business Analyst serves as the conduit between the product stakeholders and the software development team managing the requirements flow through the SDLC.

Responsibilities
Write requirements specifications according to standard templates in a simple, clear, unambiguous, and concise manner (including e.g. specifications of stories, backlog items/EPIC, Customer Journeys).
Decompose high-level business and user requirements into functional requirements
Evaluate incoming requirements, determine approaches, priorities, most suitable tools, and partner with the software development team to see the requirement through to implementation
Participate in peer reviews and inspections of requirements documents to ensure that the requirements were interpreted correctly.
Propose new product features and updates.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent technical work experience
5+ years of experience in working with business and technical stakeholders to discuss, collect, rework, and document requirements for new software, systems and solutions
Experience with scheduling and prioritizing software capabilities
Experience with financial business processes (T&E, GL, AP, Procurement, Fleet, etc.) and their associated systems recommended
Experience with analytics, business intelligence, and AI software products a plus
Ability to work collaboratively with engineering and development teams to describe needed capabilities and provide implementation-ready requirements
Ability to iteratively review and provide feedback on developed or configured capabilities, always working to ensure that stakeholders interests and needs are being satisfied and balanced against the priorities and constraints of technology requirements and business objectives
Ability to develop a comprehension of required technical capabilities and how various systems will be ultimately used to accomplish the organization’s mission
Compensation:
This position carries a competitive base salary and commissions. In addition, Oversight provides an excellent and comprehensive benefits package for our employees. This training consists of the same components that are offered to the top sales executives of Fortune 500 companies.

This position is in Atlanta, Georgia.

If this sounds like a good fit for you, please submit your resume to recruiter@oversightsystems.com.

About Oversight Systems:
Since 2003, Fortune 1000 businesses and government organizations have trusted Oversight to analyze over $2 trillion in annual payments. Powered by Artificial Intelligence and machine learning technologies, our automated risk management and compliance monitoring platform detects and mitigates fraud, waste, and misuse in financial spending, reducing auditing effort by 50% to 90% and improving policy compliance by up to 70%.

Develops a working knowledge of the technology commercialization process, formation of new companies, and the process for obtaining funding for the new companies.


Supervisory responsibility:
~2 to 4 student interns
Minimum qualifications (mandatory):
Bachelor’s degree in a biological or engineering related science required. Minimum 2 years’ experience in marketing, preferably life and physical sciences technologies or working in industry in a similar function.
Preferred qualifications:
Advanced degree preferred, but not required, in a related science or a MBA with experience in biotechnology fields.
Special knowledge, skills, and abilities:
Able to understand complex technologies and develop concise, clear synopses of the technologies.
Resourceful with data gathering, manipulation of large data sets, and quantitative analysis.
Able to think creatively about potential commercial applications for new technologies and how JHTV might facilitate commercialization.
Able to deal well with unstructured problems.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Detail oriented and highly organized.

The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Job Description

Amazon’s Paid Search team is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to deliver a set of high-priority initiatives. The Paid Search team manages Amazon’s advertising on external search engines such as Google and Bing, managing vast keyword portfolios, designing and launching tests to programmatically drive new business and improve ROI. Our channel is one of the largest levers for new customer acquisition and engagement, supporting both US and International Amazon marketplaces.

In this role, you will work with diverse, complex, and very large data sets, and you will lead the prioritization, development and optimization of analytics solutions to generate insights, drive marketing strategies and identify business opportunities. You will work hand-in-hand with Marketing Managers, Product Managers, Applied Scientists and Software Developers to build solutions to optimize Paid Search programs for both Text Ads and Shopping Ads. You will build self-service reporting and analytics solutions that can be leveraged by marketing managers globally and you will represent Paid Search at weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews. You will work closely with the data science and software development teams on the experimentation and development of machine-learning-based products to optimize Paid Search marketing.

You will own the end-to-end development of solutions to complex questions and you’ll play an integral role in strategic decision making. You will have a solid understanding of business intelligence software such as Microstrategy or Tableau and an ability to use data for statistical analysis. You will analyze Paid Search marketing performance across multiple geographies and effectively communicate results and opportunities.

Key Responsibilities:
Creating and overseeing business dashboards and present key metrics, insights and recommendations during weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews
Enabling effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Partnering with engineers and applied scientists to build analytical solutions to deliver on business goals
Developing reporting solutions for marketing managers to monitor key input and output metrics
Performing deep-dives to find the root causes of variances and data anomalies
Working with Product Managers and Marketing Mangers to analyze experiments including elasticity, incrementality creative content and more

Overview
Visiting Nurse Service of New York (VNSNY) is the nation’s largest not-for-profit community-based health system. VNSNY provides a comprehensive array of home- and community-based programs, including health plans, tailored to the needs of high-risk, vulnerable New Yorkers, improving their quality of life. Each day,more than 18,000 VNSNY employees — including nurses, rehabilitation therapists, social workers, dieticians, other allied professionals, and paraprofessionals — deliver compassionate care, unparalleled medical expertise, and 24/7 solutions and resources tomore than35,000 patients, helping them to live the best lives possible.

Created in 1998, VNSNY CHOICE is the managed care affiliate of the Visiting Nurse Service of New York and shares its mission of compassion and care for the poor, the chronically ill and elderly. Our guiding principle is to help the most vulnerable among us live safely and independently for as long as possible in their own homes and communities. VNSNY CHOICE has 700 employees, including 227 care management staff. On any given day, VNSNY CHOICE coordinates care for more than 40,000 members through its array of Medicare and Medicaid health plans, including Medicaid Long Term Care, Medicare Advantage, and a HIV/Special Needs Plan. With offices in Manhattan, Brooklyn and upstate New York, VNSNY CHOICE health plans are available in the New York City metropolitan area as well as on a plan basis in selected counties throughout New York State.

Overview:
WebPresented is an innovative software company that is quickly growing into a leader of business intelligence and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software development. We provide tools that empower our customers, helping them to make confident business decisions based on solid data.

Based out of Rev1 Ventures in Columbus, Ohio, we work with clients all across the United States and Canada. We provide competitive pay, healthcare benefits, and opportunities for personal and professional growth. We are looking for dynamic individuals with high energy and drive, who are self-motivated and results-oriented, to work with our team. This is a great opportunity to be part of a young, innovative company that is on the cutting edge of the industry.

Over the past 12 months, WebPresented has experienced extraordinary growth. With this growth comes more discipline execution of specific processes to manage customer implementations, product development and account management. The perfect candidate will bring energy, an intellectual curiosity to understand and improve how we are performing now, the desire to roll-up their sleeves, and the ability to execute their ideas. The ability to manage multiple activities is critical for this role to succeed.

Responsibilities May Include:

Customer Implementations – Using the WebPresented Implementation Methodology, work with our customers to capture, track and manage requirements and activities throughout the implementation process.
Quality Assurance / Quality Control – Review current processes for Quality Assurance, make recommendations for improvement, and implement and execute Quality Assurance processes
Account Management – Work with specific key accounts during the implementation and post-implementation stage to grow the customer use of WPCRM. This includes managing the implementation from the point of User Acceptance Test through Operational Support

Should have acquired or be working towards a degree in MIS, Marketing, Computer Science, or a related field.
Skilled in Microsoft Excel or similar productivity tools.
Self-starter with strong self-management skills
Ability to interact with customers to plan / organize events
Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities
Ability to quickly learn new concepts and software

----------------
Role Description
----------------

We're looking for a Business Analyst to partner with marketing, revenue, and product teams to answer key questions about how to grow revenue, scale and monetize the business, and launch high-impact initiatives. We solve challenging problems and boost business growth through a deep understanding of consumer behaviors with applied analytics techniques and business insights. An ideal candidate should have robust knowledge of consumer lifecycle and behavior analysis, customer segmentation, digital campaigns, monetization analytics and business operations for a SaaS company.

----------------
Responsibilities
----------------


Develop a deep understanding of customer journey phases and key business metrics
Perform analytical deep-dives to analyze problems and opportunities by researching and understanding user behavior, identify hypothesis and designing & executing experiments
Recommend experimentation strategies based on exploratory data analysis, predictive analytics and behavioral segmentation
Design logical decision trees, leverage propensity models to create segments and customize actions to drive business results
Build executive-facing dashboards to track progress of KPIs and extract actionable insights through analyzing large, complex, multi-dimensional customer behavior data sets
Translate complex concepts into implications for the business via excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Work with cross-functional teams (including Marketing, Product Management, Engineering, Design, Creative, and senior executives) to rapidly execute and iterate
Understand what matters most and prioritize ruthlessly

------------------
Requirements
------------------


Bachelors' or above in CS, Engineering, Physics, Math, Statistics, Business, Economics or related field
2-5 years experience using analytics to drive key business decisions; examples include business/product/marketing analytics, business intelligence
Proven track record of being able to work independently and proactively engage with business stakeholders with minimal direction
Significant experience with SQL and large datasets; proficiency in programming/scripting and knowledge of statistical packages like R or Python
Deep understanding of statistical analysis, experimentation design, and common analytical techniques like regression, decision trees
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Experience with customer acquisition, web analytics, growth and monetization analytics

------------------
Benefits and Perks
------------------


100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
401k + company match
Market competitive total compensation package
Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
Wellness Reimbursement
Generous vacation policy
10 company paid holidays
Volunteer time off
Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

At American Express, service has been at the core of our company for more than 160 years. In taking care of our prospects and customers, Global Servicing Network employees view each interaction as an opportunity to deepen a relationship. The Global Partner Network is an organization within the Global Servicing Network. Our team manages a complex, global network of 3rd party servicing partners who provide AXP with servicing flexibility and quality experiences for American Express card members and prospects.

Global Partner Network is seeking an exceptional candidate for the role of Analyst who will report to the Manager of Partner Compensation. The role purpose of this role is to drive process improvement and will entail significant relationship management across the Global Partner Network team and with key business partners at all levels of the organization. Critical to the role is intellectual curiosity, a proactive nature, attention to detail, comfort with data & financials, and strong work ethic.

Responsibilities include:
Spearhead report automation projects which would capture operational metrics and key performance indicators
Provide insights on metrics and partner payment terms
Report on operational efficiencies and vendor contractual terms
Support the Manager of Partner Compensation with day-to-day activities related to business updates and executive reporting
Identify and monitor progress against key priorities and initiatives
Lead and/or participate in ad-hoc projects to support efficiency, effectiveness, and growth objectives for the organization that contribute to GSN’s overall business results
Participate in other GSLN / GSN Governance & Control activities to support the overall success of the global GSN organization
Qualifications
Minimum of 2 years of reporting experience
Proven ability to analyze data, identify and interpret trends to evaluate potential
Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office, specifically MS Excel and PowerPoint required
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau required
Experience in call center management - systems, methods, reporting (Highly Preferred)
Understanding of general accounting principles and a strong financial acumen
Motivated self-starter with the proven ability to resolve complex problems and open-ended business challenges independently and work through ambiguity to prioritize work to meet all timelines
Strong thought leadership including capacity to quickly understand critical linkages and business requirements; define problem areas, communicate & achieve resolution.
Strong relationship building skills including the ability to gain alignment among key stakeholders with demonstrated experience in influencing without authority
Proven ability to maintain an organized approach to work with a strong focus on managing multiple projects / deadlines simultaneously
Ability to remain composed while driving results in stressful situations and escalate when necessary
Knowledgeable / Experience in 3rd Party Management a plus.
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

The HR Business Analyst is part of the Business Process Optimization team at Vanderbilt University and is responsible for the ongoing maintenance, configuration, and support of Vanderbilt’s Oracle Cloud Finance and Human Capital Management (HCM) system. Reporting directly to the Associate Director of System Consulting, the Solutions Consultant serves as a key partner to operational leaders in Finance, Human Resources and Information Technology.
The Business Process Optimization team is charged with working strategically across the university to build efficient, repeatable business processes, training the community on system changes and best practices, and maintaining Vanderbilt’s Oracle Cloud system. The BPO team is highly collaborative, with a culture focused on supporting each other in getting the right work done the right way.
The HR Business Analyst will have a portfolio of systems for which s/he is responsible for managing the routine operations. This includes serving as a key resource for operational leaders in accomplishing business goals through system configuration. Additionally, this position is responsible for delivering excellent customer service to both end users and business process owners, monitoring monthly and quarterly releases from Oracle for system changes, conducting configuration and testing for quarterly releases, and creating detailed analysis of transactional metrics to support process optimization. The HR Business Analyst must be creative, a strategic thinker, innovative, resourceful, and utilize entrepreneurial thinking in meeting challenges.
About Vanderbilt University:
Vanderbilt is a renowned private institution founded in 1873 and located in the heart of Nashville, Tennessee. The university’s students, faculty, and frequently cite Nashville and the surrounding area as one of the many perks of being a part of Vanderbilt community. Vanderbilt University is a place where your expertise will be valued, your knowledge expanded, and your abilities challenged. It is a place where your diversity is sought and celebrated. It is a place where employees know they are part of something bigger than themselves, take exceptional pride in their work and never settle for what was good enough yesterday. Vanderbilt was recently ranked #1 in the Princeton Review among 382 top colleges and universities for “happiest students” - as well as #2 for “best quality of life” and “great financial aid,” #5 for “best run colleges” and “beautiful campus,” and #6 for both being in a “college city that students love” and having “great campus/city relations.”
Key Functions and Expected Performance:
Managing Work Processes
Communicates comfortably at all levels within the university; consummate team player able to work effectively up, down and across the university
Builds and maintains strong working relationships with university stakeholders
A bias for action even in the face of ambiguity and complexity.
Attacks everything with drive and energy; drives to finish everything he/she starts. Is effective and efficient at marshalling multiple resources to get things done; lays out tasks in sufficient detail to mark the trail; is able to get things done with less and in less time; can work on multiple tasks at once without losing track; foresees and plans around obstacles.
Is an effective process, work flow, and systems designer; is good at figuring out what to measure to track progress; can quickly diagnose and fix a work flow problem; always looking for incremental process improvement.
Adapts easily to changes in technology and process
Models intrinsic integrity and excellent professional judgment while exhibiting unquestioned discretion with highly sensitive and confidential information
System Knowledge
Maintains an extensive understanding of Oracle Cloud functions and related connections among all parts of Oracle Cloud
Understands integrations between Oracle Cloud and other systems used at Vanderbilt
Serves as expert in Oracle Cloud configuration
System Configuration
Translates the institution’s business needs into the appropriate configuration, or where those needs cannot be met, work with leaders to find suitable alternatives
Monitors release notes for impact of upcoming system changes and communicates as necessary
Assists with detailed system testing for process changes and quarterly releases
Works collaboratively with BPO team, functional leaders, and information technology to prioritize change requests
User Support
Serves as escalation point for end-user support requests
Provides ongoing support to functional teams
Serve as source of truth for system functionality
Assists with management of Oracle Service Requests (SRs)

Supervisory Relationships:
This position does not have supervisory responsibility. This position reports administratively and functionally to Associate Director of Solutions Consulting.
Experience and Education:
Bachelor’s degree and 2-3 years of relevant experience with demonstrated progressive responsibility
Modern system experience preferred; Oracle Cloud HCM, ERP, P2P, PPM experience a plus


About Vanderbilt Benefits:
In addition to offering a lively community that encourages learning and celebrates diversity, Vanderbilt University offers a competitive, flexible benefits package including health, dental, vision, life, accidental death & dismemberment, disability insurance, paid time off, and a 403(b) retirement plan with employer match. Vanderbilt offers tuition assistance to employees, spouses and dependent children. Also, after five years of service, Vanderbilt will pay up to 55% of the tuition for up to three dependent children to earn a bachelor's degree. Learn more about Vanderbilt's benefits at VU Benefits Overview.

Analytical & Detail-Oriented – Accurately assesses information and applies applicable law, policy and procedure. Considers the long term implications of actions today and advises employees appropriately. Even small mistakes can create big issues; attention to detail work indicates care about the outcomes.
Integrity – Holds oneself accountable; takes responsibility for failures as well as successes, recognizes that trust is required to hold a team together.
Raises the Bar – Expects and delivers excellence. Is a creative problem solver. Is proactive. Welcomes input on making things better. Places a high value on learning and getting better
Hard-Working – Is industrious as well as efficient (busy isn’t the same as productive). Can juggle multiple competing priorities simultaneously without becoming overwhelmed.
Teamwork – Genuinely values teamwork and co-workers; make them feel valuable and important by acknowledging what they do well. Doesn’t expect from others effort that one is unwilling to do themselves. Finds ways to acknowledge other’s strong suits.

Senior Business Analyst - Williston VT
About Us
As a high energy health information technology consulting company, Strategic Solutions Group (SSG) focuses on providing value driven solutions that positively impact the health and well-being of our nation. We combine expertise in project management, business analysis and information technology to provide superior business consulting services and software products to our clients in the fields of public health, healthcare, and public safety.

Our key to success is a team of smart, dedicated people with integrity. It is an exciting time to join SSG and grow with us as we expand our impact and service to others within the healthcare industry. Our team members have the opportunity to make an immediate impact and we value people who can get the job done, individually and as part of the SSG team. We love meeting smart people and look forward to hearing from you.

About You
First and foremost you are a great problem solver who can communicate effectively about information technology requirements and concerns. You can handle challenging customer meetings by bringing together key stakeholders to define requirements. As problems crop up, you can handle the adversity by determining why the issue happened and offering viable options to resolve them. In addition, you have a willingness to learn new technologies, a proactive entrepreneurial spirit and are extremely reliable.

Description
This role generally acts as a Senior Business Analyst for one or more assigned projects. The Sr. BA works independently or as part of a Business Analysis team to effectively execute Business Analysis responsibilities in an efficient and professional manner that derives optimal value for the business entity impacted by the project(s) execution, balancing cost with quality and schedule.

The Sr. BA designs, documents, and manages against a project Business Analysis Plan to ensure that critical and appropriate Business Analysis methods and deliverables are applied to the project from initiation through closure to support achievement of the project’s objectives and benefits.

Many of the Projects and Programs within the DVHA IT Portfolio are subject to oversight (IV&V) and federal governance processes. In addition, Projects >$500k in total implementation costs are subject to Independent Review through the ADS EPMO.

Required Qualifications
We’re looking for someone who gets excited about serving as a Senior Business Analyst. The duties include:

Identify business and technical needs and opportunities and recommend solutions that will deliver value to the business.
Identify and recommend opportunities for process improvement.
Understand the position of the organization within a global context.
Determine the appropriate business analysis strategy for a given initiative and manage the execution of that strategy.
Conduct Business Analysis according to the standards established by the ADS EPMO and/or DVHA IT Portfolio and IIBA.
Manage project deliverables in accordance with documented requirements life cycle.
Ensure compliance with Agency, State, and Federal requirements regarding business analysis.
Work with stakeholders across levels, functions, culture, and geography.
Direct, delegate and distribute assignments to Business Analysts within the Project
Manage communications vertically and horizontally to support the success of business analysis activities.
Mediate between project stakeholders.
 Preferred Qualifications
Knowledge of the accepted practices of the Business Analysis profession.
Extensive experience in business analysis and requirements definition for IT systems.
Extensive experience with UML modeling including context diagrams and Use Case modeling (identifying and describing use cases, actors, etc.), domain model diagrams (entity-relationship modeling) and activity diagrams.
Knowledge of relational database design structure concepts and IT systems architecture patterns (e.g. tiers of an IT system, Services Oriented Architecture patterns, etc.).
Familiarity with both Waterfall methodologies and Agile principles a plus.
Familiarity with User Experience concepts such as design for usability.
Some project management experience.
3 years of professional business analysis experience.
Bachelor's Degree required (business or technical degrees are preferred).
SSG is an equal opportunity employer.

This is Adyen

Speed is the foundation of our company. We think fast. We work fast. We launch fast. Our merchants’ demands shape our development path, and we never stop until the job is done. We’re creating our own path, with a global team driving sustainable growth. We don’t do hierarchy, egos or boundaries. “Not possible” is not in our vocabulary — “freedom” is. This is who we are: honest, direct and always bringing an element of fun into our work. If you’re ready to join the power of fast, keep reading

Business Analyst

Adyen is looking for a Business Analyst to join our US Partnerships team in San Francisco. The ideal candidate is someone who is able to approach complex problems in a structured manner, while converting the results of the analysis into a compelling and actionable story for internal or external stakeholders.

Whether you come from the payments space or not, we need you to be an independent thinker who is curious about how the payments ecosystem works and how that fits in with global commerce.

What you’ll do

Framework Development – Work with our cross-functional data teams to develop scalable and reusable frameworks for analyzing large datasets on the most pressing business questions
Be a Subject Matter Expert – Adyen’s SME for both merchants and internal stakeholders on credit card scheme rules and fee structures. Help our merchants understand and optimize the cost and revenue impacts of interchange and scheme fees.
Data Analysis - Determine the necessary data required to solve a wide variety of business problems; extract required data, perform analysis and draw conclusions and recommendations
Storytelling – Turn the analysis into effective communication and concise, actionable advice
Who you are

Education: At least 3 years of working experience and undergraduate degree
Technical Aptitude: Excellent analytical and modeling skills, with proficiency in tools such as R, Python, Matlab, and database SQL
Global Perspective: Ability to interface seamlessly with a global, multicultural team and the openness to meet with the core team in Amsterdam as needed
Interpersonal skills: Team player with excellent communication skills, and the ability to adjust a message to its audience.
Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for many of the world’s leading companies, providing a modern end-to-end infrastructure connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. Adyen delivers frictionless payments across online, mobile, and in-store channels. With offices across the world, Adyen serves customers including Facebook, Uber, Spotify, Casper, Bonobos and L'Oreal.

gTech’s Strategy and Operations team (gSO) is made up of strategic partners and trusted advisors that drive success and transformative changes for gTech. We create value through deep functional and business expertise combined with analytical rigor to formulate and deliver strategies. Using core capabilities ― strategy, analytics, and communications ― we empower gTech to do amazing things to land the present, and build for the future.
Specializing in operational reporting, data insights and data analysis, the R&A (Reporting and Analytics) team leverages big datasets, analytical tools, and business partnering to help global advertising business organizations provide exceptional customer experience and drive smart business decisions.
Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
Responsibilities
Analyze data on operations and develop insights and strategies for business organizations.
Be a trusted partner for the business stakeholders understanding their business and strategy.
Present regularly at an executive level and engage with stakeholders within the organization.
Provide thought leadership on deep analytics, identifying issues and opportunities and proposing feasible solutions.
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
B.S. in a numerate field (Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Science, etc.) or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience in an analytics, statistician or data scientist role.
Experience with data analysis tools (R, SQL) and techniques (machine learning, statistical analysis, data mining).

Preferred qualifications:
Master's degree or PhD.
Programming experience in Python, C++ and/or Java.
Experience with data analysis techniques (machine learning, statistical analysis, data mining).
Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent organizational and project management skills.
Excellent problem solving, communication and presentation skills.

RADCO Residential is the property management company for the RADCO Companies®, an Atlanta-based multi-family real estate company and a nationally recognized industry leader and innovator. We challenge the conventions of real estate investment, creating exceptional opportunities for our partners, empowering our employees, and fulfilling a distinct need in our communities. RADCO is currently seeking a new Business Analyst to join the IT Team to better serve and continue to add value to our team members.

Job Summary
The Business Analyst will work with other business analysts in the IT function and alongside the business functions they are supporting, including the Operations, Construction, and Investment teams. Main responsibilities will include performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes, and performing some user acceptance testing. To succeed in this role, individuals should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users. Core competencies include Communication, Technical Skills, and Critical Evaluation.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and develop and implement solutions
Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies
Stay up-to-date on CRE business processes and IT advancements to automate and modernize those processes
Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings
Perform requirements analysis
Document and communicate the results of your efforts
Effectively communicate your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management
Gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and produce useful documentation
Allocate resources and maintaining cost efficiency
Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements
Perform user acceptance testing
Manage projects, develop project plans, and monitor performance
Update, implement and maintain procedures
Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and users.
Manage competing resources and priorities.
Monitor deliverables and ensure timely completion of projects.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
A bachelor’s degree in business, IT or engineering is required
A minimum of 3 years experience in business analysis or a related field
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Basic understanding of business operations of various departments, including Investments, Operations, and Construction
Ability to develop data-driven reports and processes to fullfill the needs of various business departments
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions
Advanced technical skills
Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations
Proficiency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Sharepoint, and Outlook.
Advanced in Microsoft Excel
A track record of following through on commitments and leading and supporting successful projects
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills
Experience facilitating and supporting top performing teams

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIORNMENT
This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones and photocopiers/scanners.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.

Career Opportunity


Role Title


Business Analyst

Purpose of role



Job Description


The Business Analyst plays a primary role in performing business analysis, defining and producing business reports, developing technical documentation, managing strategic and tactical projects, and performing cost-benefit analysis. The incumbent may also assist in the development and execution of unit level business plans.

Responsibilities
Source information and analyze (often complex) processes, information and data, in order to make, advocate for and implement recommended improvements. This analysis may be with respect to unit revenues/expenses, business processes, vendor/intermediary services, or other similar. Quantitative, process workflow, and qualitative narrative output will be required.
Identify and define business requirements in the coordination, evaluation, and production of business and technical specification documents. This work will occur with regard to the implementation of a new system, process, or service and documentation of the scope of the initiative would occur via utilization of business templates.
Manage projects, collaborate with relevant stakeholders, and provide departmental head and inter-firm updates as necessary. In this role, the incumbent will be asked to take a leading and independent role in implementing approved business initiatives to business specifications that they will define (or that they will assist in defining).
Develop and oversee business reporting produced by unit. The incumbent may be asked to develop new business metrics, to improve the process by which metrics are produced, or to ensure the timeliness and accuracy of the production of metrics. This incumbent may also be asked to produce or contribute to the production of Board or firm executive reports.
Assist with strategic and tactical planning with unit. This will occur through participation in periodic, typically annual, unit level planning and through ongoing assessment and input toward reprioritization of initiatives. It is expected that the incumbent will identify opportunities to improve unit processes and service offerings.
Liaise within FIS and with other business units on behalf of FIS leadership. In carrying out the above responsibilities and with respect to other incidental activities, it is expected that the incumbent will be capable of communicating in a similar manner as had the communication occurred directly via FIS leadership.
FIS Client Relations telephone coverage may be required (applies to incumbents previously trained to perform this duty)
Other duties as may be requested

Educational Requirements
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required. Degrees of preference include Finance, Economics, Business Management, Engineering or Statistics.

Experience and Background Requirements
Strong analytical, problem solving and execution skills
Project management experience preferred
Strong written and verbal communications skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications

Utilant is dedicated to providing innovative, software applications to the insurance industry for both residential and commercial uses. One of our applications captures inspection data and distributes it to the parties that make underwriting decisions; the other is a sketching software for real estate appraisers and insurance inspectors.

What makes us different? Customization. We continue to expand the software capabilities, customize the application(s) for our global customer base and provide support services on an on-going basis. Every client wants their application to suit their needs and we aim to please!

As a finalist in Buffalo's Best Places to Work and Best Tech Team in Service Industries, we are dedicated to making Utilant a great place to work. Located in the newly renovated 155 Chandler Street building, we offer a great casual working environment in a tech-type atmosphere.

The person in this position provides clarity and direction in the ticket process so that continued maintenance and development is clear, concise and driven toward a timely and successful completion. Business Analysts assists with project optimization by recognizing potential efficiency improvements; taking action to positively affect the project/account and escalating issues to appropriate parties where necessary.

Successful candidates will be comfortable working on technical/analytical work, at a steady, even pace to promote an accurate and quality end product within established systems and standards. They will communicate based on job knowledge and expertise and make decisions within clearly defined job scope. Additionally, candidates should be experienced in:

Leading interactions with clients and internal resources to a successful conclusion
Formulating and defining system scope and objectives through research and fact finding
Being the technical liaison for issues that may arise from the implementation process
Review/explain templates with clients as needed as part of implementing LossControl360
Review, understand, and document feature requests originating from our customers for inclusion into the product
Assisting the Sales department in identifying and documenting gaps in functionality between company’s product/software and the client’s desired functionality
Working with clients to define project specifications and requirements
Analyzing business and user needs, documenting requirements and translating into system requirement specifications
Managing client communications person, via video and phone conference as well as "go to meeting" interactions
Translating meetings, conversations, etc., into requirements and documents
Clarifying/explaining business requirements to technical team
Performing data mapping activities and distributes to the technical team
Accurately and timely accounting for time worked, production and participation in client proposals and invoicing
Managing changing and multiply priorities
Successfully motivating cross-functional teams toward project completion
Ideal candidates should possess a bachelor’s degree in IT field or related major and 2+ years’ related experience. Time management and organizational aptitude necessary. Previous application development and/or an understanding of relational database concepts in SaaS environment is a plus.

Program: The mission of the National Name Check Program (NNCP) is to analyze and report information in response to name check requests received from federal agencies, for the purpose of protecting the United States from foreign and domestic threats to national security. Many federal agencies seek background information from FBI files before bestowing a privilege—whether that privilege is government employment or an appointment, a security clearance, attendance at a White House function, immigration benefits, naturalization, or a visa to visit the United States. More than 50 agencies regularly request FBI name checks. In addition to serving federal government customers, the NNCP conducts numerous name searches in direct support of the counterterrorism, counterintelligence, and homeland security efforts of the FBI. The employees of the NNCP review and analyze potential identifiable documents to determine if information exists regarding a specific individual, and if so, what information may be disseminated to the requesting agency. It is important to note that the FBI does not adjudicate the final outcome; it just reports the results to the requesting agency. The NNCP conducts manual and electronic searches of the FBI’s Central Records System (CRS). The CRS encompasses the centralized records of FBI Headquarters, field offices, and legal attaché offices, as well as all investigative, administrative, personnel, and general files.

5-10 yrs of experience
Bachelor's degree
Policy or Policy improvement experience preferred
Active Top Secret clearance required

Caliber Collision is the largest, fastest-growing collision repair company in America. Right now, we're looking for highly talented, dedicated, and quality-focused teammates to help restore the rhythm of our customers' lives.

Essential Job Duties

Interpret and functionally design integration solutions between various systems.
Assist in the acquisition and merger process to include data conversions and process re-engineering.
Work directly with developers in troubleshooting application issues to find root cause analysis.
Research current environment, analyze information, and provide sound solutions to complex business issues.
Develop business requirements for resolving issues, new enhancements, and new applications.
Continually analyze existing applications and business processes to identify opportunities for improvement.
Provide support to business owners and users regarding business applications and processes.
Work with business owners and users to create functional requirements.
Document business processes.
Act as a point of contact for business and technical support.
Develop and maintain documentation for current applications and user manuals.
Participate as a liaison between the business user community and the IT Organization.
Contact point for systems and services that are outsourced to a third-party developer or maintenance organization.
Other duties as assigned
Skill/Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems or related field; or equivalent combination of education, experience and training that provides the required knowledge and skills
Minimum 6 to 8 years of experience with enterprise systems in a role as a functional business analyst
Report development using the Microsoft Business Intelligence tools
Project Management Certification a plus.
Interviewing skills, to talk with individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements information.
Listening skills, to understand what people say and to detect what they might be hesitant to say.
Analytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements.
Facilitation skills, to lead requirements workshops.
Observational skills, to validate data obtained via other techniques and expose new areas of opportunity.
Writing skills, to communicate information effectively to customers.

Workday experience a plus

About Us
Caliber Collision didn’t get to be the nation’s largest collision repair company by accident. It’s taken an unyielding commitment to being the collision repair center of choice in every community we serve – a vision that began when our company was founded in 1997 and continues strong to this day. To achieve this, we’re not just part of the collision repair industry - we lead it. Not only by setting new standards in customer service, but also by implementing cutting edge technology at every turn. This is how we’ve built a company with more than 500 convenient, state-of-the-art repair centers and growing, and why hundreds of thousands of people entrust their vehicles to us every year. We are driven by our purpose – to restore our teammates and our teammates to the rhythm of their lives. A career at Caliber is not for everyone, but if you’ve got the drive, we’ve got your ride!

Job Description
The Amazon Global Fulfillment Services (AGFS) Marketing team is looking for an exceptional and experienced Business Analyst to drive data analysis and insights that will ensure products listed on Amazon meet the high product quality bar.

In this role you will leverage your advanced SQL skills to construct and implement data pipeline to collect data, clean/organize data to get it ready for analysis and perform structured analysis to glean insights that will identify areas of opportunity and in turn shape the product features and programs we roll out to continue to improve customer experience. You should be self-starter who is highly proficient in SQL, has an extremely high level of customer focus, has a passion for process improvement and is excited by mining large and complex datasets

As you further your career as a data analyst in Amazon Global Fulfillment Services Marketing, you will focus on instrumenting automation of metrics that measure customer experience and identify emerging trends teams need to focus on, analyze Customer and Seller data to identify the root cause of customer issues, and recommend solutions, backed by data, to address customer issues. We are focused on your success and want to build strong leaders. You can expect to leverage your data skills and have full ownership of the projects you work on.

Key Responsibilities Include:
Advanced SQL skills to extract, aggregate and load data from multiple data sources
Work with and synthesize large datasets from multiple data sources
Work with BI team to navigate through the data sources and introduce new metrics to audit performance and identify areas where customer experience is degrading
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Automate reporting with a combination of SQL, Excel, and BI tools like Looker
Deep-dive a variety of ad hoc questions on emerging customer experience trends
Manage and execute entire projects or components of large projects from start to finish including project management, data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations
Seek opportunities to inject advanced analytical techniques across the FBA Customer Experience organization

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering or a related field
5+ years of professional experience in data analytics, business analysis or comparable analytics position
Advanced skills in data mining using SQL, ETL, data warehouse as well as Excel
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
Ability to structure complex analysis and perform the analysis to drive insights
Proven problem solving skills, project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional organizational skills
Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast paced environment
Preferred Qualifications
Masters degree is preferred in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field.
Advanced SQL skills to extract, aggregate, and load data
5+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analysis role.
Experienced in data warehousing, data modeling concept and building new DW tables
Experience with building multi-dimensional data models to serve as a foundation for future analyses
Ability to deal with ambiguity
Understanding of predictive modeling
Understanding of R or Python/another scripting language

Determines how new information technologies can support reengineering business processes.
Collaborates with all levels of the business to develop sustainable, repeatable and quantifiable business process improvements.
Collects and analyzes process data to initiate, develop and recommend business practices and procedures that focus on enhanced customer service, increased productivity, and reduced cost.
Researches best business practices within and outside the organization to establish benchmark data.
Defines change management issues and supporting change management processes

Business Analyst Responsibilities
Participates in the design of technology solutions which implement standards and performance requirements to maximize reliability, functionality, and integrity while minimizing costs and cycle time.
Participates in the design of technology solutions which meet security requirements.
Develops a strong working knowledge of products, services, and industry trends to select appropriate technologies to meet business partner requirements.

Communicates with all areas to ensure a smooth efficient process.
